comment: Professor Ross is engaging and passionate. His lectures are informative and relevant. I found Unstuck ai super helpful for exam prep alongside the class materials. Overall, a great course to take.
he released the grade distribution after the "final". nobody got an A.
Hes a very good teacher. Makes learning fun. Cracks jokes and makes the concepts easier to understand. Just keep up with the work and you should get a good grade.
Professor Ross is really great. Very pragmatic, realistic and actually helps you prepare for the real world! I think everyone should take this class no matter your major.
Highly recommend taking a class with Professor Ross. His lectures are very applicable to real life. His interview tips helped me land my dream internship. I can't thank him enough!

Professor Ross is one of my favorite professors at UCLA. He genuinely cares about his students, and he is so passionate about teaching and guiding students. He is down-to-earth and super approachable. If you need anything from him, he is there and ready to help.

The lectures are very informative, take notes!!
If your goal is to get an easy 1 unit course, you will enjoy his class because not much work is required. If your goal is to learn as much as you want to about different careers and continue your own career preparation, you will also enjoy his class because he will help you achieve just that.

Professor Ross shares his extensive line of experience in financial services while giving comprehensive instructions on how to become a successful applicant. Truly inspirational, he definitely structured my outlook on my career. I recommend him to anyone who lacks resources on how to approach interviews and what industry to be involved with.
SNOOOOOOOOOOOORE!!!!! Actually he's a great professor and makes hilarious jokes to make the concepts easier to understand
His class inspired me to become a financial lawyer. Hes also funny, and we watched YOUTUBE and Googled lots of things!

ECON185 was the most valuable class I've taken at UCLA. I wish I took it sooner because the course material is very relevant, especially for those applying for jobs/internships. You can tell Professor Ross really enjoys teaching this class and appreciates his students. I cannot recommend this course enough, so if you are debating taking it, DO IT!

Stephen was an awesome professor. Although the class I took with him was extremely short and not very intense, it was very valuable and I took away a lot from his lectures. He knows so much about life and what it takes to have a successful career. During this class, he did a fantastic job sharing those experiences with us and providing advice.
Great guy, amazing professor!

Ok seriously the worst at talking. I usually love economics classes but jeez can this man TALK and some of the time it is not even relevant to the material we are learning about. We do weekly reflection which is just what you learned in the class and then there is a "research plan" worth 70% of your grade. Doesn't give out a rubric for it.

I took Econ 185 with Professor Ross last fall quarter. He is an amazing, well-rounded professor and his career story inspired me to get up to speed with my own career journey. Professor Ross is very knowledgeable on a vast array of financial services careers & the current markets.

This professor has yet to grade past assignments, when finally grading he leaves negative comments that aren't helpful. Has lectures, but doesn't know how to work canvas so they're hidden. For the most part does not teach but just gives you discussions and writings each week with maybe an extra assignment. Professor does not email back timely.

I honestly have no idea how he has such good reviews. My experience with him was AWFUL! He hates when you ask him questions. Instead of answering the question, he will always just tell you to go read the book/syllabus, even if the question is not even related to the class/book! One review on here says "RUDE" and I think that sums him up perfectly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: This has been one of the most informative and constructive classes I've taken at UCLA. Not only is Professor Ross an amazing lecturer, you can also tell that he cares deeply about his students and their success during and beyond his class. I would recommend that every economics student takes this class.
He always answered your questions really rudely and never wanted to help. Don't take him!!!

Steve is by far & away my favorite Econ lecturer. Every student ought to take his class. Hes said teaching is his passion and I can definitely attest to his aptitude for mentoring, too. When I was struggling with a job after 2020, I reached out & Steve met with me to give resume/narrative advice that helped me land a job shortly after. Great guy.

Professor Ross is an amazing teacher! He makes it really fun and interesting to learn about practical skills for the real world from interviewing to buying real estate. Even before our first meeting he was emailing us letting us know what to prepare for. He is very organized and let's you know that attendance is mandatory.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Ross is really a great man. He is truly successful in his own career path, and share his experiences and tips selflessly with all his students to help the young people grow up to succeed in their own career life. This is the most practical class I have taken, all he taught would be useful for your future and even for your whole life.

Incredible class and incredible professor! He drives all the way from San Diego to teach this class twice a quarter and makes lectures worthwhile. I found Professor Ross very inspirational and has made me want to come out of my comfort zone and apply the advice he gives out in real life. I hope others who take this class enjoy it as much as we did!

Prof Ross is a beast. He managed $5b worth early on his career and then continued to grow as a personal and business professional. The class is amazing and he breaks down the financial markets and also talks a lot of professional development, delving into interview and email skills. I love this man he's the best
He teaches real world things which are very informative, inspiring, and helpful in your career. One of the must take class for your career and success.

Make sure to take his class. You will learn a lot about finance industry. He is a great guy to know in general. He is there to help you with your future career goals. Dont graduate without taking his class.

Stephen Ross is one of the most influential professors I've had the privilege to take at UCLA. I feel his course is applicable to all students not just Econ majors, this coming from a biology major, and I hope I can use his skills in my future line of work. His career planning and financial advice was awesome and he was really inspiring.

Very inspirational and very wise. The tips and lessons learned in this class will last a lifetime. It was an honor to sit in Steve's class and to hear him speak. The amount of support and care that he gives to his students to ensure that they succeed is unparalleled to any professor. Truly recommend this course to all majors, it is a life lesson.

HE IS AMAZING PROFESSOR! Now I can understand why he is the best rated professor among econ department at UCLA. His 11-hour lectures (split into 2 lectures) were so helpful and useful in REAL LIFE. I wish I could learn more about presentation skills from him since he never made me sleep during his lecture which means his presenting skill is AWESOME

Professor Ross offers one of the best classes in the Econ major at UCLA. He teaches real life skills which is rare at UCLA. He truly aims to help everyone enhance their social and networking skills to prepare for interviews and life post-graduation. You only meet twice in the quarter and in that time alone he has an immense positive impact on you.

Professor Ross is AMAZING! He's very genuine & really wants students to succeed by enhancing our pre & post-interview skills. Definitely sign up for the one-on-one meeting sessions cause he'll check your resume and that's VERY valuable. Besides, he's very fun and engaging! Take his class & you won't regret ;)

Professor Ross is one of those individuals that you meet in college that truly care about their success of each and every one of his students. This class alone taught me more about preparing for the real world than any of my classes these past two years of college. Definitely a must-take for anyone no matter their major!
Great class!

Professor Ross provides one of the most relevant classes for undergrads. He breaks down in detail what one should be thinking about for one's future post-graduation and how to navigate the professional world and news. I wish this class would be available to everyone. He's just that good of a professor and his lectures are just that relevant.

I was so glad I took Professor Ross class and I definitely gained a lot of value from his class. Professor Ross shared a lot of real world examples related to career paths and his own life wisdoms to us. His lecture is really amazing and inspiring. Now, I had better idea on which career paths I am heading too. Highly recommend his class.

The class is fantastic, and the professor is knowledgeable and willing to help students. His lecture is valuable and precise. Ive gained a wide range of information in class through his experience and real-life examples. I appreciate all of your hard work and thank you for teaching me valuable lessons!

Professor Ross is so down to earth and inspirational. He is very knowledgable yet makes his lectures understandable for anyone, even a psych major who had never taken an econ class ever before! I would 100% recommend this class to any and all majors, loved the class and this professor!!

As an exchange student from Beijing, China, taking this course is definitely an unforgettably wonderful and meaningful experience. The professor not only provides inspirational career guide but also explicitly and concisely explain the important Econ knowledge in an intuitive way. He is such a nice professor!

Absolutely amazing professor. He definitely cares about his students, and tries to help them succeed. Really recommend his class. He inspires students and gives them really useful and real world skills.

Professor Ross genuinely cares for his students and you can tell. His career development class was so helpful and I loved learning from him because he himself was successful (and still is) in his career. He is so engaging and connects every lecture to personal stories.
Very caring, nice thoughful and helpful
He is sarcastic
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Ross wants you to succeed and is an amazingly wholesome and down-to-earth individual. He provides information pertinent to career development during and post college. His personal development story is inspirational as well. Would love to have more homework and class interaction time (he comes up from San Diego on two Saturdays).

Prof. Ross is one of the best professors Ive had at UCLA. His class is a truly practical & necessary introduction to the world of finance and careers. Ross is a great storyteller so lectures are always entertaining, clear, and concise and cover a variety of topics. I really appreciate the fact that he provides tremendous help to intl. students.
AMAZING PROFESSOR

Throughout my college years, this is the most useful class I've ever taken. Professor Ross is very understanding, and he truly wants you to succeed. I felt motivated and inspired at the end of every lecture. Take this class. You will thank yourself later.

This is by far one of the most useful and practical classes ever. Prof Ross is great. He has a wealth of experience in how to get a job and succeed in the professional world., like career development Yoda. He will work with you to help you make you into the best that you can be for recruiting. Take it, it truly is an investment in yourself.

Professor Ross' class is one of the most useful single classes that you could take at UCLA. MAKE SURE YOU ENROLL IN IT AT LEAST ONCE. Not only this class gives you a tip on how to better position yourself to an employer, this class also gives you general life knowledge that you need to know to financially succeed. Professor Ross is AMAZING!

Steve really cares about his student and reach out to each of them personally. It was easy for me to talk to Steve any question I had in future career choice and in life. He is also an marvellous lecturer that he is able to keep his 7-hour lecture entertaining. I learned a lot from his experience and this class.

Awesome professor who really cares about his students. Was fortunate enough to be given a slot on his office hours, which are limited due to the size of the class and shortness of the class. He offered to connect me with members of his network in order to help me further my career. His advice was also beneficial, nice course to take.

He is an amazing professor that care about the development of his students. His lectures provide real-world examples and practical information that helps the listener grasp the concepts that are bring covering. He is one of those rare professors that knows both what he is talking about and how he can easily explain it to his students.

TAKE THIS CLASS!  The information and advice that Steve shares with the class is so valuable and definitely necessary to hear. He goes over all the things that are crucial to know when applying for internships and jobs! He is a great mentor/person in general,  and very knowledgeable about the different financial career paths.

Professor Ross's class covers all the steps in recruitment and how to stand out. He also talks about the various industries that economics majors are interested in, the pros and cons, and how to apply. He also offers individual sessions where you can talk to him about anything and  are very useful.I recommend this class to all Econ/ bus Econ majors

By far the most useful class I have taken in UCLA. My only regret is that I didn't take it sooner. Professor Ross is one of the few professors that genuinely cares about his students. He has given us a lot of useful information about the financial industries, savings, buying a house, and even life in general.
Great overall professor. Learned more in this class than any other class.

Professor Ross is hands down the best teacher I have ever had at UCLA. The lecture seems long, but every minute is engaging and relevant. Also, he gives amazing advice on careers, personal finance, morals, and life in general. If you have the opportunity to take his class, you will be extremely thankful as well! 10/10 recommend!

Most useful and engaging class I have taken at UCLA. Incredible professor who cares so much about his students, a true mentor.  Provides students with valuable information, skills, and guidance for life. 10/10 my favorite teacher at UCLA. He genuinely cares about his students and  provides them with the resources they need to succeed.

Thoroughly explains what kind of jobs you can expect to get or go into after you graduate with a business/econ or econ degree. Went over accounting, investments, sales, and etc. I would definitely take him again!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Real-world practical information that I am sure will shape my future professional life. So glad I took this class as now I have completely changed which direction I want to take my life in.
Really enjoyed the class, learned more practical things here than anywhere else

Professor Ross is hands down the best professor I have ever taken. His class gives you real life career advice and I don't think I would have gotten a full time job lined up for when I graduate without his tips. If you get the chance to take this class I STRONGLY RECOMMEND you do. It does meet on Saturdays for 6 hours but it's only two Saturdays.

Great class that teaches you everything you wish that school would teach you. My only issue with the course is that it isn't longer. Professor Ross is fantastic, and definitely has students' interests at heart. This class set me up for success for the rest of my life.

From the very first lecture, I knew my experience in this class is one I will cherish forever. It was definitely helpful to listen to the professors background story on his time as a college student to the beginning of his career. Additionally, he provided the necessary tools when it came to resumes, LinkedIn accounts, and interviews.
Mr Ross is the best lecturer I have ever taken. He has many amazing and inspirational stories. I Highly recommend taking his class and you will learn a lot from him.
Steve Ross is a phenomal guy. He really cares about his students and does anything he can to add value to their lives.

Professor Ross is honestly an AMAZING professor! He truly cares for his students and wants the best for them. He gives great advice. His lectures are engaging and practical for life. He teaches the necessary skills for interviews and making a resume. Highly recommend this class.
Professor Ross is amazing! He is so helpful and wants to help each and everyone of his students. HIGHLY recommend Econ 188.

Professor Ross is an inspirational person, he is not just a professor, but a mentor to the students that he teaches.  Life has been really strressing me out lately, but after meeting with him at a coffee shop on a saturday, this man knew exactly what to say.  Professor Ross helped me find myself.  Dont miuss the opportunity to take this class.

Take 188. This is will one of the most relevant classes you will ever take at UCLA. Interviewing and working on your career is a skill, and Steve teaches you exactly what you need to know in order to crush the life game and reach your career goals.

Professor Ross is definitely of the most caring professors out there! He is so genuine with each and every one of his students. He takes the time out of his busy schedule to sit down and talk to his students to get to know them better and to give them career-related advice. Hands down one of the most inspirational, motivational, and kind professors

Professor Ross is always opened to chat about any concerns that his students have. As a business economic student at UCLA, I really appreciate the time he took out on the weekend, to come down and teach/prep students for career. Definitely recommend reaching out to him !
This class might have been the most valuable class I took at all of UCLA. Prof. Ross had me excited to look for jobs and begin my career!
Awesome general knowledge class. Puts you a step ahead of other students on campus, regarding post graduate career paths

Only a class like this can make two 6-hour classes on Saturdays so worth it. Every minute spent in his class is 100% worth it and you walk away with knowledge you know you will use every day. More classes like his need to be offered! He really makes an effort to get to know his students be being approachable and offering one on one meetings.

I had the privilege of taking Professor Ross Econ 188-Career Development at UCLA the winter quarter of 2016. In only two lectures, I felt a genuine personal connection between him and myself, both through his lecturing style and his welcoming personality to my questions during breaks in the class. Highly recommend the course!

I took Professor Ross's course (at UCLA). The course was 9:30-3:30 on 2 SATURDAYS, but 110% worth it! He covers real life lessons, advice for the workplace & life post-grad, and gives great "how-to-get-a-job" tips that you won't find in ANY other class. He is an all around great guy to hear speak and definitely an authority on Finance/management.
Nice guy and a good speaker.

He is one of the best lecturers at UCLA and I wish he would teach more classes. He has practical experience and every word that comes out of his mother is valuable. Wish UCLA would ask him to teach more classes.

Steve is an awesome guy and  he really cares about helping his students out. I went to him for some job search and career advice and he really took the time to answer my questions and understand my position. If you think you might have trouble in the interview/recruiting process, take his class and ask him questions!

Steve is an awesome guy and truly cares about his students. He is a great resource for job and career searches. Not only is he committed to helping his students, he goes out of his way (Drives up to LA on weekends to teach) to give you what he has to offer. If you want a job, take this class as you will have more guidance.

Steve is an amazing lecturer who truly cares about his students and their futures. He takes time to speak to his students individually to provide career guidance. He's very personable and easy to connect to . I would definitely recommend this class to everyone.

Steve Ross' course was so helpful and everyone interested in the business field should go take it! He truly cares about his students and their future. I had the opportunity to have one-on-one meeting with him, and he was so encouraging and easy to connect with. Go take his class; you will learn so much about interviews, resume writing, etc.!

Professor Ross' class is one of the most useful and beneficial! He taught us essential skills to communicate successfully with employers and colleagues, do well in interviews, and how to create a good reputation among colleagues in your industry. He is always willing to help his students, outside of the classroom as well! Inspirational!

Steve Ross is one of the most inspirational people I have ever met! He is a strong professional and a very giving man. He lectures to help out the students and he really cares about them. His class is on career development. He teaches the essentials of interviewing, common courtesy, relevant knowledge, etc. This is the most useful class I took.

Steve Ross is one of the most inspirational lecturers at UCLA. His class is for career development. He gives invaluable advice on the essentials for being successful in the future. He is such a caring man. He is always willing to help and cares a lot about his students. His success story is very amazing. I would recommend this class to everyone!

Professor Ross is an enthusiastic teacher who cares about the future of his students and makes an effort to get to know and help each one of them. I found the class very interesting and useful, and recommend taking it to all students that want to apply for jobs  internships or aren't sure about what they want to do yet.

Really cool professor! He is passionate about teaching and helping his students, even outside the class. I had the honor to have this one-on-one meeting with him and it was really helpful. He has amazingly diverse background and knowledge to teach this class. Highly recommend if you really want to pursue a successful career path.

I had the pleasure to take Mr. Ross' Econ 188 seminar at UCLA. He has such an amazing, relatable story to tell about his professional career. He is articulate, easy going and speaks from experience. I had the opportunity to meet with him one-on-one. His honest and straightforward advice is inspiring, which helped clarify some of my career paths!

Best class I have ever taken so far in UCLA. Professor Ross is very passionate about helping students. The class is practical and useful in the real world. I learned a lot about career development, interview skills, resume writing and financial markets. Don't miss this class! Try to get an one on one meeting. It will be valuable experience.

Best class I have ever taken so far in UCLA! Professor Ross is so passionate about helping students building career path in the real world. The class is very practical and useful. I really learned a lot about career development, interview skills, resume writing as well as financial markets. Don't miss this class! Try to get an one on one meeting!

You will never fall asleep in his engaging lecture whether he talks about career path, job interview, or finance. I'm an international student having hard time looking for job. I was lucky to have a one-on-one meeting, in which he gave helpful advice for my career path and made me more confidence about myself. I would highly recommend his class.

Very good professor. Highly recommended. He has a very diverse and strong background to teach this class. Very professional and very concerned. I loved how he does 1-on-1 meetings with students to take a look at their resume and help them with any questions they may have about life, school, or their career path in general.

Professor Ross is a fantastic teacher! He is so passionate about what he does and truly cares for his students. He is not only devoted to creating informed, intelligent students, but also respectful young adults. He is one of few people who still believes that success is second to character. Great educator and guy. Take Ross if you get the chance.

AMAZING PROFESSOR! Absolutely recommend this class. He's very passionate about the curriculum and has a lot of advice to offer about resumes, interviews, investments, and life in general. TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY!

Professor Ross is an exceptional professor and an incredible person. He genuinely cares about his students, and makes sure that he is providing them with practical knowledge to help them be successful in the future. The class is very interesting. It covers financial career paths as well as topics such as investing and the markets. Take this class!

Best class to take in college! He outlines the lectures very clearly and he really cares about the students. His lectures cover everything from different career paths to learning the basics of the stock market which was so useful. Great class, take it!

Took Econ 188 with Ross at UCLA! This class was a very practical and useful class. I learned a lot about different career options after graduating and gained many useful tips for interviewing. I would recommend this to anyone and everyone, no matter what year in school you are. Take it, you won't regret it!

I recently took this class and I can honestly say that it is the best class that I have taken so far in college. Stephen is an inspiring teacher and he teaches you crucial skills to succeed that you would not learn in your normal classes. I'm probably going to take this class again next year. If you haven't taken his class, go for it!

I was fortunate enough to take this class this past quarter and it was undoubtedly THE best class I've ever taken. I learned so much about future career paths, steps to obtain internships, and important skills and attributes needed when working in the real world. I highly recommend this class to all and will use the knowledge I obtained forever.

This class was the most useful class that I have taken. It's a useful class for a "real world" perspective on how to be successful in getting internships and navigating the transition from college to the real world of careers, networking and goal setting. I definitely will tell my friends to take this class because it was so helpful!

This class was the most practical course I have taken as an undergrad. Professor Ross really cares about his students, and provides them with priceless info. I learned so much about interviews, presentations, resume building, the stock market and different career paths in the business world. I would recommend Professor Ross and the class to anyone!

Steve Ross is straight out AWESOME! He is so dedicated to helping students and that is really nice of him. TAKE THIS CLASS as you will learn a lot of practical things, which NO other class can teach. Keep it up Mr. Ross.
Professor Ross seemed like he really enjoyed his job and helping students succeed. Even after graduation, he makes himself available to his students. would definitely take his course again!

Highly recommend taking his Business class, Professor Ross is exceptional! He is extremely passionate about teaching and genuinely cares about helping students succeed! He is exceedingly knowable and a truly remarkable person! By far the MOST VALUABLE CLASS I’ve taken at SDSU! Essential information for transitioning into real world!

Professor Ross was AWESOME! And this is coming from someone who usually doesn't write reviews for their professors and doesn't usually have a positive experience with professors. His course is very applicable and practical, and his teaching style is superb. He genuinely cares about his student's learning! You won't regret taking his class!

Professor Ross is amazing! Not only does he provide students with extremely practical and valuable information, but he is also very accommodating and actually cares about his students! I took his class and asked him to be a speaker for my organization, and he was more than happy to do it (which just shows you how much he cares about his students!)

Extremely insightful class! You will learn so much in regards to the current financial state of the US, the stock market, career options, and how to prepare well for an interview. As everyone has mentioned, it is a highly practical class and will help immensely in preparing for life outside of college.

Professor Ross has been the best professor that I have had. He has a way of absolutely capturing you in what he is talking about. Will teach you topics pertaining to the real world that you won't learn in any other class. Classes go by very quickly and I always leave the classroom feeling excited and motivated.

Professor Ross is just an amazing professor. The lectures are about the real thing that no one is going to teach you in the university. He helps you from building your resume to analyzing the stock market. A very good lecturer and a very interesting class. Try to bet your luck to meet him one on one and prepare some questions, you will learn a lot.

I already submitted a rating for Professor Ross (below) but would like to correct myself. The course is ECON 188: Career Development. Amazing Professor, inspiring class, and no doubt the greatest class I have ever taken!

Professor Ross is the BEST Professor & his class is the most USEFUL and HELPFUL class that you will ever take. This class truly prepares you for your career with REAL LIFE SKILLS ranging from personal finances to steps on how to land a job.  He is amazing, passionate and truly cares about his students! I can't get enough of this class, thank you!

Professor Ross is one of the BEST professors at UCLA and SDSU. He is passionate, charismatic and truly cares about his student. The career lessons I've learned from Ross' class are VALUABLE, HELPFUL and ONE OF A KIND. Out of all the class I've taken, this was the most USEFUL!! Thank you Professor!

I'm taking this class at UCLA my last quarter. I REALLY wish I had this opportunity two years ago. However, it's still super practical information--basics that everyone should know (resume, interviewing, stock market, etc.) I really respect Ross and I think he's a great guy because he genuinely cares about his students. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

What an amazing guy. I have taken many classes within my four years at UCLA, but this class, by far, was one of the most valuable class I have taken. I learned so much about everything that has to do with career development: resumes, career fairs, interviews, presentation skills, investments, etc. Take this class! This guy is amazing.

I took his class, econ 188 at UCLA. Basically two classes from 930 to 330 on Saturday throughout a quarter. seating for 6 hours may sound long and boring but what he talked in class was really interesting and practical. basic knowledge about stocks, job markets, interview skills. Most of them are highly realistic. Take it!

Such a great guy! Not only is his class extremely valuable, but he is truly concerned with student learning. Steve has a passion for the subject and a compassion for his students! If you ever have the chance, make sure you take a class with Steve!!
Steve Ross was an incredible professor  It was amazing to get a perspective of the business world from a successful businessman.  Very rare in academia.
He is the most caring professor you will ever meet. He is truly interested in getting to know his students and helping them in anyway he can. Overall, BEST professor!
Awesome professor, really helpful for everything you need to know about succeeding in the business world.

Prof. Ross has a plethora of knowledge that will help any student become more competitive in the business market.  He teaches useful techniques that can be applied to interviewing, resume building, and career searching.  Students at universities severely lack these skills; however, Prof. Ross is adamant about "adding value" to each of his students

Wonderful professor! He really cares about your progress, and teaches extremely useful information. The business concepts are very practical, and help you in whatever you want to do in life (investing in stocks, buying a house, whatever career path you choose). Hands down, the most sincere, knowledgeable professor I've taken in school; great class!

One of the best professors I've had the pleasure of taking at UCLA. He genuinely cares about each individual student and our futures in the real world. I have never attended a class in which the professor was so passionate about what they teach until I took Econ 188. I am so grateful to have had him as a teacher and I learned so much from his class
Professor Ross is a very helpful and care a lot about his students.

I had Steve Ross as a Professor at SDSU and he was one of my favorite teachers.  He taught about practical business knowledge based on his professional experience.  His passion for teaching and the opportunities available to students was inspring.  I always left his class filled with exciting new career apirations.  Take Steve's class!

Prof. Ross is beyond helpful. He knows the material, and he knows how to make it relevant, interesting and understandable. His passion for helping others really shines through, and that level of passion for helping others is something that I can only draw inspiration from and aspire to attain in my future. Note: I took a class with him at UCLA.

Steve has some serious expertise and knows what he teaches. In my opinion, the best professors teach as a passion, and that is S.Ross. He is a mentor and he takes his job seriously.  I learned a lot from him and attribute many of my successes to him. Great class, and it was one of the few that left a lasting impression.

I took Ross's class at UCLA. I cannot thank Ross enough for such an educational class. Ross gave me the best advice of my life and helped me land a summer internship. He relates to students so well and is such a likable character. This class should have been mandatory for all Economics undergrads. Too bad the class only meets twice in the quarter!
Prof. Ross was extremely helpful. Definitely the best professor I've take at UCLA, and provided the most useful, real world info and advice than any other class. Wish he taught more classes at UCLA!

I took Steve's class at UCLA and I can honestly say the class was probably the most useful of my college career. Steve helps students choose a career in business and develop the skills necessary to succeed in today's economy. The lessons from this class are practical and insightful. This class should be required for every student before graduating
Took his class at UCLA. Couldn't have been more approachable and insightful with how things work in the financial world!

(Taken@UCLA) The only complain I have about the class is that there are not enough class meetings! Steve teaches us critical skills to apply in real life.  He has also given helpful advice on my after college career goals as well as on my resume & relationship building.  One of the most valuable and important classes I've ever taken - a MUST TAKE!

I took Prof Ross"s class in UCLA. His class so far has been the most useful college course I've ever taken. His class is useful, helpful, and direct you to the right career path after college. I highly recommend his class to all of my friends. He is the best prof! and this is the most practical course!

I was a student in his UCLA class (Econ 188)--the class is a MUST for any one looking to succeed in the professional world during/post graduation. He provides a wealth of knowledge and is genuinely interested in adding value to each student. Highly recommended

As a UCLA student, I must say that Professor Ross's course was absolutely amazing. Provides a very clear examination of the skills and jobs within the business world. Ought to be a mandatory class for all students!

As a UCLA student, I am so glad that we have Professor Ross, his experiences for teaching is remarkable, you will never feel bored in his class because the lecture is so valuable and interested. After taking this class, I learned a lots and got to know myself better on my future career choices. highly recommend for this class!!!!!!

As a UCLA student, I have to say Professor Ross is the most inspiring and insightful professor I have came across throughout my UCLA career. I am happy to say that I have had the pleasure of taking his course - truly one I have learned the MOST from. Not only motivational, but also a true leader and genuine professor. Highly recommend.

Hands down, this class was by far the best class I have ever taken!!!Prof Ross is so knowledgeable and passionate about teaching this class.I have learned more important,useful,helpful,real world things than in any other class.  My resume is now very competitive, my interviewing skills impeccable and Prof Ross is ALWAYS around to help and guide me.

Dr. Jay Grossman is a very good professor. On his lecture about finances and investments in dentistry I was amazed with all his knowledge and how easily understandable he made himself for the students. He is also pretty accessible if we have any questions and always ready to help the students.

Dr. Grossman was an incredible preceptor who took the time and care to ensure that I had the proper guidance working on our patients. I appreciated the way he supported me as I took on a variety of procedures, giving the perfect balance of freedom and direction.
Dr Jay is such a great leader and mentor, I would love to the the boss and clinician he is. He makes everybody around him feel so comfortable and cared for.

Dr. Grossman is not only aspirational for his business and dental knowledge, but the way he works with his patients, staff and the student who work with him is so impressive and compassionate. He is such a great role model and I hope I can continue to learn from him throughout my career!

Dr. Grossman is an immensely insightful, inspiring mentor. His perspective on how to be a good clinician, effectively communicate with patients, and manage a successful practice is invaluable and so vital to our dental education. I learned so much beyond patient care, and am so grateful I had the opportunity to attend his clinical rotation!
Dr. Grossman has such valuable insight and advice not only for dentistry but for real world applications. Highly recommend having the opportunity to work and learn under him!
Dr. Grossman is a great mentor for any UCLA dental student who attends his CBCE. They will be given autonomy that is not possible in the dental clinic and learn the ins and outs of private practice.
A great clinician and leader. Inspires young students and teaches in a practical manner. He is willing to share his experience and different skills in his repertoire.

Dr. Grossman is an inspirational professors that I am grateful that I came across as a UCLA dental student. He was generous in providing advice and mentorship during my time at HNT. Dr. Grossman also provided critical information in regards to various dental and management techniques he utilizes in practice. I definitely enjoyed and learned alot

Dr. Jay Grossman's remarkable feedback, intelligence, leadership, respect, resourcefulness, and patient care contribute to his legacy of excellence in dental education. His influence extends beyond classrooms and clinics, inspiring a new generation of dental professionals, including myself.
Dr. Grossman is not only a great dentist, but a great person!  I loved my time in his office.  I learned so much clinically in addition to patient communication and business tips.
Great mentor and coach!

Dr.Grossman was a pleasure to work with! Not only will he give constructive criticism but will also present the material in a way that makes sense and address the why of a problem. Great bedside manner and overall a great human being.
Dr. Grossman is very thorough and inspirational. He has good chairside manner and treats his patients and staff very well.

I had the privilege of collaborating with Dr. Jay Grossman at HNT. His unwavering accessibility and willingness to provide assistance whenever needed were truly remarkable. Under his guidance, my confidence was boosted, empowering me to effectively treat and care for patients with utmost success.
Gives a great amount of independence but will provide critical feedback when asked for.

UCLA can tend to zone students in on grad requirements, but Dr. Grossman's rotation was the refreshing experience I needed to re-emphasize why many of us chose dentistry in the first place. His variety of cases enabled me to refine my skills while stressing the importance of public service. Would recommend to every student in the school!

Learning from Dr. Grossman led me to build upon my technical knowledge of dentistry. In addition, he has great tips, tricks, and advice regarding dental procedures, treatment planning, and so much more. He took the time to teach about patient communication, patient management, and practice management, which was very helpful. The real deal.

Learned a lot about the technical aspects of dentistry, patient communication, patient management, and practice management from Dr. Grossman. He has great tips, tricks, advice, and a lot of wisdom to share! The real deal.
Very knowledgeable and willing to take time to teach you!

Fantastic clinical based teaching, patient based treatment planning, Excellent communication skills,
Caring and knowledgeable.
He is so wonderful and likes to teach.
It was very informative and amazing lessons learnt! Learned a lot about running an office and patient flow!

Professor Grossman truly cares about the community & educating the students. He is exceptionally knowledgeable & gives thoughtful advice, offering a holistic & accurate perspective of private practice. Through the invaluable services Homeless Not Toothless provides for the veterans, he inspires us to do more for the community & follow his success.
Dr. Grossman is one of the best professors and dentists that I have ever met! He is incredibly kind, caring and wants to teach you the ropes of dentistry in a private practice setting!

Dr. Grossman was a pleasure to work with during my rotation at Homeless Not Toothless. I was able to learn a great deal about proper treatment planning, patient communication, and more. Not only is Dr. Grossman a caring and respectable doctor in the office, he genuinely wants every one of his students to succeed and learn while they are there.
Dr. Grossman is so approachable when it comes to learning. You can ask for help and he will educate you without looking down on you for not knowing. A rare quality in professors these days!
I enjoyed the rewarding experience of serving people who are in dire need of help: vets, women and children of domestic violence, and the homeless.
Great professor who cares to give back to his local community
Great caring professor who gives back to the community!
Dr. Grossman is so understanding and compassionate. I really love his energy and his determination to do his very best in all aspects of life
Amazing instructor and person. There is a lot to learn from Dr. Grossman as an accomplished and expert dentist and a fascinating human being. He never hesitates to teach and share his knowledge.

I really appreciated the practicality of Dr. Grossmans advice, from real life dentistry to the numbers behind a great practice. We got to see the real side of a running a profitable clinic AND a nonprofit. I loved learning about new technology (lasers, cancer screenings) and about the business side of dentistry from him.

If you're willing to work hard you can get a lot of work done here that normally can't be found as a regular dental student. In particular you can do surgical extractions if you're comfortable, and can do same-day treatment if your schedule permits. The mission of the program is also wonderful, as I saw patients in quite extenuating circumstances.

Dr. Grossman is the best! I learned more about real world dentistry during my time with him than all my years at dental school. He teaches so much about what running a dental practice is actually like in the real world. I wish I could extern with him every week.

Dr. Grossman is always looking to teach you in his clinic, while treating patients he routinely notes why something is being done for specific reasons ... this type of learning in a real private practice is truly unique and not something I believe every dental student can experience.
Excellent professor. Great and Funny Lectures. Easy Class. I cheated on his test by finding answers online, but I'm sure he would never find out.

Dr Grossman and HNT were awesome! Such a great combination to get both hands on experience and amazing real world tips for business management, insurance, patient management, etc. Would definitely recommend!

Dr. Grossman is truly one of the rare dental professionals that is able to impart the same level of excitement and interest in the field as when he first started practicing dentistry. He taught me more in a three-week rotation than most of my other teachers have taught me in months-long courses at UCLA. He's a rare breed of clinician and teacher!

I spent three at this program. The culture that Dr. Grossman promotes at his clinic is astounding and gives a very welcome feel. The clinical expertise Dr. Grossman teaches in a very short time of the rotation was extremely valuable to me. Dr. Grossman always made himself available for questions and was constantly ensuring that we were learning.
Dr. Grossman is a great mentor! He provides excellent care to his patients and shares clinical skills and knowledge with his students. I definitely recommend him and the HNT program.

Dr. Grossman challenges students to think critically and independently during all clinical tasks. Dr. Grossman encourages all students to self-reflect and determine areas they can improve their skills moving forward. Thank you Dr. Grossman!
Gives great feedback and caring. Very kind.

I really appreciated being able to work with Dr. Grossman at HNT. I not only gained confidence in my clinical skills, but was also able to learn about the practical aspects of private practice management. I really enjoyed my experience!

Great professor. Blends the clinical aspects of dentistry to the professional aspects of patient management in a seamless way. Invaluable mentor to dental students; he is one reason that keeps me motivated in the pursuit of becoming a dentist.

Dr. Jay Grossman is an excellent clinical professor at the UCLA School of Dentistry. His ability to mentor and blend the different aspects of dentistry in a seamless way is unparalleled. The patients at Homeless Not Toothless come from a multitude of backgrounds and are all very satisfied with the program and how Dr. Grossman delivers his care.

Dr. Grossman is an amazing mentor! He made sure I took something away from every learning opportunity. Instructors who care this much about student growth are rare, and I know he's helped so many students in their journeys. I felt so supported and encouraged my entire time working with him.

Dr. Grossman combines clinical expertise, business acumen and a deep compassion for people... I feel like I learned so much during this rotation that I couldn't have learned in an institutional setting. Great experience!

Dr. Grossman is an amazing dentist. Not only does he do great work but he is extremely kind as well. I really appreciate him hosting HNT and he does a great job in giving dental students a preview of what private practice looks like. I wish I could've spent more time with him at HNT but I'm very appreciative of the time I got to learn from him.

Dr. Grossman is the most thorough and caring dentist that I have seen and you can really see through the way he talks to his patients. Truly wants the best for them and takes a lot of his time to make sure that they understand what they need. Learned a lot from this rotation and would highly recommend Dr. Grossman!

Extremely amazing mentor and leader. His Homeless not Toothless program is an exceptionally wonderful resource that helps so many people with their smiles. I learned so much in my rotation at his office and know that many students will. He really goes the extra mile in involving students with care and provides autonomy for us to learn dentistry!

An excellent experience all around. Dr. Grossman has crown preps down to an art and his business model is second to none. There is so much to learn and a lot of opportunity to practice clinical dentistry.

Dr. Jay goes above and beyond for his patients and students. He runs a Homeless not Toothless program to provide quality dental care at no cost to those with serious financial needs. As a long time dental educator, he takes time to give students the real world dentistry perspective and encourages us to think critically. I've learned a ton from him!

He truly enjoys his career as a dentist and is extremely knowledgeable. He is always wanting to help out everyone and anyone. Hes caring, compassionate and hes been there and done that. ALWAYS willing to give advice on future career steps and business side of things as well. Love love love him!
Great work!!
Excellent experience
Amazing

Dr. Grossman was an inspiration to observe and fantastic to work with. He has great rapport with his patients and really explained everything he was doing. He also gave great advice not only from a dental but also a business perspective. I wish I could have more time to learn from him through the rotations.
Dr. Grossman is really inspirational and his lessons are really important for us to hear as students. I wish their were more opportunities to hear from him!
Best lecture I've had in quite some time. Dr. Grossman shared his own story and gave us an idea of what to expect after graduation. I'm so glad I attended.

As an international dentist, I was very confused/worried about my future path after graduating from a dental school in the US.  Dr. Grossman really encouraged and inspired me by giving this amazing lecture telling us his own story abt all the options after dental school. I am also very impressed by his passion and hard work.

As a dental student, thinking about life after dental school can be a daunting task. However, Dr. Grossman turned this time in our lives into an inspiration and exciting time. He laid out the options for after graduation so clearly and passionately. I wish we had this lecture earlier on in dental school. I would recommend his lecture to student.

Dr. Grossman is a really inspirational speaker. He opened my eyes to a few option I could choose about dentistry, as well as gave us more information about residencies and other advanced education programs and the pros and cons of a few which I thought was really helpful.

Dr. Grossman's is a great speaker. He was very engaging and spent the entirety of the lecture interacting with the students. His insight on life after dental school gave me a few things to think about. He highlighted his work with Homeless Not Toothless and that really encouraged me to make a difference in what I can do.
I hate math, but this was by far my favorite class of the quarter. Nikjeh makes lectures easy to understand. It's hard, and requires a lot of outside work but his tests are very fair.

Esmaail is honestly the best Calculus teacher! He gives you extra credit for people who need to boost their grades up. He is very helpful, he takes his time to help the students. He cares about his students. You will learn a lot. 11/10

Amazing professor! He is very enthusiastic about the class and does a superb job explaining the concepts. His notes are well organized and informational (you wouldn't need to read the book in this class,) and he is very willing to help after class. His tests are fair.

Dr. Nikjeh is a great Math Professor. He's very helpful and caring. Again study from his lectures, if you need additional help then practice from the PDF book! He gave me a great recommendation letter for medical school. Just take him.11/10

Dr. Nikjeh is definitely my favorite professor from all my classes that I've taken this semester. He allows notes on tests. I would suggest attending his lectures since he will often give 2 free test questions during the lectures before the day of the test. If you have to take Calculus, I definitely recommend taking it with him!11/10

Is this class hard? Yes, I'll say it: this is not a hard class. Prof. Nikjeh makes the Calculus easy to understand. I enjoyed the lecture. He is a fair grader. He gives extra credit. At the end of the class you will be happy with whatever you learned and what you earned. He curves the grades.

Super clear lectures, math is not my strong point but Professor Nikjeh is very good at making seemingly hard math concepts appear easy. Tests are open notes and open book. Weekly homework, just follow the agenda and you can easily get an A.

This professor was so great! The class is really interesting- you don't have to show up every session but it's definitely easier if you attend for lectures & review, though. DON'T GET THE BOOK! All the info needed to study is in Canvas and his class notes:)Take him!

This guy is one of the top professors at UCLA. Doesn't even need any aids to help him present the material. Great personality and fun guy to work with. He is demanding of students (don't miss any classes) but the landed benefit of having taken him for this class is well worth it!
Prof. Nikjeh is EXCELLENT!!! If you have a chance to take him, DO NOT HESITATE!

Prof. Nikjeh is the students' dream instructor. He is very knowledgeable and explains difficult concepts in an easy way. He gives many examples. Exams are similar to the class examples. He curves the grades at the end of the quarter.

Really great and nice professor overall. Makes lectures interesting, and explains complex material in a coherent fashion. Provides plenty of material to study for exams. Classes themselves are very laid back and comfortable. He curves the final grades.
Dr. Nikjeh is AMAZING! Do all the homework he assigns and study the class examples you'll be set for every quiz and exam, sometimes he copies questions directly. He nicely curved the final grades.
He was able to explain things clearly and concisely and was probably the most "down to earth" math professor I experienced. Best math professor I have taken. I learned a lot in this class.

Prof. Nikjeh is an awesome professor. His lectures are simple and clear, though a bit tedious. I think it's the subject and concepts he has to work with since it's a calculus class. Class got more interesting towards the end. He grades fair, tests are fair.

The course itself is very difficult but the professor speaks clearly.  his quiz is about 4-5 questions limited to one hour and the exam is about 10 questions. I like this professor very much because he is very reasonable and has taught me a lot and understands the students.
Excellent teacher, one of the best at UCLA Math Dept. English is my second Lang. but he is very clear on aspects. Very very helpful and super nice. You will like and enjoy the class.

Prof. Nikjeh is a remarkable teacher, and I passed his course with flying colors. He allows note sheets on exams. He was able to explain complicated concepts clearly and concisely and was probably the most "down to earth" math professor I experienced. Overall, wonderful teacher.

Prof. Nikjeh is by far the best teacher for Calculus at UCLA. He genuinely cares about his students and works tirelessly to ensure that everyone learns. Never be scared to ask questions if you're entirely confused about a subject! He'll be delighted to assist!

The written HW was a bit challenge and the exams are fair but honestly,Prof. Nikjeh is now my favorite math professor I've had at this school. He is willing to work with you if you need grace/help. Strongly recommend taking him not just for this class, but for any math class.

I loved every part of this class. Professor Nikjeh makes learning easy. The class is very easy to pass as long as you take good notes and watch the lecture videos. Tests are open book and are based on lecture videos and class examples. Prof Nikjeh is very caring about his students and wants them to pass.

I absolutely loved the class I took with Professor Nikjeh. Calculus ended up being my favorite class this semester. Professor Nikjeh is thoughtful and really just a great guy. Every single expectation was outlined and overviewed. Every single lecture was entertaining. I wish Professor Nikjeh could teach all of my courses. Take this class!!

I would highly recommend professor Nikjeh to anyone! He breaks things down and makes it really easy to understand. He also takes the time to make sure each and every student has a clear understanding of the subject. I was terrified of Calculus because I am not a math savvy person, but he made it all so easy to understand!

He is incredibly smart and actually cares that his students understand the material. His lectures are clear and precise with plenty of opportunities to ask questions, where he gives clear answers. His teaching styles make hard classes seem easy. Take him.

Nikjeh is the best math instructor I've had here. His lectures are pretty easy to follow and he does a good job of doing a lot of examples. He also uploads everything he ever writes out so that is helpful too. I struggle with math and I found him very willing and able to go above and beyond to help students understand. Super nice!

If you have to take MathXL31A this is absolutely the guy you want to take it with. Seriously cannot recommend him enough. He made one of the more difficult classes at UCLA manageable. He's a fair grader on the exams and while there is a lot of homework he'll often let you turn things in late without penalty if you ask.

Professor Nikjeh's "teaching" was simply regurgitating text book material for three hours straight in lecture; he couldn't manage his time and constantly shifted tests/assignments. HIs tests weren't commiserate with material "taught" in class. He didn't return a single graded item (so you never understood what you did wrong). Absolutely dreadful.

He is awesome! Gives great examples of concepts to help students understand. Soft spoken and always leaves room for questions. Work is easy if you try a little bit. Definitely my favorite math teacher. His quizzes are from the lectures (examples). He'll show you exactly how to ace the exams.10000% recommend.

He is a great professor. He wants you to know all detail of the class and gives you enough information to do it. If you study you will get an A or B. Attendance is important. An easy class as long as you listen to him carefully and study. I will definitely take his class again. he knows what he teaches. Super nice.

One of the best math teachers at UCLA and quite laid back. Had him for MathXL31A on Saturday mornings, not the most fun thing to do on a Saturday morning but this professor is great and teaches the material well. He allows note sheets on exams, so take advantage of this however you will. Overall, wonderful teacher.

Incredibly nice and caring guy, wants everyone to do well and understand the material. With that being said, if I could rate his communication I would give a 0. Quiz and homework dates were always in the air and he would take so long to reply to your emails. He's a very traditional, old school teacher and virtual class has made it very hard for him

Does not actually teach the concepts well, rather he just hand writes what the book says. While his quizzes and tests are just reworks of the example problems he gives during lecture, meaning they're pretty easy to pass, don't expect to learn anything. Had to go to pretty much teach this entire class by myself.

Professor Nikjeh is great! His lectures make Calculus very digestible. He does an excellent job explaining theorems and providing example. More importantly, he really cares about his students. He wants everyone to do well in class. He encourages students to ask questions and is willing to slow down if students find the material difficult.

Straightforward class with clear grading criteria. Do homework, pay attention in lecture and take notes. Exams reflect notes exactly! Professor was patient and lectures were very clear! Quizzes, exam and final from notes. Take this professor and class!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Nikjeh is one of the most understanding and caring professors I have ever met. He truly cares about you and wants you to succeed; his lectures are clear and well organized. Super accessible outside the classroom; take Calculus with him. You won't regret it.

Professor Nikjeh is an excellent professor and I greatly enjoyed his course. His lectures are very helpful for understanding the material with exams/quizzes that are very fair in challenge level. He made the course interesting and his lecture notes are very organized! He is kind and genuinely cares about his students.

He was a great professor who cares about you doing well in the class. His lectures are pretty easy to follow and he gives you shortcuts where he can. There is a lot of homework but it is helpful because many of his quizzes and exams are modified versions of the HW questions. He grades your HW by completion. Exams and quizzes are not too difficult.

Professor Nikjeh is extremely understanding and approachable. He truly wants his students to succeed in his course . He also provides you with plenty of examples that will help you with quizzes and homework. He also does not rush through material. . I would recommend this course for anyone that wants to do well in calculus.
Great Professor would take again 10/10. The class was easy if you listened to his lectures and took good notes. Hes more than fair with grading!

You will need to work out problems by yourself since he only explains really basic ones during the lecture. Have the student solutions manual handy. He was too overloaded with work to answer questions or give feedback/ mark questions in quizzes or homework. Really lovely professor but he was definitely overwhelmed by online teaching.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Prof. Nikjeh is by far the MOST AMAZING professor I have ever had. I had no prior knowledge in algebra before this class, but with his teaching skills, I was able to end with an A-. He makes it clear that he wants his students to succeed in the class. He is super caring and passionate about teaching. I was rly lucky to have him as a prof! 11/10 :)
Not good professor but very funny and personable. Didnt understand much but he showed up to every class
Ok professor, didnt learn much but its an easy class and easy A.

Best math professor. He really teaches you how to manage your own and when you put in the bit of work that is compiled in the homework and his study guides, there is no way you can't get a B or A. I received all HW credits. You need to have a very good understanding of basic algebra to be successful.

Prof. Nikjeh is a wonderful professor. He makes concepts clear and makes himself available if anyone needs help. This was an easy class for me. I went to all classes and paid attention, and did all practice problems that he would say to look at before a test and got an A+. He is a great guy.

Great professor! Very clear expectations from his students. Is more concerned about students understanding a few solid concepts, rather than jamming a book down their throat. If you have to take Calculus, take him! He will make it interesting and easy for you. 2 thumbs up!

Best professor I've ever had! I am NOT a math person, I repeat I AM NOT. However, I made it with an A in a very short time (5 Weeks). Only 2 quizzes, 2 exams, and a final. His lectures are very straight-forward. His quizzes are exactly the same as the examples he provides in the lectures. He's an amazing & caring person. I highly recommend him!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Prof. Nikjeh goes over the material clearly at a moderate pace. You will probably not do well if you dont do the homework or you didnt take Intermediate Algebra before. Homework is not hard at all. You may see class examples on the test. Overall he is very nice and helpful. I will take more classes with him.

BEST PROFESSOR AT UCLA! Honestly an amazing person (reminds me of my dad). He is very sweet. His exams are based on textbook questions & examples so make sure you look over questions and you'll be solid. Honestly a great professor, explains well in class. If you dont understand he is more than willing to explain it again. Truly an amazing prof.

He is one of the best professor Ive ever had in my life. He takes such an abstract concept like calculus and breaks it down fundamentally and really makes you think. Hands down one of the best math teachers youll ever find. I will take him again.

Prof. Nikjeh is great math instructor and I enjoyed and learned a lot. Always kept class active, although we were learning the most boring materials. Fair and easy grader. Tests were a breeze if u study just enough to know how to do the math. No crazy preparation needed. Awesome. 10/10

Professor Nikjeh is the best lecturer I have ever had. His lectures were organized and prepared. They used well thought-out examples that were referenced across multiple lectures. I never felt like my time was being wasted. Also, Nikjeh's demeanor was very polite, funny, and relaxed.

MATHXL1 is the hardest class I've ever taken but prof. Nikjeh was an absolutely amazing professor. His lectures were well organized and full of meaningful content, and he structures his lectures so that his students' focus is maximized.
Not organized at all and blabbers while explaining. I didnt understand much of calculus
OK professor, he can make it boring but you don't learn anything

Professor Nikjeh is a wonderful teacher with a firm, accurate, and understanding grasp of that which he teaches. He makes difficult content easy to master and does so in a comfortable way that makes lectures a joy and not just another class. His fashion sense also speaks volumes about what truly matters to him and I respect him very much.

What to say about Nikjeh? The best professor of my life. In the most different class I've ever taken, Nikjeh made a dent in my education. Nikjeh is just not only a talented professor, but also a great human being who believes in teaching as a life changing job he's up to. MathXL31A is hard, but Nikjeh will make it inspiring and really worth taking.

I was scared to take this class- but Dr. Nikjeh made it totally the best class. He is so understanding, and he is a great teacher. He is very nice and helpful- the ideal prof to take for ANY course- let alone math. I love this guy- def take this class no matter what time it is offered.

I must admit, considering that I am not mathematically-adept, this was the one course I feared taking the most this semester. Yet, Professor Nikjeh's class has turned out to be one of the easiest, yet more informative, class I've ever taken. I highly recommend him to everyone.

He is the BEST Math Professor I have ever, ever had. He really knows how to teach a very difficult subject in such a way that students can grasp and understand. I took him for 31A & 31B and I learned more than ever before. He is very fair and truly cares about his students learning the material. I Highly recommend him for any Math class. Great man!

This class was GREAT. I dreaded taking it, but I was so lucky to have Prof. Nikjeh. He taught it clearly so that non math majors could understand it. I actually understood the material, while friends in other classes struggled. Don't settle for anyone other than him, he is the best and super nice. And I got an A.

He is a GREAT GUY. Reminds me of a high school math teacher. Truly caring, very compassionate, and makes Math genuinely fun. I do not like Math at all, but learning math with him was absolutely great. He made math fun. Definitely one of the nicest professor in UCLA.

Just do yourself a favor and take his class. You won't regret it. Prof. Nikjeh is one of the most helpful and genuine professors I've had at UCLA. And did I mention he actually teaches you the material? And that he cares about whether you understand or not?? Just take his class already.

One of the best professors that I have ever taken. The material isn't easy, but he really prepares you well for the midterm and exam. Super nice and patient, and explains everything very clearly. He is so passionate about his work, he is funny, and fantastic.

Esmaail is one of the best professor I have had at UCLA! I never write reviews about anybody, but he really deserves all the praise he can get. His lectures are clear and to the point. Final exam is super fair, if you study. Definitely take him! No regrets! If you need to change your schedule to fit him in, DO IT.

He was honestly the best professor that I've had since being at UCLA. He really does care about whether or not you understand the material. He is very specific about what you will be tested on and as long as you do the study guide and show up to class you'll do fine in the course. He also offers extra credit for the final and homework.

Accepts late homework and gives very lovely quizzes/tests with some questions derived verbatim from the examples in the textbook and homework problems. Great professor, I highly recommend him and would definitely take again.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: I took this class with Dr P through USC last year he was a cool dude. His lectures are recorded so you can watch them when you have time + the entire class is graded on two tests & one paper.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor! Very clear expectations from his students. Is more concerned about students understanding the material than assigning a bunch of busy work.

Dr P is one of the most real teachers I have had. I took this class in 2022 with him.The man is an unapologetic Conservative Gay Jew & he changed my view on all 3 of those groups. He taught diversity in a way that erased the identity politics & threw out the PC Garbage.
Very engaging lectures, pretty fair grading . The class covers a lot of ground that you are expected to be responsible for.

Doctor Patrick is that rare breed of professor where he is equally  as obnoxious as he is intellectually gifted. The man literally quoted HIMSELF in a lecture about his own published material . YES he pulls sections of the material from HIS OWN text. Unfortunately he is the only professor who teaches this course most years.
Dr Patrick is a NO nonsense professor. The exie

Thankful I switched sections & ended up with Doctor Patrick.He is what I call a no frills professor.There are 2 tests + 2 essays which make up the entire course. He doesn't care if you attend the lectures , he doesn't care if you watch the pre recorded lectures , he doesn't assign homework .

Doctor Patrick has moments of clarity but his lectures tend to turn into him rambling.If you think you are going to pull source material or quotes from CNN or other left leaning media sources you can expect him to reject it on the grounds of credibility issues.Clear conservative slant to his world view which is reflected in his grading.

WATCH THE LECTURES.That is all you have to do to get an A.Every single question on the two exams he gives all term are pulled word for word from his lectures.I think I went to class twice in person & just watched the rest of the lectures on the portal since they were recorded.He was slow to respond to emails but that's the only issue I had.

The course itself was great with information packed lectures he records ahead of time which lets you watch them multiple times so that's cool. Dr.Patrick has a reputation for keeping a tight grading scale and its well deserved.I barely swung a B+ and I am in the top 2% of my class.Only 13 people in a class of 125 got A's.

(Taken at USC 2020) The only real downside to Professor Patricks class is that he can be extremely long winded when he's lecturing. The grading scale is tough but clear.There are only a couple of tests all term.

I enjoyed this class and professor patricks energy all semester.I was nervous taking a DEI class taught by a vocal conservative but I sure was glad I made the choice to enroll in his section.He was loud and energetic at times but in that way people get when they are passionate about the material.

Dr Patrick was one of my favorite lecture professors at USC & it was sad to see him leave. He took a course based on the concepts of Equity & Inclusion yet he kept the material unbiased and non political. The lectures were clear .The Grading rubric was tough but easy to understand.All around a great course .

Dr. Patrick teaches across multiple departments (Law , Education ,Business) and a pretty wide array of courses.I took LAW105 with him back in 2020 & EDUC523 in 2021.He taught the Law class with a sterile efficiency that bored me to death.Then I went into the Education class expecting the same and got a super happy high energy lecture instead.
Doctor Patrick has cultivated one of my favorite courses with this one.The pace is pretty fast but well worth it in my opinion.Very informative and eye opening.
He is a bit long winded with his lectures but easy to understand.Tough grading scale on the final paper.Overall Decent guy.

The guy is a run of the mill CA republican you will often find teaching at the business and law colleges here in SoCal.He is obviously over qualified to teach a basic policy class which is made abundantly clear by how bored he looked the entire semester.Hard to stay engaged in a class when the professor is checked out from day 1.

I took EDUC 523 Equity & Inclusion In Organizational Contexts with Dr Patrick at USC back in 2020.He is still one of my favorite lecture professors from my time there.The lectures are recorded and correspond with the textbook even though its more like a teaching aid as he only pulls about half the lecture content from it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Be prepared to do a ton of reading & watch the video lectures multiple times.Dr Patrick teaches this class at warp speed under the assumption that you've come in with a basic understanding of individual constitutional protections & the landmark Supreme Court decisions from the 1960-1980s.Dont take this class if you don't or you will not keep up.

Law 675: HIV/AIDS Law and Public Policy (Taken Fall 2019)
Dr. Patrick has an insane amount of knowledge on the subject matter which he somehow squeezes into a single term.I learned more from this course about the history of HIV-AIDS & LGBTQ Public-Judicial Policy than I have learned in 3 years of academic courses on the same subject.

Law 675:HIV-AIDS Law and Public Policy(2019)

Dr.Patrick has an insane amount of knowledge on the subject matter which he somehow squeezes into a single term.I learned more from this course about the history of HIV-AIDS & LGBTQ Public-Judicial Policy than I have learned in 3 years of academic courses on the same subject.This was a fantastic class.

I had my first class with Dr. Patrick in 2020 & he was one of the kindest most flexible instructors I have ever had. My mother had passed away & we were about 2/3 through the term.He let me submit my term paper early and counted it as my entire grade allowing me to skip the midterm and final so I could go home early to be with my family.

Prof. Patrick is a nice guy. He talks with everyone and tries to engage people in class. The bad part is he ends up selecting his favorite students then spends the entire term asking the same 5 students questions. The class isn't too difficult but it felt like I was watching a podcast with the same 5 guests not attending a university lecture.

I first took a course he taught at USC on censorship & the 1st amendment in 2018. So I jumped on this class when I saw he was teaching. He speaks loudly & is bold with the way he presents controversial topics. He is a very passionate educator who wont shy away from discussing the darker parts of society. Highly Recommend taking his classes.
Professor Patrick is one of the best professors you will ever have.His resume is impressive and he is incredibly accessible.His lectures can be long but they are full of information.

His entire class was built on extensive recorded lectures that make up almost all of the material you need to learn.The textbook wasn't really necessary to buy since the tests are taken directly word for word from his lectures.Almost zero classwork to turn in.I would take him again
*Clear Grading * Clear Expectations * Minimal Work *Exceptionally Tough Grading on the Term Paper

This was easily the hardest course I have taken so far in my time at UCLA.This course is a carbon copy of one taught at Harvard, he teaches it exactly how it was designed.There was a significant amount of reading from multiple texts that resulted in the need for major dedicated time to study.I learned a ton but it was a rough ride.

I had Dr Patrick a few years ago at USC, it was one of my favorite classes.I went back to school in 2022 and had him again.He is easy to understand and his assignments are straight forward.If you study for the tests you will do great in any of his classes.

Doctor Patrick is an extremely knowledgable professor but the man pulls no punches.He will have an all out argument with a student if they get disrespectful and drag the hell out of them while he's at it.Lectures felt like a combination of high value learning + a gay comedy hour.If you are easily offended take a different class.I LOVED it.

Boring Class
He was easy to communicate with
He offered virtual office hours twice a week
I would take him again

Doctor Patrick is a hilarious man with clear conservative leanings teaching a course previously taught by a super liberal professor.This was the most entertaining & information packed class I have taken.If you need a professor whose going to pander to sensitive students feelings this isn't the class for you.
Great Professor.He is a no BS kind of guy & that's clear right off.If you watch the lectures you will ace this class.Minimal tasks to complete & no busy work.
Lectures are long but recorded so you can watch multiple times.He talks fast so I found myself having to watch multiple times to be able to take notes.
