Professor Patrick is tough but fair.If you study you will do well.

I also took LAW105 with him but this was night and day.He seems extremely passionate about this class and his lectures had an excited energy.He had live Q&A sessions scheduled with live lecture hours that went along with the recorded stuff.I left this class with a totally different view of him.I had a fantastic experience this time around.
Middle of the road instructor who doesn't seem to care about this particular course.Everything is cookie cutter
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: He is the first college teacher I have had who actually went out of his way to encourage students to fill out campus reviews of his course and rate him online at the end of the quarter.I had a good experience with him ended up pulling off an A.His office hours are virtual and he responds too his own emails pretty fast.

His lectures lean right and have a clear conservative bend to them.He is extremely particular about what he will consider to be "Reliable Source Material " and anything that veers too far to the left will likely be deemed unreliable for the purpose of citation. Great Instructor overall as long as you color within the lines.

I had previously taken Law105 with him so I had a decent idea of what to expect.I was a bit surprised that he stuck to only assigning 1 paper and 2 exams all term for a much more complicated course.The lectures are  recorded and available online.He is pretty hands off but easy to reach during office hours if you need to.

Professor Patrick is a nice guy & easy to get ahold of during virtual office hours.The tests are manageable if you watch the lectures a couple of times each.The grading on the term paper seemed to be on a whole different level than the rest of the class which felt inconsistent.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: This was the second time I have taken a lecture class with Doctor Patrick & it was run the same way.Pre recorded lectures that stay available all semester, two midterm tests pulled directly from his lectures, and one term paper.He grades all of the papers himself and is pretty open with how tough of a grader he is.

Doctor Patrick uses previously recorded lectures and then also sets specific dates for live lectures but you dont need to do both.All the tests are pulled from the lectures.I didn't use my textbook once.

Professor Patrick runs his classes on a super simple system.There is zero homework throughout the term.The lectures are recorded online starting on day one and stay up for the entire term.The test questions are taken word for word from his lectures.Put your best energy into the one term paper he assigns as he takes no prisoners with his grading.

I took DPI 122:Politics and American Public Policy with Dr Patrick this past term.This is a course borrowed directly from Harvard and he graded the class as if it were being taught at Harvard.There was very little homework or classwork required so most of your final grade comes from two exams which are based off of his lectures not the textbook.

This was my second class with Dr Patrick and his teaching style is consistent.He assigns a limited amount of work and leaves the recorded lectures open all term.Its up to you if you watch them or join in on the handful of live lecture Q&A sessions.The exam questions are taken directly from his lectures not the text book.Easy course if you study.

I have taken three different courses with Professor Patrick since 2020 and he frames his classes the same exact way every term .There will be one large essay assignment which will be graded on a bell curve with very little room for mistakes and then two mid term exams.Those 3 items make up your final grade in the class.

Dr Patrick is one of the coolest teachers I have had since transferring to UCLA.He sets you up for success by making the classwork extremely light and the lectures are available anytime you want to watch them online.I didn't do well on the one big essay but after speaking with him during office hours he gave me a week to redo it and I got an A.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment:
Prof P is AWESOME

This guy is hilarious and always in a good mood.He loves what he teaches & if you show an interest he will bend over backward to help you succeed.The entire class is graded on one paper and a couple exams which is fantastic.This class had zero busywork which I loved.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I would not take a course taught by Professor Patrick again.The material is clear and the lectures are pre recorded but that's where the good stuff ends.His expectations are unrealistic and his grading is downright unfair.He gave me a C on a paper other professors looked at and said they would have given A's.

I have mixed feelings as I write this review.He has a VERY strong personality and doesn't take being challenged well.He makes it clear he isn't paid to be liked.The material is straight forward and the lectures are recorded so overall the class itself is a 5/5 you just have to deal with his ego.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Patrick is one of those professors that you will love or hate.His expectations are high but clear from the first day of class.The entire class is made up of a couple of essays and the course exams.All of his lectures are recorded & available on the student portal so you can watch them multiple times which was great for studying.

Professor Patrick is tough .My entire grade was made up of 1 Essay + Midterm+ Final Exam with each being worth 1/3 of the points available for the entire course.If you are a high performer he's great but if you struggle or are not a great test taker you should find a section taught by someone else.Very Little Flexibility.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: WORST EXPERIENCE. She accused me of using AI on abunch of assignments and deducted a ton of points. I received an ominous email saying "I hope you don't reach for your AI when you write your final paper." I NEVER USED AI. The dean investigated me and declared me innocent, but she still wouldn't give all the points back. Went from an A to a B+.

Very difficult and did not teach. Very worried about AI work without real reasoning. Pays for her own AI site and will flag you!! I took her class in the summer, and she flagged half the class. I would avoid it at all costs. She does not like her life.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Work-heavy, tedious class. Each week we had a reading to leave 5 comments on & 2 500-word discussions/2 replies that we had to incorporate lecture/readings into. Also had a midterm + 2 7-8 papers. If you follow the rubric for the papers + fill out her midterm study guide q's you can do well. She's strict on deadlines. I enjoyed the material.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Unprofessional. Avoid.

Worst professor in 4 years at UCLA, literally the quintessential "those who cannot do teach". The recordings have dogs in the background and her taking sips of iced tea or something, she also hits the microphone several times making the lecture tedious and unprofessional. only 350 characters damn, I should have had CHATgpt write this hahahahahahaha
Terrible. Take this class if you like t0rturing yourself lmao. I literally wanted to d1e when I took her class, im not even joking

I took two online courses this summer with this instructor and received an A- in both. However, I am leaving this review to help other students maintain their excitement to learn and retain information. This course load was so dense without any guidance from the instructor. I taught myself and learning became a chore for the first time ever.

This class was a lot of work, you will get out what you put in. My main reason for not recommending her is because she is not helpful or accommodating of her students. I sent her a few emails throughout the year to check in on my grade as well as to ask for accommodation for a trip, and I was referred to the syllabus with my questions unaddressed.

My experience in this class has completely obliterated my joy of being a UCLA student. Her lackluster teaching methods and insensitive demeanor fuels the distrust that continues to build in academia. I can't imagine the number of students that have left her courses feeling completely underwhelmed and unmotivated. My instructor now makes up for this
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Honestly one of the worst professors at UCLA. The amount of work she gives is insane. Initially, I was very interested in the subject and she made me despise learning about it. We had 2 discussion posts (500-600 words each), 2 quizzes, and had to annotate 2 readings every week. We also had 2 papers, each being 8 pages long. Totally not worth it!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment:
Note: Class started with 30 students registered and ended with 7 remaining students. The majority of students dropped the class due to either wildly uncommented ripping of papers or the final project of cross-dressing in public. 

If you want to play Halloween, read articles from Utne reader, getting your papers arbitrarily destroyed have fun.
Terribly strict grader for such a simple bullshit class, save yourself some time and find a different Professor.
Teacher like Terri Anderson are why many students hate learning.
Awful teacher. Does not care about her student's learning. Expects only the regurgitation of facts, no room for original thoughts or creativity. Terri Anderson Unesisarily strict grader.

She was extremely insensitive to the circumstances students were going thru during the pandemic. She repeatedly told us that she was in her "cabin finally catching up on Netflix shows" while we were literally dying here in LA due to wildfires & surge in covid cases. She admitted to recycling lectures she's used in the past. Extremely disappointed!!

comment: Do yourself a favor and DO NOT TAKE HER!! She would post prerecorded lectures that gave the bare minimum, assign a lot of reading that you basically have to do in order to do the essays and weekly homework since you're mostly teaching yourself everything, and is just overall insensitive to everything and everyone. The work wasn't worth the credit.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: The worst. The class material was wonderful, but my passion for it waned after every paper. Toughest paper grader ever- which was probably a tactic to make us work harder. I realized at the end of the term I could see the "mean avg" for every paper, which was typically around a D or C-. Vague feedback, but she curved my grade massively at the end.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: lol. relatively easy class just discussion posts and three papers, however, very harsh grader with little to no feedback. also is just REALLY rude

This professor is super insightful and is clearly an expert in their field. I learned so much about gender constructs and am more conscious of how gender is enacted everyday. The class is super dense and is reading-intensive, but hey, it's an upper div class at UCLA, so it's to be expected.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I personally was not a fan of this professor. The readings are about 50 pages long per week. However, when you ask for help the professor kinda leaves you hanging. As other students have said, she is a very harsh grader. Unfair to a point. Her class is okay. I just would have liked if she was more present. I would not take again. Good luck.
She's kinda sorta okay. The readings are really long. Some classes are really interesting. Others are really boring.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This is an amazing professor. Hope you dont pass her by bc of her bad reviews. I took her for the Soc of emotions and this was by far, the best class and professor Ive taken at UCLA. She does assign an insane amount of reading and work, and she is also a tough grader but her class is well worth it! U will actually learn something valuable!

The material was very interesting but she seems to believe that the times have not changed. If you are working regular 30-40 hours a week (my experience) You can not give 200 pages of reading a week like let's say when college was cheaper and your only worry was reading for class. If you have no life she is the professor you need.
She cares about the subject.
I took her intro to sociology class at Occidental College. The things she teaches are pretty easy. Essay grading can be pretty harsh. Not a difficult class.

I had prof. Anderson for a sociology class that she taught at Occidental College (not UCLA) and I thought that she was great. She was very accessible and presented her subject in a way that really grabbed my attention.

Professor Anderson showed a lot of enthusiasm for this particular class. Focused a lot on social change in the progression of music throughout the 20th century in this class, but also focused on social change in entertainment in general at the beginning, & social change in artworks at the end. Lectures primarily off her own notes along w/visuals?

?including movies, documentaries, & music videos. Many parts of lectures come from required readings she has throughout the course. You really do need to have these readings, because she wants you to integrate them SIGNIFICANTLY in discussions, & especially ALL assignments. Without them, you will most likely fail the class as I did. I didn?t have?

...the readings because she was added late as a professor for the past term, & w/both the readings not made easily available in the bookstore & my inability to purchase them online @ the time of this class for various reasons beyond my control, she graded down my assignments for not having the readings integrated in those assignments. If you?

?aren't able to get the books for this class for your own reason, DO NOT TAKE THE CLASS AT ALL. FAIR WARNING; YOU WILL STRUGGLE W/ASSIGNMENTS AS SHE WANTS THEM DONE. Breakdown of grade: 6 journals (of three pgs. each of a relevant topic in class) worth 3% each, attendance & participation is 10% (she WILL mark you down for not participating)?

?30% for a 7-pg essay focusing on social change in music, 10% for a 3-pg LA Art Walk report, & 32% on a research project where you integrate an interview w/artist in a 10-pg paper regarding what is necessary for there to be art. NO MIDTERMS NOR FINAL for this class. There were even special guests who visit in person or communicate via videochat.

I love professor Anderson, she is interesting and informative. I really enjoyed the material in the class. People who think doing a 1 page journal per week is too much obviously shouldn't be in college in the first place. Highly recommend this professor.
she doesnt seem to care about her students much. she's not a easy grader! I dont like her class, boring.

I just finished a summer class with her. She gives WAY too much work. For this (6-week) class you were supposed to turn in one journal per week, plus there were two papers, and one group paper that included field work plus a presentation. On the last day of class one of each of those 3 things was due. If you have a life don't take her classes. ANAL
Awesome!
I love Professor Anderson

She looks for specific answers and criticizes students when she doesn?t agree with their answers. She is snide and can be very rude. The only thing good about her class is the content but even that is biased. She often states her personal opinions but challenges students when they give theirs.
a lot of work, but easy grading. teacher is obnoxious. doesn't allow laptops, phones, etc. i only attended lecture a couple of times and got an A.

Super easy class if you pay attention to what she says, I had the best TA so this class really was easy... she is crystal clear in lecture, and there is not test just research paper which is divided into little assignments. Recommended!

This class is a lot of work but if you do the work and the extra credit there is no excuse not to get an A.  There is a lot of reading but Generally you just need to read one or two o the ten things she assigns per week to write your essays.

She was terrible.  The class was super easy and a complete joke, but the entire time we just had to sit around and listen to her opinion, and any time anyone had an opinion of their own, she just shut them down.  I learned nothing.
She is an extremely interesting woman and professor! I highly suggest this class and professor to all my friends!
She's a little flighty but in a good way. She loves what she teaches and makes you comparably interested!
She is amazing! I love her so much. Her assignments are unbelievable. I will take her again. =)

She is an amazing teacher.  A teacher who actually teaches practical material.  The topics are a bit abstract but it's your life! Her teaching style along with the course material made her classes the best I had taken at UCLA

Such an amazing professor. Her lectures/assigned readings made me think critically about the social constuction of gender in our society.I loved doing the journal entries because I learned so much about myself through many of the articles, films, and lectures.  At her office hrs., she's approachable and will talk about her life experience. LOVE HER

I love prof. Anderson. She is what made me finish school. She gives you live lessons rather then just preach. 10 times better the LVL. I wish I did not graduate so that I could take more classes with there. Easy A too if you do all the work.
I really liked her, she makes class fun. At the end, i came out feeling like i actually learned something, not only from class but from myself also!
No Comments
Anderson is so cool and hip. She talks to you like a person and not a student. Her projects are really out there but you really learn.

Dr. Park relates classroom material to real life examples, which greatly helps to better understand concepts. Dr. Park's teaching method encourages students to go beyond memorizing, and pushes toward applying your understanding beyond the scope of the classroom.

The course was taught well, professor thoroughly explained the concepts. The lecture notes and check your understanding handouts were extremely helpful. The exit tasks and weekly homework
assignments also helped reinforce the learning.

Dr Park is an excellent instructor. He cares about his students and makes sure we understand the content. His lectures are very interesting and thanks to the exercises we were able to commit the
content of the class to long term memory
it was an amazing course, i really enjoyed it. Best Physics class I've taken in my life. And I've taken about 6 course and I finally understand through his teaching methods.

Dr. Park says he will change the way we look at the world, and he was right. I learned so much!!! It's not just for my career but for my life. I wish I would have had Dr. Park and this class knowledge long ago in my life. Incredibly practical and applicable in so much of life. You really do understand so much more about how everything
Dr. Park is good at engaging the students in his lectures. Each lesson is fun and refreshing. He ismeticulous in his syllabus, so students know what to expect.

Dr. Park was a great instructor to have. He was very informative in every lecture and brought a sense ofhumour that put a smile on my face during every lesson. I had little interest in physics before taking thiscourse, but Dr. Park's teaching completely changed that in my and now I feel passionate about thesubject. This has been a very enjoyable co

I was always interested in Physics, but Dr. Park really gave me a new view on it and taught things I didnot know existed. He had already said the class would change your view of the world, and I really didnot expect the experience I got. He taught the course very well. I would only say that it would be morebeneficial to students if he taught the le

Dr. Park is a wonderful instructor. He is both knowledgable and an excellent educator. I felt like he wants his students to succeed and gave us every opportunity to do so. He is a passionate teacher and you can tell he cares about the subject and his students. He doesn't let remote instruction limit his ability to provide demonstrations to class

Overall I really enjoyed this class! Probably one of the lowest stress classes I've ever taken at UCLA since Dr. Park prepared us exceptionally well for his midterms. He NEVER tried to trick us on tests, but instead asked questions that directly related to material he covered. His method of teaching was very successful in helping us students

Dr. Park is brilliant. There was never a moment where he didn't have an answer, or a clever way to convey a complex concept to someone who doesn't understand. He's funny, he has great demonstrations, he's always prepared, and he is always willing to answer questions

I have learned a lot and had a great time in his class. Although I am not pursuing a career in physics, this class sparks my interest in learning more about our universe and gravity. It's truly my pleasure to be in Dr Park's Physics 10 class.

Dr. Park was extremely knowledgeable and entertaining. He kept the class engaged while making sure we learned all of the core physics concepts. I will Dr. Park was teaching more courses at extension because I would take them. Overall, Dr. Park is an excellent professor and I would recommend this course to everyone interested in taking a physics

Dr. Park is a very entertaining professor, in a sense that he keeps his students engaged with the topic at hand. He deliberately asks questions from students about certain topics that have been previously mentioned, which allows him to gauge where the class is with the material and how well they understand it. I have enjoyed my time with Dr. Park,

Loved the class! Made it super enjoyable to come in on my summer and take this class. He was a pleasure. I didn't like physics before and now with his class he made it super fun and enjoyable. Loved it! Wish he taught all my physics classes.

Dr. Park is probably one of my favorite professors. I wish we had more like him. He makes learning very fun. He has a great sense of humor, energy and wonderful teaching style. I learned a lot of interesting concepts and ideas in our class.

I thought Dr. Park was amazing. I learned so much from this class and his tests were very fair. He was very serious and expected us to take this class seriously as well. He was very patient and made sure we fully understood the material. I would definitely recommend him to others/ take another class with him! Probably one of the best Professor

Dr. Park is what you would call "one of a kind". He makes the class so very interesting and makes sure he implements real life examples that make the class better. The class isn't boring or hard, as people would usually say, because of him. He makes it great, and he is a very good professor.

I thought doctor Park did a great job of explaining concepts and giving us real life applications of them. The course has made me think about the basic aspects of my life in greater detail, and that has made it very valuable educationally.
I learned a lot and got a much better appreciation of Physics !!!

Professor Park made this course a smooth ride. I was worried about doing a physics class, but the professor made sure to keep a slow and steady pace of each topic so we could fully master each topic. His check your understanding packet is amazing because it helps be review important topics and feel confident in knowing each topic in the course. I l
Easily the best teacher I've ever had and the best class I've ever taken. His lectures went by quickly and were always interesting. I would take this class again.

A fabulous instructor in my opinion. He makes the course fun, interactive and the little introductory toastronomy has made me want to go into that field of study. He tries his best to answer questions for students and makes himself available as possible for his students. His passion made this course fun to be in.
The strengths of the professor include his humor and enthusiasm in teaching introductory physics to non-science majors. He is both an amazing professor and person. Thank you

I love what I have learned in this class, I only wish there was more time to cover concepts in more depth and learn other topics. Dr. Park is a great teacher who brings his energy and enthusiasm for physics to the classroom, and keeps us on our toes and engaged.

Dr. Park is by far the best professor I have met at UCLA who changed my academic performance. He creates the class atmosphere to be very exciting and interesting to students. He has a powerful communication skill that draws all students' attention and he definitely is tremendously humorous.

I really appreicate the class has such aa knowledgable professor. It surely broaden my interpretation at the whole Universe. Professor Park explained the material brilliantly. He shared his enthusiasm and knowledge of the subject with us very well
Super Course, Great Professor,Very knowledgeable,Great powerpoint, Very through!!!

Dr. Park is by far one of the best professors in terms of keeping students engaged. Physics can be a difficult subject matter but his demonstrations make it very easy to understand. I don't think a 50 minute class has ever gone by as fast as physics 10 has.

Dr. Park was an enthusiastic, compelling, and hilarious instructor! I am so glad I got to take this course with him it was definitely worthwhile and he made it an excellent class! I learned a lot of material in a short time because Dr. Park presented it in a very effective manner.
Dr Park holds class attention extremely well. He is very entertaining and effective. I was highly satisfied with this course!
Wow... yeah, I'm taking his class, and he's a great Professor, just too smart
He is fantastic. I loved the class. He is very knowledgable and super good.
Great demo and always helpful slide ! Very satisfied  At times a bit difficult to understand but I still learned a lot  professor makes dry physics materials fascinating.
I really enjoy professor teahcing. He has a lot of energy keep material simple and  also maintain classroom attention thoroughout the class
Fun Professor.Know what he is doing. I really enjoy every meetings.
HE ROCKS !He covered all modern issues in Physics !! very Funny Professor I love his class

He is an awesome professor. I was terrified to take Physics and now I actually really like it!!!!! Professor Park is fun, incredibly kind, funny, helpful and engaging. He shows a lot of helpful animations and really makes the class interesting. I would HIGHLY recommend taking this class with him. He makes it interesting and fun!
Explain difficult concept with easy step by step method. Learn a   lot He also teach astronomy parts that I like most
You should take this course animation, demo, movie clip so so fun I learned a LOT
Best Professor ever!

Took his class during the summer, the biggest issue is not really an issue at all, is that he is korean and has a heavy heavy accent. But no worries he has power points, and the slides that are plain whitish/yellow with multiple choice questions are directly from the test and make up about 90% of it
Great class full of fun

He was definitely a fun professor. Quite the opposite of Brent Corbin in terms of difficulty, Prof. Park still makes room for demos and comprehension in simpler terms than most other profs. However, this is a review for Physics 10, which isn't even university level, so disregard this review... entirely.
excellent class with lots of demo
He is really nice.  Explains things wells.  Has great examples and in class demonstrations.  He makes a tough subject easy.  Best to take his class through extension.

Extremely easy class. All the questions on the test are from the so called "quizzes," which are basically questions we go over as a class and don't even count as our grade. When I took this class in the summer, the class average was an A. out of 75 people, I believe only one person got a C, a few more got B's, and the rest got A's.

Ravetch is a good lecturer and engaging but the way he grades is super harsh for no reason. He's also really unclear about what he wants for assignments and homework and will then dock you points for not doing things that he didn't clarify. In person he's cool but honestly this class isn't hard but he makes it more difficult for his students

What a gem! Ravetch will always be one of the best professors I have ever encountered. He made accounting fun... wait is that even possible? Yes! He is that good! One of the most memorable experiences at ucla was his class.

Took 2 classes and he is the reason I am not a CPA. Guess what? I shouldnt be a CPA. Hes easily the best professor you can get in any subject. Why? Because he will be passionate, do everything he can to help you learn, and he will teach you how to be great. If you want to fck around, go take someone else's class. I got A- and C for 1A and 120A.

Very difficult tests that challenge you to fully grasp the material. Really cares about student learning as opposed to getting grades. Very funny and encourages students to seek his help outside of class.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: try get his past exams it will help you ace the class

Definitely makes you work for the grade but his classes teach you more than you would learn with any other professor in any other accounting class. One of the few professors at UCLA who has a real passion for teaching and ensures that his students are well equipped to handle anything.

He is really a good professor!---good at assigning homework and giving exam. You really learn a lot from this class!---learn everything by yourself, at home!!! The worst teacher I have ever encountered because  he doesn't really teach. I never blame a professor for workload or exam difficulty but I just cannot tolerate that I can't learn in class
Prof. Ravetch is hard, but his lectures are entertaining and clear. He is one of the reasons why I am now a CPA. If you complain about him being hard, you don't know what hard is.

I wish I can say I got something out of this professor, but I didn't. I was unlucky to have him twice for 1B and 120B. He seems like the only bad apple in the accounting department as he has the lowest curves and teaches the least, instead he tries to give inspirationalmessagesorsmallchitchattopics.Overall,Iwishrecruitersnoticehowhard buttheydidnt

Professor Ravetch teaches the BEST online math review course.  I was skeptical at first because 1) I've been out of school for 11 years, 2) math isn't my strong subject/interest and 3) didn't have good experience with online classes before. Prof. Ravetch is an EXCELLENT teacher.  Great sense of humor and v. engaging.

Really entertaining and energetic.  And funny! He puts for extra effort covering difficult concepts and doesn't waste time with useless material.  He is extremely helpful and open-minded when answering questions. He never made me feel stupid, which all my other professors have done.  I'm slow.  You don't have to rub it in my face!

Had him in early 2000, egomaniacal and really full of himself. Had a reputation for teaching EVERY class like you're trying to become a CPA, this was supposed to be entry-level accounting! Proud to say I managed to start and currently run a very successful company without his influence--there are better profs out there.
"How many of you follow me? Who's with me?  How many of you get it?" *2 hands raised* "Good!"

I had Professor Ravetch back in the late '90s and absolutely loved his class. His lectures are engaging, entertaining and interactive. I have never worked as a professional accountant, but I have found myself recalling skills and concepts I learned in his class on multiple occasions over the last decade. Glad to see he's still around.
hard but a good teacher. one of the best i've had.
I had David as a professor for many classes between 1988 and 1991.  He is a fantastic teacher -- a real character --and folks, college is supposed to be hard.  Get ready for the real world.

People give Ravetch a hard time because he's challenging and you have to work hard to get a good grade in his class, but he's one of the best professors I've ever had at UCLA. I'm taking all  my future accounting classes from Ravetch.
I took him over 20 years ago in 1988.  He's one of the most memorable teachers you'll have.  If you want an easy 'A' don't take his class.
This dude makes his class way too hard. Can be entertaining at times but overall he's on too much of a powertrip

Take it from an alumni, Prof. Ravetch's class is the most memorable you will have at UCLA.  Get to know him and get involved in the accounting assoc.  You'll be so prepared for the real world.  And, I say this 10 years later.
He is very enthusiastic and a great teacher. His grading scale is harder than the other professors, but his class is worth taking it if you want to learn.
Extremely entertaining and helpful. Best teacher I've ever had but also the hardest teacher I've ever had. You must really know your material to do well.
Tough class, but the best professor i ever had. class is very entertaining sometimes, never boring. lectures are very clear, just really need to study and will be fine!
Say NO to both Amway and Quixtar.
Hard as hell, but one of the best professors at UCLA.  He actually cares about the students but don't you dare slack off...
Very tough, but great teacher.  Not a class you can slack off in.  His tests are pretty difficult.  But overall, he's a really good teacher.  And pretty entertaining.
Please be kind to your GPA and opt for Litt, Guerin, or Freixes.
Egomaniac.
One piece of advice: Take Litt.

Yes, he is a 'tough' professor, but he is good. Here's a tip - study EVERYTHING from his lecture notes (that little book in which you fill in the stuff he shows on slides during class). Forget that huge $90 book (the HW is only for practice). Everything he tests on are in those lecture notes.
One of the best professors at UCLA. Good sense of humor, interesting lectures. He has high standards and teaches well. I recommend him strongly.
The worst, most pompous professor I have ever had.  Biggest unwarranted ego on campus.
No Comments
great class for those wanting accounting careers
He teaches you to apply the concepts.
No Comments

A tough professor, but cares about learning alot. Great teacher, especially comparable to other accounting teachers. Very active lectures, interactive as well. Tests are hard, but 4 or 5 nights in the library and you'll do fine.
why is everyone praising him, i admit that he was one of the easiest as a matter of fact, so easy that its not even worth walking up for.
Took him for a math referesher course prior to entering Anderson b-school. Very good professor.

Most people think Prof. Ravetch is too hard. But, his class requires you to really THINK, not just memorize. You can't just regurgitate on his tests. You have to really know the concepts and how to apply them in new situations.  Best professor at UCLA.
Horrible, arrogant teacher
Deespite the difficulty, he's still one of the best professors I've ever had.
An asset to the school
By far the best accounting professor at UCLA
Excellent teacher, fun, but not a giveaway
nice you need to work hard

Great professor. Very helpful outside class. Tests are pretty hard, focus on concept more than mathematics, the best ways to prepare are take previous year tests, do OWL questions and go to his office hours. Lectures are understandable, sometimes confusing. Stick to your course reader at all costs.

Easy if you study his old tests with the correct solutions. He provides some past exams and some are available at the UCLA test bank in SAC.  Not recommended because the material is  not taught well and the course reader is disorganized. But if you choose Lavelle over Scerri for 14A/B, be prepared to study hard.
Definitely recommend over other 14B teachers: not too much hw, lectures relatively easy to understand, and you can prepare for the midterm and final by looking through past ones.

Scerri is very interesting... he's kind of snarky and asking questions in class is a little intimidating, but on the whole, he's actually a good teacher. Chem itself isn't easy, but with Scerri you focus more on concepts than math so depending on what kind of learner you are, that may be easier or harder.
He's absolutely hilarious. Tests can be tough sometimes, but if you live Chen, he's gonna be your motivation. He's very intelligent and knows all his stuff. I'd recommend that you take him.

He is arrogant and brash but he is a good professor. He speaks well, is not boring, and his course reader actually makes it easier to study for his class. A lot of people underestimate his difficulty. He is not hard, but his class isn't a cakewalk either. Do the practice exams, go to discussion, and watch his podcasts.

What I don't like about Prof. Scerri is that he makes you buy his expensive course readers. You can't even use the old ones because he switches the pages. This makes it mandatory to buy one and i did not appreciate it as a cash strapped student. I thought he only cared about making money off students.He doesn't explain most concepts well,
GOOD PROFESSOR

Everybody complains about Dr. Scerri's snobby demeanor, but honestly, I found it hilarious. Apart from that, he's a really good professor. He WILL lose you at times, as his course reader becomes hard to follow in some places. But if you pay attention, seek help when it's needed and do the practice tests in the back of the reader, you WILL pass.

Awful teacher. Incredibly disorganized: makes mistakes 10+ times a lecture despite the fact that he's been teaching this subject for years. His course reader was like Egyptian hieroglyphics I had to decipher, and sadly his tests are entirely based on the ridiculously confusing course reader. Does not seem to care about his students, just his ego.

I don't know why everyone complains. He's funny and snappy to students who waste his time by asking stupid questions but nice to people who genuinely need help. I got a 57/58 on the first midterm (though the class average was like a 62%). Its really not that bad. Oh, and every lecture was podcasted- yay!

I enjoy Scerri. He's really snarky, but very helpful if you approach him outside of lecture. He doesn't like answering silly questions mid-lecture though. He's extremely knowledgeable, the class is straight forward, and he's also funny. The chili pepper is retroactive speculation...I mean he used to be in a band.
<3 sexy beast

So he was better than the alternate teacher.  His classes were incredibly boring! And it was a struggle to get up to go.  His midterms were horribly graded, mean was 40! If you dont have to take this with Scerri, DONT.
Ok, not the best or the worst. I took his class because the other professor was even worse.
Just memorize the reader and you should be fine. He does not use the textbook at all so don't even buy the book if you plan to take him for Chem 14B.

Scerri's class can be fun with the demos. he is really good at the guitar. Make sure you get 100% on the repeatable quizzes. Know the reader and you will get a good grade. Don't read the book or anything else. You also don't need to goto office hours. You can actually understand scerri and the pace isn't too slow/fast.

I feel like I'm always interrupting him when I visit Prof Scerri during his office hours.  It's like he quickly wants to get rid of you and go back to whatever is on his computer.  In class, you'll notice that the more attractive a girl is the more attention she gets.  He seems very cool and aloof in his European sort of way.  Can't figure him out.
look him up o YouTube and see videos of his lectures !!
i have no opinion. memorize the reader or you're dumb.

Yes he may seem arrogant and stuck up but he's a good lecturer.  His accent actually kept it interesting for me.  I give him an A for effort for trying with his jokes.  Overall, besides personality, I learned a lot from him.  He's good at teaching chem.
awsome!!!!!!!!

Scerri is overall not bad. His grading policy is decent, and the guy curves the midterms. In addition, his office hours do help a lot. However, his practice midterms are misleading. Don't ever base your upcoming midterms on the practice ones.

Scerri's an arrogant british boob.  don't bother going to lectures because the guy doesn't even teach.  only redeeming aspect of the class was his head TA Gagik who spearheaded ALL of the review sessions (read: real lectures where you actually LEARN!!!)  yeah...but, he does play the electric guitar. but still, BAD PROFESSOR!!!
No Comments

Scerri wasn't that bad of a teacher. You do well on his tests if you memorize the reader he gives you-especially the graphs. He's not very approachable, but he's concerned about how much his students know the material. Last quarter he thought my class wasn
He is full of crap with his english accent. He doesn't give 2 shiets about his students. The only good thing about his class was his damn experiments and even those weren't that interesting.
He's alright compared to other professors just know reader inside and out and you should do alrite..
Great class, great teacher. Made complex concepts easy to grasp in an entertaining way. Loved his experiments, guitar, and British accent.

nice accent, as long as u can understand him

He SUCKS and oh yeah, he's really stuck up. He lectures like it's an audience of biochemists and he's rude and he's not funny.  Also, his exams are SUPER hard. He deterred me away from the biological sciences--my experience with him and his class was just horrible- maybe it'll be different for you/others!

my first impression wasnt very favorable, but after taking chem with baugh, scerri isnt a bad professor at all.  his tests are fair and although lectures are a bit dry, theyre lightened by his demos.  The course reader became my best friend for this class.
Very arrogant and difficult, TA couldn't speak english either unfortunately.
He is very arrogant and unclear and boring during lecture. His accent is annoying. HARD grader.
No Comments
His class was pretty entertaining. Although he makes jokes that arn't so humerous, he teaches chemistry really well. It solely depends on your TA for the further understanding in chemistry.

just go by his reader, forget the book (he doesn't even know what the book is saying), use the Munowitz book instead. Everything he knows is in the reader, outside of that, he really doesn't know much chem. Fun demos. Can be arrogant.
Very good at explaining himself

LVL teaches topics for life.  For once, courses that teach you about your personal self, and daily interaction.  What is going on in seemingly overlooking interactions.  Once you graduate, you might think back and REALLY appreciate his style, topics, and simplicity.  Just do your work, think, make an effort, and this class will change you.

Had no clear grading system; when asked about expectations, would give no answer and tell you to "find your way", yet still gave bad grades; didn't use half of reading marked as required to purchase; smelled really really bad. Stay as far away from this joke as possible.

Only LVL can convince 80 college students the intricacies of S&M.  Yes, you heard me... S&M.  LVL takes very sensitive topics, and just changes your world/ideas.  This class is so worth it -- do the readings, do the post.  Don't fritter, just do it.  After ten weeks you might just thank me for writing this on Rate My Professors.

went off topic sometimes. didn't use all textbooks assigned. reader didn't contain needed articles. no clear grading rubric. no syllabus til 3rd week of class. presented interesting topics, but felt it could have been done better. assignments were random and vague.

worst. soc. class. ever. assigned books that were never used, lectures were foggy at best, assignments were unclear and vague. didn't feel that what was taught really pertained to the topic in anyway. prof seemed more intent on sharing buddhist ways of life than teaching urban sociology. no syllabus until 3 week of class and reader was useless.

Worst instructor I've ever had for any class ever, and it's my major. Was meant to be an Urban Society course, but what we learned did not match the course description at all. You never get any of your work back, so unless you ask the TA you won't know your grade. Readings are nauseating. Assignments are useless. Who gave her a Ph.D. anyway?

This class was by far the WORST class I have ever taken while at UCSB. She teaches based on what she "felt" was a good enough topic. I felt stupid sitting in a class where all we did one day was watch a slideshow on SIDEWALKS!!! The class had no structure at all. Too much of a hippie for me and a waste of my time.
that class had so much potential to be great...but she was unorganized unprofessional and full of herself.
WORST course I have taken at UC Santa Barbara.  Avoid this professor.

We buy 6 bks for this class and don't really use them, then we have to buy a wkbk from her that should cost $6 but she charged 47 for.  No respect for our time: assignments by email on Sat., due on Sun. Random irrelevant assignments on the side. When concerns are brought to her, she's "teaching us to live with uncertainty." No clear grading policy.
All mighty LVL causes earthquakes and blackouts.  She's that awesome.  Trust her, she's a doctor..
Linda Van Leuven should either:   A) Stop writing her own reviews on Rate My Professor B) Make a better effort to vary her writing style in these positive reviews.

Very interesting reading material, however Dr. Van Leuven is extremely biased and refuses to allow actual discussion if students disagree with her point of view. She can be hostile, scream, and grade down based on personal opinion rather than academic merit. Frustrating even if you agree with her. Only mind blowing if you have no prior knowledge.

LVL is energetic and passionate, but very biased. I took her class "Contested Sexualities," which touched on the feminist sex debates of the 80s/90s, but we only read one side of the arguments (Bright, Califa, etc), and this perspective was presented as truth rather than opinion. Lectures were full of strawman attacks and disdain for opposing views

There are tons of good comments about her. Just warning people that she's not for everyone. I guess you either buy into what she has to say and love her or you don't (like me), and it's just boring and really annoying. She yells like everything she says is the most profound thing ever said. I got an A in the class, still regret taking it.
You will leave wanting more. Twice a week wasn't enough.
the sigle most interesting human being in this school
she will still remember my name... maybe not in a favorable light, but she will remember

the BEST teacher you will EVER have!!! Period.
1 word discribes linda van luven: unforgetable (and in a very good way )

she was ruff & she hated me... knew my name personally hahaha... bet if she reads this she knows who i am. I didn't like her class. I am just not interested in that stuff... she is almost too liberal to a point of annoying but hey to each his own.
She's the bomb!
She rocks!

Great professor! Teaches must take classes.  What you learn will change and question how you view life.  A true valuable experience.

I absolutely loved this class!! Furthermore, I did regret not having found LVL sooner while I was at UCLA...she's the most amazing prof I ever had the chance take!! She is very challenging, but she forces you to think over the bar you're used to thinking.

BEST TEACHER I have ever had in my life, IN MY LIFE!!!! Every where i go and anyone i run into who has had her agrees that she is life changing. People pour their hearts and thanks out to her at the end of class crying every quarter....amazing!

Part academic. Part talk show host. Part comedian.  She is awe inspiring and her dedication to sexual liberation and education is intense.  I respect her whole-heartedly.  She will bring an eternal smile to my face every time I think of UCLA.

This class was challenging but wonderful. LVL made me change my major to Sociology (despite a good GPA in another major)-- and that says a lot. Her class helped me understand others and myself, take the course, you won't regret it!!!
No Comments
LVL is fabulous and energetic. She is a great lecturer and gets you really involved in the class and the subject matter. Probably the best class I ever took at UCLA.

Dr. Van Leuven really is the best thing that has happened to UCLA, well at least to the Soc department.  She made my academic experience a memorable one.  You definately cannot avoid learning something from her class, she is great!
No Comments

VAN LEUVEN ROCKS!!! "WHO KNEW?" SHE'S ENERGETIC AND BLUNT, BUT CHALLENGES YOU DAILY. SHE EXPECTS A LOT, BUT HER CLASSES WERE SO MUCH FUN. I TOOK HER FOR DEVIANCE AND CONTESTED SEXUALITY. SHE WAS ONE OF MY FAVORITE PROFESSORS AT UCLA...LVL IS AWES
wow. van leuven simply rocks my world each and every class with her insight and her just overall dedication to the students.
To put it bluntly... professor vanleuven is the reason i can look back at my career at UCLA with pride. She is hands down much more than amazing. Take her, it's an experience that is priceless.
THis is a truly special induvidual. If you have the opportunity to take with her, do it. You will neither regret nor forget it.
No Comments

Very captivating and unforgettable... She epitomizes what a college professor should be. The class is easy, but most importantly, she makes you THINK outside the box, to challenge current norms. Simply put: she is the BEST thing that has happened at UCLA.
she is very energetic and open to teaching and learning...

lots of cool guest speakers.  class isnt hard but prof has very specific guidelines for essays and assignments.  there are no exams. good lectures but attendance is required. interesting lecture. prof responds quickly to emails very helpful. great class definitely take.

The study guides are a nightmare but the lectures and guest speakers are amazing. The study guides are instead a test but they add about 2 extra readings a week that you don't talk about in class (on top of the readings for guest speakers). Grades strangely harsh for a professor that gives a 24 hour grace period. Guest speakers make it worth it.

Super nice, responds to emails / questions and concerns and is flexible regarding attendance conflicts. Study guides are genuinely helpful and seem like a lot to handle, but are more helpful than exams in terms of understanding material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: Professor Frederick provides an expected learning experience for the number one public university; simultaneously, he requires you to apply your knowledge. I recommend Professor Frederick if you have a genuine desire to better yourself.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I really enjoyed this class! The lectures were super interesting and he had guest speakers, like authors and people in the porn industry, come talk to us. There are no tests for this class but there are two very long and detailed study guides that are worth the majority of your grade, but if you stay on track you should be good.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Dave made this class very helpful and easy. He had a study guide that covered the lectures, however I feel like the study guides were a little long and graded a bit harshly. Other than that his class was really enjoyable. He brought in various guest speakers who discussed anything from bdsm to sex toys. I really enjoyed Daves class.

The class was without any exams which is very chill. There were 2 study guides, some discussions, and a final project ( optional). I like the study guides because they made to find out so much interesting information about COVID and other psychological issues, while I was answering the questions.

The lectures were not recorded so attendance and participation are critical. The grading is pretty fair and the rubric is clear. Focus on the Study Guides, start them early and you will be fine. Overall, this was a fun class and the guest speakers were all really helpful and informative for the study guide.

Never have I completed so much work for a class. The class material is interesting and fun to learn about but the amount of work for this class was so draining. No exams, just 20+ page study guides. I would honestly rather take the exams than spend 10+ hours on each study guide. Grade breakdown: 2 study guides 60%, group proj 20%, final proj 20%
Professor Dave is really helpful and attentive to his students. The lectures were always well organized and interesting, but the workload was overwhelming.

The lectures were not recorded so attendance and participation are critical. The grading is pretty fair and the rubric is clear. Focus on the Study Guides, start them early and you will be fine. Overall, this was a fun class and the guest speakers were all really helpful and informative.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Was a chill class in terms of lecture and guest speakers every class meeting. He gives lots of class time to work on group projects during class; however, if you fall behind on assignments, it can be really stressful. He communicates expectations clearly and communicates a lot week to week. Overall, I recommend this class, it was interesting.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Dave's lectures and his plethora of guest speakers makes his class interesting and fulfilling to learn about. What ruined the class for me was the heavy load of homework that's worth 75% of our grade. Instead of midterms, Dave gives 20+ page, single spaced study guides. I have never completed more work for a class in my college career...

This class is SUPER insightful and the way Frederick structures his class reallys helps your learning outcome and engagement.The two major study guides that really need attention to detail  so do not expect a regular just fill in the answer but be more indepth with outside resource and person. I recommend this course if you are able to stay on trac

4 Study Guides based on reading, lots of extra credit opportunities, and one final project. The lectures are not only very interesting, but you have the opportunity to meet a lot of other influential psychologists, researchers, and authors. Clear grading structure and instructions for assignments.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Love love loved this course! The summer course was super flexible, and Dr. Frederick is always more than willing to answer any questions you have. Keep in mind you REALLY have to put in some work to get an A; that being said I thought the lectures and study guides were interesting and engaging, and everything was graded fairly.

Professor Frederick is a wonderful professor. Even though the class was very big, 70+ students live each class, he made it very personable and every lecture felt like a group discussion which I appreciated a lot. Personally, I think when professors take this approach, I tend to learn and engage more in class. I highly recommend this class!

Exams are memorization heavy but come straight from the study guides. Also good to know research methods (experiments, correlations). Lectures are fun and engaging (and funny). One of my fave classes.

TAKE THIS CLASS!!! For someone like me who's suffering from crippling senioritis & have tasted the various demoralizing flavors of college courses, Dave's class was a much-needed breath of fresh air. I felt like this class reminded me of how exciting learning can be, and gave students a chance to voice our insights. Inspirational & highly memorable
great class. fun guest speakers. most of grade is short answer exam. learn about different topics in sexuality.
Loved loved loved this class! Discussion and debate in class get to know problem well and great lectures. 2 exams one poster and completing study guides.

Engaging lectures / homework that makes you study for the exam / mostly lecture with some discussion and activities / exams hard but doable / funny and interesting lectures / talk about hormones, brain, sexual satisfaction, dating, trans issues. One of my favorite classes.

Legit class. Exams require lots of memorizing but totally doable. Pay attention to the research studies. Sit in groups of 6 and lots of discussion. Lectures interesting and funny sometimes. Amazing guest speakers

Dr Dave is fantastic. Interesting lectures and all exams are directly from homework study guides. You ha e to memorize a lot and know research methods well. Great guest speakers and lectures. Attendances coutns toward grade.
I love his lesson
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Frederick is a fantastic professor, his lectures are soo interesting and rich of contenutes and discussion moment

I really enjoyed the class, it was a great way to end my last summer at UCLA. The course content was extremely interesting and very informative. In class discussions about topics, and exams are hand written but he gives study guides he makes the exams straight from

The course is entertaining The weakness of the course is the exam format. I agree that the recall test is better. However, his test is just the recitation of the powerpoint. More questions that link or apply the course material to the real world is better because not all people taking this course go to graduate school.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: he is very inspirational

David is an amazing professor that engages with the class to challenge their thought process. The lectures are well paced and students are given enough time to discuss with their peers their ideas. He is very approachable (available through email and before class) and gives the students the tools that they need to succeed in the class.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: This class is really great and so is Professor Dave! If you do the study guides and pay attention in lecture you will do great. Study guides are similar to the exams. You learn a lot in a short of the time. Topics were interesting as well!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: given lecture+reading packets. Lecture packets are a little hard to follow during lecture because sometimes the things he's talks about doesn't reflect to the packet. Make sure you do the packets though they're E.C.(3%boost). Tests are hard, but lecture is easy + entertaining. If you study a week before, you'll do pretty well in the class!

Dave was a really funny and engaging professor. However, the tests very heavily rely on memorization. I also wish we spoke more about human sexuality rather than biological and evolutionary studies of why certain phenomena exist. I would recommend Dave for his lecturing and the course readings, but I did not feel like I learned much about humans.
He is reaaaally a responsible professor! Clear study guides help me a lot in the exam, and the lectures are interesting with lots of discussions and surveys.

Dave provides lecture/reading study guides that outline what he expects you to learn from the course, and they are extremely helpful. As long as you are engaged in lecture, which isn't hard with him, and fill the guides out as you go along you will learn the material and do well in the course.

Professor Frederick makes the class interesting with his lectures and constant jokes. His exams mostly require memorization but he gives enough extra credit for those that dont do as well on them. His study guides are very helpful and are almost exactly what is on the exam. Would definitely take again!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This professor makes the class very interactive and interesting through his lectures and his personality. While I personally don't like group projects it was very useful in this class to delve a bit deeper into certain concepts. Overall a very good class and definitely worth learning about.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: David is very up front with what is expected in the course. He provides study guides for lectures and readings that help you know exactly what will be expected of you on the exams, and the group projects he requires are actually fun and helpful in understanding the material.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: best class ever!  i put off taking research lab until my last semester here but this class was amazing.  we covered research on racism, dating, etc.  weekly quizzes and two group projects.  Dave is funny and cares.  The class goes REALLY fast

Great and passionate professor. Lectures are information heavy; however, he lets you know exactly what will be on the exams and quizzes. I changed my vacation plans and course schedule for this once in a life time opportunity to learn from his class the one time he is on the west coast. Passionate in helping students succeed to medical school.
Heavy lectures but very passionate professor! Well qualified and respected.

Dr. Dauer does a great job teaching this course. He is very straight forward about the material that will be on the test and what won't. What makes this course very intriguing is that he is very excited about what he is teaching. Would definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. Dauer has so much life experience and I felt very lucky to have been able to learn something from him over this course! His lectures can be pretty heavy and include some techniques/procedures with immense detail that he breezes over though. However, I appreciated him letting us know exactly what we needed to study and his straightforwardedness.

Great Professor, makes course material really interesting. Very qualified, over qualified if anything to teach. An honor to learn from a man who has so many degrees. Caring, willing to offer help and advice. Really interesting to learn course material from the various perspectives he has to offer. Sympathetic towards student learning and obstacles.

Great Professor, makes course material interesting. Very qualified, over qualified if anything to teach. An honor to learn from a man who has so many degrees. Caring, willing to offer help and advice. Really interesting to learn course material from the various perspectives he has to offer. Sympathetic towards student learning and obstacles.
Love Dauer!! Super kind and knowledgeable man. Lectures were dense but very interesting
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr Dauer is a really good professor, he is clear on what he includes on the exams; lectures are fast paced but he is very considerate of everyone's standing on the class. Must-take!

Dr. Dauer is really laid back and chill. He's not working against the students and it seems like he's just there to help us learn about bioengineering (and brag a little bit). He's very clear about what will be on the exams. However, sometimes he lectures kind of quickly. You have to go to class and pay attention to get the most out of it, imo.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Dauer really cares about his students. He wants everyone to succeed and will make sure everyone feels comfortable with the material.
Does a really great job keeping the class entertained and interested in his lectures.

Definitely one of the best professors I've had at UCLA. He cares about the class and student learning, but he's also just an interesting person with a lot of life experience and a lot of stories to share. I highly respect him and am very thankful I decided to take this class.

Super knowledgeable man. Very intriguing and interesting lectures!! Very fair with material and lets you know what topics to focus on. Tests a little tricky; make sure to read carefully! Overall very respected and noteworthy man! I love his class!
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dauer has a very charismatic personality which helps keeps the students engaged on the material. The material is very interesting and he does a great way of explaining things

I took Dr. Dauer  for Physiologic Sciences 122 in summer session A at UCLA during summer 2017. I really cant say enough good things about Dr. Dauer.  He is kind, knowledgable, funny, and very fair as a professor.  You will learn tons of physiology as well as essential lessons when applying to medical school.  You are the best Dr. Dauer. Thank you!

Thank you, Dr. Dauer for a great class! This class is one of those few classes where what you learn you use for life to help yourself and/or others. Dr. Dauer teaches extremely well, so hard concepts are made clear. He also takes time to speak with students and help them on their career pathway.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: I had to work hard in this class, but I honestly enjoyed it.
Great professor. I would definitely take this class again.

Definitely recommend this class for anyone interested in medicine or biomedical technology. Dr. Dauer has studied both medicine and engineering so he bridges the gap between the two excellently. He always keeps lectures engaging and his class is fair.

Dr. Dauer really cares about his students. He is a world class, diagnostic radiologist that facilitates a great learning experience and never fails to prompt interest. I would highly recommend this class to anyone interested in biomedical science.

Wonderful professor who really cares about his students and wants us to not only do well in the class but do well in our future and will take the time to give us advice on future careers in the health field and how we can succeed.

This class is a must take for anyone interested in biomedical engineering or preparing to prepare for medical school. Dr. Dauer gives students interesting lectures and has clear expectations. Put in the work and you will get an A.
Great prof. Sometime goes on random tangents but they are almost always entertaining.

Professor Dauer is by far one if the best professors I have had at UCLA. Not only are his lectures extremely engaging and very interesting, but Dr. Dauer also truly cares about his students' well being and makes himself very available to answer questions. He strives for his course to not provide extra stress. I would highly recommend this course!

Dr. Dauer's lectures are not only informative but also engaging. It was especially so because he would tell us about his clinical experiences with patients. Although I had no interest in biomedical technology initially, I was definitely swayed by the end of class due to how he presents the information. Definitely take his class if you can!

Dr Dauer is a great professor. He genuinely cares about his students and wants to see all of them succeed. HIs grading is very fair and he isn't there to trick you on tests. They are very straight forward. Anyone should take his class. There is never a dull moment.

Dr. Dauer's class teaches very relevant and fascinating biomedical topics, like MRI machines to stents for coronary disease to bone marrow transplant. Dr. Dauer also tailors the class for pre-med students, which is a plus for many. He's willing to meet outside of class and is very approachable. However, he goes off on tangents about his hobbies

Dr. Dauer cares about his students and their learning. He is readily available outside the classroom. The class itself is interesting and offers valuable and relevant information for pre-medical students. I highly recommend taking his class.

His lecture presentations are always interesting and keeps me at my toes. Never felt like sleeping in his lectures and that says something considering the fact that I am heavily prone to sleep in classes. Truly a respectable scholar and teacher. Please take Dr. Dauer's classes whenever he is available!
Dr. Dauer is absolutely amazing, take him if you get the chance.
Professor Dauer is awesome! He is an interesting lecturer, clearly knows his stuff! Very friendly and approachable!

The professor puts a lot of work into his presentations. He drops hints on what will be on the exam, and if you catch them, you will do well in his course. His course is a difficult not just in his teaching style, but the material he covers is a big variety.  He is very dedicated to this subject, and can make the class entertaining. Awesome guy!

Professor Dauer connects concepts to real world application, goes above and beyond outside of class with regards to availability, and is an expert in a lot of material, making class really interesting.

It was a pleasure taking Dr. D's class this summer quarter. The course content was interesting and relevant, especially for aspiring doctors. Dr. D was extremely clear in grading criteria, presented engaging lectures, and made himself accessible to students outside of class. One of the most helpful professors I've ever had--take this class!
Awesome professor. Dr. Dauer teaches us a lot of important concepts. He is a very dedicated professor. I would want to take him again.
helpful professor

This was my first physci class and I actually loved it. I honestly learned so much and I'm definitely keeping the powerpoints for future reference. Dr. Dauer is a great professor with great stories and he makes every subject exciting and simple. He personally gave me great advice regarding my future in science. I high recommend taking this class

Professor who is dedicated to teaching and dedicated his students. Dr. Dauer is not only a great professor but a great mentor who is willing to help out students and talk about their future endeavors.He is very approachable and wants his students to do well. All professors need to be more like Dr. Dauer!

Doctor Dauer brings a lot to UCLA. He has high expectations for his students and motivates his students to live up to them. I have learned and have been able to retain class material and I credit Dr. Dauer's passion for teaching.
Great professor

Took his intro to stats class through UCLA Extension. His lectures are very engaging and helpful and clearly explain topics covered in the textbook. It's very clear that he's passionate about statistics and teaching. I really enjoyed his class and would highly recommend!

Yeooo Professor Chen is the best. So organized, so clear, so concise. Every week there will be an in-class quiz, textbook readings, and assignments, but the assignments will be good practice problems for the following week's quiz. You can tell he really loves teaching too. AND he tries really hard to be politically correct, it's so sweet.

I was nervous since I hadn't taken math in ages, this class is designed like a map to guide you through learning the content from start to finish. It's meticulously organized, lectures are recorded for you to review, practice problems solidify the concepts and help you succeed on the tests. I wish all professors were this good!

Really cool guy and is willing to help all his students understand statistics. Im not a math person and was nervous about taking this class but he really helps you understand the material in a smooth process to learn. He gives us everything we need to learn the material and pass the class, everythings online and can make cheat sheet for the tests

Miles is extremely interested in the success of his students. I took this class as my last GE and he certainly made it worth waking up for the  9am class. The Quizzes  are super easy and made up the same amount of the grade as the midterms. It takes the pressure off of the bigger tests. If he keeps the same setup you'll easily get an A.

Miles is a caring professor, who explains the material carefully and efficiently. He provides extra credit, and the quizzes and labs aren't difficult if you go to his lectures. He is accessible if you need help with either the class or if you have any concerns going on in your life. Simply put, Miles is awesome.

Professor Chen is such an amazing professor who clearly cares about student learning and does everything he can to help students get a good grade in his class. Exams, quizzes, and labs are all very fair, and he provides practice quizzes which definitely help a lot. His amazing personality made the class even more enjoyable!

One of the best professors that I have ever taken at UCLA. He is so kind and caring. He made the class so interesting. I actually understood what was being done in class despite hating math! He might have even inspired me to attempt the Statistics minor. I know most majors require Stats 10 as a pre-requisite and I would highly recommend Chen.

Professor Chen is one the best professors I've ever had. He really cares about his students and is very helpful. His exams and quizzes are very fair and if you study you can do well in the class. He is a really good lecturer and covers the material in a way that makes statistics seem easy! I would definitely recommend taking his classes.

Professor Chen is the best professor I have had at UCLA so far! I have never taken a stats class before and I thought I was going to hate it, but he makes the class understandable and enjoyable. He truly cares how his students are doing and makes sure every subject is clear.

Professor Chen really does care about your well-being, and simply wants you to learn and enjoy Statistics. He's very clear about what to expect, and there really are no surprises with him. He understand we're struggling students and takes that into account with the amount of work he assigns. Lectures were really enjoyable.

Dr. Chen is amazing!!!!  I wish I could take him for every class.  His class is well organized and he is really straight forward.  Fair grader and extremely helpful.  Midterm and final are take home.  Everything is submitted online.

Dr. Chen is really cool.  Recent grad student and is really down to earth.  Explains well and is very clear with his expectations.  Getting an A is super possible, but you def have to do the assignments and look at his code.  Teaches you a lot.  I wish he could teach all my classes!  Take him.
WOW! This guy is AWESOME! One of the best professors you'll have.

This guy is supreme! Excellent professor. He outlines what he expects of you and gives you a plethora of tools to meet his expectations (such as study guides, videos, etc.). He also has a nice sense of humor! Awesome guy.

Professor Chen is amazing! He is 1 of those professors who is very caring and wants to see his students do well, but that all depends on if you're willing to put in the time and effort to understand the material. Textbook use is low- only need for hw, this is an example of what a fair teacher, grader, and class should be like, thank you professor!

Professor miles Chen gives you the tools you need to succeed in the class ! I have not taken a math class in years but was able to pass this class. Professors Chens video lectures and tutorials on homework problems will save you in this class ! I found the text book to be confusing and useless however it is required to do homework assignments.

Anyone who doesn't do well in this class is just lazy. He has YouTube videos on how to do all of the homework, he records every lecture, and he makes stats very relatable and engaging. I haven't paid attention in math in years and I still understood the material. One of the best professors I've ever had!

25% of the class dropped by the time I did. I assume the good reviews are from the ones who were able to "get it".  He is somewhat helpful, but he won't review anything one is already supposed to know (i.e., algebra). His quizzes are too long for a 30 minute slot (specially after working all day).  From 3rd week on, most people looked desperate.

In my wildest dreams I could not have imagined that I would fall in love with statistics.  Took as a prerequisite.  Its been a while since math class, so I was intimidated and thought Id have to drop out.  Dr. Chens enthusiasm, creativity, clarity and availability to answer questions motivated me to try, and I learned so much.  A great teacher!

Miles is a great teacher!! I absolutely hate math, I'm not good at it at all, but worked very very hard and got an A! He gives you a lot of hmwk, but trust me you will do very well in the class if you just keep up. He really wants the class to succeed and even posts his lectures and hmwk answers online. I recommend taking this course with him!

Stats requires at least a few hours of homework each week. You will do well without spending this time. That said, Prof Chen is a very good teacher, VERY fair grader, and offers more than enough opportunity to do well in his class (especially toward the end). Don't skip class or homework, pay close attention to lecture, and you'll excel with Chen.

He made math seem so easy and fun! and i hate math. I went with the mindset of just passing with a C but I ended up getting A. that says alot about him as a professor, he really care about his students, he is by far the best professor, because he really enjoys his work. the videos are a big help, so is the note card he lets you bring.

MC is a great guy! But this isn't a popularity contest. Goes way 2fast& doesn't challenge students answer ?s &get involved. Class full w/spoiled kiddies whose mommy/daddy paid 4them. They talked, mocked students asking questions the ENTIRE class. MC doesn't know how to control his class @all impossible 2focus. Work hard 4my$ 2babysit.2distractiing!

Professor Miles Chen is a beyond professional passionate dedicated and an extremely true professor. hard math course however it's doable if students thrive to succeed. I learned SO much by giving 250 percent. Must do Office hrs attend every single class and practice. wow Amazing Professor God Bless Miles Chen.

He is just too good to be true. Extremely organized. You really can get an A if you do the homework pay attention in class.He video tapes his lectures. Don't miss a quiz he gives 4 quizzes and take only the highest 3. each quiz has 5 point bounce. Best professor I have ever had in my life! he just great if you willing to do the work. DO THE WORK

I did not pass this class, but no fault of professor. He is a great instructor and does everything possiable to help you understand and pass his class. I highly recommend him for any student who is serious about learning and willing to do his/her part. The professor does his part 1000%
