i would of failed if not for every homework problem and lecture being uploaded on youtube. its the most helpful thing in the world. you don't need to be great in math to get an A. you are allowed cheat sheets on the test which is so cash. I got an A and haven't taken a math course in 3 years. this is the guy to take. best ever.

Miles Chen is a superb instructor - he made the course challenging,engaging, interesting - I loved his real-world world examples--truly brilliant.  Also exceptionally patient and helpful in office hours.  The course was perfectly balanced. I wish I could take another course with Professor Chen!
Great instructor who manages to keep faster learners engaged while not leaving slower students behind.
Really great professor! veey patient and clear. Made stats enjoyable :)

Professor Chen made stats palatable. He is extremely nice and conscientious. Also, he makes himself very available to students via email and his website. I absolutely recommend taking stats with him. I only wish more professors were as inspiring as him!
Sickest guy, really good teacher. Makes everything clear and his youtube videos really help.
Great teacher.  Passionate about the subject matter and great resources available on youtube for both lectures and homework solutions.

Knowledge o/basic math & algebra needed. Excellent instructor that genuinely cares about students' learning. Online vids so helpful for those that work full-time but go to class when you can. Subject matter is not easy so take time to do hmwk and learn material and you'll do fine. Office hours & accessible by email. Highly recommended teacher!
Brush up on your basic math

Great instructor. He posts lectures and HW solutions online. Very accessible but be prepared to work. If you don"t do the work you will not pass, this material is complex. Follow his CARD tips and you can get a good/great grade. Brush up on your elementary math skills, decimal/fractions, simple linear equations. Only need reg. calculator.
really good professor
Incredible teacher. Take this class. So willing to help. exams are not bad.

Best class I have ever taken in USC. He was so enthusiastic about what he teaches, always willing to help his students or to discuss anything with his students. Exams are writing essays based on readings and lectures. there's no right/wrong answer but you need to develop your arguments logically. Pay attention to his lectures and do the readings!

Professor Von Blum is one exciting, inspiring and intelligent man. He is extremely engaging with his students, managing to get impressive participation in a class get participation in a 120 person class. He encourages you to think about apathy, inequality, racism, war, patriarchal society. Yells at first, but honestly cares about his students!

Took his course at USC on censorship and the 1st amendment. Would definitely recommend him to any student. He is a very passionate educator with lots of life and educational experience. He talks loud and is bold. Midterm and final only -- essay style. Loved this class.

Professor Von Blum is by far my favorite professor at UCLA. His stories are great, he challenges you with intriguing scenarios, is extremely passionate about his subject, and truly cares about his students. I really have no negatives to say; I am even pursuing an individual studies course with him in the fall!

I took courses with Paul Von Blum at U.C. Berkeley over 35 years ago.  He was a highlight of my college experience.  I still think about the books we read (The Plague, Miss Lonelyhearts, The Loneliness of the Long Distance Runner, etc.) as well as the artists we studied (Hogarth, Goya, Daumier, etc.)  Thank you, Paul, for everything!

I took several of his pol sci classes at UC Irvine 20 yrs ago and thought so highly of him that I recently looked him up to see if he was still at UCLA.  He challenged us with moral and ethical scenarios which made us think and some didn't like it.  I loved it and thought he was very brave to push the envelope on taboo subjects.BEST Teacher EVER!

I took Paul's class over 13 years ago.  He helped shape my understanding of the world.  I learned a lot about Paul Robeson, who continues to inspire me, and about public art.  Good teachers question the way we think about the world and they force us to ask ourselves questions far after the exams are over.  I recommend that everyone take him.

Anyone reading this....I took two courses with Paul in the mid-70's at Berkeley.  35 years later, I can tell you he changed my life.  What he teaches is how to think and communicate.  Whatever you do in your life...those are the most important tools.

Itrs professors like Von Blum that make UCLA prestigious and worthy of anything. He's been in the UC system I believe for over 20 years begining with Berkeley.. part of the Civil Rights movement.. I cant say more than passionate & experienced to describe him. You must take a class with him to make your education worth anything!

At first I did not want to go to class during the summer because basically I did not have to for the grade was based on two essays. But the passion and quality of this teacher made me want to go just to hear him talk and engage in the interesting conversations. I RECOMMEND THIS TEACHER!

This class was soo long that it could get kinda boring, but professor Von Blum is the type that will go out of his way to help you understand and grasp the information. I recomend him just another course.
EXCELLENT PROF! MUST TAKE AT LEAST ONCE WHILE AT UCLA!

I would not call this man a teacher, but more a speaker. He is a very passionate speaker. However, I had no idea what he wanted us to retain. I did not know what to take down in my notes. I think it is completely unfair that some TAs grade harsher than others. It is an easy grade if you have easy TAs. If you are a great writer, you should be fine.

He's an amazing teacher! The discussions in class - the way he leads them w/out you even noticing it -, his points and questions, the topics, the works, etc. were excellent. AND he's  there for his students anytime.

I disagree with the previous review. My discussion sections with my TA helped glue everything from lecture and readings together. I did very well in the class and found my TA to be very accessible and helpful. If you write well and convincingly, participate in discussion, and attend sections, you'll get an easy A.

He is very passionate about his teaching, but the grades are not in line with what you learn.  Poor TAs that lack communication skills.  He is a great guy with interesting lectures, but the graded system is all subjective and is not objective.
No Comments
EASY B HARD A
very captive speaker with lots of interesting stories.  class is just two papers and a quiz, class can inspire you.  is always open to help students after class
he's one of the best professor here.

Von Blum is by far one of the best professors at UCLA.  he give his lectures with much energy and her sincerely cares about his students.  he has a passion for what he does and what he teaches- and it shows.  if you haven't taken a class with von blum, you've missed out.
After graduating from UCLA, Von Blums classes are probably the fondest *coursework* memory that I have.  He really enhanced my college experience.

Who takes you on a field trip to LA county Jail for a Speech class - Prof. Von Blum. This man poseses a gift for teaching. He inspires and excites his students through the greatest lessons of all, that which come from real life experience. I'll never forget some of the discussions we had in and out of class. How many teachers truly make that kind of an impact? I hope he'd take pride knowing he's partialy to blame for the passion (and stories) I bring into my own classroom.
Amazing professor. Amazing man. Like no professor you've ever had.

One-of-a-kind professor-- Exemplary man. The most profound and influential teacher i've had.  I'm now a professor in San Diego and I continue to reference Von Blum as an inspiration. Unfortunately, the UCLA administration fails to recognize that it's the people like Paul who make the university honorable, respected and prestigious.

Thrilled to see the students at UCLA recognize quality - had Von Blum over ten years ago at UCI and we all worshipped him.  I am now a professor on the East Coast and he is still the best I've ever seen.  He is a living legend, so make your time with him count.  He is a rare gift.

I love this professor, his classes are interesting, and he brings together a wide range of knowledge and integrates them into his classes. and he teaches everything! I especically liked his women's studies and art history courses, and I guess the comm classes were awesome tooo. You rock Paul!
well he is my dad so I guess you can say that he's also my professor. If any of you students have heard any stories about me in your class, remember that it's just a story.  love you dad
this professor is excellent, and unlike another reviewer's opinion, I like his personal stories because he is actually interesting
anybody like hearing stories?  because that's what his lectures are.  very opinionated man, prefers to share past experiences rather than teach anything.
we loev you BLUUUUUUUM!!

This professor truly cares about his students - like no other I have met at UCLA or anywhere. He even spend his off hours helping students, taking students on field trips (four field trips in one quarter!) The best teacher I've had!
No Comments
Professor Von Blum is quite refreshing and he doesn't believe in final exams.
Most caring and respected professor

Great professor! The workload for this class was extremely manageable and easy to follow as long as you pay attention in lectures. Provided weekly study guides which helped with understanding class material and the quiz questions were based on these study guides! Lectures were also recorded with subtitles and attendance was not mandatory!
The best professor I have ever met. Legit the GOAT.!!!
She is very caring and understanding
Interesting lectures ranging on many topics. Greatly enjoyed the class and hope to be able to take another class soon.

I loved Professor Placek's class.  She is approachable and well-versed in her subject area. Her lectures are interesting and keep your attention easily. She keeps materials current and all of the studies we read were interesting and not too long. Homework assignments were appropriate in size and quizzes were not very difficult.
Caring, compassionate professor, very easy to communicate with fast feedback. I will take any class of hers she is dedicated to your learning. A true value to UCLA.

Dr. Placek knows how to teach difficult concepts in a way that captivates young adults. She provides a variety of different resources like traditional readings, tv show episodes, documentaries, guest lectures, etc. And she really cares about her students. She's very helpful with assignments and even helps us discover things about ourselves!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: This class is chaotic and you have no idea what the assignment is asking of you. There are probably seven TRILLION instructions and conditions you have to keep in mind per workbook Prompt. You can find 50,000 more on the syllabus if you want to be extra perfectionist. ONE prompt question is a PAGE full of instructions.

Best professor I've had at UCLA, she makes learning so fun! Don't be scared of her quizzes, I watched the lectures + went over the study guides and got an A or B on them all. She gave a generous 7% of EC. Follow the rubric and you can get a perfect score on her papers. She's so cool & accommodating. I would take all my classes with her if I could.

Great Professor who gives you plenty of help for the weekly quizzes. There's a study guide for it every week that has everything covered for the quiz, so even if you don't want to go through the weekly reading then you can at least grind the study guide.

I enjoyed taking this class over the summer sessions. The course content was very interesting which helped with staying engaged in an asynchronous class. There is a quiz every week regarding that weeks lectures/readings. There is also 2 workbooks that are straightforward and relatively easy if you paid attention throughout the course.
This is a very balanced and informational course. I took it asynchronously and you will be able to obtain an A as long as you watch the lectures fully through. The content is also really interesting!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Wonderful course. Was very interesting and engaging. Clear that the professor loves the topic she teaches. She is very helpful during office hours. If you remotely pay attention to the lectures, she tells you the answers to most of the quiz content during those lectures. She offers a few opportunities for extra credit also ! great class !!

Professor Placek doesn't just teach what is traditional, she digs deep and it will blow your mind!

Class isn't hard but quizzes can be confusing with the wording.  She's understanding but don't take advantage of her kindness.  Don't expect to get an extension on an assignment if you don't show up to class/never make comments or ask questions.

Professor Placek is very nice and her lectures are actually fun and interesting. Usually we're done a little early too, which is nice. Personally, I thought the class was very easy, but that's because I attend lectures and studied for the quizzes for a few hours. Would take her again, and I probably will in the fall.

Prof. Placek is incredibly engaging. The content material provided is exciting and relevant. She has fascinating guest speakers for both courses. She is very accessible via email or office hours. She records the lectures, is accommodating, and does not count attendance. Stay on top of workbooks and review material! The quizzes require studying.

I love Professor Placek. Her lectures and material are super interesting. She is accommodating, caring, and considerate of all students. She wants everyone to succeed. I've already taken both classes but would immediately take her courses again. Quizzes can be challenging. Make sure to review lectures. I would highly recommend!

Lectures were super engaging. Prof. Placek really cares about all her students and creates a welcoming/safe learning environment in her classroom. Only thing I didn't like all too much were the quizzes. I don't know if I was the only one who struggled that much, but I never did well on them despite how much I studied. Workbooks were good though.

She has one of the clearest grading criteria and the course is about probably something that you never expected to be taught in a university classroom. Do take this course if you are interested in such topics and do not if you hate readings.

Professor Placek is one of the most caring teachers. - Cares about our well-being and grades & always provides additional instructions on assignments. -The lectures are to the point -Tests are a little confusing because of the wording, but if you study the lectures & readings, you are good! Caring, respected, and interesting professor!

Good professor and very caring, the TA's kind of graded harsher than I'm used to. Quizzes sometimes were confusing. On the study guides she gives there's a correct answer and then on the exam when that question is asked it's missing the correct answer but has all the other options. Attendance wasn't mandatory and online recordings were provided.
Class seems like it will be super easy in week 1, but the grading is really rough.

One of my favorite professors! She chooses really interesting topics and makes lecture fun. To do well on quizzes, you just need to go to lecture and listen/ take notes. She really cares about what she's teaching as well as the well-being of her students. Thank you Prof Placek for a great quarter!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: OUTSTANDING PROFESSOR EVER! She is generous and friendly if you face any hardship in your quizzes or assignments. I appreciate her caring for a whole semester, I definitely would take her courses in the future again!

Dr. Placek is one of the most generous, understanding, and engaging professors I have taken here at UCLA. She was an amazing lecturer, and had quite a few guest speakers to break up the monotony of school work. She is easy to relate to and fun to listen to. I highly recommend attending lecture... it will benefit you for her tests.

Dr. Placek is tremendously understanding and approachable. She cares about her students, gives extensions on assignments w/o taking points off is very accommodating during exams, and lets you reschedule w/o a question. I took soc. 132 w/ her and it was very interesting. her exams take a bit of getting used to but she applies a curve if needed.
Really enjoyed taking this class and learning about the material!

If you can take any class by Prof Placek pls do! They are so interesting and bring in a good amount of guest lecturers to break up the coursework and keep things fresh. I always felt engaged during class and enjoyed speaking to them after as well. The graders were a little harsh but there are several extra credit opportunities.

Professor P, is one of the most caring professors UCLA has to offer. She is very understanding. Be transparent with her if you are facing any obstacles. Be prepared for weekly monitored test. Do the study guides and take GOOD lecture notes and you should do fine on the test. She grades on a curve. Start your workbooks early.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: Socio - 145This course is structure primarily with a study guide review that are useful for the weekly quizzes and for following lecture. Lecture can cause for you to be distracted since the professor might go on tangents but overall good professor.

Placek has probably been my least favorite professor at UCLA. The way Placek lectures is very unorganized and goes on random tangents. Almost everyone did very bad on the midterm. Grades are based off of participation(10%), 2 workbooks(50%), a midterm (20%), and a final but you can opt to do a 3 page single spaced reflection paper instead (20%).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Placek made my first quarter at UCLA amazing. When I first began her class I was genuinely uninterested in the course material and by the end of the quarter, I became well-invested in the course material looked forward to her lectures. Be prepared to write a lot for the workbooks though and start early.

Dr. Placek provides an incredibly supportive classroom environment, which was especially conducive to my learning for this Sociology of Sexuality class. Her responses to the research articles presented in class are critically kind and compassionate. She is an excellent facilitator of discussion and respects her students unique perspectives.

Professor Placek is very caring and accessible. The course is well structured with very interesting topics. There are guest speakers, and the lectures are very inspiring. Would definitely take another course from Professor Placek again.

She gets the struggle of being a student & provides all materials for free. Its clear she's rlly seen it all, nothing phases her &she rlly likes to open up the lecture into class discussion.. Even tho she is super chill the work should be taken seriously. She gives specific rubrics & lecture attendance was optional bc she provided a recording

This class is very fun and interesting. Workload is manageable if you get started early. Amazing guest lecturers!!! Only downside is lots of references to popular media so if you don't watch TV it's a little hard to understand at times.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Placek has honestly been one of (if not my favorite) lectures @ UCLA. Take any of Dr. Placek's classes. Her lectures helped me learn more about myself & conversely, what I've been taught about conventionally stigmatized or deviant communities.  Dr. Placek was extremely understanding & extended deadlines when necessary. We Love Dr. Placek !10/10
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Accessible outside class

comment: Amazing the lectures were always interesting and we had guest lectures. The class has 2 workbooks, midterm quiz, extra credit, and the final was either a quiz or essay. Everything is interesting. The TAs also help a lot with understanding topics. She is also super funny.

Just awful. Doesn't seem to want to even be in class. Barely knows material. If you can work the homework problems, the old exams, and TA review problems then you should do well on the tests. avoid her like the plague.

Professor Annabi is the best,knowledgeable,patience and She is one of the highest honors in the world.
We all know who are those who make negative comments and who are they from and what is their intention, they are not more than two people, it is better to seek more effort in education instead of envy.
Recommend
she is a very easy professor. The class was very difficult to not get an "A" in it. However, that does not mean it is a useful class or that you'd learn very much from the experience.
No comments, just bad.

HORRIBLE!!!
You could skip class since everything she lectures are in the book and the powerpoints based on the book.

Annabi is nice, but she is very very difficult to understand. She can't answer questions well so her lecture is next to useless. Count on using the textbook and practice exams to learn the material on your own. I don't want to completely bash her though because she tries hard to do what she can for her students.

I'm 100% sure that she knows nothing about Bioseparations! NEVER take her class! She answered almost no question! She taught wrong formula! She deliberately forget extra credits for course evaluations! No more Annabi for me
Highly recommend this class and prof.Annabi. She is knowledgeable and caring.

The TA was more help than her by far. Don't get me wrong she seems like a nice person but i didnt learn anything in her class. When we asked her for help she simply said "please ask my TA". At first I thought she was strict but quickly realized she had no idea what she was doing.

Best course& instructor. Prof Annabi is great. Course was well organized.Really liked the course structure, lectures and invited speakers seminars. We worked on a research project with our team members and gave a group presentation during the last week and liked doing research on topic related to medical applications of materials. Def recommend her

Enjoyed C124, also took C125 with Prof Annabi. Very knowledgeable and an expert in biomaterials. With no biology background, I learned many new concept in biomaterials and tissue engineering, great lectures, also posted lecture notes/recordings soon after the class. assignments were journal club presentation and paper summery. Highly recommend it!

I enjoyed this course. Surprised by all the negative comments that is obviously repeated by few disgruntled students. prof.Annabi knows course material well. organized lecture notes ,knowledgeable and expert in her field and more importantly caring. Definitely recommend her.
Amazing prof. cares about her students and their success. Highly recommend prof.Annabi.
She is unprofessional, does not prepare for class, and her class is somewhat uninteresting.

Annabi is quite possibly the worst professor I've ever had. She teaches so much off her slides it seems like she doesn't even know what she's teaching. She was very condescending when students were confused and had to ask questions. She refuses to be accommodating to students, and failed to organize her course in any way that made sense.
she is awful

This by far has been the worst college course I've ever taken. Professor Annabi is not helpful. She is constantly corrected by students and is very unclear when trying to teach. She also seems to get bothered if you ask for clarification. If you have the book you are better off teaching yourself. I wish I had something positive to say, but I don't.
worst ever

Nasim Annabi is a very nice lady. Unfortunately she does not have a firm grasp of the bioseparation course and should not be teaching this class. She is disorganized and changes due dates at the last minute. It appears the students know more about separation strategies and UO problems than she does. But getting an A wasn't that hard.

The problem is trivial. When she does answer a question, she says an answer that is completely unrelated to the question. In addition, during most classes, she does not know how to solve some problems in the textbook. She would put an equation on the board, spend at most 10 minutes on a problem, and this is not an exaggeration, and then erases it.

Prof. Annabi is by far one of the best teachers at Chemical Eng Dept at UCLA. You will notice her dedication towards her students and enthusiasm to teach. She shows how theoretical materials relate to real life industry problems. She has an accent ( common among professors in engineering majors) but speaks clearly. many share my opinion!

I got an A in this class and still say that she is one of the worst teachers I have had. It is possible to get an A in her class, but she is not a very good teacher and ruined a class that I was very excited to take.

She is barely qualified to be a lecturer. After spending an entire class bumbling around writing arbitrary equations and becoming confused by her own algebra and logic. Poor teacher, poor understanding of subject matter.
If anyone want to learn something please dont take her class. She is unbelievable. My advice ( save your money ).
It was okay. Prof. Annabi was not very organized but she is kind and caring.

Dr. Annabi is without a doubt the WORST professor I ever ever had in my academic career. Extremely inconsiderate person. She never answered any of questions. I taken two classes with her and in both of these classes she promised extra credit but never kept her promise. If you can, DO NOT take a class with her.
Just No!

Dr. Annabi is kind and caring and easy to communicate with. Course is easy and you can get an easy A if you have already pass reaction engineering course. Final project was fun, and she gave an award to our group.

I highly recommend taking this class for an easy A. Prof Annabi is a very generous grader and gives lots of food/drink during the course. I don't think anyone learned anything from this course - Prof Annabi is not a natural teacher. And she won't be able to answer homework/test questions 99% of the time. But, it will bump your GPA

Just okay! Exams are technically the same as last year, but she was not helpful at all if you had any real questions or concerns. Most of my emails were forwarded to the TA, and questions after class brushed off.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--EXTRA CREDIT--So many papers

comment: The course is very easy; the lectures are basically the text book (same and even easier than 106 Chemical Reaction Engineering); Just attend the class and get an easy A; Professor Annabi is kind and bought us cookies and coffee :d, but she is not very helpful, like she doesn't know well the stuff and can't properly answer the questions!

Professor Annabi was one of the dumbest people I ever met. She made several mathematical errors on the board while doing problems. If students had any questions, she had no idea how to respond, instead asking the TA. I asked her a basic question regarding the homework and she told me she never looked at the problem before, and referred me to the TA

Professor Ruiz is one of the funniest professors I've had in UCLA. He enjoys teaching and engaging with students, which demonstrates that he cares about student learning .One of his key messages is for us to enjoy life.
Such a great lecturer, I would take him every year if I could. He was helpful, considerate, and gives us the midterm and final weeks in advance.
Amazing performer! Memorized verses of Classics of Spanish Golden Age! Overall great class! BEST TEACHER, caring , understanding and a bit revolutionary which makes him even better of a person!

The first lecture I attended Freshman year. After stepping out of Moore, I thought all professors were as enthusiastic, bright spirited and passionate in what they taught. He has a great sense of humor and truly cares about his students. I regret not going to office hours, yet I will definitely take another class with him. Take him! Easy A as well.

If there were words to describe Teo! He likes you to show up to class but I wouldn't necessarily call it mandatory, but it gets to the point where you WANT to show up to class. He really is a storyteller and sucks you in in lecture to the point where you don't realize you learned anything until you write a paper. Incredible teacher and human being!

In short, their is nothing NOT to LOVE about Teo.  A great professor, probably the best UCLA offers.  Fun, engaging, incredibly knowledgeable.  Teo is what I will miss most when my days at UCLA are done.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Dr. Ruiz has been in National Geographic television for the show "TABOO" and was a Princeton University professor in his earlier years. His lectures are so moving, he will almost bring tears to your eyes. He incorporates history and life as a human being into great depth, touching the heart of a student who truly loves knowledge and learning.
COOL PROFESSOR. SUPER FUNNY! KNOWS HOW TO GET HIS STUDENTS' ATTENTION WHILE TEACHING EFFECTIVELY.
Love him, you'll really miss out if you don't take his class. One of the best and most caring professors I've met!
Awesome prof- best ever.
amazing guy :)

He works really hard at appearing to be friendly, but he doesn't teach history.  Rather, history is a platform for him to preach his message of hedonism and revolution.  That's all he cares about and you'd better be able to write about it on his tests if you want a good grade.
No Comments
Best history professor/history chair ever!
Awesome teacher, do your self a favor and sign up for his class.
teo is the greatest! do urself some good and take a class with teo. went to paris with him this past summer...a truly amazing experience!
One of the best teachers ever!
Best. Teacher. Ever.
Don't graduate from UCLA without taking a class with Teo... your tuition is a waste without it.
Teo is the man.
Amazing is the only word for Teo
I love this man...
I love this man...

ive taken most of teo's classes. his 121 series, his religion & magic class, etc. and i even did a research project for him. the one thing about teo that stands out above his colleagues is the amount of caring he has for his students, their well being, and their educational experience.
Teo is so much fun. He is an awesome professor.
What a remarkable, interesting, caring professor.  His lectures are like being transported to another time.  Best professor in my years at UCLA.
My favorite professor at UCLA. Very passionate about teaching and an expert in medieval history.
He is a great professor and advisor.
WOW!! absolutely the teach I had at UCLA.
No Comments
SIMPLY THE BEST TEACHER AT UCLA!
Absolutely the best professor! I love him. He is just great. He is so passionate about the material that there is no way this is boring. He also relates the importance of history now.

Do not take this professor. This class consists of 3 assignments: Midterm, Paper, and a Final. This class is very lecture heavy but he does not use powerpoint or detailed notes. I ended up recording lectures to rewrite later. Everything he said could show up on the exams. Grading takes way too long. Overall, avoid this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
This class is hard, but worth it! Super informative. 
START STUDYING EARLY (memorize material from each week, week by week).
START WRITING YOUR 10 PAGE NOTES FOR EXAMS EARLY (so many students make the mistake of waiting till last minute).
He is very clear on what he expects from you. If not COMM major - avoid him, but if you are - you got this! :))

The class material was easy enough to manage, interpret & understand. However, the grading on the test and paper is all subjective and was horrible. No critique was given the only response was that many of the other students in the class had the same concerns. There are 3 assignments so unfair grading & no rubric is detrimental to the final grade.

I took this as a GE to manage my upper divs... But it was so bad, he throws so much unorganized content and random facts that are expected to be memorized for the exams. The paper that is a huge portion of my exam was graded extremely harshly. Even after being evaluated by the UCLA paper program. Don't take this professor unless you have to.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: AVOID. He is extremely disorganized and couldn't care less about his students.
Tests aren't a test of whether or not you know the concepts, they are a gamble on whether or not you word them in a way that pleases the TA...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: This persuasion course prof. turned to the class over a dozen times (no exag.) asking if he spelled a word correctly. He persuaded us he was beyond his capabilities. The oddball concepts about persuasion, several random silly named theories such as "Theory of social attractiveness," Duh, there's a whole quarter worth of hours we'll never recoup.

If you care about your GPA do not take Suman! Neither he nor his TA would respond timely to emails until days later. I thought this would be an interesting class, I was wrong. Suman is another UCLA Professor who doesnt care about his students. The pattern repeats itself when they train future professors. Too much ego....
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He was my favorite professor! You HAVE to show up if you want to pass because that's the only way you can obtain the lecture material since there are no online notes. He explains things very clearly and tells you what to look out for on the tests so just pay attention and you should be okay. -No electronics. -Tests take full 2/3hrs b/c essays
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Avoid taking this class or a class with Suman if at all possible. Expect to read tons and tons of articles and books. Do not miss a class- everything from lecture is completely different than the assigned readings.

Comm 10 has very interesting course material, but has super difficult tests. Involves lots of pure memorization, which considering the amount of material given at EACH LECTURE, is pretty impossible unless you have a gift from god. Meh.

The guy is very funny and the things he says isn't hard to grasp. The TA (hector) sucks and not helpful AT ALL. If you can grasp alot of info in short amount of time and write detailed answers for exams, take the intro class! but if you can, don't take it with hector...

I just came out of the final and I was literally shaking. Long exam that takes the full three hours of non-stop writing. This class is a horrible thing to do to people, but on the good side, you can easily guess what you need to know and what will be on the exam. Don't procrastinate before the midterm and final! allow 3 days of study time non-stop!

Dwells in pop culture and mass quantity, so is a psuedo-intellectual. Deliberately does not offer lecture notes so you'll have to find someone who took the class before and use that person's notes. TA Sniezek sucked, since she didn't offer any detailed explanation, only her own opinions on things. Surprised he got a PhD.

Vast amount of info. Tests are long and are very detailed.  Professor is not available for assistance, and the TA (Hector) does not respond to emails nor is he helpful.  Took 28+ pages of notes, and still came out with a C.  It's a class to weed people out of the major. This class changed my perspective on Comm. If possible, take w/ diff prof & TA.

Prof. is cool. TA's are iffy. Too much information to grasp. Extremely hard to do well in this intro class unless you take scrupulous notes and MEMORIZE EVERYTHING! way too detailed to truly enjoy the class and lectures.

Intro materials aren't hard. The only thing is the QUANTITY. Man! you need to memorize EVERYTHING to get A. If you give an average answer (even tho you answered right) you only gonna get 1/2 credit. EXTRAORDINARY DETAILS are needed for A...I don't like it. Average B- pretty much every quarter.
class presented very well and easy to take notes, also graded on a huge curve, just be sure to be very very thorough on the essays for the tests
Lecture is fun, but the exams are very hard and you have to go to lecture to pass this class. Lot of times, small things are on the exam, need to know almost everything.
Nice guy, interesting class, must go to lecture to take notes to pass class!! exams are essay and some short answer, not so bad if u study hard.

anyone who wants to be a comm major has gotta take this class...  so take it with suman.  its alot of material, but it is interesting and fun learning about...  but you will definately need to invest in index cards...  study groups a must.
The material isn't too difficult, but you have to do all the readings assigned and go to section. You must know details!
Intersting and challenging.
No Comments
No Comments

As a prof, I thought he was fine. I got an A in his class and did his honors section. The next quarter I asked him for a rec for the Education Abroad Program, since we interacted often and he seemed genuinely interested in my projects and ideas. His rec (w
Large class (400+). It was easier for me because I took it my last quarter at UCLA and was a Comm major, so much of this was review.  He will hit you with some lecture only questions, so look out.

Comm 10 is a hard class. They make it hard to disuade too many people from becoming communications majors. All the comm pre-req'ds are hard, but the major isn't. But in order to major in comm you have to have a 3.5! Suman isn't bad looking either....
No Comments

i pulled a C in this class. it probably would've been higher if i actually studied for the tests. you MUST go to lecture and discussion if you want to understand the material better. there's too much to catch up on if you miss a lecture/discussion. fairly easy material, just a lot.

Info is very straight forward and clear, there is just a lot of it and tests are extensive.  Seems like a nice enough guy, gave a big curve!  Makes attempts to make it humerous.  May not be "oh damn" hot, but not bad to look at.
Course was ok and the readings weren't bad, but he screws you over on the midterm and final.  They are very extensive, cover insignificant material and are just a pain in general.
No Comments
Great

Jordan (as he likes to be called) is awesome. Learned a lot and he is very nice and always doing anything he can to help. He even does things like having an Ice Cream party at the end of class to reward our hard work. Its the little things like this that differentiate him from average professors.
Mr Mendler is very caring. Really great teacher and you can tell he is there cause he loves mentoring students

Super chill professor. If you show up and want to learn he will teach you so much. If you don't pay attention he doesn't really care cause it's sort of your own loss. He treats us like adults and his philisophy is that grades are meaningless and it's up to each student to decide if they want to put in the effort to learn what he has to teach.
Loved the class
he's great
Great professor. Challenging but sensible.
One of my favorite teachers. Highly recommended!
Really enjoyed the lectures. I learned so much
Extremely knowledgeable. I would definitely recommend taking his class.
Very very smart guy. Really knows his stuff
Great professor. Highly recommend.
Loved this guy's class. Would definitely recommend
More than a professor, a real role model.
Very good professor!!
I wish all students will have a chance to study with him
Great guy
He is one of the greatest professor I have ever known
Excellent professor.

Learned so much about the ins and outs of distributed databases and distributed systems. Love how he covers both deep architecture and theory, as well as high-level practical skills. You learn really well, yet he is very down to earth and the course is not too difficult.
Took him many times and Mr Mendler was always great
Really great professorship. I took him several times and he was already awesome.
Loved the class. Learned a lot
professional and conscientious
The teacher is very good at teaching and explaining.
Cool professor, cool lectures
Great professor. Highly recommended
Great teacher
nice guy. good lectures. smart and interesting. easy a and just good class overall
Enjoyed the class
Lectures were really great. Combined real world with theory. Very down to earth and practical.
Best class I have ever taken! Hands down GREATEST Professor on the planet. Highly recommend.
He is a terrible teacher. Ruins GPA and takes pride in failing students. Should not be teaching.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He is an awesome teacher and extremely funny. If you do study enough and properly, he is totally an easy teacher. Just ignore other rates because they are just complaining without any efforts for coursework. He gives you all you need for you to do well in the class. Just take his class, and you will know how awesome he is!

Horrible professor. I went into class thinking I could handle his absurd tests and confusing lectures, but I was wrong. He obviously wants people to fail. Once he sees that the class is doing well, he'll throw in irrelevant and absurd questions on his tests. Save yourself the trouble, your GPA, and your nerves. I warned you.
Hard class.

So on BruinWalk, some friends told me to take him, but real friends didn't.  He is brilliant in separating the "sheeps" from the "goats", so try to stay above the mean to stay a psychology major.  Good luck with that...

General psych lab. The class seems easy until you get to the tests and realize you need to repeat exactly what he expects and not simply a "correct" answer. Not sure if that's good or bad, but it keeps you on your toes. It seems like an excuse to keep the mean grade around a B-, so   I can't really take him seriously. Expect trick questions.

To get a good grade in this class you need to do practice problems on your own. McAuliffe goes very fast, covers more material than Nandy, and has trickier test. He's a funny guy and speaks English well where as the other guy does not and is boring. People in the other class seemed to struggle just as much. Do not buy the book
No matter how hard I studied, I ended up getting a C.

Worst teacher ever!!! People were crying after the midterm. He throws in exam questions that were never discussed and aren't in any of the review problems. I made stats my life for 3 weeks and the test was impossible. Tries to be funny...but it's hard to laugh at his jokes when you know he's slowly ruining your GPA and enjoying it.
He makes it really fun, there is no paper to write, there is no text book to buy...easy material
Took him for intro cog sci, and it was definitely my favorite class thus far here now at UCLA.  Tough material, good teacher, fun examples...and if you like corny jokes, hoo boyyy....
He is very knowledgeable but goes over the material TOO fast and speaks too fast making it harder to learn. His exams are very hard because you have to memorize the formulas.

his exams are a little difficult, but he posts A LOT of review problems online before each test. a lot of the questions on the exams come word for word right off of the review. if people choose not to use the review questions, then i don't feel bad that they didn't do well on the exams. he provides all the resources you need to do well.
difficult, not clear lectures,
Brutal class, but he's a nice guy.
Was always late. Unclear Lectures.
No Comments

Terrible terrible terrible.  The class is hard overall (too much stuff to memorize) and he makes it even worse.  The tests are hard... and he isn't a very good teacher.  The only thing I learned allllll quarter is that he is 6'1 and that he is taller than most people.  He used that example ALLLLL quarter.  Then, he played the guitar for us, brought us candy, and showed us his dog to get us to rate him better.  DO NOT TAKE... at least not for 100A.
tests r hard.....and u will need a tutor..and the book is useless!!!
Worst proffessor ever (for 100A). I feel sorry for you if you have him for 100A. Although, I heard he's good for other classes.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

I don't know why people think he's so funny. His jokes are quite the contrary. He grades REALLy hard. He's not clear; he basically diverted me away from the subject entirely. I would NEVER take another class with him.
Tests are culmative, harsh classd... he expects you to "know everything" It's horrid!
Harsh
Class is easy overall, his tests are somewhat hard.  The wording of his questions makes it difficult understand.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Dr. Phelan is great. His lectures are really easy to understand, and their quality is impeccable. He is dedicated to his work and students. If you watch his posted lectures and go to discussion there is really no reason that anyone should get less than a B. Awesome teacher, but also inspirational and interesting. Would recommend!

I really enjoyed Dr. Phelan's class. His lectures were interesting and he really engaged with the class. Although he posts lectures online, there are clicker questions so you have to attend. He isn't boring and you really do learn from him. He's very approachable and honestly one of the best professors I've ever had. Highly recommend him.

Professor Phelan has been one of my favorite and one of the best professor I've had so far. He makes the class topic interesting and relatable to everyday life. You are not going to want to miss a class because it is fun. I actually looked forward to going to his class as opposed to most of my other classes.
He was great. His class is engaging. If you do the work you'll get a good grade. It's a pretty easy GE.

Professor Phelan is a great professor, probably one of the best I have had at UCLA. This class helped me realize how exactly biology comes into play in my life, and that's something I appreciate. He really cares about student learning and takes time to help you.

I loved him even though i'm no longer at UCLA. Very creative way of presenting science material. You could tell he takes the time to prep his lectures.  His tests are challenging, but he curves so it's okay in the end.
Best!
Professor Phelan made me love science! he is an awesome, smart, and funny professor that really cares about his students learning.

Honestly, one of the worst professors I've ever had.  He name drops constantly in class and really doesn't clearly explain much of anything, but then expects you to know every minor detail on exams.  He's also full of himself and pretty useless if you ask him any questions.  He makes LS 2 much harder than it should be.

Hands down the best professor I've ever had. He teaches with such enthusiasm and applies all the concepts to real life situations to make it easier to understand. He's also very helpful, approachable and eager to help his students succeed. His class is one you'll actually look forward to. Material is tough but it's definitely possible to get an A.
One of the best professors at UCLA

I love Dr. Phelan, his lectures were always incredibly interesting lectures. Unfortunately even though I studied as hard as I could, I barely passed. (I must add that I was in the top 10% of my graduating high school class at a highly populated, competitive public hs in So Cal). The class is in no way easy what-so-ever.

Whoever studied their butt off and still thought the exams were hard must not be very bright. Go to class, do the homework, and the class is pretty much a breeze. An easy B, a little bit of work for an A.
His exams were really hard no matter how much more I studied and he is not that helpful when you ask him questions.
Great communication skills, but if you don't have an ok background on biology, you have to study

One of the best science professors I've ever had. The class is catered to humanities majors and is relevant to their lives rather than just another stupid bio class. He's dynamic and fun and makes his lectures easily and readily available. It's not an easy class but it is a good one.

Great professor. You can really understand what he is teaching, keeps the class interesting. Tests are hard and not enough time, but if you keep on top of the material and practice on the problems, shouldnt be that much of a problem.

He's funny.  Connects lectures to common experiences.  Excellent communication.  To understand lectures, stay on top of the reading.  Prepare to MEMORIZE.  Exams are long.  Don't procrastinate on reading - it will mess you up.
Fantastic professor.
the worst teacher i ve ever had in ucla, study hard and barely passed
His class sucks.  Take LS 2 with someone else cuz Phelan will screw you over with his exams.

He's full of himself. He can be funny in a cheesy sort of way, but when it comes down to really delving into genetics, he's not the professor to take. And his book is inane - of the less researched, popular science variety.
he sucked
He gets you interested in the material!
Hard, but ls 2 is hard in general. Very good lecturer. Record his lectures, get every detail in lecture, it will be on the exam. Get his old exams to succeed. Prepare for very long exams.

Jay Phelan should never write a book again. His book, "Mean Genes," is terrible and has no academic merit. Don't take this instructor because his class was just as bad as the book he recommended (his own book!).
best bio professor I ever had!  He is hard but you learn so much!  he makes it fun.
I can't say much about the class because I was asleep for most of it, but this prof is way hot!

Blake Allmendinger is a great professor who really cares about student's understanding and development. If you have any issues he is very easy to get in touch with either via email or during office hours. The texts are easy to read within the allotted time and Blake is available to discuss them throughout the week. Would highly recommend.

Allmendinger is my favorite professor I've had in my two years at UCLA, and definitely the one that I've had the most personal contact with. It was easy to talk to him outside of class and joke around, but he was also really helpful with information. His lectures are funny and compelling, just like him. Take his class!

Detective Fiction was one of the best courses I've taken in my college career.  The subject matter is fascinating and entertaining and the lectures are interesting.  However, the tests are extremely difficult and require creativity and a mastery of the concepts discussed in class in addition to your own theories and ideas.  Tough class but worth it

Prof. Allmendinger is professional but also funny & relaxed; you will look forward to each class if you read & appreciate witty humor -lectures are interesting & relate to real-life.  Smart, helps you to become a better writer instead of simply going through the motions. TRULY CARES, there for students, responds promptly to emails even on weekends.

Blake is absolutely amazing, especially if you're an English major! Prepare to read important texts and engage in intellectually stimulating discussions. He's always there for you whenever you need him and will ensure you succeed if you want to. He is straightforward in what he expects, and is overall a wonderful professor.

Don't take the class unless you are an eloquent and fast writer. The professor grades on in class essays. You could learn more about the subject on a weekend by reading professional essays  than you will learn in his class. Again, his class is a writing class.

Hands down the best professor I've ever had.  Incredibly kind, funny, and accessible.  On top of all that, he puts together really interesting classes.  I learned a lot, and had a blast doing it....he genuinely cares about his students.  Take his class.  Any of them.  You'll thank yourself later, it's an absolute treat.

Overall, Professor Allmendinger is very nice and extremely funny, however, he is not organized especially when it comes to explaining what he expects for papers and exams! Almost 20% of my class failed the midterm and it seems to be because he did not explain what he expected! If you take his class, be VERY careful and go to office hours!!

Obsessed with Professor Allmendinger.  He is THE most genuinely concerned and approachable professor I have ever had.  Ever.  Period.  He cares deeply about his students.  Plus, this class was outstanding...doing the "homework" (reading detective fiction novels) made me feel guilty because I enjoyed myself so much.  Take this course. It's perfect.

Fantastic teacher. Funny, insightful, and helpful. Responds to emails very quickly. Lots of discussion in class but will never pressure or cold call you into speaking in front of class. Also, very clear about breakdown of work and grades. Outstanding teacher. Did not do as well in the class than I wanted but would absolutely take him again.

Allmendinger is my all time favorite professor! I have taken two classes with him and I would not hesitate in taking more! He is funny and makes the class truly enjoyable.  He is very clear about how your grade breaks down and is always willing to help! He is also understanding if you don't want to participate in discussion. Love him!

Prof. Allmendinger (most students just call him Blake) is an amazingly devoted, highly approachable teacher and mentor. His teaching style is very casual and he rarely, if ever, merely lectures. Some students, especially those who are not very independent thinkers and who require strict guidance, may not care for this style. I, however, love it!
Best English professor at UCLA hands down. Smart, witty, and extremely dedicated. Hilarious and insightful lectures. Take his classes. You won't regret a second.

He is an excellent professor. My favorite so far. He made class fun and interesting. I would suggest his class to anyone. He is very knowledgeable about his subject and is open to feedback. He is enthusiastic in his lectures and clear on his expectations. You know what to expect on tests and can always go to him if you need help.

He is by far the best professor I have had at UCLA. He makes class fun and entertaining. He is very reasonable and approachable. He is clear on what he wants and what he tests on. Participation is not mandatory, but it can help if you are on the border of a better grade.

I disagree that you have to speak up in his class in order to do well.  I got an "A" and never participated in discussion at all. He says on the first day that participating helps if you are on the borderline for a certain grade but is by no means mandatory.  This is by far the most entertaining class I have ever had and one of the best teachers!

I just finished taking a course with him in Spring 2012.  I haven't received my final grade yet, but I definitely have to that it was the most enjoyable course I've ever taken.  It was extremely thought provoking, and I appreciated the different avenues of thoughts he offered.  He was very helpful, and extremely funny and enjoyable.

If you are quiet, I don't recommend this professor, and in fact would not recommend discussion-enriched courses in general. Allmendinger has been the most open-minded professor I have had as an English major at UCLA, and I appreciate having a professor who does not pander to his students, but raises them up to be equals at the table.
Professor Allmendinger is a great, funny, and engaging teacher. I always looked forward to his lectures. I highly recommend taking him.

He seems like a nice enough guy and is very available to give assistance. However, if you have difficulty participating in discussion, this is not the class for you. If you are very talkative, you will be happy with your grade.

Professor Allmendinger's selection of novels for my American Literature class was very diverse and interesting. His lectures are insightful and he's very articulate. He expects a lot from his students and their writing. Professor Allmendinger is very approachable and I will highly consider taking him for another course in the future.

i took allmendinger almost a decade ago. to this day, i still think back on the experience with great fondness. this guy is smart, funny, engaging and serious about scholarship. it's an honor to have the opp. to learn from him! show up, do the work and engage in the material at the level any self-respecting bruin should, and you will do well.

Your grade is set from your look. Seemed to anger him if you are cute & smart;he played "games" giving instructions then grading harshly for power "play".He likes All-American,UCLA types(Teaches the West!).If you are European or Ethnic,safely use convention and get low B, C, or D. It is hard to fail you if always use Standard writing conventions.

He is so utterly useless. I can't believe this guys is still teaching here. One of the pitfalls of tenure. I know what I'm talking about. I got an A so it's not about the grade. He gives the English Dept. a bad rep.
xyz

Barely lectures and rarely puts anything on the board. Mentions things in passing and then grades very harshly and unfairly. Appears as though he has not re the books he has assigned in quite some time which makes it difficult for him to recall facts, judge and grade fairly or add to and answer questions in class. Don't really think he has a clue.
Unfair grader.  Gives vague assignments, then grades them harshly.

He puts out so many resources to use so you can learn and understand the material well. He has great communication when it comes to tests and assignments. Id say his lectures can be boring at times, but hes a great professor.

Prof. Lavelle could have done better. My high school didn't offer AP or honors chemistry so I had basic knowledge of chemistry. You won't survive his class if you've only had that kind of background in chemistry. He speeds through material and tests on extremely complex problems. Buy course reader and practice his old exams to get at least a C-.

This class was really organized but his lectures were not. I took a super easy version of HS Chem so I was not prepared at all for this class. The quizzes, midterm, and final were really hard and I got Cs and D's on them . However the lowest quiz was dropped with HW.
His lectures are confusing and hard to follow unless you have a lot of background in chemistry. Office hours and tutoring are your best friends for this course.

Lavelle is honestly a hero. He has over 50 office hours every week with all of his TAs and UAs combined, and over 24 hours of midterm/final review sessions starting a week and a half before the test. Yes, the class can be a bit tough for some people but that's just because it's chemistry. Lavelle explains everything very clearly and is always there

Lavelle is a great guy, but as a professor, he is really frustrating. He assumes the entire class knows things when almost nobody knows it, and moves too fast during lectures. His tests are way harder than the examples he gives in class - he goes over material in a very basic way but expects you to know more difficult methods.
He is boring in class, skips over material and is generally unhelpful. Hopefully you get a good TA
Lavelle was a terrible professor. He skipped over material that he though was basic, but half the class didn't understand what he was talking about. We never used the textbook, could have save $200.

Decent professor. You will be able to pull off a B- or above if you put in moderate work, I got a B+ while working 60 hours a week outside of school. Watch the podcasts, it's easier if you rewind and make sure you understand what he's saying.

Dr. Lavelle really cares about his students. His examples are easy to follow, and he really starts from the fundamentals/basics. He doesn't expect everyone to be genius chemists, he explains things in a simple way.

BORING. Class is alright, if you can learn from a good TA, the course reader or the book, you don't need to go to lecture. Pre-meds will be in every class, so it doesn't really matter when you take this class. 12pm lecture usually has the highest curve. Everyone sleeps so don't feel bad. Do the homework, but Lavelle will complicate the tests.
Professor is a nice guy but his lectures are boring 90% of the time, although he does have a great sense of humor. Good thing is, you don't have to attend the lectures. He has webcasts online.

Lavelle seems like a nice guy, but his lectures follow too closely to the course reader. Also, he tends to assume that his students are familiar with most material. If you have already taken chemistry, maybe you won't do too badly. However, if you have no chemistry background, beware.
Pretty good professor, but it's a tough class regardless.

He cares a lot about his students. He has multiple online resources including podcasts, webcasts, VOH (virtual office hours), and numerous office hours as well T.A. hours. If you attend UCLA, he is essentially your only option for 14-a and 14-b. There is another professor but Lavelle is MUCH more in demand.
Lavell expects you to have learn everything in high school, "You should of reviewed this is high school" is his favorite phrase
Class is boring.  Better off reading the book and course reader.

Lectures are straight out of the.. well, lecture notes! This can mislead one to think they are actually digesting the material because you are just following along what is right in front of you. Sometimes that makes you a little sleepy. The course really requires you to do book problems if you want to pass the test, pretty much.
Lectures not helpful as he doesn't explain anything in depth, he has the expectation that you learned it ALL in high school chem....better off just doing the homework.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Dr. Lavelle is an awesome professor. I love his accent. :)
Really nice & approachable guy.  Organized & clear lectures although bit boring.  Explains material thoroughly.  No surprises on exams.  Just know lecture notes & practice book problems.
Very clear in his presentations of course material.  Goes into detail about everything.  A very decent curve that helps grades.  Makes everyone interested in the class
too conceptual, totally confusing, plan on teaching yourself intro chem. on the other hand, he has a decent curve.
Dr Cook is all inspiration. Thank you Professor!
Took Anthro of Protest and Activism with her. INCREDIBLE teacher. Amazing topic - she is very passionate and wants you to succeed. Hard class - lot of work and lots of readings but SO worth it.
WOW
Professor Cook doesn't teach every quarter. Take her when you can.Your world will change. She's rare as a human being and a teacher -:)

Dr cook doesn't just teach how to research change. She creates the change. Her course on protest and activism changed my life. This is what a human teacher with crazy smarts looks like. Take note UCLA.
The best course on activism and protest. Dr Cook is a force of nature:D
I'm still trying to figure her out as a person but as a teacher she's terrific. Her anthro of protest is the hardest course i've taken at UCLA and I'm not complaining
Wow Her anthro of protest course's revolutionary.It isn't for the faint hearted. Dr Cook's demanding instructor but she's in it for the students. Respect.

Probing performance has taken over my life after this Perf studies class and I didn't even want to take it at first. I'm considering grad school in this field now. Dr Cook is intense but clear thorough and fair. She gets everyone excited with her.
I really enjoyed this challenging course. This was my first real anthro experience!
Best instructor I've ever had at UCLA and i'm graduating this weekend
Dr Potuolu Cook can be scary because she is big on challenging studnents but she's a better tecaher for it
anthropology and performance studies
How can she have so much energy?
Tough as hell but amazingggg teacher.
I;m taking her anthro of performance.So far her lectures are engaging and helpful.
the best
Extraordinary course on the middle east
I miss Dr. Cook's class.Everything about the ME course. crazy pace crazy amount of info. She pushed us.She cares.
Kindest person ever. She takes her students on a challenging journey but i learned more in this class than in my 4 years at UCLA
Spectacular course
Great teacher and a greater person!!!
P. cook's honesty's refreshing. Think dat is why she's an amazin prof. super caring and tuff. Interesting preson.
Culture area of Middle East
Brrilliant!!

Calvin is among my favorite professors. I had him for multiple classes and he was one of the reasons why I transferred to UCLA instead of Berkeley. He finds the profundity in "dumb" questions, he rarely offers his own philosophical sympathies in (what I take to be) an attempt to give credibility to opposing views. Character limits prevent full grat
Totally brilliant and really interesting to listen to. The prompts for the essays were straightforward and I would absolutely take him again.

Normore is a competent professor. However, the class I took with him, Philosophy of Mind, was not engaging. I must mention that Normore answered any questions I had and was very patient with others. I do not recommend the class, but perhaps other classes with this professor would be more interesting.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I loved prof. Noremore BUT his grading was excessive in relation to how unclear his lectures are and in relation to his lack of OH + email communication. I loved his lectures but they did not link up with the assignments at all. Id love to take him NOT for credit but if you are serious about having a high gpa, avoid him.

Professor Normore's class was one of the most frustrating and confusing classes I've ever taken. By week 3 more than half the class didn't come to lecture because you gain more by not being there than by listening to his scattered thoughts. He says the same things each lecture and his slides are either just a title or just a block of text.

A truly amazing Professor. He knows what he's talking about and he really knows how to relate it to his students. He's very approachable and fun. I wish he taught more philosophy courses. He does go off on tangents but it is not detrimental to the overall understanding of the materials he records his lectures so you're not required to attend them

Outstanding professor. I took Phil 100B & Phil 154B with him. Extremely knowledgeable about the topics in his courses. Provides his own, creative examples. Doesn't read off of boring PowerPoint slide shows. Able to keep class interested & doesn't bore the class with monotony. Incorporates good humor into his examples. Highly recommend him!!
Excellent energy. A bit disorganized but a great communicator. He is passionate about medieval philosophy and it gets passed on. Learned a lot about how similar Descartes and Ibn Sina are.
Amazing.  Can give a comprehensive history of philosophy in just one lecture.

Everyone knows Calvin is an amazing philosopher. But as a professor, he sucks. His lectures are ahrd to follow, and he is the most disoprganized man you've ever seen. He didnt answer emails, would never have his lectures ready, went off on tangents, and is not good at lectureing. If you need help, go to office hours-- hes better in that setting.

I had him for a metaphysics class and then took an Independent Study class with him at O.S.U.--of the professors I met there, he seemed to me to be the brightest, most curious and most humble of the pack.

Prof. Normore is a true genuis. he needs no notes to lecture and has a true love of Philosophy. Atypical of the professors in this major he is completely approachable and is not condesending at all. He loves students and embraces their questions. A WONDERFUL CLASS AND WONDERFUL PROFESSOR!!
Brilliant professor. A true genius! Taking his class is an experience that every philosopher should have at least once.

He is about the Best Professor any one could have. He is above all, dedicated to his students. He is not easy, but more than willing to give as much help as you need. He has integrity and he is hands down brilliant! A very fair grader. Which is important because many of the TA's are problematic, some are good.
Seriously, just take a class with him. He's awesome. Actually I want to be his friend. He looks like a magical creature.
awesome prof!
One of those professors that reminds you why you're studying Philosophy.  He's a Philosophy god.
No Comments
Since its ancient philosophy, probably harder to teach, and Normores idiosyncrasies make it harder to understand. Extremely knowlegeable about subject matter and doesn't need notes to lecture!
You missed out if you don't take at least one class with him.
Normore is the best thing that can happen to any student in UCLA!!!

best professor in the department.  brillant man, the classes i took from him were the best in my college career. very patient, takes time to make sure you understand and entertains your thoughts as well.
AMAZING professor. One of the most learned men on the planet.
Best professor I had in college.  Brings cookies and juices to the final exam as well.  Take him and him only for 100B.  No one better to teach Aquinas than him!
Good teacher. Can be advanced & hard to understand sometimes. Has study sessions

Professors really cool, the workload is fair, 3 papers 4-6 pages he mainly cares about what you want to say and your own opinion which is really cool and nice. I like how you go with the flow and breeze.

He's engaging and really funny; he can be very sarcastic. The TAs for the quarter were also really cool and section is pretty important in understanding the material. A lot of writing, but overall worth it for a really cool class.

Hands down the BEST HISTORY PROFESSOR at UCLA. I wish I have taken more classes with him. He is brilliant and hilarious, absolutely a legend in his field. His lectures are concise and on-point, I went to his class every lecture and scored A's on all his papers. If you pay attention when he is talking, then you won't have trouble writing papers.

Am taking a one unit, SU undergraduate seminar on ISIS and the Islamic State.  Great class.  Gelvin started by giving background, then we read and discuss several articles each week. Gelvin guides discussion lightly and tries to get everyone involved.  Lightens the mood with humor--the subject is stressful.  Take him--you'll learn a lot.

Funny, smart, approachable.  Teaches ME history from a world history viewpoint ("In the 19th century Ottoman sultans looked at France, looked at China, and decided it would be better to a strong power like France than one picked apart like China").  More interested in the big picture than factoids.  Went to class, took notes, and did fine.

I enjoyed this class alot.  Gelvin's lectures are clear and he numbers everything (there are three reasons for...).  Used to hang out during his office hours, where we talked about course stuff and current events.  He does seem to like undergraduates, but cuts off conversations when you whine about grades.  Overall, I learned alot.  Will take again

Extremely knowledgeable guy, you will definitely learn a lot.  Problem is he doesn't really care about the teaching aspect of being a professor, so he isn't very helpful.  Also, his lectures can be all over the place at times.

Gelvin is fantastic.  We used the book he wrote on the Arab uprisings, supplemented by videos and articles.  Map quiz, paper, and final.  Overall, his lectures were crystal.  I didn't know much going in, but followed the news.  He helped me put it all together.  Jokes are good too.

Gelvin is an expert in his field. Lectures are very engaging but are essentially a regurgitation of the textbook.There are no tests in this class, just take home essays. His outlines are basically an outline of what he expects in the papers. I didn't read the book at all and got a B+
Awesome prof. He really knows his stuff and makes it so much easier to understand to everyone who doesn't! He's witty and really relaxed. TAKE HIS CLASS.

Took his graduate seminar on historiography of the modern Middle East.  Although I planned to be a historian for years, I never knew history was like this.  Made us read classics in ME history, along with classics in the discipline (EP Thompson, Foucault, Quentin Skinner, Tilley).  You should hear him on Marx, Hegel,Foucault, etc.  Now I know!
One hour p/f seminar on Arab Spring (he hates that phrase, btw).  Took it because I needed the credit, but began looking forward to it every week.  NY sense of humor and he DOES look like House.
The guy already has a class about the Arab uprisings.  Blew me away.  Gives us chapters of a book he is writing on the topic chapter-by-chapter to get our opinions.  OUR opinions!!!
totally awesome, even at 10 in the monrning.

Loved this class.  Loved this professor. I like the way he didn't talk down to undergraduates, but at the same time was able to explain complex ideas (totalization!  integration and peripheralization!) in a way undergraduates could understand.  Take him.
Really smart, really funny.  leaned alot.
Really smart, great lecturer.  Course was on Israel and Palestine. Professor treated the problem fairly.  Also told funny stories.

I cannot say enough about how nice this guy is and how beautfifully organized his lectures are.  One should take ANY class he offers.  As for the "bias" comments, unfortunately they are true.  Snide comments,  highlighting certain information while downplaying other info.  It is minor, but it is certainly present.  Still, you've got to take him!

I have one gripe. He does not grade fairly imo. As and Fs are absolute and everything else is on a curve. So you can get a C, like a 72, and it is still a B. But if you get like an 87, that is a B+ and will not become an A. I do not think that is fair. Everthing should be on a curve.
i take his grad seminar and he's the best teacher i think i've had at UCLA.

Hilarious (and he knows it too), confident, a genius of middle eastern history. Gives absolutely non-biased views. I took his Arab-Israel class, and didn't know anything about the issue, but he opened up my eyes. I attest to him not being biased, but merely giving the facts (and pissing some ppl off), facts some ppl don't want others to hear.

The best professor of Middle Eastern history around. He is a balanced and truthful professor. Those who say he is biased are those who(especially in regards to the Israel/Palestine conflict) take his class, refuse to listen to anything that does not conform to their viewpoint, and then scream "academic dishonesty." Take him if you can.
No Comments

Prof. Gelvin is by far the BEST at UCLA. His lectures are incredibly easy to follow, as are the readings. He has an awesome sense of humor and will keep you entertained. There's usually a couple 5-page papers and a final (this does not apply to the seminar)and neither are that difficult. Totally approachable and genuinely cares about his students.

Todays class was a big meandering lecture, with frequent stops, messy, chaotic discussions about Breaking Bad and other produced Hollywood or streaming (Netflix, etc) products, with very little actual instruction into the art and craft of writing screenplays. Horrified to waste money ($1650) on his online 2020 course.
I loved this class.  Our 434 had the best chemistry out of all my other ones.  His notes are helpful, inspirational, and concise.  Wish I could go back to the program.

Best teacher I have ever had in any subject. Passionate about the art of storytelling. Keen insights. Funny, easygoing, cares deeply about writers and helping us understand the business and how to make the most of our natural talent. Loved his writing style and continually refer to his textbook.
Professor Walter was a fun teacher to have. I took a screenwriting class with him. There was no test or quizzes just had to write a screenplay. I liked it.
Nothing but good things to say about Prof. Walter's.  He's a class act!
mazing teacher, mentor, guide.  Positive, nurturing, funny as hell.
Only took an online class from him, but made me want to be a screenwriter. Great teacher, great class, and an easy A.
Inspirational!
inspirational, caring, dedicated. a huge blessing in the lives of the students at ucla.

If you are truly interested in screenwriting there is no better mentor than Richard Walter. Everything he has to say is exactly what you need to know to become a successful screenwriter! And he manages to teach it in the most hilarious and enticing way. How many times have you heard an entire lecture hall laugh out loud?!

A general intro to screenwriting, that is, writing movies, a relatively new medium just over a century old.  This class is open to undergrads, which is a shame because they take it as an easy A and don't show up.  Richard is great.  Those that don't get him, don't get that writing movies is about story, and good stories are not easy to write.
Richard Walter is AWESOME! Enough said.
THIS MAN IS A LEGEND YOU SHOULD BE SO LUCKY AS TO LEARN FROM HIM
Intellectually curios people do not get bored.  Anybody who has a problem with this class should drop it.  We won’t miss you.

He's completely approachable and genuinely interested in supporting people's writing. He tells a ton of stories, but those should be valued because they illuminate what he's saying and what he's teaching. Fantastically entertaining class from a legend.

Anyone that disses this man's skills, just doesn't get the magic going on in his classes. I'm sorry you Undergrads are bitter you took this class and it was shockingly different in structure and feel than your life sciences classes. Or, that you found out you didn't have the chops to be a screenwriter. Get over it! Walter rules!
A legend of the screenwriting world. And a genuinely kind man. The success of his students speaks for itself.

People need to understand that this guy is a living legend and an institution and instead of complaining because he's telling stories... soak them up and learn. He's got great things to teach and it's not a coincidence that UCLA places so many writers in the industry. Sit back, learn, and be entertained.

Much better than most people acknowledge.  Can wander in lectures, but engaging, has a no-bull**** policy.  Simple exercises and final, but still challenging.  Helpful, but was intimidated approaching him and his TA.  Sometimes reads hate mail directed to him in class.  Would not like that I'm using run-on sentences.  Awesome professor.
Should be called Anecdotes 101. The guy has a story for everything, and nothing.
This guy is terrible mediocre and worst of all a waste of my tuition money. Drop the class before he speaks about himself all day.
