Joke, this guy is the best!  If you love to waste tuition, listen to ancient hollywood stories, And learn quotes like "I am just an old****from Brooklyn" this is the place. Wind him up and watch him go. Why should he read your script anyway?
No Comments

This guy is a joke.  He wastes class time talking about himself and all the people "he made famous", and offers very little substantive input to students on their scripts.  And he's lazy - he doesn't want to read his student scripts.

People with anxiety listen up: as someone with severe anxiety this class wasn't bad. He doesn't expect people to share out or call on people at random. He does do popcorn reading through each row sometimes but the lines are never long and no one looks up from their papers. he's really nice and it wasn't a bad experience. *Join the groupme it helps*
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Excellent, able to invoke magic in the classroom.  Has a real passion for Shakespeare.
Great class
Took this for the Literary GE and I don't regret it at all. A very engaging lecturer and encourages students to speak up in class, but doesn't put any pressure. Very funny.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you can write well, I fully recommend taking ENGL 91A (Intro to Poetry) with Dr. D. Preferably, take it your first quarter at UCLA, because you can really get a chance to meet people and interact with the class. Sometimes lectures are slow, but this class is 100% what you make of it. Read poems, write a paper, and take two exams (test bank!).

AMAZING instructor. His sense of humor and personality shine through in his lectures. Definitely my most highly enjoyed class, ever. He makes learning fun and therefore easy to remember. He is so passionate and knowledgeable--  I could not imagine being taught Shakespeare by anyone else...see for yourself what everyone is raving about!!
Best Professor I have ever had.
Had him for three classes 20 years ago. One of the few profs I remembered. Smart and compassionate.

Professor Dickey has been by far one the most amazing professor I have had. He is very inspiring, knowledgable, and passionate on what he teaches. His engagement with his students is remarkable and he is always happy to assist student. I cannot emphasizes enough how much I appreciate to have had the opportunity to be taught Shakespeare by this guy!

I've taken him for two quarters now. He's probably one of the most inspiring, passionate professors at UCLA. Even if you aren't an English major, I highly recommend taking one of his GE classes [95A/B]. He's helpful, approachable, and really funny. His exams are very fair.

Professor Dickey is my favorite Professor at UCLA.  I have never met anyone who is genuinely interested and knowledgeable in so many subjects.  If you put in the effort and get to know him, you will not only leave the class with lots of knowledge, but a helpful and kind friend.

Prof D is one of a kind. He is a teacher that is not only inspiring but also a friend. He really seems to care about his students and wants to see them succeed. If you get a chance take him for Shakespeare or his Beat class. Dickey Rocks.

Prof D is one of a kind. He is a teacher that is not only inspiring but also a friend. He really seems to care about his students and wants to see them succeed. If you get a chance take him for Shakespeare or his Beat class. Dickey Rocks.
I really enjoyed his class and learned a great deal about the plays, as well as, the poet. I loved how allowed students to "creatively" present the play rather than having to write another paper!
Mr. Dickey is an awesome instructor!
Truly talented, performative professor.  Will read drafts of essays, and helped me write one of my best papers.  Simply fabulous.
No Comments
He's a fascinating lecturer and a real nice guy. Loved the class even if I thought I deserved a better grade on my one paper.
the most approachable smart guy that i've ever met.

He really got me excited about shakespear, what a great profes. amazingly intellegent, funny, enthusiastic. He really made me enjoy a subject that I didnt think I would ever really enjoy! If you enroll in his class you are sooo lucky
I had him for 2 shakespeare classes.  He is the nicest guy, funny, and not pretenious but really smart.  I wish he taught at the grad school I'm going to go to next year.
I had Professor Dickey for 3 courses at UCLA.  He is the best especially Shakespeare.  Even if you're not an English major take him.  He just brighten up my day.
Very good professor.  He really cares about he subject matter.  I highly recommend him to anyone at UCLA. Very prompt to emails and does a great job about making things interesting. A+

Lieberman is as good as it gets!  His lectures are very clear.  2 weeks before the midterm and final I listened to the lectures about 2 times through and ended up with a 94% overall before the extra credit.  Know the material and you'll do well !

He is a great professor and a wonderful person. His classes are very entertaining. I still quote things I learned from his class. He basically takes you behind the scenes of every day life. Fair grading, tests not so difficult. But don't think you'll get by without studying.

Great prof. Nice speaking voice. Tests mostly on lectures, which were interesting and clear. One paper. Reading small, relatively interesting books. Material covered was incredible and easy to learn. Know it and you'll get an A!
koo
Great prof! Lectures were interestings and tests are pretty straightforward. Easy on the eyes too.
seriously, he sucks
Great Instructor. Fun Class.
Great instructor. Fun class.
He made social psych very interesting and easy to understand.  It seemed like he was doing a talk show more than teaching a class, as far as the entertainment factor is concerned.
I still think about and use concepts I learned in his class.  He's super helpful- he even gives a special lecture on getting into grad school : )
No Comments
No Comments
This guy rules.  I think I had his first class in Summer of 1999 and I remember it as one of the best classes I had at UCLA.  Seriously.
Very enjoyable teacher, super friendly.
The best professor I have had!  Take his class!
best prof at ucla
Great teacher, dynamic and interesting
No Comments

At first I wasn't sure about Lieberman's style, but he grew on me. Gotta love a teacher who really tries to make things interesting. His video clips were appreciated. And if you don't like the class- you can just sit and stare @ him. He's purdy.
No Comments

This professor accused me of plagiarism because he said he couldn't understand how much paper related to the various prompts we could choose from. He gave me a D. I was able to salvage my grade, but it was not only insulting (I didn't plagiarize) but he was rude about how he approached it and did not provide any sort of constructive feedback.

Prof. Fisher's passion for what he teaches makes his lectures truly profound and thought-provoking. I learned so much more in his class than I ever expected to from a lower division course. The class is challenging due to the sheer volume of material, but he is quite understanding & fair if you need extensions or if any other difficulties arise.

Prof Fisher is intimidating and a bit of a bully. Always cuts students off when they speak, and his responses are mostly judgmental. I tried my absolute best in his class which wasn't enough, and all the help I sought was a waste of time because he's so unclear. He grades with so much exactness for someone with vague essay prompts. Don't take.

I looked forward to a Fisher lecture every week.  Entertaining and energetic. Class workload is a bit on the heavy side but doable. I enjoyed all the readings save one or two. Good class, great professor.

Although Prof. Fisher is extremely bright; I would hold off on this class if your a transfer student attending UCLA for the first time, this Fall quarter.  Even under the best of circumstances this class can be challenging.  I was new to UCLA and took Prof. Fisher's class my first quarter.  Yikes.  I was like a deer in the headlights.

This class exceeded my expectations. Professor Fisher was an absolutely amazing professor. Probably the best English professor I've ever had. He's brilliant! Sure, at times he spoke so fast I couldn't possibly write everything down, but every little thing he said was so great that it got imprinted on your mind anyway.
I love him.  He is bright, emotionally generous and cute.  I feel energized, when I leave his class.

Get a grip girls, Fisher is NOT cute. He looks more like Ross from "Friends" than Prof McDreamy. Also, I got the impression his caffeine-fueled lectures were prepared last-minute, and often ended with him shouting line numbers at students while they left the classroom. I thought the 2 TA 'guest lectures' were far more clearly presented and useful.
Yes, I am aware he went to Oxford. FYI, "Oxbridge" is a valid term used to describe someone of his educational background: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oxbridge
Just reviewed but wanted to say to the person below me..it's OXFORD, not Oxbridge! And yes, his English education made the experience all the better. Loved his Canterbury lectures. :)

At first, Fisher really intimidated me. But, once you get to know him, he is really sweet and friendly and willing to help you succeed. I went to every office hours just for the sake of learning-he truly is passionate and brilliant! He is always willing to help.Immense reading load, but it was a great experience. Plus, he is really cute and witty!

Professor Fisher's lectures are challenging, and times, entertainingly digressive, but if you are willing to be  challenged and inspired to come up to his level you will be greatly rewarded . Yes, he does affect on an eccentric, arrogant Oxbridge persona, but I think it adds to his delivery, and makes him... appealing. Too bad he's married.
oh, by the way, my interest level prior to attending class was low.  As of right now, it's off the charts.  The 2/5 "interest" category in the prior evaluation should instead be 5/5--If not 6/5.

It was an honor to learn from Professor Fisher.  Before the class, I chose to take notes in a blue notebook to reflect my glum disposition towards the subject content.  Now, I find myself reading from the text in my spare time.  Never has a teacher so stirred my thoughts and touched my heart.  I'll never forget him.

Contrary to popular opinion, I think Fisher is great!  Yes, he challenges your arguments and has an extensive vocabulary, but isn't that what one should expect from UCLA? Shouldn't English majors welcome the challenge? He doesn't want people to restate his ideas. In fact, he once commended me for disagreeing with him on a midterm. He's just smart.

This child is the epitome of pretension. His lack of clarity or willingness to assist students exudes beyond his ego. As stated before, regurgitation is the best method applied in his course. The smell of coffee and tobacco are not very inviting towards the student body and one can sense he is there only to publish, not teach. How unfortunate.

Started off the course shooting down every argument voiced, and then had the nerve to be annoyed when no one wanted to talk in class. Wonder why that was? Blamed one particularly bad day on trying to quit smoking, and flat-out told me I deserved a higher grade than he'd given me. Not a great experience, overall.

The worst of the worst. Addicted to coffee & interrupts lecture when briefly misplaced it. Embracing his coffee took priority over writing any of the course's incomprehensibly complex terms/concepts. This makes it all the more painful when subject material predates Shakespeare & friends. Tops all off with an insanely rapid speech rate.

can i say that this man loves the sound of his own voice and even though he is obviously brilliant, he is a jerk and a big complainer. he asks grandiose questions and never give the answer. and u better regurgitate all of his personal ideas in your papers. i say save yourself the trouble, dont take him.

Pros: He's energetic, enthusiastic, well-informed, and uses helpful and sometimes funny analogies and anecdotes./ Cons: He paces across the front of the room and it gets distracting after a while; he encourages class participation, but has a habit of interrupting and dismantling the argument before the student's thought is completely voiced.

Socratic method. That says it all. Every sentence he says has to end with a question!! Can't seem to please him no matter how hard you try. However, he's really nice....maybe you just need to truly understand the Socratic method in order to get an A.

Professor Greene is nice, but the homework is really unnecessary and many of the problems are not reflective of material learned either in the book or the lecture. Also, the lectures really do not match the textbook well, and you will have a hard time reading her writing during lectures because she moves quickly. Good luck!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Admittedly I had experience with AP Calculus in high school making the class easy for me, but Prof Greene makes the class easy for anyone. She's clear, not too fast, accessible, helpful even over zoom - she answers all your questions, and her homework isn't busywork: each assignment was about 10 problems. Absolutely take her for calculus!

Her lectures only provide examples and rarely ever go into depth on laws, definitions, or rules that you need to know in order to do the work. I do not recommend having her as a professor unless you have a good foundation of calculus (not pre-calculus, but calculus).

If you are an incoming freshmen who needs to take math I highly recommend professor Greene! Her lectures are well organized and she has long office hours so you can always go in if you need help on homework. The class is a little homework heavy because there is book work and online HW, but you will be glad to have taken the class with Greene! Easy!
Even now after I graduated she remains as the standout professor to me. She really cares about her students' education and holds plenty of office hours. 10/10 recommend.

If you need to take Math 1 or the Math 3 series do yourself a favor and TAKE HER CLASS! She is super sweet and so nice. She genuinely wants students in her class to do well. Her midterms and final exams are very reasonable. There usually is weekly written homework due on Fridays and online homework due as well but it helps you understand.

Professor Greene set the standard for all of my other professors. She is detail oriented, and will carefully go over examples from the textbook in class. Homework is always doable, and if it's not she has great ta's. No surprises on the exam. She gives practice exams with solutions. Wish I could take her again! (took 3a, 3b, and 3c with her)
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: She's great, literally the sweetest. She is there to help you whenever you need her.

Professor Greene is the BEST professor out there. Super sweet. Midterms were similar to the practice midterm she handed out. The work load is doable if you keep up with them. She gives a reasonable amount of time to finish everything. She provides a PDF textbook which means less money.

She was an excellent professor. She was super kind and always really helpful. Her exams are straightforward and she has many office hours that can and should be taken advantage of. There is no reason anyone should get below a B in her class.

In my personal opinion, Greene is not a great teacher. She rushes through topics in class and the lectures are pretty much pointless. The homework helps a lot with midterms, but there is SO much of it, it's hard to study for tests because you have so much material to choose from. Also tests are out of like 7 questions, miss 2 and you fail.

She seems sweet at first, but in all honesty, she's not. Terrible teacher, not clear at all, and rushes through everything. Lots of homework, because you're covering a whole chapter in a week without really covering everything in the chapter. Be forewarned: you'll end up teaching yourself.

hey so this is for all the math 1 people. I just took her test 1. To do well, study the HW inside and out. Also the practice quizes she gives you at the beginnign of class are important, questions from them were practically all on the test. this test was easy. Dont freak out, just make sure you get the practice exam and her practice quizzes

Mrs. Greene makes Math so much fun! Like mentioned before there is a significant amount of homework to do per week, but she is so sweet and welcomes you for help with open arms. Tests can be quite challenging but if you study all the homework and practice tests she provides, then you're fine. I definitely recommend her! Best math teacher I've had

Professor Greene is hands down the most helpful professor at UCLA.  I consider myself very lucky to have been her student.  She is so kind and caring, and like she mentions many times in class, she truly wants you to succeed.  If you have a chance to take any class she happens to be teaching, I highly recommend you take it!

Professor Greene has a fun personality and is very helpful. I fell asleep in her lectures many times though (8am classes suck), but still managed to get a A+. Homework is very long and tedious, but it makes good practice. Her midterms and finals are similar to her midterm/final review worksheets so be sure to do that and go to the review sessions.
She clarifies her ideas very well. Like the other people mentioned, she is very approachable and helpful. I recommend taking her class. It will make you like math a lot more than you did.

She is very interesting when she lectures and throws in cute little jokes. I would recommend this teacher a thousand times. Some of the things I learned in high school were taught with more clarity in her lecture and helped me understand so much better.

Goes through all of her progressions and thus helps you understand how she got from one place to the next-- doesn't jump around. She emphasizes the homework a lot, because it definitely helps on the tests. She's one of those professors with a really cool personality and that you would like to go to her office hours to just talk about casual things

Great professor, definitely recommend anyone to take a class with her. She loves teaching and does it well. Very funny and helpfull professor. This class was too easy..=A+  HW is a bit lengthy , but its a great practice  :D

class is catered to those who already took math analysis..calculus in high school aka ALMOST EVERYONE! therefore, thats exactly how she teaches, rushing thru things as if its just review. so i skipped pointless lectures and just did the ENDLESS amounts of hw and only wound up with a B. for me..it was terrible.... HOWEVER,EXTREMELY helpful during OH

I took his class in 1998 and I can honestly say he was one of the most memorable profs I ever had. I also know a hell of a lot more about retroviruses and such--the knowledge has definitely been retained. That's a good prof.
He was one of the most amazing biology teachers I have ever had. I loooved him
No Comments
One of my more interesting profs at UCLA...definitely an experience - take at least one of his classes.  Never fell asleep in them ^_^.
Horrendous.  TA's are awful and grade poorly.  Waste of time. I could have done an independent study.
The scientist from South Park is based on him!
the easiest and funnest class i've takin my whole UCLA career...every lecture we brought people who wasn't in the class just because Prof. Bohman was the****!!!!
No Comments
great teacher. great class.  highly recommend this guy.
Probably the best professor I ever had at UCLA.   Took as many classes from his as possible.....and learned a TON.    He has a unique teaching style that WORKS.
he's hilarious.  enjoyed his class thoroughly.
hilarious, lectures with his eyes closed
possibly the greatest teacher i have ever had. Thanks for everything - arash hakhamian
an excellent lecturer, and very helpful during office hours; takes a bit of time to understand his rantings and ravings, though
asfd
He is still wearing those Hawaiin shirts?  Pretty cool prof., but didn't really teach much.
cool dude, K.I.T.
No Comments
No Comments
at least he stays off your back

This class was very challenging, but it's possible to get an A. Do the worksheets! She gives old exams to study off of. Know how to do them all. I got some tutoring from David Watt's who teaches at UCLA Extension. Definitely go to him if you need help! Majority of my learning was through Khan Academy. But, she was a very fair grader on exams!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: She goes way too fast and doesn't really care about her students learning abilities. All she wants to do is give you the information. She needs to learn how to teach a difficult subject to students. I don't recommend her at all. UCLA Extension needs to bring better Chemistry professor who can teach and importantly care about the students.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The material is very difficult, so you really have to put in a lot of time into this class. And yes, the professor goes very fast. But to be fair, she has a lot of material that she has to cover in only ten weeks. So if you take advantage of her worksheets and practice exams, and really understand the concepts, an A is absolutely doable.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: THE WORST. ABSOLUTE WORST.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This teacher moves incredibly fast and only has office hours right after class. So if your class is 9-1 on Saturday be prepared to stay after on a Saturday just to ask questions. She doesnt slow down to make a thoughtful effort to respond to you
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Shiraki is a great professor. Yes, the exams are difficult, but the road to health careers are difficult. Her class format of giving an example problem, then difficult problem you work on, then going over the problem as a class is effective and going over those problems is key for exams. I left feeling that I had a solid gen chem foundation.

Professor Saori Shiraki is bright and engaging. I absolutely love her style of lecture. Yes, she's fast,  but she's concise and detailed. Let me be clear, this class is tough, and she doesn't pull any punches. Read before class, do the practice problems and study! You need to commit, but your reward will be a great foundation for the rest of chem.

Most people think that Shiraki is really hard, and she is, but I learned very well from her. She goes fast in lecture, but it makes you pay attention, and she's very clear. If you go to her office hours for help, she is nice and good at explaining. I loved having her for Gen Chem and I feel like I learned a lot from her class.

Having to go through difficult and varied material fast in 14B is a consequence of UCLA's Chem series setup, Shiraki is actually a great lecturer. How to do well in her class:  Understand concepts ON lecture day.  Do homework until you're comfortable applying equations.  ACE THE MIDTERM REVIEWS AT HOME- THEY ARE VERY REPRESENTATIVE OF THE EXAMS

Professor is very fast, be prepared before taking her course.  Get a Chapter ahead if you can to prepare yourself.  Getting help after class or on break is less intimidating than asking questions in class.  She is not helpful in a group setting.  It seems that she likes Organic Chemistry better than the Thermodynamic portion.  Study a lot or lost..

Only recommend for those who have already taken Chem. She is very fast during lectures & hard to keep up with. Grading is a bit ridiculous sometimes. Very nice and willing to help at office hours, although you will definitely need to put in work if the concepts are new to you. Made us buy an access pass to online material, which was a bit pricy.
She is ridiculously fast. Practice problems in the book and quizzes are completely useless. Her responses to questions only confuse you more.

She makes many mistakes on tests and lectures slides and refuses to apologize. In addition she does a terrible job of clearing up any confusion caused by her errors.  Terribly unhelpful and very condescending

Professor over complicated curriculum. She comes off as arrogant & does NOT like questions, she will humiliate you in front of others. Tests were unnecessarily difficult, making it nearly impossible to properly prepare esp. since hwk & quizzes were not representative of her tests. Would suggest extension gets professor who actually likes their job.

This teacher is inexcusably inefficient. Works too quickly to give students time to absorb information. Doesn't outline conceptapplication. Just throws all the info on the board and hopes it sticks without explaining any of it. She barely gives us time to write down what's on the board. I can't focus over the smell of chalk burning.

Dr. Shiraki is fantastic. She has well structured lectures and has a lot of patience. She gives students opportunities to improve and helps every step of the way. She gave me a great foundation in chemistry.

Very hard to get an A in her class, mostly because of impossible quizzes. Even with open notes the answers were very hard to find. And yes even with very good lab reports, the quizzes will destroy your grade! She doesn't curve at all, and I'm pretty sure she is the only one who doesn't. Don't take her. :)
Take a different professor.... I worked really hard the entire semester and ended up with a B in the class.

She is impossible! Her quizzes are very difficult and the only way to get a decent grade is if you already are a chemist. Her lab section of organic chem is by far the hardest section compared to the other instructors and she makes an effort to make the class a lot harder than it is. I would run from this teacher!
Dr. Shiraki is a bright light in what is otherwise a mediocre undergraduate learning environment.  I just wish I'd studied a bit harder.

I liked her, provides a lot of help (ie material you can study to understand enough to do fine on exams).  She goes to so much work and it's hard to appreciate her effort because it's all there waiting  for us to use already.  Don't be shy, go ahead and take her.
Treated us like we were in high school still, honestly did not like her at all. Not helpful and only cared about a select few.

Really easy for Econ 1, just remember to study for the midterm and final from the lecturenotes, to get a good grade. I took it as a high school student and I didnt study once or open the textbook, but GO TO THE LECTURES and print out her lecture handouts, thats all you need, and all you need to study from. The sims are a good way to bump your grade
horrible teacher!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Only class I ever got a grade lower than B. Talks too much about off-subject. Her tests are very confusing and sometimes contain material that she doesn't teach in class. The grading system of non-multiple-choice questions is very unclear. Moreover, the multiple choice is worth more points, which is even more frustrating.

She makes you work for the grade. If you go to the lectures and work on the homework, you pretty much will do really well on the midterms and exams. If you do both, then you'll know the materials in and out and you'll have enough time to finish the tests.
she is a terrible teacher........she's very fast paced

Very difficult class. Studied hard, did terribly. Early morning classes not great, and lectures a bit dull. But she has a dry sarcastic wit which sometimes made me giggle. Tip: Do not answer her questions unless you are positive you are right, no matter how much she coaxes. Its a trick, trust me.
No Comments
i didn't think she was too bad...i've had better, and i've had worse

She isa horrible teacher.  I tookher class twice and studied hard and I still didnt get the grade I wanted.  Her lectures are long and boring and her test don't follow her lecture notes.  For those of you that have to take her I'm sooooooo very sorry.  She's horrible
My Worst Grade In College
No Comments
She's lame... don't take her classes.. you will regret it fo sho.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

A great professor and lecturer. Was never boring and always organized, he really knows his stuff. Can be dorky and lame but makes lectures all that more interesting. Class is graded purely on how you do on tests but the tests are straightforward, not trick questions. Go to lecture, do practice tests, you will get an A. I'd love to take him for 14D.
Very specific about what will be on the test- no surprises. Very straightforward, clear and a little dorky. Amazing teacher 1010 would recommend
great professor. made ochem really interesting. loved the class! just go to lecture and do all of the thinkbook problems and practice tests.
Best teacher I've had so far at UCLA. He makes concepts pretty easy to understand and his lectures aren't too boring. The class isn't easy, but if you bust your ass, you can definitely get an A.
This man is brilliant. He had a passion for chemistry that augments how he teaches. He makes sure you understand WHAT and WHY the reactions are happening. It all makes sense with Hardinger.
This man is part dragon, part god! While he treats us less-intelligent students like half-orcs, if you work hard in his class, he will definitely level up your knowledge of ochem!
Fives aren't high enough for this Man-God of organic chemistry. All other are morons before him. I would rather have killed myself then take organic with anyone else.
The man is god.

All you have to do is look at his course website, and you can see he is the opposite of what an educator should be... "Rules For Life #9: Life is not divided into quarters. You don't get summers off, and very few employers are interested in helping you find yourself. Do that on your own time.        #13: Nothing in nature gives anyone partial credi

I got a B in this class but I learned so much.I basically screwed up the midterms because I was being stupid and not trying my best.All you need to do is go to his lectures,sit in the front,and pay attention!Then do all the problems he assigns you and go to his OH for any questions.He's a good lecturer.You'll definitely learn in this class.
Absolutely the best professor of organic chemistry anywhere. Period. Your life is incomplete until you take this course.
Absolutely no concern for the student's learning/future. As long as he does his job of blabbering the material 3 hours a week, he feels satisfied.
Best organic chemistry professor in the universe.

i usually get As or B+s, but i don't think i've ever worked harder before in my life and i squeezed out a B-. I literally put in five hours a day and never missed lecture, discussion, reviews ect.I also bought extra outside sources for the o-chem subject and read those as well, but honestly, the topic was hard and the professor was harder.
Going to lecture really helped. I never went to office hours...but he seemed like a nice guy in lecture. I would highly recommend him, he made O-chem bearable.
No Comments
WAY better than Luceigh (he doesn't make you feel like an idiot). Totally cares about his students. Very fair. I ended up liking o-chem! Who new?!
HORRIBLE TEACHER, couldn't care less about your progress.  The RUDEST, MEAN-SPIRITED individual I have ever met.  Avoid taking a class with this heartless jerk.
No Comments
Dark sense of humor, but you'll learn very little in class. His grad student TAs couldn't solve a lot of the homework problems, and the tests weren't much easier.

Although his class is a bit hard, the exam almost all comes from his homework. It is good that he usually have more questions than 100% and if you do more than 100, you will have an 100%. Of course sometime he makes some adjustments to the question.  But if you learn the homework well and you think you are good at math, you will be fine.

Lectures are convoluted and useless if you don't read the book beforehand. Homework is hard but doable if you have a study group or go to TA's office hours. Tests are based on homework problems so if you understand them you'll do fine.

Chayes is the worst professor at UCLA. His lectures, while hilarious because he is creepy funny, are useless as he assigns tough homework and impossible tests not based on lectures or book. He is also a mean person who makes fun of kids that ask questions and is insensitive towards his students. Steer clear if possible.
Hard but good professor

Professor Chayes is very unclear and not very helpful at all. He often dodges questions, and it is difficult to follow his lectures. If you are a Math major, I would avoid this class because he will make the class very hard and not exciting.
i never understood a word he said and the homework was way too hard. the TA helped 100% more than he did
It's just that genius comes with its flaws...like being completely incapable of communicating with the rest of society.
Hardest Professor ever! Take him at your own discretion...
worst class ever have had
This is the best math professor at UCLA.  He cares about making sure that you understand the thought process behind math.  If you want to learn to his class.
No Comments
He's intimidating...i never went to office hours...but he's definitely interesting and a great instructor.  Tests and homework are difficult but it makes you really learn the stuff.
just dont take his class. make life easier and less confusing, find a diff prof
Very amusing, fun to watch but tests are impossible, never does any examples nor goes by the book. Most students leave the class more confused than when they walked in.
No Comments
Worst professor at UCLA. Made fun of students and embarassed them for asking questions. Exams were impossible and made absolutly no sense. Chayes enjoyed failing students.
No Comments
No Comments
Well good. Funny lectures and good relationship with students.

Nice professor in teaching GEOG XL5, has learned various perspectives about the Human and Nature Relationships. Even though the final exam was hard, the class is still inspirational and meaningful to take.

My first course taken in Senior 2 for UCLA Credit, great professor! It is easy to follow through classes but it is also necessary to study hard according to the study guide provided before the exam, but it is easy A with enough preparation!
Amazing Professor! Very interesting lecture and very helpful in responding to students' question. Not hard on grade. Friendly to students. Fast-pace lesson but always easy to understand.
Very good personality and amazing lecture content. Dr. Zackey draws excellent geographic graphs to make sure that students understand clearly. His grading is fair and just, but never too harsh.
Always engage students with fascinating topics in the lectures. Fine homework and almost no quizzes. Appropriate exams! Generous curve and grades.
Very nice professor, and I took 3 his courses in China. Hard exams, but interesting lectures.

Prof. is a great Prof overall. He has passion for his field and he explains course material clearly. He keeps the class engaged and lifts the class spirit up from time to time with his jokes. Prof. Zackey is very approachable after class during office hours and he's a friendly guy to talk to. An eye candy too, but TMI.
Nice teacher.
love this professor. very helpful.very fun class!
Tougher class than I thought. Exams are pure memorization- unfortunately, they do not test whether or not you know the material and can put it in your own words. Write down everything from lecture.

He's awesome. He's the teacher for our international program. I took two of his classes. He's really easy-going and humorous.  I'm not a native English speaker, but he can explain everything clearly. He gives a lot of help out of class.
This guy is awesome,he is one of the best teachers that I have met! Don't hesitate, join his class, be a friend with him, you will enjoy it.

He is one of the sweetest guys I've ever met. Humorous, easy-going, helpful, responsible...He also gave me a lot of help outside of class. Don't hesitate. He's the right guy to go to whenever u have problems.

Had him for class in China.  Gets to know students, approachable, fun.  Easy class, but I learned a lot. Willing to work with you if you don't "get it" right away.  Lectures didn't always seem to have a theme or point tying them together, but were usually clear.  Professionalism not his strength.  Study guides for tests, straightforward assessment.

An awesome professor! Very clear, helpful, and knowledgeable! I would highly recommend taking his class! There are 2 exams, somewhat extensive but extremely fair. Loved it and can't wait for him to come back to take another class with him.

Great professor! Very clear, helpful, and a joy to listen to. Explains things well and is always available during office hours for any questions. Many of my classmates and I were very upset that he didn't teach Geog 2 during Winter 2009. UCLA needs more professors like Dr. Zackey. I highly recommend taking classes with him!
Great professor, will make material very easy to understand and is very approachable. Highly recommend him, he is no easy A, but if you put in the effort it is very easy to get a good grade.
Cool guy and interesting mateial. Exams are mostly memorization and labs are really easy.

I have taken 3 classes by Dr. Esdin, and I look forward to taking all his other classes! I took Endocrin, Pulmonary Physio, and Cardiovascular Pathophys. Very caring professor. He takes the extra time to make it seem more like an in-person class rather than online class. This rare esp in other UC online classes that I have taken many of.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Enjoyed the class. Take notes on lectures then read the assigned reading and you will be fine for the exams.

Lectures are amazing but the textbook should always be your tried and true. His exams are very tough; so be warned.  Dr. Esdin seems to get a lot of hate but I will say you will get what you give to the class.  I was out of school for 7 years so I'm haply grade wise.  10/10 suggest. I plan to take all his classes he offers via extension.
Best professor at UCLA.

Seems to be running courses only for $$.  Literally copies/pastes the same responses into his online classes. Doesn't respond to mandatory discussion posts or engage with students in any way. Quizzes are random multiple choice questions from the reading, hyper-specific and not applying any information. Exams have typos, misspellings, and errors.

Don't bomb a single test because your grade will never recover. Not very accomodating to students or passionate about teaching. Really his class is just the textbook. He didn't add anything to it. Also, tests are very specific to random details from the textbook, so knowing the materials isn't a good measure of how well you will do.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Great orator. I always left class feeling very excited about the material and inspired. But the exams showed that I did not fully understand the material. It is NOT enough to rely on his lectures. You need to study on your own. 5 years later in med school as I am now studying the lungs, I am careful not to make the same mistakes again.

Professor Esdin is amazing. Genetics is a difficult subject but he made it more than bearable. He explains everything step by step and goes through practice problems in class which is extremely helpful.

For Physci 5 you have to sign in for participation during discussions. My lectures were 50 minutes three times a week and section is once a week for 2 hours(lab).  The class was manageable and Professor Esdin was a great lecturer. He sometimes makes silly comments.  It's easy to keep up if you make sure to read along and go to lectures.
Best Professor ever

Course is very straightforward: read the pages assigned weekly, and be expected to know the material inside out for the exams. 3 multiple-choice exams, with some questions you'll see before in open-book weekly quizzes. Esdin isn't great at responding quickly to e-mails, especially when you need him the most...

The class is well structured: 3 exams with 3-4 chapters of material each, with open-book weekly quizzes and discussion responses. Dr. Esdin's lecture slides are helpful for review, but you definitely need the textbook for often detailed exam questions. You won't need much helpclarification from him, but he's still responsive to all questions.

He is very punctual with E-Mail replies. Also, he is very clear about his expectations and of the material that students need to know for class. Do not wait until the last min to study. Study as planned in syllabus, you will do great. Buy the book, worth it. He gives review sheets, very helpful. Weekly quizzes, easy. Exams:use review sheet as guide

He must be writing his own reviews on this site. I took an online Endocrinology class with him. Basically, he assigned you a bunch of chapters from an Endocrinology textbook and gives you multiple choice tests that could cover anything from the textbook. Gave very limited handouts and minimal guidance. Instead of paying tuition, just buy the book.

Dr. Esdin is superlative. His lectures are perfect. He is very aware of himself, the students, and guides the class masterfully and seamlessly. His class is truly a masterpiece of teaching. He is clearly passionate about the genetics as well as teaching, a great combination. One of the best professors I've ever had the pleasure of learning under.

I was dreading the fact that I had to take Genetics as a GPA booster and heard how hard the class was overall. Dr. Esdin is not only one of the best teachers that I've had but one of the most helpful teachers that I have ever had. He will go out of his way during lecture or after class to make sure that you understand it prior to leaving class.

Dr. Esdin is an EXCELLENT professor!  I took Genetics this summer and I can't say enough good things about him.  He cracks jokes which makes class enjoyable and he does practice problems in class so you know how to set up the homework problems.  Tests were challenging but it's clear what you need to know.  Oh, and the class is curved!

Excellent professor. He goes out of his way to ensure that his students receive the education befitting a school like UCLA, and goes beyond that. I'm taking him for genetics this Fall, too. I can't say enough positive things.

(This is for LS 2) Dr. Esdin is so helpful.  His tests are exactly what he teaches from his lecture notes.  The book is helpful on confusing topics, but Dr. Esdin does a really good job explaining most of them.  The best professor I've had yet.

Not a bad professor. Makes lectures sound more like casual conversations. It can get very interesting as well as boring (he gets lost in his thoughts sometimes which makes it hard to follow). Doesn't really care about syllabus, or calendars, or homework for that matter. Likes to talk but not listen.  Still a good professor.

Fantastic professor! By far the most passionate teacher in philosophy I have encountered. It is recommended to only take his courses after you have read basic philosophy courses though, because he can have esoteric tendencies at times. He can get of track sometimes, but if you know the subject those moments are actually very enriching and fun. A+
He is unconventional but engaging. Balls up and take him just don't expect it to be easy. His TA's work really hard to simplify stuff.
This class was difficult to follow, but interesting if your a philosophy major. No syllabus or course website, if you can deal with this the class is definitely worth it.

Absolutely incomprehensible, would repeat the same lectures because he had no syllabus or outline.  Insane.  I graduated and just want to warn everyone not to take him, unless you are a huge Philosophy lover and don't need clarity in your teaching.

Don't listen to the bad ratings for this guy because they most likely have come from freshmen or sophomores who complain too much. As long as you know what the subject is that he says he will lecture on, you can follow his lectures, and the accent isn't that bad. Great professor who knows his stuff, don't complain so much guys!

He's sometimes hard to understand, but worht it !! Just make sure you take him seroiusly. Despite his joking, he's a brilliant professor, and I felt privleged to have have taken 2 classes from him-- 185 and 170. He works on some really hared stuff, but teaches it well, and is always willing to help, as long as you're listening in class & reading
Need to read between the lines when he talks. Don't listen to everything he lectures because he goes off tangent.
one of the best professors at UCLA. Very down to earth.

His lectures are confusing, can't understand what he's saying. Disorganized, no textbook, the coursereader came out a week after the class started. lectures are boring, a good chance to take a nap or catch up in another class.

animated and interested.  His style is rather...all over the place and disorganized, his lecture are difficult to follow, and makes the material somewhat more difficult to learn.  Overall a good professor in need of a new method, perhaps using the board, or something to help track the flow. Approaching him in person is recommended.

Very interesting guy. Way out there! But he loves what he teaches and that is very obvious! If you can follow it you will love the class. If not, its all kind of a blur. But he loves to help and is pretty lenient in grading.

almog kicks ass.. good prof, good soul, the *nicest* brown eyes.  he expects a lot and made me surprised what i was capable of,  Loves what he teaches soooo much.  kind of eccentric, his own person, makes things interesting.  Created a bit of a community at ubc among profs and students
This class was horrible. He is impossible to understand and screwed our class over because a few people messed up. Unfair, rude, and confusing. Never take him.
No Comments

Sometimes hard to follow, but awesome if you can. One of my favorite teachers. A bunch of us used to pick our classes based on whether or not he was teaching it and not on what the class was about. Whatever he's teaching, you know it'll be cool!
No Comments
No Comments
hard to follow and understand. easy class, but lectures are extremely confusing and unorganized. he did say he was going to try and fix that but who knows.
Not good. Old-fassioned.

Spring 2021 review on Bruinwalk captures it best: petty, petty little man. Uses a form paragraph as a diatribe that reveals both smallmindedness and an apparent lack of knowledge/understanding of how the "real world" operates. Has a deep regard for the inconsequential that borders on reverence. I guarantee he was safety patrol in grade school.

Very good instructor, super nerdy, I highly recommend him, very hard class, projects take all of your time, but such an important subject. It was a huge shock to go from community college to this level of classes.

Smallberg teaches for a trained audience.I know, there are Geeks saying the opposite because they learned prog ever since they were in diapers and love the fact that Smallberg teaches this class for them, not for beginners. Smallberg wil be worst prof ever atucla. You'll start loving C, but you'll end up hating it. Smallberg hates EE students
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: I came into the course with 0 experience with C++. Lectures can be dry but I had to stay on my toes. Coding projects can't and should not be procrastinated. During exams, if you payed attention in lecture, did well on the projects, and go through the problems carefully, you should be fine. He was great for my first CS professor.
If you have no programming experience (like me), his class is very hard. If you do (like many of the people in the class), you probably won't need much effort in this class.
He is Great

Prof. Smallberg will go out of his way to help you, even looking back at code you've already submitted and asking you about bugs in your program, so in the future you don't make the mistakes.  Will respond to questions posed at 2 in the morning

I had Professor Smallberg for CS31 and CS32. He's an excellent instructor but the course is very challenging because of the length of the projects, which take most people double digit hours. They're graded by a program so it's easy to get a 0. If you want to be a programmer this course will prepare you for the real world, which is the intention.

This teacher is not too bad, he only has a problem with his personality. He wants you to think exactly like him, if you don't, you will be punished getting very low grades even when your proyects are OK. However there is a way to escape to his punishment: go to his office hours because he loves to be worshiped. Do it if you want at least a B.
Don't count on a curve, there isn't one.
Okay prof for teaching, but if you really want a good lecturer, take Nachenburg, but you can go to w/e com sci teacher, the hw and basic material for the classes are the same

Extremely helpful! I was in actually both his CS31 and CS32 classes, and Dr. Smallberg was very clear and precise about everything he taught. I emailed him on average 10 emails per proj/hw, and he would patiently answer all of them, and I'm just ONE of about 200 of his students! The only prof that would top his teaching style is probably Nachenberg

I guess he's an ok lecturer although his lectures were pretty boring.  I found the class very difficult due to having no prior programming experience whereas most of the class did...I would not recommend taking this class without trying to learn some C++ first because otherwise you will find it HARD.

He is a great teacher, goes very much into depth and really brings all the details to the foreground, and he does it all very clearly. Tests are difficult (long), and homeworks/projects are also really large (and if you make a single mistake you can get 0 points in some cases). Overall hard but very good teacher.
One of the best CS lecturers at UCLA by far.
Very helpful, he conveys ideas very well and makes concepts easier to understand.

I had this professor in the 80's.  He turned me on to Computer Science, and programming, in particular.  He has the unique talent of being able to take very complex concepts and break them down so that any student can take it and run!  I will always remember Dr. Smallberg.  Thank you!!
Excellent. Sort of corny at times, but he's a really good teacher.

This is by far the best Professor at UCLA.  Although his grading may be difficult, his presentation of the material is absolutely outstanding.  Thank you Professor, for telling the Armenian story with such vigor.

Don't be fooled by the other comments. This class is not difficult at all. If you don't do well you have nobody to blame but yourself. If you do the readings and attend class regularly, you will do fine. No prior knowledge of Armenian history is needed. Everything you get tested on is in the book and lecture.

Yes, he it is a hard class, but he is a fair professor. If you do the required readings and attend class, you are pretty much guaranteed an A. There is nothing on the tests that is surprising or has not been extensively discussed in class. He is a great professor and you end up leaving the class having learned tremendously. I recommend him.
HARDEST FREAKING CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN.
Simply the best !!!

Pretty much the best professor.  Very intelligent and articulate.  Dr. Hovanissian has a wealth of knowledge at his fingertips.  I took his Armenian History classes as an elective having only heard of his incredible reputation as an academic.  He told the Armenian story with verve and dignity.  Well done professor.
No Comments
Dr. Hovannisian is the finest intsructor I have had at UCLA, both in terms of his mastery of history, and in terms of his dedication to simply being a good teacher.

My idol.  Pretty hard to keep up with him or even try to impress.  Even after graduating I would enjoy his lectures and conferences.  I was raising my two children, working full time and taking care of my disable parents while taking all of his classes.  My newborn took all the energy I had during the night and I was sleeping during his class even I was sitting just in front of him.  I used to record his lecture and listen to it every day while driving to school, work and back home.  He is the one and only!
Hard class... but you feel like you've learned so much when it ends.
The Professor was very knowledgeable...great lecturer.

One of the best professors I have ever had, Dr. Hovannisian is an encyclopedia of information about the history of one of the oldest cultures in this world, the Armenians. Not an easy grader, but an A in one of his classes is an honor.

It is impossible to believe what a great instructor Dr. H. is, his understanding of the details of history is astounding; especially when combined with the genuine almost fatherly interest he takes in his students.  Thanks for an awesome quarter of learning professor.

I took an Honors Collegium class on Genocide with Prof. H. A LOT OF READING!!! But it was totally worth it. Class discussions were great, and the TA rocked (Go Jake!!) Grade based on two papers - 10-15 pg, and 25 pg. First one, based on novel on the Armenian genocide. Second, you pick your own topic, research it, write it. Great class, great prof.

Professor Hovannissian is the best teacher I have ever had in any subject including high school.  He has a stunning overwhelming grasp of history.  I highly recommend any class he teaches as a class that should be taken.

20 yrs. ago I took 3 quarters of Armenian History from Dr. Hovannissian.  I was a math major but Dr. Hovannissian's classes were the 3 best classes I had ever taken and have ever taken since. Thank you Professor for teaching me what it means to be an Armenian, thank u for giving me back my culture.

This man is incredible--he is a walking history book. His sarcasm is also entertaining. The tests are mostly short answer/ids/essays--none of that tricky multiple choice stuff. Take him--you'll learn a lot.
No Comments
One of my favorite professors at UCLA! I learned so much from her lectures. She's awesome. :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: If you get the chance to take a class with Mary, jump at it. She is one of the best professors I have ever had, a true delight to learn from, passionate and quick-witted. She thrives on teaching and it shows. She does assign a lot of reading, but as long as you're engaged you should be fine. Also: GO TO OFFICE HOURS! You'll miss out if you don't.

Mary is very straightforward on what she expects, and she rewards class participation. I highly recommend visiting her during office hours. Mary is brimming with intellectual energy, and her enthusiasm for history rubs off on students. She is also very humorous--one of the my top three most memorable instructors.

She is the best but she is not an easy grader.  Contrary to what people will tell you, you do need to attend lecture and office hours.  Isn't that what separates the C students from the A students anyway?

She's the best!  Leans left, but this is to be expected from a professor.  She gives brilliant lectures and her office hours are some of the best times I have ever had in school.  If you do the readings, go to lectures, and to office hours then you will (probably) get an A.  I cannot say enough good things about Prof. Corey

Either do the readings or go to lecture, depending on what you like. I did almost no reading and just went to lecture; got an A-. Final and midterm were take-home, so make sure you flip through the reading to find quotes for the papers at least, if you read or not. That's almost the entire grade for the class, aside from maybe 10%.
She is an excellent instructor with entertaining lectures and mostly interesting textbooks. Attendance is not mandatory if you do all the reading. All exams are take-home.

Midterm & Finals are take home papers. She loves to teach US History of the 1960's. Not a Communist, but a Social Justice educator. Great lecture and videos (Harvey Milk & Vietnam Documentry). Also, she's very youthful & full of life experience. I always recommend this class to all my fellow Chicano student friends

Great professor. Both the mid-term and final were take-home. "Museum" report was also required, and was about anything you wanted to do it on. Attendance not mandatory if you did the reading, but her entertaining lectures make it worth it. Do not argue about your grades or you'll be sorry.

Professor Corey is very passionate about the 1960s and the civil rights movements that emerged in that era and had a major impact on US history. The class I took dealt with 1950s - present. The assigned readings were informative and fun. Best part of the class was the wide variety of essay questions to choose from for your midterm and final.
Extremely interesting course content plus her bubbly personality makes this a class worth taking.
Very fun lectures and topics... take the class you wont be waisting your time
This teacher is a communists who berates the US in many ways - one wonders why she still lives in the CA capitalistic system rather than in some socialist backwater country.
Cool as hell! does not hold back, take good notes and you'l be just fine I got a B- and I would still reccomend her

She is one the GREATEST professors of history I have ever taken.  If you are having trouble, she takes the time to help you out!!  Her class is awesome!  I promise that you will not fall asleep, she captures her students with her great lectures.  I totally recommend her!

Mary was amazing.  Note to students - take notes voraciously...that helps a lot with the midterms and finals...regurgitation of lecture + your well formulated and intellectual opinion of the subject matter = A...don't be brain dead and you will be fine.  Also, take advantage of office hours...this is where you will get some of the most intellecutally stimulating conversation she has to offer.  If you want the chance to speak with a very accomplished and interesting Prof, this is her.
amazing mind... in spite of her 'aural hallucinations'...

Mary is hilarious.  She has a passion for the subject matter as well as an opinion.  the class is fairly easy if you write descent.  Despite her relentless attacks on white people and her liberal politics...she is pretty cool.  She might be the only liberal on campus i can actually stand listening to.
A man with a mission!
I've been taking Dr. Graffin's classes now for like 20 years. Best professor I've had.
Wicked cool.
He was awesome, very available for questions
Awesome teacher!, and a great singer
Badass professor
coolest man alive
great teacher and punk rocker
Amazing, I really loved whole experience! And he is frontman of great band. Just wow.
Best teacher ever
one of the best!
Awesome Teacher.  Not an easy A, but still work taking.  Also fronts bad religion
agreed. frontman of an amazing band AND professor? thats insane. the man does everything.
awesome, great, fun
Totally Cool!!!!!
Wow. I was hoping for so much more. But he is the most boring lecturer I've come across my college career. AVOID AT ALL COST!
great teacher.  knows everything
Genius.
Prof. Little gives a great class, engages the students, demands participation and pushes the class to work out ideas.  Great class and I'm glad I could attend.

I've taken Professor Little twice and wished he'd teach more classes. He's absolutely full of knowledge and so incredible. He's very engaged with your learning and loves to lecture. He's very theatrical, you can't be bored in any of his classes. I learned so much form him. If you can take him, TAKE ALL OR ANY CLASSES HE TEACHES.
I wanted a college professor who shared knowledge, not one who gave over every class discussion to students who seemed to be quite opinionated, but didn't seem to know much.
He's brilliant! Take any class with him.

I don't think there was a single day I didn't laugh out loud in this class.  Made shakespeare fun.  He is also a LBGT studies professor I think and it showed a little in the class, but it's shakespeare...its jam packed with LBGT and sexuality.  Really open in office hours.  Helpful, plays favorites (but your TAs grade you anyway), fun.

I had Little for M101A and B and also for his lower division Shakespeare class and absolutely loved all of them. You HAVE to do the reading, but in the M101 classes, if you read exactly what you're supposed to and do well on the midterm and papers, you can get an automatic A without taking the final; I did it twice, so it's possible!
Great professor. Very accessible and helpful.
Absolutely the best professor of my undergrad experience.

The class is tough. Some people say that you must be LGBT to get an A...not so. In fact, many of the straight kids in the class got the top grades. I'm straight, I got a B, and it was well deserved. This is not an easy A class, and I don't regret taking it. Prof. Little is absolutely brilliant. You will look at literature in a whole new way.

Prof Little is hands-down one of the best professors I've ever had.  Lots of fun in class, very engaging as a lecturer, and really knowledgeable -- plus, super available outside of class if you have any questions!  If you love Shakespeare, you need to take his class. :)

thinking outside the box and reconsidering your most sacred assumptions isn't always a comfortable experience, but if you came to college to do just that, then take shakespeare with prof little. he's brilliant, engaging, hilarious, and devoted to his students. what more could you ask for??

Been in grad school for three years, and in all graduate and undergraduate courses I have taken, Arthur is the one professor that I felt taught me something I would not have otherwise figured out on my own.  He made me work my ass off, and he gave me all the support I needed in the process.  He is as brilliant as he is generous and humble.  Buy his book:  Shakespeare Jungle Fever.
No Comments
He's completely immersed in the subject matter and his lectures are usually amusing. Class discussions were usually the most interesting.

Professor Little is an awesome professor. Who knew taking Shakespeare cold be so interesting, englightening, and ultimately radical?  It speaks volumes to this mans intellect.  UCLA should be honored to have a scholar such as Professor Little

He is one of the best professors at UCLA.  I really had to work hard for my A and I actually enjoyed working for it.  He makes you really think outside of the box and he makes you want to do your best.

Shakespeare: the best course in Shakespeare ever. A brilliant man. Provides fascinating context that aids understanding. He's out-there. No cookie-cutter stuff. Tough exterior; but win his respect with enthusiam and hard work and he's a doll.

Professor Rowe was my favorite professor at UCLA. Her class was difficult, but it was only difficult because I had never really put effort into developing my writing skills before taking this course. I will never forget the butter cookies provided during our final exam, nor the hours of help she provided in office hours to make my essays readable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Oh the memories... OCD is the best word to descrube her. Took her in 1997, ans would type or rather re-type my essay on the back of my paper using an old type writer. It was insane. But i really enjoyed her lectures. She interviewed me for almost two hours just whn i asked her for a letter of rec. Too funny.. she is nice though.

I took Milton with Dr. Rowe about 25 years ago, and we would giggle about the handouts and chalk drawings even back then. They seemed infantile to those of us who were accustomed to Dr. Allen's or Dr. Braunmuller's esoteric lectures (also wonderful). But we LEARNED. I think she was a highly effective teacher.

Though a compassionate woman, her lectures are haphazard!! Yabbering at lightning speed, she spews information & expects automatic absorption. With chalk etchings ALL OVER, her writing is disorganized & unreadable. Using outdated references & allusions, she litters students with meaningless handouts. Her tests focus on most minute & random details.
Loved the seminar. Teacher very gracious with comments.
She's utterly useless and trapped in the past. She's competely out of touch with reality. Her class is painful and pointless.

Oh, please...those who complain about how hard she is or how much work there is in her class (esp. Milton) really don't belong in college! You ARE supposed to work in class, and Prof. Rowe makes you work! She expects a lot but she rewards hard work - you need to be on your game! Those who moan about it - what are you doing at UCLA?

I have taken 3-4 of her classes.  Professor Rowe is one of the best at UCLA--smart, hardworking, very intelligent.  And, she cares about her students.  If you're lazy and want an easy A, you should go somewhere else.  If you want to learn, are serious about literature, and don't mind reading and writing (A LOT), you'll LOVE her!!!

Prof. Rowe is one of the best professors at UCLA.  She's funny, smart, and diligent.  She spends a lot of time making sure her students learn.  The serious English major will love her.  Those who are there to mess around won't do too well.  Her classes are challenging (lots of books, many papers, etc.), but those who work hard will get a lot out of

You people need to grow up.  This woman has a lot of knowledge to share.  If you actually care about your education, you will find her class stimulating and informative.  And if you work hard, you'll get an A.

If you want a quarter filled with femi-nazi rhetoric and opinions, stay.  If you want an unbiased class geared towards fostering individual growth DO NOT take this woman's class.  She is arrogant and uncompromising.  She is a great writer and will give you good suggestions on papers, but that does not outweigh the overall experience.

I don't know why people are so down on Dr. Rowe. She's tough, but that's challenging. She's very fair, and unlike some profs, she really takes your work seriously when she grades it. She's not very smiley, but so what?

Look for an alternate class. I found her to be a tough grader, I don't know if it has anythingto do with having a ****. She has taught for a long time, I heard she helped build UCLA (100 years ago) and started the women's lit program but I can't confirm it.
RUN, RUN far away from this teacher.  She's a horrible lecturer...horrible grader...horrible reader...horrible everything.
Even with an interesting topic and decent material, this teacher was terrible.
No Comments

Horrible, unclear. Attacks students personally in notes. This class in tourture to sit through with this professor.  She reads from a note card the entire class, and is unapproachable. Students also have to endure her shrill voice during readings.
helpful to me
The kind of professor you'll love or hate.  He is more like an entertainer than an instructor.  Doesnt seem stable.  Too hyper for me.
An incredible professor! Every lecturer in college should be like him.
An incredible lecturer.
Do not take him!!! Very vague about work assignments – has favorites – if you are not one of them beware!

Dr. Arrington is one of the best professors i have had in all my years at school. His POLS149 class is the only class I have actually loooked forward to going to and absolutely loved!! I would highly recommend Dr. Arrington.. take him if you have a chance! Dr. A is the best! oh yea and read Kerosene Cowboys!! great novel.

This is the kind of professor all university students should have.  Prof Arrington not only possesses a brilliant intellect, he is humble and extremely helpful to all students.  We should all be so lucky to have a teacher like Dr. Randy Arrington.

This professor is the best teacher ever at the university level.  You have got to take his classes.  Dr. Arrington has an intensity and a passion for teaching that is extremely contagious for everyone around him.
Tremendous professor.  Great class.
Anal guy who is very unclear on what he wants you to do- kind of full of himself who likes to talk way to much about who he "knows" and what he does.
No Comments
No Comments
Interesting and engaging professor. Tries to get his students to actually "think" about what the government does.  His class is also very easy. He tells you exactly what's on the tests. Take him.
Best professor I have ever had in two years at this university.  I changed my major to political science because of him.  I reccommend him highly.
interesting, funny, movies, easy, reading interesting, papers graded fairly, litte work
Most outstanding professor I have ever seen
Most outstanding professor I have ever seen.
It's difficult to understand what he says.

I took Professor Phillips Fall 2020 & loved his class. His class is Asynchronous & lecture heavy. The good thing is that you could rewatch the lectures & download the transcript to highlight the necessary content. He always gives a study guide for midterm and final which is very useful. You don't really need to read bc everything is in the lectures
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: Midterm, paper and final. Best lecturer by far at UCLA. He is straight forward and very clear. Reading will reinforce his lectures. Go to class take good notes and you will be fine, even though he is intimidating.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I loved professor Phillips' class. He is a fantastic teacher and gives great lectures. I would take every class with him if I could. One midterm, a paper, and final. VERY LECTURE HEAVY. As long as you come to class and take good notes you will do fine. You only really need one of the books he assigns as a supplement to help reinforce the lecture.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: There were about 40 pages of one book that you actually needed. The rest of the test/paper material can be done with just lecture notes. Take good notes, he has no power point and lectures like a stream of consciousness. Write fast and study hard to pass. Tough on grading, you really need to know the answers. Very interesting and funny lectures.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: The greatest lecturer I have ever had!
Fairly easy class as long as you attend lecture and take notes. Phillips is great, very entertaining and clear.
The class isn't as difficult as some would have you believe. If you're the type of student that attends class regularly and takes good notes you should be fine.

I had Phillips for Hist. of Rome and all in all I would recommend him. He delivers crystal clear lectures, and while you really have to study hard, like others say, it's well worth it. The only downside is his personality. He comes across as very arrogant and unapproachable. Try to talk to him and he'll brush you off quickly. Needs to learn respect

I loved Roman History with Phillips!Yes, the class is difficult, but he is an excellent professor! Like others have said,you will learn in his class whether you want to or not. Many students were intimidated by him but he wasn't all that bad. Very handsome professor which can be distracting during lectures. Take Phillips for any class!

This guy is hilarious! When he gives his lectures, he is extremely scrupulous and straight-forward, but then he'll randomly crack a joke, and get the entire class laughing. He's pretty good looking too. Only downside is that you spend the ENTIRE class taking notes. There isn't even enough time to zone out. :(

Phillips is a VERY hard professor. Lectures extremely fast, and really expects students to know every aspect of Roman history. He is not very approachable, however, his notes comprise his exams. On the plus side, he's very CUTE, so that could either be good or bad depending on if you're easily distracted. Overall, Phillips is a great professor!

Awesome class, great prof. Hist of Rome is not a piece of cake, but he makes the subject very interesting. Take good notes and you're golden! Phillips is a great prof, but don't expect him to be your best friend. More friendly in office hours than in class. Take this class, you will learn prob more than you wanted to about Roman History.
His lectures comprise his exams. If you take half-way decent notes there is no NEED to read the texts (although it is helpful if you live in a world of perfect time management).

Phillips is a very serious teacher, but he is not boring. he is very straight forward midterm, final and one paper. if you mess up on the paper and the midterm but do good in the final you could still earned an A.

He is not very approachable after his lectures, but he does know his greek history.  His classes were the best notes I have ever taken.  I didnt really do the reading cause he covers it during lectures.  You just have to know your stuff and know details!!!
He is boring and hard. Don't take him unless you want to read at least 100 pages a night!

I took this class because I needed the req but it sucked for me. Half the class failed. I got 10/40 on the midterm (which is an in person 3 HR pen written exam) when asked why he said "Your answers are right but arent what Im looking for." He, under any circumstance, does not give out extra credit even if you are a point off from a passing grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Convinced these good reviews are either him and his TA army, NPCs, or just the Bio students that have these concepts down to a T. If you are new to Bio Anthro and have no photographic memory I am warning you to steer clear of this class.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Worst class possibly ever. Passionate teacher. The lectures based solely on what he says in class so no slides or anything be prepared to keep up with what he says. random pop quizzes. Exams are worth the most of class but are extremley hard and he has said that he does not hand out A's to everyone but only the poeple whos anwsers are perfect.

Acknowledge the professor's passion in this topic Midterm (35%) and final (45%) are in-person challenging essay questions. Lecture content necessitates thorough note-taking and memorization due to the absence of recordings or PowerPoint slides. Heavy reading load as topics frequently change, TAs grade like everyone can afford F's. F this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: This class was the worst. He is very very smart which is great but he spends most of lecture ranting. His exams are incredibly hard and there's only two of them. He expects you to be able to master the material in the way that he has mastered it and I feel like it is very unrealistic. He is a nice guy but I would never take him again.

I hate leaving poor reviews on Profs., however... His lectures are interesting but he spend most of the time ranting about nothing. The TA's are helpful. He only has 2 exams which is entirely ridiculous. I was CONSTANTLY stressed about my grade and less focused on the topics. If you can, I suggest avoiding.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Just a heads up, Professor Fessler posts all of the course evaluations (completed before we get our grades back) from students on his personal website (danielmtfessler dot com) to help students out. There are a ton more reviews there than here.

Most intelligent professor on UCLA campus. If you didn't take advantage of the information provided or the hours he set side for meeting with students, then your loss. Hardest A I have ever worked for, but totally worth it. He's tough, but not unapproachable as some previous students have alluded to.

Super hard class. Yes he gives you the questions ahead of time, but no they are not easy to answer by any means even if you have a week to prepare. This class NEEDS a discussion section. While prof. Fessler is indeed extremely smart, he demands a lot from his students in this class so be prepared to work your hardest.

Fessler leads an extremely informative class based on lectures and readings. He recites lectures from memory with 1 or 2 slides per class. The readings he assigns are absolutely required as there's a quiz on them every morning AT 8am when the class starts. It requires work, but he's extremely intelligent and helpful and the information is awesome
great class but very difficult and pop quizzes almost every class. So much for a class. If i wasn't working fulltime then i would have done much better. Did enjoy the class alot

Best class I took at UCLA, straight up! Fessler is very hard but if you do the work you will definitely take a lot out of this class. Material is extremely interesting and relevant to everyday life. Highly recommend!
Seriously, this guys gives you all the questions for the exams. How can you possibly do bad in this class?
great class. just pay attention once in a while. this isn't high school

His lectures are very interesting but the material that he presents is so hard to understand. Based of that material or the reading he gives "pop" quizzes" pretty much everyday. I would not advise to take his class..very intense
wow! he was so rude! dont think about asking for help because the chance that you will get it is slim to none... his class is very hard... the average score on one of our exams was a 60%
he may seem strict and arrogant but he has good intentions, and has many interesting things to say; is very knowledgable and lectures basically from memory
Professor Gardner is transparent in her lectures.
Ms Gardner is a great teacher and knows her stuff!!! I had a blast taking tax with her.

Study the course reader not the book.  Her tests are right out of it.  Know your stuff.  Lots of questions on the test.  Sterling is too long and time consuming.  The stock project was graded harshly.

Don't bother with the book.  She only tests from the course reader.  Her tests have a lot of info so better know your stuff.  I did not like the Sterling project-too much time consuming.  The stock assignment was graded hard by the TAs.
She is entertaining. Some may feel uncomfortable with her dirty jokes.  She tells her real life experience which is good to know for students who are into the accounting field.
Gardner is amazing.  she got a standing ovation on the last day of my class.  you fill the course reader in during class which helps the learning process.
tests are hard and beyond lecture. you need to have extra knowledge beyond this course. what she is asking on tests is unclear.
really good professor.  Always wanted to know how I was doing, and what I decided to do after college.   Wrote a good letter of rec.
hard
the worst teacher i've had so far
She's one of the most intersting, enthusiastic, and entertaining proffessors I've ever had. i had a great time in her class.
One of my favorite prof. at UCLA!
a bad apple in a great department
