Take anyone else from that department
Mean and detached from reality
No Comments
He's tough dude, real tough.
Leazer made cataloguing seem cool, hot even.  Very much appreciated the depth of the readings as well as the levity Leazer brought to class with his radiant casuality.
Good teacher, great class
Professor Leez is pretty dope, dude.  He's like really smart but also really funny.  I njoyed learning about cataloging with him
Professor G is awesome, dude.  You learn a lot and he give good feedback.

Leazer might be an acquired taste- he's a bit rough around the edges, but I'll take a little rambling and the occasional questionable joke when studying a topic as mortifyingly boring as cataloging. Despite his bristles, he does care and care very deeply about what he does, and that earns my respect.
Utterly Brilliant.

He is very vague because sometimes he trails off during a thought and begins a new thought, confusing you.  He interrupts your questions, so he can't answer sufficiently.  I received no clarification to the numerous questions I had so I sought out his reader, who was the only real help you will receive in his class.  Good Luck!!

He's sounds like a moron. Has high credentials-- there must be some mistake. Sarcastic. Stupid anecdotes that take us off the topic. you can learn more by reading a book, and not have to deal with his opinions. interrupts people before they are done speaking. I just can't see why others are so fascinated by him--  must be his slacker/slouchy appear
brillante

The above reviews were pretty accurate.  Can't say I was too into the subject matter, so Leazer was the most engaging while giving strange antecdotes or talking about something he was personal interested in.

Professor Leazer is a likeable guy, and he had great anecdotes to tell. However, his lectures tended to meander until it seemed he lost track of his point. His policy of not checking messages makes him hard to get a hold of. One day he kept checking sports scores as he lectured - not cute. But still, I learned stuff and had an OK experience.
Funny guy. Good anecdotes. Makes the class interesting, but bring coffee to early morning classes. Sometimes he can droll.
Greg is very funny, and easy to talk to. You learn a lot about AACR2 and MARC records. You learn stories about the eccentric catalogers and their quirky tendencies.
great guy!!!!!
friendly, funny, very approachable, would take again.

Classic example of a "do-nothing" instructor. Set up the course so students could not communicate with each other. He gives you a whole pile of work and basically says "go do it." If you can, take it from someone else who really does try to teach. I asked a few questions by email and he just seemed like an airhead. For $555 tuition I expect more.
One of the greatest men I have ever met. My favorite professor of all time.

The class was easy. He's the "easy" professor or so I heard. So all the people on here saying "OMG IT'S SO HARD!" No its not. Do the homework, read the chapters, before class, and you'll get an A. the curve is amazing if you do above average, because most people are lazy and don't do the homework. Not an easy A, but you can do it.

He is a very nice guy, tends to give weird examples that are meant to help you understand the topic better.. But the key to getting an A in his class is DO THE HOMEWORK. Seriously, take 2-3 hours a chpt and really go through it. Do the problems he assigns +some. I spent about 3 hours a chapter (there are 11 chps) and I did amazing. DO THE HOMEWORK!
bad prof, does not teach at all. he just reads out of the course reader and goes on random tangents of his life that really have little to do with what he is supposed to be teaching...

Classes: 1A, 120A, 122, 189HC, 199. Grades: A. I <3 Prof Litt. One of the few professors whom you can have a deeper relationship with (i.e. mentor-mentee). Go to his OH and if you reason/complain he will most usually give you more points on the tests. He might not be the best teacher but so what? Who remembers accounting stuff after class anyway?
Study old tests.  LEARN BOOK COVER TO COVER and do ALL of the homework problems... if you do that, EASY A
Difficult class and he isn't very friendly
He is very nice and has respect to students. His exam can be time consuming. But he will tell you what to study for exam and that helps a lot.
His final is just so confusing and even if u studied realli hard, it doesn't mean anything cuz he even tested stuffs that he said we weren't responsible for. Avoid taking his class!
Likable personality but a stingy grader.
Study old exams! Not just the past quarter exams but the past 2 year exams! Trust me, he repeats problems!

Go to his lectures and office hours, Study his past exams.Pay attention to the topic which he spends most of the lecutre time.tests are not hard but they are long.Once you know his style, you will get an A.
Best teacher I had at UCLA.
nice professor^^

His lectures are actually not so boring since he often tells you about his real life experiences. His lecture notes are very very long. Make sure to pick out important points from the lecture notes and do your homework to do well in the class.
An amazing teacher who cares greatly for the well being of his students
Great human.  Talented instructor.  High standards but clear expectations from day one.  I'm glad that I took this class with Mr. Malonzo.
made my financial and time investment during the pandemic well worth it.

He only lectured once or twice for the class that I'm in. He was great and seemed to be behind the scenes support for some reason while others lectured. Mark was great and I heard about him from previous students. It's obvious that he's been doing this a while and, more importantly, he enjoys teaching. Wish we had him more.
Prep had a mix of instructors. Mr. Malonzo was the most comfortable of all. I've heard about him and his reputation is supported by his performance.
Mark was great. Im looking forward to taking more classes with him.
best educator by far. had an awesome experience in the hybrid emt class.
take the in person class. hybrid with mark was tough. no flexibility at all from the course syllabus and rules.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: our hybrid emt class is wrapping up this week. i'm in the weeknight skills sessions and live mondays wednesdays online. this class is hard and it moved quickly in the last half. the pace of the first 4 weeks was manageable then you read a point where you're retesting one thing and studying for whats next. Mark was a great main instructor!!!!

Found these reviews of Mark Malonzo by googling his name after he did a full day lecture on pharmacology for medic prep. Mind blowing, inspirational, and gave me a sense of confidence. Not that he rattles off a bunch of info, but rather, because he was able to keep my attention for 8 hours. Heads up: doesnt teach prep much so just a taste.
pay attention he calls on people one the roster randomly. fun class. learned a ton. mark is a great teacher, professor, person. looking forward to taking paramedic school at UCLA next year.
Great teacher! Wish we had him more.
What a waste of money paying for the paramedic prep textbooks. Mark, on the other hand, was amazing.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Talented teacher. Easy to understand.

Down to earth. Accessible. Gets to know you as a person. Our entire class had 100+ and he knew my name and asks about how my week is going. Great person first. Great teacher second. My classmates also say the same.

Mark Malonzo is an amazing lecturer! He can break down the subject into really simple terms and keeps the online lectures interesting! He answers emails quickly and truly cares about your success! My friends recommended his class and Im glad that I signed up. I want to know as much as he does one day! The best EMT/Paramedic educator! Thank you!

He's probably one of the worst professors I've had the displeasure of having to take. If you value your mental health, then please don't take this class or the professor. He claims he lectures, but most of it is him giving one opinion and opening to discussion. Speaking of opinion, if you don't share his opinion, you prob won't get a good grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: If you have anxiety, this class is perfect for you. You never get called on unless you volunteer. With that being said, if you are not an auditory learner, it'll be a pretty hard class for you. He goes off book or notes he writes and it's hardly on the board (just record the lecture on goodnotes and go back as many times as you want).

The subject material is fascinating. It revolves around author Henry James, his life and major works. For this class, you'll have to read five or six of his books and the way he writes can be very confusing. The professor is not extremely helpful in this arena, but his lectures are interesting.
Only got a "B" but learned a hell of a lot.
Fantastic professor. Knowledgable about literature, art, philosophy, history, and even popular culture. Loved this class.
He's a very scholarly type, and one of the last true gentlemen in America. Loved his course on James, even aced it!!! I recommend him to everyone.

My writing improved a hundred fold after taking this class because the guy spent a lot of extra time giving me and the other people in the class lots of helpful comments and advice about their papers.You can tell he loves what he does and he doesn't like BS!

The most articulate, interesting, and caring teacher I have encountered in college so far. I can't believe what a huge Henry James geek I have become because of Dr. DiMuro. Oh and his tests are not bad at all.
Such a wide range of knowledge that I loved coming to class to listen to him. Fair grader.
His lectures are interesting but he provides a lot of superfluous information. He used a lot of obscure and indistinct quotes to identify on the final, but he grades the papers very easily.
Brilliant, outstanding

Bad teacher, but not terrible. He gives the impression that his class is hard to pass, but he want simple and easy to read essays. WEIRD coming from a UCLA professor. He will grade you down if you use big words. Overall, try to avoid his courses.
Awesome instructor - DIFFICULT, but the class is WELL WORTH THE EFFORT!
Too lazy to give lectures, lets students carry on mind-numbing discussions instead. Doesn't make an effort and criticizes theories he doesn't understand. Very disappointed.
awesome prof but lots of reading and hard exams. witty and nice
terrific prof--brilliant, gifted teacher. opened my mind. handsome!
Calculators are not allowed in the exams, good luck :)
Very great lecturer. One of the better Econ professors at UCLA. But the classes are pretty difficult. Notes and practice problems are the best way to study for exams.

Tests are hard and get easier after the first one.  Best lectures, very clear and concise.  Do the questions, they are like the test.  My econ prof now is horrible and just shows slides and doesn't work out the problems.  McDevitt is much better and is the best econ prof I've had so far.  Didn't realize it until now

OK, this guy is one of the best speakers I know.  Very clear, interesting, and easy to understand.  However, his tests are tricky with a crappy curve.  You need to know calculus and obscure econ concepts from earlier classes.  40% of questions he never went over in class or modified extremely.  Always trying to trick you.  Tough graders too.
Great teacher very understandable lectures. Tests are very hard but they are curved and if you study his lectures and study guides you won't be surprised when you take the test.

You need to know your stuff....but study and you'll do well...he's maybe the only FAIR econ professor at ucla, and indeed an excellent teacher...the lectures were interesting and easy to follow, the lecture notes were clear, and the study questions are exa
Pretty hard tests! Know everything for the finals. Study questions help on essay portion but must know general knowledge of everything gone over in lectures because multiple choice is killer!
Easy teaching style.  Tests are straight forward.
No Comments
Very straight forward and never off topic. The study questions are extremely similar to the tests - if you can perfect those, it's not hard to ace the class.
Great teacher.Very structured and organized.He gives you a lot of value.
One of the best teachers I've ever had.  He's very approachable in office hours, and his lectures are extremely well-organized (and taught from memory!)
strict, but very clear, and useful
Cool guy! Very clear explanations, super organized. Best Econ prof I had so far @ UCLA! Make sure to study his review sheets.
No Comments
No Comments

Damn that reading! He's great: funny and articulate, explains all major points and relates context so you can understand what's going on. Expect to be asked for original thoughts on papers, NO summaries or explanations of what is already read. As a mandatory class for ENGs, he makes it as smooth as possible. Would take him again because of humor.

He has a great passion for the works he teaches.  He often reads them aloud and gives great historical context.  Definitely a teacher who knows what he's teaching and loves teaching it!  An entertaining and enjoyable professor who loves his subject.

I returned to UCLA as a mature student several years ago and took Dr. Kipling's Chaucer course.  He brought the material to life and made the poetry sing by reading aloud in Middle English. His extra sections helped students become proficient in the archaic language.  Chaucer with Dr. Kipling is a must for the serious English major.

Dr. Kipling takes teaching very seriously, and this is shown by his high expectations of you as a student, which translates to respect for those who are truly present in the classroom.  He's an old school academic in the best sense.  He has a fantastic, dry sense of humor, and if you're paying attention, you'll get it.
boring
single worst professor i had @ ucla. boring, orthodox, and pompous. made me think thrice about being an english major.
Friendly and approachable professor who genuinely cares about his students.

I hated the book, but he was very passionate about it. If you like Chaucer, you should like him. Hes a sweet man and he doens't ask for much...just read the book! He sayed we would have quizes, but we never did...The lectures did get boring a lot of the time...its a long class....
Although the class was difficult to get through because he didnt give a break, I loved it. He made the topic interesting. He is very passionate about literature.
No Comments
No Comments
Lovely man.  Excellent human being.  Brilliant mind.
I slept a lot in this class...ALOT.
No Comments

I am not sure what I did wrong, but this is the worst grade I have ever gotten in a class. We seemed to get along, and the material was very easy, but when it came down to grade time he was way harder on  me than I thought I deserved. It could be me, but I have finished almost three years of university without ever being so demoralized by a class.
Wonderful professor.
Test questions will come off his powerpoint notes. I only made a low B on one test and still passed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He needs a massive raise from this joke of a university right now

Wonderful professor! His lectures move quickly and he gives extra time for those who need help. Exams are based on the book and lectures and he's always available during office hours. His emails, contrary to what BLM is saying, are funny and very well thought out. Hope he stays!
Great professor! Love the way he teaches and goes about his students! Anyone who begs to differ is lying! His style is not for everyone but he is an overall GREAT person!
awful
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Excellent professor who makes you work for your grade. He is also a recent victim of social justice activists getting him fired for not being racist. I appreciate that he is not racist. Thank you professor Gordon for adhering to the principles of the great Martin Luther King Jr.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Klein makes you earn your grade but is fair. Don't expect to be lazy and get a good grade as you will earn what you put in to the class. It shows that he cares about what he teaches and about student learning. I would highly recommend him if you are ready to work and learn!
Great job

Klein is NOT approachable at all. He wud set his OH at 7 and you have to meet like a lot of requirements to be permitted to even email him cuz his personal and professional time is much more important than teaching or helping students. Barely any practice questions for exams other than 2 Qs from the course reader, which is not like the actual exam

Klein's style isn't for everyone but he was my favorite professor  bar none (and yes, I do know Ravetch is amazing). Humorous anecdotes convey core concepts and keep his lectures easy to follow and at times, even *entertaining* to follow. Don't expect details.  You'll understand; you won't memorize. Do NOT buy textbook; course reader  mandatory.
Teaching is relatively straight forward.  Sort of likes to talk about himself.  Unresponsive and unhelpful outside of class.
Superb. Great real world knowledge and a very concerned person who goes out of his way for his students.
Good instructor to take if you are preparing for CPA exam. Study course reader and read text for your success in his class.
No Comments
Overall good
Easy A. The guy obviously knows a lot, but he's just going through the motions. The grade is based on two 500 word papers, a midterm and a final. You get study guides and lots of time to study them.

this guy is awesome. the class is interesting.  the lectures are always fun. mid terms are essays he hands out before hand and this quarter he gave us all the easy ones on the midterm and final.  he is so interesting and knowledgable.

There is a disconnect between the lecture and the difficulty of the papers and exams.  The lectures are really relaxed Mellor makes the class seem really easy.  But the graders are really tough.  Most people got B's on the first paper as a result. The lectures have no point...just read and you will be fine.
He has fun lectures, but they are not that relevant to the tests. Anything you need can be wiki'ed anyway. Some slides go by fast so you might want to bring a camera to class.

One of the best history professors I think you can have. DEFINITELY recommend him -- he is both very entertaining and knowedgeable. Besides that, the course material is really interesting as well. You'll have fun with this class! :)
One of the greatest professors I have ever had. He truly loves history and teaching, and has a lot of fun while he's lecturing.
he is a very interesting professor with a very entertaining lecture style.
Best professor I ever had at any level.  Even better when you get him in an honors section.
No Comments
No Comments
Prof Mellor rocks and is quite entertaining. He gives study guides for the exam and as long as you follow the reading, it is easy.

Mellors lecturing could be followed word for word out of the Rome travel guide or the Reader. His lecturing is clear but has no real insight, just guide book verbatim even though he acts as though they are his own thoughts and ideas.
Great lecturer, very approachable
No Comments
Great teacher. Very animated and knows his stuff. Loves Bush, Not!
easy A, all you do is a resource report, 10 minute presentation, and show up everyday, garunteed A!

Dr. Batten is one of the most wonderful professors I ever had.  Expect to work extremely hard and to leave the class feeling enlightened and rewarded.  He taught one of the best classes I ever took in College.
Very animated professor.Knows his stuff.  Tests can be difficult, but you do learn a lot of interesting facts.  He is friendly and thoughtful.  One of the best English professors anywhere.
Brilliant. Great. Enjoyed his insight, his knowledge, his energy.

Batten was very approachable and easy to understand.  Sure, the course work was strenuous, but it's supposed to be!  I took him for three classes and he wrote me a wonderful letter of recommendation when I graduated.  It just doesn't get better than this!
No Comments

He was very funny and entertaining. His lectures were informative and interesting, but the subject matter was a little difficult to follow. He wasn't very approachable, but a great performer for the class.
No Comments
No Comments
Really funny, very personable. Made the class enjoyable.
Relatively intelligent in terms of subject matter.  Not the most receptive to students when it comes to seeking assistance.
Brilliant and very funny.  Offers one of the most enjoyable classes at UCLA.
Good sense of humor.
No Comments

His lectures relate very little to the textbook and homework problems. He only teaches things that he finds interesting. He started off the General Chemistry course talking about quantum mechanics rather than actual general chemistry. He is lazy and makes his TAs do all the work for him.
Took him for 113A Quantum Mechanics!! He is really bad at teaching  a. if you can avoid him specially for such a hard course like this.

Worst "teacher" I've ever had, period. He cannot teach to save his life. Studied my a** off and it did nothing for me. His test questions were completely from out of left field, and his lectures make no sense whatsoever. The little that I did learn was all thanks to my TA and myself. Take a different professor and save yourself the stress.
Terrible teacher, he teaches at a level far above the students in Chem 20A. His tests are unrelated to the assigned readings in the book, and only slightly related to his lectures. Avoid if possible.

Boy, where to begin. Goes off onto tangents, he is an amateur in chemistry, and not a professional at teaching. You might as well take Chem 20A later unless you have to. AVOID BAUGH! You will be happy that you did not take chemistry with this teacher!
Terribly professor, smart guy. That's it.

WORST CLASS I'VE EVER HAD!!! i went to class everyday and took very good notes and read the book, first off, the book is terrible and hardly makes any sense and his lectures make even less sense. after receiving a D and F on the midterms and a D on the final somehow he curved so much because everyone must have done terrible i got a C- in the class

A good chemist but a bad teacher. The tests are entirely from lecture slides, but the slides have nothing to do with the book, and the book is so God-awful it's entirely unhelpful. You can tell he knows chemistry, but he cannot convey his understanding to students. It's a difficult class as it is, but having Baugh made it that much harder.

Dr. Baugh is a really nice person, but he has a hard time teaching his students. The finals counts for your entire grade, one page of note for each midterm and two pages on the final is allowed. Go to your TA's office hours, and Kenny is the most beautiful creature on earth, oh and he's an amazing TA too, if you gut him you should ask him for help.

The exams were easy, if that's what matters to you.  He went on weird tangents, stuff like Africans in ancient Egypt and claiming that whites stole all their technology from Africans.  Lectures were ok, although he sometimes got confused by fairly simple concepts.
he is very bright. explains concepts well, even though he often goes off on tangents.

He had no interest in teaching this subject, and it showed in his lackluster performance.  His TA's did a better job.  He is only interested in his own research.  He never once gave an interesting lecture, his lectures didn't connect with the book info, and his tests were out of left field.  I think he should go back to USC.
easier once you know what his tests will ask. off topic alot.

he knows his stuff, but hes rather incompetent as a professor.  lectures are useless and really slow. material seemed to be entirely disconnected until the final review session when things were somewhat explained. overall, not a great professor

Terrible Professor.Talks to the board and talks funny too.Tests on things he never goes over.All he does is derive stuff.Take Scerri instead if you can.If you absolutely have to take his class, be sure to get tutoring in covel.

He is passionate about Math & shows interest in the students. If you never miss class you can easily get an A. He also makes the class fun, never boring. One of my favorite professors at UCLA. Really nice, polite, helpful.

Taking his class, I felt like a light weight going up against Mike Tyson. Nathaniel Grossman was the first Math professor I had at UCLA in 1989. I came from one of the worst high schools in the LAUSD. I was completely unprepared for his class and failed.
Smart but cannot teach

Grossman is adorable :) I would go to his office for help and he was very inviting. I took 135a and b with him back in 2002. They are upper divison classes and there is a certain amount of work that you should be able to do for yourself. But I have heard  that he is difficult for the lower divisions. He is a flippin genious :) Go Grossman
Prof Grossman is a good professor.  He is very approachable and seems eager to assist students with their learning.  As I enjoyed the course, I don't know why so many peeps are bagging on him.
No Comments

i hear this guy is practically a genius, but he is a HORRIBLE instructor.   DO NOT take any of his classes!!!!  maybe it's cuz he's too brilliant for most students to comprehend or maybe he assumes we're just as brilliant as he is but he doesn't know how to teach.
Grossman has no idea what he is doing.  Unless you find proofs very helpful, stay away.

Professor Grossman has no business teaching at any level. As a teacher he is incompetent, uninterested, and has close to zero social skills. If you have any choice in the matter whatsoever, do NOT take a class with him.

Prof Grossman is a great professor. The material is extremely complex at times, but he is thorough with his explanations. The best attribute about Professor Grossman's teaching is his willingness and desire to help his students. Go to his office hours!
Man...does this guy need a reality check. now i've done very well in his class but there were a lot of students frustrated and worried.  he acts like UCLA is Yale.
Gives long, difficult, but interesting homework assignments. The exams were pretty easy if you knew what you were doing, but were hopeless if you were unprepared.

Dr. Grossman does expect a lot from his students.  If you are not hard working, you will not survive his class.  But he extremely good at what he does (solve very difficult problems) and he is always willing to explain things to you again if need be.
Worst professor ever.  Stay far far away
very hard and distant

The most prepared professor I've had at UCLA. He expects a lot from you, but only because he expects a lot from himself. He is always open to discussing topics outside of class and office hours and teaches in a way that makes you interact with the material in a real-world sense. Best teacher I've had at UCLA, hands down!
Not a hard prof, but a large amount of work is required to do well, along with mandatory attendance

He is a truly awesome human being. If it wouldnt be for him I wouldnt have come to consciousness of the value of life! Very helpfull and is always encouraging his students! He is very anal for his essay assignments, but it definetly pushes you to work hard for your grade.
Had some interestig stories!
Really interested.  straight up an optional midterm and a final (15 pages)
awesome!  i think he is kinda hard but i think that it really pushes the intellectual boundaries!  as a huge nerd he's ****in awesome!
No Comments

Great class, my most hated subject, but his lectures were great.  Wish I had the chance to take him again, killer class though, took it over summer a few years ago, 4 papers in 1 weekend for the final.
The best!!
No Comments
great prof..
The greatest!

Pror. Rocco has a real passion for his subject and for teaching. He really makes you work for you grade. Even though he is a tough prof I found his first class interesting enough and valuable enough to take a second course with him.
The greatest. Truly loves what he does.
No Comments
He is strong on the constitution and encourages an open mind. Welcomes diverse opinions and ideas.  We need more professors like him.

Keith Fink is one of the best Professors I've ever had at UCLA. It is troubling to me that at this time Fink is being forced out of UCLA. I don't like what I'm hearing or reading on the subject and this prevalent fabrication of evidence. He has a mastery of the material, makes lectures interesting and interactive&makes himself readily available
This Professor cares about all of his students. Takes time to answers your questions.  Excellent class discussions.
Incredible professor
great proff, amazing lectures
We need more professors like this.  Providing the facts for all involved. I want to know my rights, not just "theirs"... whoever "they" are.

Great guy. Teaches in a very direct and easy to understand method. Loves to debate interesting hypotheticals. Fair warning though, he is politically incorrect, so the school will probably try to get rid of him soon, so sign up for his class NOW

One of the top professors at school. Dr. Fink gets beyond the doublethink and newspeak prevalent on campus and analyzes first amendment rights in a clear, compelling, and interesting way.  Sooner or later, administration will likely figure out a way to get rid of him, because he's not politically correct. Take his course now.

Took him in the summer and he was fantastic . Don't leave UCLA without taking a course with him. He truly cares and cases our really interesting. He goes over the cases in class. The class wasn't difficult and very enjoyable.
super easy. attend class and its an easy A. Midterm and Final are multiple choice. Professor is really entertaining

Professor Fink's classes on free speech in differnt settings are amazing. The class lectures are entertaining with the students having to answer hypotheticals which keep changing. Professor Fink is very challenging during class discussions and has a masterful style based on his debate and liitgation background.This was my favorite class.

Best class I have had. Professor extremely dymamic and smart and teaches in a unique pure Socratic style. Professor Fink went to UCLA and clearly loves the school and teaching. Very interesting material covered and I came away with a great understanding of the First Amendment.

Great teacher! Really loves his students and will do anything to help them out. He will take care of you if show respect and interest. Go to class and speak up! It will make a world of a difference if you are involved in the discussions!!!

Prof. Fink is a UCLA alumni; he clearly loves the school and has respect for the students there.  He has the typical tough lawyer persona because he is a practicing attorney, and though he can seem intimidating,  he cares about his students' understanding of the material.  This class definitely broadened my knowledge of free speech and the law.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! While Professor Smith seems like a nice person, that does not make her a great professor. This quarter, she completely restructured the course, making it nearly impossible to achieve an A. The midterms were hard, averaging a C and she refused to curve. Lots of reading and no preparation for exams. Super stressful, dont take!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Helpful

My favorite lecturer so far. Lots of reading: 2 novels and 3 journal articles per week for half the quarter. You can get away with not reading her "Ordinary People" book and only reading the abstract and conclusion of each journal article. It's audio bruincasted but she only posts parts of the lecture slides so you should go to class.

Really knows the material. Her tests are challenging so you need to do the readings and keep track of the authors because you will need to cite them in the exams. The class discussions are interesting and she is very helpful if you ask.

Prof Smith is excellent and one of the brightest professors at UCLA, I would recommend her. Sure, the curriculum can get difficult but that is what learning is all about. You need to challenge yourself! :-)

Good lecturer.Friendly, approachable.Not dry.Presents material well.Uses powerpoint but refuses to post her slides.Assigns a lot of reading.Her lectures are so elementary and basic but when you get her exams they require a lot of detailed knowledge that she didnt touch upon during class.Grade based on midterm, guided research paper, and final.

Dr. Smith is an amazing professor. She has great knowledge in Archaeology and is very passionate about it. She is an amazing lecturer! She engages her students and even cracks a few jokes. She  is one of the best professors i've had here so far. Amazing class!

Clearly pre-occupied with being the professor who can jam pack as much as possible in an introductory course.  The guided research papers were a farce. Entirely too much reading for this class.  Does the bare minimum to justify her office hours.
No Comments

She's like a lawyer that doesn't have time to go over the case with her clients.  She's quick and sweet with little to no opinion every so often she'll with respond with, " Um I don't think so" other than that anything you ask her will be NO.
Dr. Smith is awesome!
No Comments
Trying hard to impress the department, not the students.
so detailed  you will throw up

She is a very strict grader and expects students to show up and do the work. She doesn't respond well to people who don't do the work and expect a good grade. She is very helpful in and out of the classroom. Her tests are insanely difficult, which I think is the only downside to her courses.

she's a wonderful lecturer and her class is super interesting, but she doesn't give a study guide or even do any sort of significant review for the final and midterm. the final is 68 percent of your grade too, by the way! exams are very challenging. final is cumulative and you are given zero hint as to what to focus on or study.

Professor Kennedy is extremely knowledgeable. Her lectures are worth your time. However, her exams are beyond difficult. You cannot study enough. She will not give you a study guide, nor will she review. She is vague when anyone asks a question in regard to an exam. She does not grade her exams, her TA does. She is the worst TA I have experienced.
The class was really interesting and the professor was helpful with any questions we asked.

It makes all the difference to attend the honors seminar. She is very informed and relays plenty of information to the students. She maintains a sense of humor and sometimes adds pictures in her slideshows just because they're cute. BUT she takes class very seriously as well. She has been my favorite professor thus far. I highly recommend her!

Very interesting class.  I learned a ton, but did not do well.  Her tests are very difficult.  If students do well on the final, she will disregard a poor midterm grade.  However, the final is very hard and if you don't do well, you will not get the opportunity to take the class again. That's just the way UCLA works. Also, her TA isn't very helpful
the class is pretty interesting. while attendance isnt mandatory, you really should go to lectures cause you miss out on a lot. the exams are kinda hard.

Very knowledgeable and easy to get along with. She covers very difficult material in her lectures, and expects students to learn. She is a strict grader, but for those students willing to put the effort into learning the material, she is a fantastic teacher.
interesting lecturer, leads great conversations with new perspective and information in the honors section.
Definitely made my first year at UCLA more difficult. Way too proud of her "achievements."
Is she here to teach or to scowl?
Seems like she is always in a bad mood, like you are imposing on her by coming to class, unfair grading and repels students.
Very fair and helpful Professor
Informative, easy to understand, look forward to going to class and will take any class she teaches in the future.  All around an asset to the Anthro. dept.
this is a corona time review TAKE JUKKA. HES THE BEST PROFESSOR FOR LS30A. YOU DONT NEED TO WASTE MORE TIME FILTERING THROUGH REVIEWS FOR HIM JUST TAKE HIS CLASS. best, F+P
One of the best professors ucla has.

Hilarious man, funniest professor I've had thus far. Huge goofball. Loves his students and will listen to their feedback. He even lightened the homework load for us when we requested it. Will do whatever it takes to make sure you are prepared for exams. Supplies great resources, and keeps all lecture slides on CCLE.

Double PH.D eccentric guy who is willing to open up any of his specific view on comedy and his teaching is very theoretical. If you take his class be prepared to really study and review the topics. In the future you'll be really well off and you'll also do well on tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough--Would take again

comment: Jukka is an excellent professor who really cares about students learning. He does a multitude of office hours, particularly before the midterms and final. I even reached out to him when struggling in my next math class and he set up office hours with me. Not at all a dry lecturer which was a huge plus. Very well organized with his notes.

Great lecturer. Very funny. Arrogant but also cares for his students. TAKE ADVANTAGE OF HIS OFFICE HOURS. He gives out so many that you would be stupid not to go, especially during the week before midterms and finals. There, he sometimes gives out hints like "This is a good problem. Maybe I should give it in the test."

Dude is funny, sure. Midterm 1 is supposed to be easy but if you mess up one or two questions you get a C, Midterm is awfully hard yet somehow grades are still the same as Midterm 2 because people study harder based on Midterm 1, and then your final is doable as long as you study but you better go that extra mile for practice or be happy with a C
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Hilarious, responsible, and very helpful. Tests are based on lecture examples and homework, nothing surprising.
Great professor. Funny, clear, and very helpful. There is a lot of homework, but it's not an unreasonable amount. Just more than I'm used to. Final was hard, midterms were pretty easy.

Jukka is an amazing professor, and his clarity and drive to make sure everyone understood the material was appreciated. His review sessions for the two midterms were very helpful, but not the one for the final. The only downside- everyone did so well that because of the department standard, a 95% and below is a B, not A :/
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Really good professor, just do your work.
Funny professor, tests are based on homework, clear lectures.. Good overall experience
He's really funny but he'll be laughing when he's grading your papers too.
Amazing.
Terrific Professor: demonstrates knowledge and expertise in his subject; would take again.
Fantastic professor, I really enjoyed statistics and Prof. Christou was fantastic in explaining concepts and he is really funny.
He is very good instructor, very smart and also a hard subject. I would definitely recommend him.

He's a great guy and he's incredibly nice, but man are his tests ridiculous. You won't score above a 70% on any of his tests but his curve is very generous and he doesn't fail anyone. He has a thick accent and can be sort of incoherent, but show up, do the homework, try your best on tests and you'll be totally fine.

He's amazing!  I do agree that he goes really fast, but he's super cool. Going to class is imperative, and his notes are critical for his exams.  Best way to study for the class is by reviewing the notes and understanding them well.  Go to office hours!!!

Dr. C is dope.  He goes super fast, but his work is really clear and he explains well.  Go to office hours.  His tests are based off his notes.  Great professor.  Cute Greek accent and has a funny sense of humor.
Awesome professor. Was very helpful not only in class but also during office hours.
Very dedicated and helpful!

great professor..he gave us three exams....first two are very very easy....and the last one is very hard..however you did well in first two....so dun worry about the final....the mean in our class is 91%....very very high.....take him...........and do well in first two exams..(really easy)

You need to really work it to get good score in his exams because the wording of his exams can be tricky and he hates it when students ask him to explain during exams. Also he cannot tolerate stupid questions. He will give you nasty looks if you do. If only his homework will reflect some difficulty that matches his exams will be even better.
No Comments
the best guy ever!
No Comments
very poor instructor
Overall not that great.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: This professor is awful!! He should do research in Math instead of teaching. He taught so quick and hard to understand. I think he needs to do other jobs instead of teaching.
Best professor i have ever met.
Amazing Prof, was an absolute pleasure to work with.
I love this guy.
Just feels like he's spilling his knowledge out rather than teaching. You can be a genius and all, but that doesn't automatically make you a great teacher.
Great Prof.
AMAZING
He's really good at looking at the solutions manual.
this guy is the best high school teacher of the past 4 centuries.....i kid you not
It's just plain wonderful to be taught by the smartest, most amicable mathematician alive! Truly amazing.
Amazing professor, this guy is literally a genius. It's amazing to learn from him.
Great
No Comments
Professor Dolovich is hands down my favorite law school professor, and I've had some great ones.  She is brilliant, passionate, and comitted to her students.

Professor Dolovich is brilliant!  Had heard mixed things about her entering the class, but she really surprised me with how interesting the class ended up being.  What really held the discussions back, at least in my section, was actually the class' unwillingness to oppose "PC" opinions, for fear of offending someone.

Amazing. Absolutely brilliant, and even though she talks REALLY fast (!), she is very willing to work with you outside of class if you don't understand the issues. She focused on very interesting topics within Crim. I came into the class not interested in the subject and now I'm absolutely in love! Dolovich was the best prof I had this semester.

Professor Dolovich is wonderful. Yeah she talks fast and encourages discussion, sometimes at the expense of reading cases, but this is partially because the doctrines are unclear and disputed and it's important to learn why. She encourages difficult discussion and critical thinking, and I've always felt respected in and interested by her class.

Do attend class and try to stay somewhat engaged; she tends to call on people that appear to be zoned out. Write well and edit your exam; there is no time pressure and the issues are easy to spot, so clear writing sets you apart.
Sometimes hard to follow, but she is brilliant and very interested in the subject.
She was pretty bad.  One of the worst I have ever had.  Rude, unhelpful, unfriendly, close-minded.  I could write much more...
Such a brilliant legal mind.  She talks fast, so you'd better be a fast typer, but everything she says is totally worth hearing.

This woman had managed to completely turn off any interest I might have had in criminal law. She was more interested in dragging out of us what she thinks the policy should be than cases and law. Too bad as 1Ls people don't have much choice to avoid her.
Her exam is pretty easy - 8 hour take home.  A lot of smart people did poorly in her class. =)

This was the worst class I have had thus far at law school.  The woman is brilliant, but I feel CHEATED out of my the crim law experience.  She was more interested in how my fellow students felt than in teaching us the state of the law.  Terrible, terrible, terrible.
fascinating.  I hung on every word.
No Comments

His lectures are highly intriguing and entertaining. He is basically up there theatrically performing Shakespeare with such a passion that you can't help but be enthralled. He once abruptly dropped to his knees as he reenacted a scene from king Lear. He's brilliant.

This class is a joke! He uses his students as a platform to perform pre-written essays in 75 minute sessions. He presents outlandish theories that he mentions his colleagues disagree with him on (Romeo raped Juliet?), but teaches them as fact. Don't take this class unless you want to be brainwashed by his bizarre, egotistical notion of "reality."

Words simply cannot express how amazing Professor Watson and his class were. Due to his enlightening lectures I have developed greater interest for Shakespeare. It was the best experience I have ever made and I can only encourage any student who likes to put effort into his or her studies to take a class with Professor Watson!

Absolutely brilliant!  Apart from his deep knowledge and passion for the subject, his charismatic and passionate style during lectures made the hours fly like minutes. I was always sad when the lecture was over.  You are privileged if you can learn from this erudite and learned man!
He was ok. His lectures had nothing to do with the questions he gave on exams.
He is so brilliant and hysterical! Best lecturer I have ever had! He truly has a gift!

Felt like failing class so I could take it again.  Eloquent but understandable with a fun and fast-paced method of lecturing.  Was drowsy at times, but blame the unbelievably comfortable chairs.  Warm and helpful man, does not misrepresent opinions.  Strong essay topics and feasible tests.  Excellent TAs.  What college should be all about.
his lectures are really interesting, he seems really involved and excited about the material he teaches, but I found the exams difficult.
Extremely brilliant, funny, and lucid lecturer. One of the best professors I have ever had.

Really, really smart guy.  He lectures that way, too, filled with allusions to Shakespeare, contemporary politics, the environment, music from all over the board, and so on.  If you're not a great close reader, just watching him do it in lecture will help enormously.

Great class.  His lectures should be taped and sold.  He starts off his lecture with a point and then wraps the entire structure of the lecture around that point.  He is very helpful and speaks with clarity.
Fun, keeps things interesting, keeps you from falling asleep even when discussing King Lear.
No Comments

This was my favorite class at UCLA. She is a good communicator and her lectures were so interesting because she talks about current events that are happening right now and the research applies to everything in the world. Her tests are not easy, but you will be fine if you study.

Very interesting lectures. I can't believe someone is complaining about having to read an easy book for a college class. It's actually on the best seller list. This class is probably the only useful psychology class that I've ever taken. The professor loves her students and will spend a lot of time discussing the material with you.
This is by far my favorite class. The lectures were outstanding and Dr. Smurda really cares about her students.

Dr. Smurda's class is fun and interesting. It took me a while to actually understand everything, but once I did, it blew me away. She is also a great person to talk to and to get advice about graduate school. I enjoyed her class so much that I ended up taking 2 more with her.
Favorite class
I found this class to be very interesing and informative. Her tests were hard though so you need to study. I like the fact that there was a discussion component so we could talk about the material.

This was the worst class hands down. The readings were redundant. She assigned multiple readings on the same subject and none provide any new information, so clear your schedule because youll be reading A LOT. The lectures are dry and boring. And, the exams are written to confuse you. I dont understand why some professors and TAs do this.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: 135- Social Psych The class itself is cool/interactive. Two Midterms  40-50 MC questions There were 4 books assigned, however you're only responsible for a few chapters/book. Easy read & very interesting. 6 dis sections for this quarter, only accountable for 5. Must submit a post on readings.
I'm in love with her
She's amazing, hilarious, very intelligent. I highly recommend her
By far, the best professor on campus. She has changed my thinking about life more generally.
great teacher and very fair on exams. she is very easy to understand but i would recommend reading the textbook because it goes more in depth. favorite class though.

By far the best science teacher I have ever had. She is clear, helpful and entertaining as well. Her tests are extremely fair. There is a lot of information covered but that is the only reason I'd say easiness is not a 5. I would recommend attending her lectures because she goes into more detail than her slides, but her slides are posted.

He is a great Professor who knows his material well. The readings are a must as well as going to lecture is you want an A. If not you can do one or the other. He is enthusiastic, clear, and amazing. Take him if possible.

He reminds me of the guy from the movie 'Up', only way happier.  He loves what he teaches about, and makes it seem like political institutions are the most important thing in the world.  After a quarter, i began to think so too.  Great guy, always available in office hours, and very helpful with any problems you may have.
20 years ago, but still remember him as a great prof and cool guy.
So nice! explains everything so clearly. very helpful. made me so interested in the topic of the class. I actually enjoyed lecture. he is so intelligent.
So nice! so helpful! explains everything so clearly! got an A!!!

Prof. Lofchie was one of  the best I ever had. He is very enthusiastic and cares that you learn it and makes his class really interesting with side commentary.  He is one of the few professors here who really cares about his students. Take him if you get the chance. His class is easy if you do the reading and attend lecture
Best Professor EVER!!! You must take this guy, if only to get to know him!
No Comments
Lofchie is GREAT!!! He's very concerned about the students and whether or not you get his stuff!! I totally recommend him and can't wait to take another one of his classes!!
Amazing class, tough, but he made the economies of Kenya and Tanzina interesting, you will love what you learn, he really is an expert, but still a tough class.
Great Lecturer. Clear and the class isn't that hard.

Lofchie is a great man! Even though he is department chair, he took all the time in the world to sit down and talk with me. He really cared if i learned something. Can you believe that.  I really wish him the best and hope he teaches forever
I took him roughly 7 years ago, but he was good
Make sure you complete all assignments and take advantage of the extra credit opportunities. Also, make sure to pay attention to the Practice AoLs.

Professor Pires was not a good professor. During lectures she acts as if she cares and wants you to go to office hours, but once you do go to her office hours, she makes you feel stupid with any questions asked and has a hostile approach. Would not recommend her as a professor. 0/10
ok

Cares about her students. Her exams are some of the hardest I've ever taken. Do the homework and reading before class. Class consisted purely of clicker questions for practice, you must come in already knowing the material. Discussion is boring, all simulations and a quick walk through the botanical garden.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: Her lecture was really good, she explains it better than the book. But the exams are tricky, she doesn't give questions that is straight forward. There are online quiz each week due by tuesday. You must read the book ahead in order to do those quizzes. She wants the student to succeed, and helps a lot during office hour.

Good lecturer. I never slept in class (it's a 9:30 am class). Notes are important, book helps to clarify. Loves Q's on lab techniques, since she's been doing that since forever (as a grad student). Tests were MC, and not the worst kind where all Q's had choices as all of the above or A&B. Clickers used (T.P.) Lots of OHs a wk. She's good for LS 3.
her tests are very tricky and go into the slightest detail of the book. You have to read and understand/memorize the entire book and graphs. test averages were midterm 1 73% midterm 2 63%. Final?
She was tough, but if you put your nose to the book and study hard, you will earn your grade. She has great study guides as well.

Debbie Pires rocks.  She is extremely helpful, tech savvy, patient, helpful and beautiful too.  She challenges you to really understand and learn the concepts and retain them on a long term basis. I wish more teachers would aspire to be more like Debbie Pires. Of course, except for the physical beauty.

This is for LS 1. Class is fast-paced but the workload is reasonable. Definitely need to take good lecture notes AND read the textbook. She's a great lecturer and one of the few profs in the UC system that actually like teaching.

She's a good teacher, but you definitely need to read the book and listen to her lecture pod casts. It is a difficult class - you should spend at least four hours per lecture studying. It is very interesting though and she tells cool stories about the subject.
Really interesting class and, I'm a social sciences major.
She's very encouraging, helpful, OH always packed with students because during lecture she talks way too fast. exams are conceptual and covers a lot of material. class in bruincasted
He is very knowledgeable about the subject and very caring!

Amr is amazing!! I had a lot of professors & TAs during my time at UCLA but he was my favorite. He was able to help me understand nebulous religious concepts of Ancient Egyptian religion with more clarity, as well as articulate my own ideas in papers. Unlike many other professors/TAs, Amr encouraged me to think outside the box. Very supportive!

Amr is so knowledgeable about the material and presents it in an incredibly engaging manner. He is very accessible for office hours, and he provided me excellent feedback on my papers. I could tell he cared about me and was invested in my growth as a student. Because of him, I found a love of ancient Egyptian history I didn't know I had!

Amr is amazing!! He was always available for office hours where we had insightful discussions about the lecture and discussion material. He provided feedback on my essays and had great suggestions. Amr does research directly in Egypt's catacombs so he's extremely knowledgeable about the material and has a sincere passion for it.

If you take ANNEA 15W, I would definitely recommend taking it with Amr! He was one of the most engaging TA's I had at UCLA, and he was always available to answer our questions and work with us on our final projects outside of class. His discussions also expanded well on the course material, and I could tell he had our best interests at heart.

Amr is one of my favorite TAs at UCLA! He is obviously very knowledgable about the topids discussed in the course, but he is never condescending and always helps his students understand. He is accessible outside of class and I love going to his office hours!
Professor Amr is amazing! Easily one of the best teachers I have ever had, and he is extremely knowledgeable about everything, not just Arabic (he is of course an amazing Arabic teacher as well).

Amr is one of the kindest professors that I have had. On top of this, he is competent, well-rounded, and is always engaging students. Amr really cares about each individual student, and customizes his lessons for each one. He only wants the success of his students and their mastery of the material
Amr made this class so much less stressful for me, especially during the current times. I found him to be understanding and supportive as well as very knowledgeable about his subject.

Amr is easily one of the best professors Ive had at UCLA. He is exceptionally caring and goes out of his way to provide our class with resources and extra help when its needed. With courses transitioning online for spring, Amr has effectively adapted & taught us well. I would love to take more advanced Arabic & ancient near East courses with Amr!

Amr is easily one of the kindest and most patient teachers Ive ever had, and possibly the best language teacher Ive ever had (linguist speaking!). He genuinely cares about his students interests and their success in the course. I would take a class with him again in a heartbeat!

Amr is incredibly knowledgeable about the language and able to communicate so effectively. He was always ready to give us logical answers for things we found difficult. His patience was unmatched & it was so apparent how much he cared for our wellbeing. I love the atmosphere he makes for the class; he is one of the best instructors I've ever had!!
He is amazing!!!

He is a pretty great professor. He is very lively and helpful. I learned a lot during his class! I missed a few lectures just because I scheduled too much on the same days but it didn't hurt me in any way. You do need to do the readings so you won't be lost in lecture but he explains everything. Overall pretty good :)

Amazing professor. Clear and lively teaching style along with quizzes in which you get to drop the 2 lowest. Has great TAs. The final was good as it allowed you to pick which questions to answer. Overall one of the best at UCLA
This teacher is probably the best UCLA has to offer. He teaches in with a very moderate approach and is always lively in lecture. Take any class with Professor Walker and you won't regret it.

Great professor! He explained things very well and had excellent TA's. I definitely recommend him, though you should realize he required a lot of (interesting) readings. You learn info in relation to history and theory, but in a practical manner that can be used for other courses and allows for an engaging class. (PS - Lecture with discussions)

Excellent lectures, reading materials, and discussions. Quizzes are fair, and based directly from weekly readings. Lectures are clear, engaging, and thought-provoking. This class has a large reading load but the work is straightforward and not difficult.

EXCELLENT professor. He uses great texts for his class, wonderful lectures. He has students engage in discussion in almost every session which is great for everyone. The class is a bit of work/reading.. however.. if you wish to really learn and also reevaluate your own ideas/opinions, this class is perfect.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Adam Roberts is extremely nice. You need to go to every lecture because if you do not I guarantee you that you will not get even an A-.  You should always bring his lecture power points  to class and also record him. His tests are ridiculous: multiple questions, fill in blank and stories. I would not take any course with him. Don't count on a curve
Very good professor, knows what he is talking about, very friendly and didactic.

Dr. Roberts used his good sense of humor and his bio/neurology stories to keep the class interesting the entire quarter. He was good at reading when the class was overloaded with info, and would answer students' questions with tons of enthusiasm. He's excellent at explaining tough concepts, and genuinely wanted us to do well. Learned so much!

Dr Roberts is a dream. His lectures are hilarious and informative. Additionally, he  has a great personality and is extremely caring and  approachable. I would call his tests tough but fair. Extensive studying is required to get a good score, but all the relevant info is covered during lecture and review aka there are no curveballs. Absolute gem.
Dr. Roberts is awesome. He really cares about trying to make sure that students understand the info and will go over the tough information multiple times in order to do so. He's great!
rating_tags: CARES ABOUT STUDENTS--Respected by students--TEST HEAVY

comment: Truly cares about students and wants to make sure each of them learn the materials.  He is absolutely helpful, amazing teacher, always there for you to help you throughout the course.  If you want good grade you must attend all the classes.
Lots of chance for improvement. Hard tests. Explanations are more like tangents, long and at times unorderly. Doesn't use textbook and lectures slide notes aren't all the material thats on text.

Roberts is THE BEST, most adorably amazing teacher. I am touched to see how far above & beyond he goes to help his students learn. I hope he knows his time & effort (& humor) are deeply appreciated. This class is quite challenging. I worked harder & smarter than before. I learned so much cool stuff, and I am now more inspired than ever.

Best anatomy professor at GCC. He takes so much of his OWN time to have review sessions For his students. STORIES are KEY! Be prepared to Study! If I passed you could pass! You won't regret taking this professor. he is funny and makes lectures fun .. Good luck p.s Gcc needs to hire more professors like Dr. Roberts
Roberts definitely has passion for teaching this course.  Lecture slides and stories are key.

Roberts definitely has passion in teaching this course.  Basically study what he tells you to.  If you are unsure of what to study, go to his office hours and he might even give away a few questions on the exam.

Honestly I've never had such an amazing professor before, especially for biology. He was supper involved with us, and tried to help us succeed more than any professor has ever before. He held tons of office hours, where he would go over many topics that he would tell us would be on the test. Very passionate and amazing professor! TAKE HIS CLASS!
Nice guy but don't feel like I learned much it was mostly busywork.
Nice guy but does not teach that well. Class was often boring but chill. Read the book and you will be fine.
Great prof, no problems
Totally nice guy, but i didn't really learn anything about Torts in his class...

I had the misfortune of having Prof. Abel's torts class at CUNY Law School. While I came into class really interested in Torts, I left completely disinterested, disappointed, and felt that I learned absolutely nothing. If you want to get a decent grade, use outside material, i.e., Gilberts outlines. For policy, use the article he published.

Abel is really nice, but he is so focused on policy that it is hard to learn the rules.  If you have him, make sure to check out a sample exam early on -- it is nothing like what you discuss in class!
A raving socialist in my opinion.  He didn't teach the subject as much as he taught his socialist worldview.  It was annoying.
The final was tough but it's no different from past years.  I really liked Professor Abel.  He's a cool guy.

Prof doesn't believe in the tort system. While you're a first year, it's irritating (because you don't learn the black letter law), but later you pretty much realize he had it right all along. Read the papers he's published to better understand his p.o.v. for the test.
Richard Abel's exam are a crapshoot.
A Marxist at heart, his teaching of the subject tends to be ideologically driven, and he does not give enough time to alternative perspectives.
1st year School of Law Torts class.. very good teacher
good stuff

Brilliant Professor with deep knowledge 
Easy to understand and learn

Professor Lal's lectures are engaging, weaving in his opinions (w/o leaving out other POVs), anecdotes and interesting insights into how the material is relevant today. History, as he says, is the study of the future. You'll study history for ideas, not rote facts. The readings may be a bit heavy esp. if history is not your favorite subject.
He's pretty cool. He's a genius.
Not good for beginners need lot of extra reading,but course highly rearding

His lectures are very fast. He doesn't allow time for questions. His grader is ridiculously unfair. Lal claims there's a 10% portion for attendance, which he doesn't take, yet I never missed a class and my final grade never changed. Be prepared to read several novels and an excruciating amount of dense material. It's an unrealistic load of reading.
amazing guy . must watch his lectures

Very interesting and informative. He recognizes his own bias, and attempts to give both sides. Discussions are mandatory and TAs check to make sure you go to lecture. You should go to lecture because that is the main source of information. Midterms alright, final is difficult but doable. Skim the readings, but GO TO LECTURE!
lectures are very interesting, his opinions and annecdotes are fun to listen to, but work load is heavy
great teacher!!! the best

Profesor LAL is one of the best History instructors ever. He is an intellectual and challenges you like mad balls. He expects his undergrads to work like graduate students. If you are a lazy loafer, don't take any of his classes. However, if your up for a

Lal is a passionate man who really captivates you with the ancectdotes and stories he tells.  He's very approachable and interesting to talk to in and out of class.  Very supportive of student learning.

Corbin excels in physics teaching. His dedication shines in office hours, ensuring deep understanding over memorization. Inspiring and thorough, he makes physics engaging and accessible. A true gem for students seeking to truly grasp the subject. The funniest parts is when he cracks jokes. For example, when deriving planar symmetry - old mcdonald.
Great lecturer, exams extremely difficult, make sure to do all the homework and practice problems from previous exams
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: In a nutshell, lectures are very engaging but exams are very tough.
Great teacher.  Great person.  Great lectures.  Probably the best lower division professor you'll have for science majors.

Great lecturer: organized and entertaining. The book is a reference, exams are based on lecture material. His tests are impossible to finish within 50min, but the final is way more doable. Just go to his office hours as much as you can because he goes over problems that help your solving skills during exams. Great person outside the classroom too!
Best professor I've ever had. Explains everything really well and actually cares for his students to learn something.
Amazing professor, tests are really hard, but he explains the material very well, and is always available if you need help. Just go to office hours and show him that you care and want to learn.
His tests are all symbolic, so his homework is not very useful for preparing. Go to his workshops if you really want to be ready for the tests.

Brent was a great guy both in and out of the classroom.  He would be willing to change the subject to something non-class related if he could tell you were getting stressed in order to help you get your focus back.
He is very funny professor.

I liked Prof. Corbin (he prefers his students call him brent) because he is very down to earth with his class. Although he admits during the first lecture that the class will be hard, he makes physics as fun as he can.
No Comments
this was for anth001, wasn't listed. easy class, didn't attend anything for lectures. just do the work and you'll get an A.
Very easy class, I never went to any lectures and there are only essays. There is no final.
a great prof
Worst teacher ever

This class could definitely be more interesting if he was not the professor. He expects you to read so much yet when you come to class he goes off on tangents that do NOT relate. The course is half way over and i only have 3 pages of notes. He doesn't explain anything very yet but expects you to know everything. avoid this class for sure!
im in the class right now. and its alright. just gotta keep your mind interested in the subject. i feel like its gonna be a fun class.
I like the class. the last comment was uncalled for!

avoid this guy, completely unfair and uses the television to teach the class, might as well stay home and watch the discovery channel and national geographic. He expects ALOT from students as if it were a upper division course. He will make you hate studying about asian culture. Enough said~
he thinks he knows about asian culture, he knows as much as we do... basically if this guy can teach this guy you can also teach it. Basically the book taught the class, not the teacher.

Not a good professor. Bad textbooks. One of the books was only used 2 times for the entire quarter. He doesn't really teach, he just makes us do presentations on Tuesdays and then show us films on Thursdays. I'm a very good note taker, and only got 5 pages of notes this quarter. Bad exams! Not recommended!

Horrible professor, incomprehensible, hard for no reason.  Example-he told the ENTIRE class that he would fail us on a project BEFORE it was even turned in.  ALL the students hated him, and he even reduced a girl to tears...one of the worst classes ever.
He is so unlcear, he tells you one thing and then expects another thing.  he doesnt know how to explain and he is so freakin boring.  good luck.

Gen Chem was by far the worst class I have taken at Biola.  I understand chemistry is a challenging subject, but Chang makes you feel stupid and acts like he doesn't want you to succeed.  He said in class "When you're happy it brings my happiness down" regarding complaints about class.  Hard tests and rude professor.  Do not take.

I had Dr. Chang at Biola. Gen Chem 1 was a difficult class, however not as difficult as Gen Chem 2. Some things I would recommend for any future students taking his class would be go to recitation, read the chapter, and LOOK OVER MCQUARRIE BEFORE A QUIZ. Be ready to spend a lot of time in this course. A "B" is doable, but an "A" is very difficult.

Dr. Chang hands down is a great guy, and super fun. But as a teacher he is a different breed. He is unhelpful, hates what he teaches, gives you sass when you ask for help, and his tests are so dumb. If you go to office hours or recitation, be prepared to be humiliated if you have a question. Go to tutoring and do the gobs of homework he gives.
Had him for gen chem at Biola university. He was very unsympathetic and was not willing to work with me. Definitely will never take a class with him again.

I took him at Biola University as an adjunct professor, maybe he is different at UCLA. Was not a good professor. Often had to say "I do not know" on a question 4 to 5 times before he finally "helped". Very discouraging. Great, funny person outside of chem, other than that a terrible teacher and communicator.

Dr Chang was the best chemistry professor I've had in college. He was clear about what he wanted, taught everything very well, had a sense of humor that could lighten ANY situation up, and was super friendly and approachable. His tests were fair and were never meant to catch you.

Dr. Chang is funny, helpful, and makes chemistry an understandable topic. I've struggled with chemistry for a long time, but Dr. Chang helped me to not just pass the class, but to really get why electrons are moving where they are, why the molecules interact with the reagents, etc. I had Patrick as my TA and he was amazing too! Highly recommended!

Hands down the best professor I have had at UCLA.  His class is difficult, but he is clear with what he wants you to know and he takes you through it all step by step.  Dr. Chang is super approachable and is happy to help students in anyway possible so long as you put in the effort on your end.  Definitely take his class.

Professor Chang is one of my favorite professors at UCLA. I am not good in chemistry and he really cares in trying to help students and make them believe they can get good grades. Professor Chang mentions what to practice before the exams, so there were no surprises, you just have to study. His humor during lectures were also enjoyable.

Dr. Chang is one of my favorite professors at UCLA. He is intelligent and pretty funny. You can definitely relate to him. The class structure was 1 midterm and 1 final. The exams were a bit difficult but there were no surprises. If you like Ochem you will definitely enjoy his class and you won't find it to challenging. He also gives practice exams

I honestly had a fear of chemistry until I took the class with Professor Chang, and he has now become one of my favorite professors at UCLA. He made something as engineering level organic chemistry seem like a piece of cake. More than that, he made us feel like we were actually capable of doing well. I recommend him greatly.

Professor Chang is really new, so I don't think he really knows how to run the class. The averages on all his exams were really low, but he didn't adjust the curve much so like 30 people ended up failing. His actual lecturing isn't bad, but the exams were much too difficult for the level.
Jorja Leap is the BEST professor ever!
really nice and is willing to help with class work

This teacher is not afraid to speak her mind, meaning she will cuss just about every other sentence, but in a joking manner. She is VERY funny, shows fun videos in class, including Simpsons. It is a very laid back chill class. If you want an A, take this class, simple as that.
Very Fun Professor. You will not be bored in class. she has the ability to make even a boring topic interesting.
The coolest prof on campus

Crazy lady. She'd be the perfect candidate for Professors gone wild. But she's dynamic, engaging and inspring. Never there for her office hours and really bad with follow-up. But otherwise an interesting person.
The easiest teacher at UCLA. Definitely take as many as possible
Easy "A" :) for a UCLA class
I love Jorja!! Just be interested, ask questions, and she'll give you a great grade.  Got a letter of rec from her to boot, she rocks!!!
crazy, fun, easy, and chill, just show up and you're all good
takes forever(over 1 year) for me to get my grade.
EASY! EASY! EASY! A little crazy at times but fun and EASY!

We had an essay for the class with absolutely no rubric, and even asking the TA was not helpful because the did not  know what she wanted them to grade us on. Readings are long, but you can b.s in discussion. Final was a challenge because things on the final were vaguely covered during lecture

There is an okay amount of readings. However, the readings might be a little difficult. The professor is really nice, but she fails to explain any of the concepts. Plus, it's really hard to understand the lectures because she has a heavy accent. She contradicts her herself a lot. At the end it's up to the T.A. to do all the explanations.

The class is really boring. She tries to make it interesting, but I don't like how she says its hard and calls the reading boring. It doesn't make it enticing to even read the articles then and if its boring she should pick better readings. She's nice. Exams can be difficult
Very Boring. I came to class everyday but my friend never came and they got an A, great

She is a great professor. I prefer to take her smaller classes. She's not the greatest lecturer because she's so quiet but her Power point slides are very helpful (and they are online). The classes consist of a midterm and take home final. The take home final is a creative essay project which was fun and insightful. Not too hard to get an A!

She speaks so slowly and will gladly take your questions during lecture. Yes she is boring but a boring teacher+interisting matterial+A in the class= a happy student. I got a 80% on the midterm, and completed the final (an essay) and the project and got a A in the class.
Prof Tamanoi is nice. the class is not hard, give a decent effort and you can get an A no problem.

She's sooo nice and caring of her students. She's a very understanding professor, down to earth. The class may be boring sometimes only because she goes off lecture slides, but overall, if you do the readings and know and understand the information in the slides you're good to go.

SO BORING!!!! YOU BARELY UNDERSTAND WHAT SHE SAYS, SHE GRADES HARD AND YOU CAN BARELY STAY AWAKE IN HER CLASS, I DONT KNOW WHAT THESE OTHER PEOPLE ARE SAYING. THE ASSIGNMENTS TAKE FOREVER AND ARE HARD. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PROF, U'VE BEEN WARNED!
Very clear and interesting. Lectures are posted online which is a plus!
She is a very nice person, but I did not feel her lectures helped me with the material. The reading assignments were very good, however, and her choices in which ones she assembled made good sense.
You dont really need to do the readings or go to class. she posts the lectures online. she is way boring.

This professor is awful, she explains one thing in class then makes it 10x more difficult on the exams, her practice exams don't reflect the difficulty nor the material on her real exams, I would not recommend taking her for anything, the amount of work you have to put into this class is insane, its more than in pretty much any other class

I hated 100B, she designs the trickiest exams possible..its very hard to get a good score even if you know the material well. Also the grading in this class depends a great deal on your TA, if you get a good TA you will get a good grade, if you get a bad TA then you're screwed. I suggest you take another teacher for 100B, they are likely easier.

It is incredible how you can read the book, do the practice exams, and still do miserably poor on the actual exams because the exams are created to trick you. They want you to fail. Make sure you know how to decipher cryptic messages because there is nothing clear about this class. The professor needs a lesson in proper email etiquette; super rude.

She called me a lady, which is nice.  The class is way better than some other courses I have taken in the psychology dept.  She also wrote a book, which is also super.  The psych major is impacted, so it's rough out there, but I do recall this as a better class I had taken.

I took the 1st midterm yest. & let me tell you it was designed to trick u. She gives a disclaimer saying "students claim its harder than the practice exam and thats bc people take it w/ the key and they are in a different state-of-mind during the real exam," but NO. That was RIDICULOUS. I get its curved but whats the point if she TRIES to trick u??

She wasn't hard! just read summaries and know terms from book. know lecture and be able to apply. Exam answers are not tricky but you really need to understand the question.
