You do not need to make any assumptions, guesses. If you see the obvious answers or answer then pick it. the paragraph given or the question will include the answer of the ?s

i hope the next time she is late more than 10 minutes for ANYTHING that she stops to reflect on the ridiculous guidelines for the class. extremely confusing exams designed to trick you instead of testing knowledge or learning. most useless class about the most useless subject ever. i hope the TAs continue to do useless research while making 60k/yr
Entertaining teacher.
Wonderful, entertaining professor.
soo nice very clear, love her
No Comments
distant and rude

I'll reflect on him too, since many are. I'm now very successful, took this professor years ago,had 0 impact on my success. Psych is super easy, he just made tests hard. Was not approachable, acted like a God. While I don't want rats/mice in my home, sad he really does unnecessary cruel experiments on rats/mice that should be illegal, Sad! PIETA ?

Took him several years ago.  Now I teach college-level Psychology and I still look back on Fanselow's 110 as the best Psych class that I took at UCLA.  I'm literally passing on tidbits that I learned from him, directly to my own students.  By the way, my GPA was only OK, and I got an A- in this class without too much pain, so he's not that hard.

I has this professor a few years ago- so GPA doesnt matter & its not why I'm complaining- I do want to warn other students that this guy is terrible. You should avoid him at all costs. He cares more about his research than the class- I went to office hours to ask qs and hed get irritated. Worst professor @ ucla.

Prof Fanselow is an old school professor. He uses a chalkboard not powerpoint. I think this is why people think he is difficult. He isnt you just have to be on talk. He is definetly not arrogant or pompous. I have taken two classes with him and he has never been anything but helpful and friendly.I think there are a few bitter lowGPA ppl commenting.

Hard tests, have nothing to do with the book. The book even sucks. Study your but off and you will get a C. Don't take this class if you want an A or a B. Come on, how hard is it to know about ringing a bell and a dog salivating. He makes it hard in his tests!!!!Time to retire buddy!
Very interesting class; it's not as tough as people make it out to be.  Fanselow makes it tough because of his disorganized presentation in lectures.  Sections are mandatory.  Generally good lecturer
Fanselow was great. He tried to make the class interesting, and he'd answer any questions people had. Also nice to talk to outside of class. You will have to work hard though. Take him!
One of those super productive researchers who could care less about teaching.  Gets irritated by less intellectual people.  drop him and take Blaisdell or Balliene.
Difficult course content. He tries to be pretty clear in his lectures. Found that he was helpful when i went to office hours. Exams were hard.
Exams have nothing to do with the materials presented. This guy is the biggest narcissist and could care less about teaching. He's only at UCLA to bolster his research. Total ****!
No Comments

Quite possibly the worst professor I have had at UCLA.Incredibly difficult tests & a disorganized presentation of the material.He was dismissive of some of the students questions in class & struck me as a pompous ass when I dealt w/him 1-on-1.AVOID HIM!

Professor Brenner is a legend. Took his class on Marxism and was extremely interesting. He is a master in his field, hilarious and very nice when going to his office hours. He is funny and although the materials he teach might be boring, but you will get sucked right into the way he teaches history. I highly recommend his class, don't miss out!
Simply terrible. Lectures were terrible, it is extremely hard to follow what he is saying. Asking questions in class is useless because he does not answer them. One of the worst classes I have taken.
Excellent lecturer - knows his subject inside out, and keeps lectures moving.  Nice guy too.
Had him for grad history course.  Amazingly intelligent. Can unwind a question theoretically and empirically. anyone who doesnt like him is not very bright

Sum. 09 sess. 1 was all right. At 1st I thought is going to be hard and I'm going to get a C, but I was wrong! He was a nice enough prof. to learn everyone's names! He's also very prompt when replying our emails. The only con ishisback problem which delayed our lec. He ALWAYS say"PEOPLE FOLLOWING" everytime after he clarify something.Very helpful

took him for marxist theory.  well, wasn't too bad, but he worked too hard to make things clear and we worked on the transition from feudalism to capitalism until the 7th week.  tests are easy, lectures not really mandatory.  i did, however, learn the material and left with a better understanding of the subject, but it was painful.

Worst professor yet. He's incomprehensible because he tries to teach his Marxist, victocratic  opinions as facts, but it doesn't all add up and, as a result, none of it makes any sense.  I dropped him.  If you are considering taking him, do yourself a favor and don't.
Horrible, horrible. Completely unclear. Stay away!

I don't get the other ratings.  Maybe the worst prof I've had at UCLA, he's not very good about clarity or consistency.  I'm very interested in the material and I can see that he is, too, but he's not much as a lecturer and he tends to be quite disorganized.
History of Marxism! A must!!!!
Helpful. Makes sure everyone understands the material.
Very straight-forward teacher.  Very interesting. No surprises.
Vanessa is awesome. She loves teaching and her students. Her tagline is 'dorky but fabulous', and I think that sums it up nicely.

This class changed my life. Professor Vanessa let me chose my own research and helped figure out my methodology. She's very busy though so you have to be pretty independent and self-motivated. Still: good grade and experience for grad school!

This class is about talking about the identity & communications theory & how it applies to us. I was not into it until she used lots of research evidence to backup some psychological techniques. She likes students to question everything.

Professor Luke was able to maintain the perfect balance of mentor and peer. In a class such as CHS 179 where discussion is key, she was able to for a safe and comfortable environment with her professionalism and positive attitude in order for the students to maximize their benefit from the class.

Prof Luke is so passionate about this course it really shows throughout the entire quarter.  Her first priority is her students and she is there for you both in and out of class. Extremely insightful and dare I say life changing.  Take Professor Luke! You will not regret it!

Professor Vanessa Luke is AWESOME!  She is a dedicated and passionate instructor.  If you're lucky enough to take her class you'll realize that the content will serve you well long into the future.  She will impart on you techniques to deal with stress, to communicate more clearly and effectively, and to understand yourself more completely.

She is really openminded and challenges you to think in critical ways about race, class, sexuality (surprise there!), and culture. Funny and dorky in a good way, but don't take her niceness to think you can get away with blowing work off. Do it. It's good for you.

She was a very good facilitator, and even though I didn't expect to, she really made me think about the topics on hand.  I had a great time and learned a lot about a topic that I really didn't know that I had an interest in until after taking the class.

Vanessa's awesome! She is really passionate about equality and respecting difference adn acatually got us to 'dialogue' well--even if we offended people we were honest. Best 2 unit class, and as long as you don't mind talking you'll do well.

Vanessa is awesome, never been in a class like this. Do the work and your life will be better. Not too hard but grades strictly. Her lectures are actually useful. Don't blow off the assignments and speak in class or go tell her your shy.

Exacting and won't let you get away with being lazy.  Very passionate about equality and diversity. If you do the work, you'll get more out of this class than any other you'll ever take at UCLA.  She actually cares about students, so not a class to take if you want to skate through without being noticed.

DO NOT TAKE THIS TEACHER!! you will need to put in all your effort for this class and at the end you will a grade that will make NO sense. She has her favorites and will give A's to only those that she likes. If you take the class make sure you talkk a lloottt or else she won't like you.

Shelby Popham is one of the best professors at UCLA. Her lectures are inspiration and her guidance is clear. She helped me become a better writer. The books she had us read were inspirational and gave insight into the world of writing. I recommend Shelby Popham to any student wanting to improve their writing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: She assigns a lot of work but it is because she really wants improvement in her students writing. I love this teacher.
She's great! She actually made me a better writer and I learnt so much from her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: She was very helpful! She gave me very good feedback and helped my writing style improve!
What an awesome Professor- Very helpful and supportive.
Totally worth taking the class. It taught me alot about writing and English.
No Comments
her work is easy, it's just a lot to do. but she is one of the best. you'll get an A as long as you do the work and you try your best. seriously.
Took this fun course in Dykstra Hall in my pjs early mornings. Instructor was wonderful and a pleasure
She was the best!!  Great!  Lets you revise over and over till you get that A!
No Comments

I really enjoyed the course. Rhonda Hammer is a very engaging speaker, although at times, she can be very confusing and will go on many tangents; however, that is what made the class environment so much more better. I really believe I have gained a lot of insight about how realities are constructed through media and I am very grateful.

Rhonda Hammer's class fills up fast for a reason. She challenged me to view media with a critical eye. For  the midterm paper, she and her TA wrote detailed feedback. In such a large university like UCLA, it is very rare to have a professor like Rhonda who really cares and wants students to excel with their papers and critical analysis.

Rhonda is one of the best professors I have ever had. She is passionate about her class and she really cares about her students.She is available through office hour appointments, after class and email communication. Her class taught me to view media (ads, films, television) in a critical eye and become a much better writer.
One of the worst teachers I have ever had! Please think twice.. if you have any concept of media or editing this class will be a waste.

Took both classes, M149 and WS178...never have learned as much great, useful information that will help in the real world. A class that can't be missed. Highly recommend, the professor makes the classes fun and easy to learn material!

This professor is incredibly supportive of her students. She is dedicated to finding her course and her students all of the best resources and connections. The skills I have learned through the experiences she provided are priceless and I know her course offered me a a tool I can use my whole lifetime. This excellent professor is unique and rare!
knowledgeable, passionate, understanding, and a great resource.
She has little knowledge of computers which is a problem when teaching a computer driven class.
There's not a better prof. out there.
She rocks.  This class changed my life.
No Comments
I loved taking her class she was always caring and shes the reason I passed she wasnt hard on us which made it easy and she made class easy

Professor Tox kept it real when nobody else wouldn't... She saved the community and I believe she is the best psychology teacher on the planet... She cussed out a few students but she is THE BEST teacher in the world
Awesome
Amazing
"Some of y'all about to be real mad at me, but it must be said." lol
love her! very sweet and really engaged with her students. it's a little odd to have her with her social media presence but she is just so impressive as an individual.

Dr. Sanjhra Banks is a real gem in the classroom. She never allows us to leave class without laughing and learning, and her dedication to the course really shows. Her office hours are very accessible and she responds to emails quickly.
She is very inspirational would definitely take the class afain.

One of the best professors I have ever had! Really fostered my interest in psychology; her lectures are always intriguing and engaging. Not to mention she is hilarious! She is a fair grader and always available to give help & general life advice outside of class.

Professor Tox was super fun and keeps her lectures interesting. She brings in treats every once in a while and has an fresh perspective on every topic she lectures on. Her class is difficult but if you work for it she is a very fair grader. She is well respected but is also very relatable and accessible.

UCLA consists of a variety of challenging courses. Of course, this is one of them that is full of content, yet if you do your part you are bound to pass. Agnew is very straight forward and if you pay just enough attention you are bound to pass this class with flying colors since all the content he discusses is in the exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: I like Agnew but hate the way grading was set up for this class. You have a midterm & a final, plus some points for participation. That wouldn't be so bad except that the tests are essay format ONLY, short and long answer - without the option to choose between questions. You have to answer every single one, so you have to know ALL material. Avoid!!

He is one of my favorite professor. His class is easy to follow along.  I guess he was up sad about people didn't show up, so his exams questions are topics and ideas  mentioned in lecture. 1 midterm and 1 final , both take home and no homework. Go to his office hour, he would help you.
One of the best geography professors in the U.S.!!!!

Doesn't teach Gov. He's mister geography! His overheads leave something to be desired (some are brown around the edges!) but he's very focused and explains things clearly. he's a nice guy and open to different opinions which is good when the course has a lot of politics in it.
He's great, super helpful and British

Prof Agnew is a really nice guy, he keeps lectures pretty interesting, shows lots of pictures and shows videos. Grade is based on 3 5-page essays, which are based on lecture material, no surprises at all. Grades fairly and is easy to approach. Only problem is he doesn't post any lecture outlines or anything online. Overall Id definitely recommend.
He was by far one of my favorite professors at UCLA!

His lectures are interesting, even though much of the subject matter is pretty dry.  He has a sense of humor which makes lectures even better.  Agnew posts "practice" midterms, but they are practically the same as the real midterm.  He does assign lots of reading, but i really enjoyed his class.
I loved this professor. I took the class for fun and he even posted the previous midterms online and the questions on mine were the same! If you put in a little work its an easy A
No Comments

Gives literally HUNDREDS of pages of philosophical hard-to-read material every week. Tests are 6-10 page essays that you only have 24 hours to do. We had to beg for 48 hours. Yes, you read that right. Lectures always go over by 30 minutes. Was supposed to be a fun elective, and turned into my hardest class. And I'm in Pre Law, so that says a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Lectures and scholarly articles are everything. As usual w AH courses, profs give more articles per week than is humanly possible to read. But why I'm really here is to talk about his lectures: listening to him talk is like trying to decode a cipher. His convoluted verbiage overcomplicates topics and comes off as pompous. Skip this prof if you can.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: He says a lot during his lectures so it's sometimes hard to keep up with what he's saying and taking notes, but he is clearly brilliant at what he does and you can tell he really cares about it and is enjoying himself which makes the class a lot more interesting.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Every lecture is amazing! However be ready to put in a lot of reading hours! He is not one to hand you an easy A, but he will make class extremely interesting!

Professor Baker is really one of the most amazing teachers at UCLA. I've learned so much from his lectures and he has really inspired me to think more deeply about art. He does however have a terrible habit of Duchamping people. The Duchamping is a bit much, even if he follows up with the appropriated laughter meme. Fair grader, Good commenter.
bad

His lectures are full of energy but like most large classes he uses a TA which are NOT as intelligent and no where near as exciting to listen to. He is a little on the pompous side. I enjoyed the class but won't choose him again as an instructor.

Baker is wonderful.  I suppose most of the girls in my Art History class were enthralled with his dress and shoes, but boy was the guy eloquent.  Not only has he really met Rauschenberg and other artists he lectures on, but he also edits his own magazine.  His lectures are so passionate that his voice changes.  However, he does lack clarity.

He is so smart and into art history, which makes his lectures really interesting. But some of the concepts he talks about are hard to grasp quickly and he talks fast, making note taking sort of hard. And there was SOOOOO much reading for this class. He seemed nice but intimidatingly smart and somewhat condescending. The grading made it hard to tell

Without a doubt the most thrilling lecturer I have ever experienced.  He is a rare, rare breed.  A little heavy on the phallic references, but hey, this only makes him more attractive.  Beautiful shoes, beautiful mind, but ugly course load, oh my god did we READ.  Very challenging studying for his tests: you WON'T be able to predict test questions.

Even a fully online class, this the hardest Professors, EVER! Exams are fully proctored with Webcam and Microphone! If your eyeballs move to the side your exam will close and fail you. NO excuse email will help you! First thing he will say your CHEATING!! The worst Chem ever, and he makes the material even harder ! Avoid at all costs! Super HARD!

Avoid at all cost! Taking his Chem Lab at ELAC rn. Super tough grader! All lab reports worth 80 points and the class average are always only around 40 points. The lab report guideline are extremely confusing! Even enough I did what he asked, I still got average points.

The lab instructor went out of his way to say that Bacher is a great chemist with impeccable lab technique, but strangely had little to say as to whether Bacher was good in the classroom. He's absolutely terrible. Being a good chemist does not make one a good chemistry teacher, and Bacher is simply not made to teach. I dropped the course.

Cant understand accent. He's the chem professor at csub. Hardly does examples he just reads off slides that he already posts on blackboard. Intelligent man but not a good teacher. Not everyone is made to teach

If you're a biochem major prepare to SUFFER. The hours in lab among toxic chemicals are hard. Getting product with good purity is even harder. That said, this class will teach you a lot and if you're going into any sort of research later on, the skills you learn here will be useful well beyond what you can comprehend as an undergraduate. Good luck!
The worst professor at UCLA, fails at least a quarter of the class.  Didn't learn a thing about chem, and yet it is still a required class for the major.  Useless and rediculous.

take it at some other JC he wants to help but these classes are graded by the TAs mostly and he comes in at the end. Your life would be a living hell for the entire session and you still find yourself incapable of getting a decent grade. He is the worst O chem teacher yet.
The worst professor I have ever had.  Fails about 30% of the class.  Very confusing.  Class would be fine if there was no final.  Beware!

Alfred Bacher was a tremendous help and motivator for me.   He is challenging, but extremely knowledgeable and is very concerned with student's success, more than most teachers I've had.   I may not be taking the MCAT's if it wasn't for his way of "pushing me" further!!
No Comments

Grading criteria for WRIT courses are tough, but this is a department-wide characteristic. Professor Black is arguably one of the best professors at SC. She is truly knowledgable and cares for her students. Highly recommend!

Honestly, can't believe I enjoyed coming to Writ 340 everyday at USC. Dr. Black made it fun to come to class. She grades kind of hard but you get what you put into it. She cares about your school work and also life outside of school. The GOAT.

Professor Black is one of, if not the best teacher I have had in my schooling experience. She insanely smart and well-read but is still a young, cool gal who works to make her class engaging and fun. She will be available to meet with you almost whenever and gives super helpful input during the writing process. You will be happy you took her!!
She is a great teacher to meet with one on one. she is very kind and helpful, but do not expect to get As on papers consistantly

comment: She is so kind and caring! She gives amazing feedback and your grade will get better as time goes on.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I loved Dr. Black so much. She sincerely cares about her students and what they are taking away from the class. Although I wasn't thrilled with my grade, I learned a lot from her and would definitely take her again. If you actually want to LEARN how to be a better writer, take her class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. Black is amazing. She really cares for the students and is always willing to help. I would say she is the most caring professor I met at USC. She is a tough grader, but writing 150 is a course to get an A from. There are frequent 1:1 conferences. 4 papers due with 2 portfolios regarding last paper. Extra credit offered for attending events.

Dr. Black is far and away the best professor I've ever had without a doubt. She has a phenomenal understanding of every subject. Her feedback on papers and her care for each of her students is unrivaled. She is so incredibly kind, and sweet. Writing was never my strong suit, but Dr. Black always made me feel accomplished! Lots of work, but worth it
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Really awesome and you'll get the grade you work for

Dr. Black was awesome. Highly recommend for Writing 150 classes, considering how some other professors I've heard are very strict on certain things like participation and stuff. She can grade a bit tough, but if you put in the work, you should be fine. Class was pretty fun and she was pretty funny, cool, and nice.

The best professor ever! You will be cheating yourself if you don't take her class. I was so sad when this class ended. She is so helpful. The work isn't easy, but if you go to lecture (which you'll want to because she's great) then you'll know everything she wants from you. I wish I could have taken more classes with her before I graduated.
I wish he is still teaching at UCLA, it is difficult to find a Professor like him.
very smart professor
good teacher overall

very good professor overall
his teaching skill is one of the best in UCLA and he cares about his student learning very much
great overall
great professor overall

One of the best Class I have ever taken at UCLA, highly recommended

comment: Good teacher.
Simply she is AMAZING

-Get ready to read in this class. -Expect to participate because it matters. -She gives excellent feedback and is always willing to answer questions and/or clarify. -She is definitely there for her students. -Very supportive and patient. -I would with out a doubt take her again!
Wonderful professor!  Cares about students and engages them!
Prof. Heilemann is dedicated to excellence in education. She teaches in a culturally sensitive manner and really encourages the potential of each individual student.
prof is very dynamic and teaches and awesome class
awesome!

SHE IS REALLY NICE AND TRIES REALLY HARD TO GET THE INFORMATION ACROSS. I RECCOMMEND HER.

His lecture is full of trivial steps in those simple proofs, over and over again, and thus you will find it really tiring to take notes. Homeworks are not so hard but with a lot of problems, that requires you for hours on it.
Clear instruction

Professor O. definitely cares about his students, but he is a strict grader. Depending on your math background, this will be easy or hard class for you. I got an "A" in the class, but I felt like this class was VERY time-consuming. There is weekly homework AND quiz due. To prepare for exams, study your homework/quizzes/lecture problems.

Math has not been by strong suit. I even hired a tutor for this class and I still didn't pass. He goes over the material in class but it can get a little confusing. He just isn't that clear in his method of teaching.

I think since he's a friendly person, some assume he's also a good teacher.  Not so.  It's a rushed, confusing, and intense class.  Easy quizzes and brutal exams.  Do not trust the study guides!  The exam will be much harder.

Not the greatest instructor.. The lectures consist of you copying work from the board that looks similar to your homework. So basically not a lecture you just copy his work and try to apply it to your homework. I felt this instructor really didnt care about his students AT ALL. Would not recommend unless you already know precalc and need the credit

I am an engineering major I love math. This guy is REALLY amazing teacher. one thing i would say is WATCH OUT FOR THE HOMEWORK!!!! because you WILL get marked down. He takes the logical approach of teaching, shows what & y an equation works. Love this guy if you have taken algebra you will learn what i mean by 'logical' approach vs. your old prof.

Poor experience studying precalc for the 1st time. Granted the material would be difficult regardless of the instructor, Prof. Ouelette is more of a mathematician than a teacher. Classes consist of him copying his homework solutions to the board with little or no interruption. Bit of a show-off, I learned more about his calc skills than my own.

I never had as good of a teacher before and years from now, I will look back and think I never had as good of a teacher since.  He has been an inspiration and rejuvenated my self-confidence that was cracked upon transferring to a university.  Great man.  I hope he has a great life.

I don't know why he teaches at UCLA. when he makes examples in class, he is not able to solve them, but then he gives those things in exam. I do not recommend him. his lectures are terrible. BE AWARE!! His exams are EXTREMLY HARD!! today I had my midterm and I got a B, although I studied like hell. I'm going to get a unfair B in his class :( :(

He doesn't care about his students at all. He doesn't  know how to teach. such a waist of time, but if u have to take pic20A or 40A u have to take him. he doesn't replay to emails u send to him or when he replys, he replys after a week. he looks like a nice person, but I personally don't like his class, since he doesn't know how to teach!

If you like this topic or just appreciate the effort you put into studying - DO NOT take this professor. His slides are packed with loads of text, lectures aren't engaging in any way & boring, and he goes off-topic so many times. One midterm and a final (summer,COVID) & these are the trickiest exams I have ever taken. Most frustrating class ever

comment: He's pretty straightforward on tests, attend lecture it will help and the chapters are long so just read the most important points. Interesting class!
