comment: probably the hardest tests I've ever taken, especially in psychology. I would NOT recommend this class to anyone that isn't already extremely knowledgeable in psychology. The material is very interesting but the quizzes seem like they are purposefully trying to trick you. I like him in lecture, he's nice and clear, but NOT worth taking this class!!

The exam was so specific, sometimes you won't even notice that there are questions that you don't expect from the reading. Make sure to come to lecture and take good notes. He gives some extra credit and they are very helpful. You have to compete with a lot of psych majors so think about it!

He is approachable and would help you but his tests are very tricky and deifnitely hard! In our class the mean (and Median) was C ! So be careful unless you are great in Psychology. If you are a Linguistics and Psychology major (like I used to be; LA field) it's a big NO.You have to compete with Psych majors!!!

Very good professor and interesting class, but tricky tricky exams, I think on his final only 2 people out of 200 got an A on the exam itself. I enjoyed the course but his questions are ones you must really read into.

BEST CLASS EVER! IF YOU SHOW UP AND DO THE READINGS, EVEN SKIM IT, YOU WILL GET AN A!!!!! I ENJOYED THIS CLASS AND THE PROF SO MUCH, I LOOKED FORWARD TO THIS CLASS AND IT WAS SO EASY AND INTERESTING. I WISH I COULD TAKE IT AGAIN. GOOD CLASS, EASY TO GET AN A!
Lectures more important than book.  Breezes thru and doesnt explain thoroughly.  I dont recommend his class unless you are really into Psych.

Originally, I took this class with Prof. Lopez...didn't do well..got a C-  He gave exams from the text but didn't lecture from the book at all.  However, when I re-took the class with Prof. Lee, not only did I understand the material better, I got a B in the class.  Prof. Lee took the time to explain anything I wasn't clear on! He's AWESOME!

I took his abnormal psych course.  lots of lecture slides. i did all the reading and didnt do well in his class.  multiple choice exams.  have to read into the questions.  i never did bad in psych classes before this class, go figure.

I took his abnormal psych course.  lots of lecture slides. i did all the reading and didnt do well in his class.  multiple choice exams.  have to read into the questions.  i never did bad in psych classes before this class, go figure.

She is amazing! I wish I would have taken all of her classes! She is very clear with her notes (which she posts on CCLE), she gives you midterm, essay topics ahead of time so you have plenty of time to review.  Professors should sit in her class and take note on how to teach like her. Best ever ^_^

lectures are usually rushed, but you need to be there in order to do well on the tests.  her use of primary sources as reading material is commendable, but not very helpful while studying for exams.  nice woman, always available through e-mail, etc.

She's one of the most decent professors at UCLA.  To my amazement, she stuck to the facts and did not preach or whine about what us poor women have to put up with.  She's clear, very helpful, and informative.  No tricks  and highly recommended.
No Comments
Great! Amazing material, amazing professor!

She had good presentations, but they were not as effective as they could have been. She rushed a lot of the time, but overall she was informative and pleasant. She was very knowledgable regarding womens history.
She has interesting lectures, she is helpful and answers her emails quickly
No Comments
No Comments
Another parody of a fair and equitable professor.  white males, avoid.
Amazing teacher!  Had her for History of Prostitution in Europe.  She's one of the most knowledgeable professors at UCLA.
Peter goes way beyond the average professor! He has been a great mentor to me!

Professor McLaren inspired me to become an educator! I learned so many important theories about education. But most importantly, he also taught us about how to apply the knowledge we were developing to our practice. Excellent!!
One of the most profound courses I have ever taken. Prof McLaren compliments the theory with personal anecdotes to make the material relevant.

Peter McLaren is an amazing professor! Simply put, he has no equal. His classes embodied in all of its aspects the very meaning of participatory democracy and critical reflection. He engages a philosophy of praxis that exceeds all others. McLaren believes a better world is possible, and this is reflected in his top-notch scholarship and pedagogy.
Great Professor, wonderful person but most important Great Educator.  Teaches critical thoughout and how to apply it to education and community which is how it should be.  Highly recommended!

Great professor!  Very intelligent and of strong mind, body, and soul..  Excellent class that prepares students for the turbulances and realities of the educational systems they will inevitably confront.  Great Person!!

What a terrible professor. Not only does Prof. McLaren NOT teach, he wastes most of class time telling tall tales. He wasted one entire class  gossiping about colleagues. His knowledge of Marxism is limited to icons and symbols of communism like his Che flags and army jackets. What a waste!!!

The class is called "Critical Pedagogy, Multiculturalism, and the Politics of Resistance."  Does that tell you anything?  If you want to learn how to teach, avoid his class like gonorrhea.  If you want to learn how to lick the boots of murderous totalitarian dictators like Castro or Stalin, then sign up.
Incredible intellect - sometimes difficult to follow/read. A great person in addition to being a great teacher
No Comments
No Comments
Lectures are boring. It's pretty much the same as him reading the book. Only way to pass is to go to sections and try to teach yourself.
AVOID FELKER AT ALL COSTS

Just a terrible lecturer. Puts you to sleep the second you walk into the lecture hall and what he says has nothing to do with the homework or the midterms and finals (which were next to impossible). They often say that open note tests are harder than usual... well try open textbook with felker. That just gives you a feel for how tough his class is
just AVOID Felker

Lectures were convoluted and did little if anything to clarify material, relying almost exclusively on derivations. Rarely took questions and was very unapproachable, seemingly annoyed if anyone had questions. His tests were entirely mathematical, a direct contrast from his derivational lectures. A mess of a lecturer.
His lecture is very bad. His tests are extremly hard....If you don't want to ruin your gpa or suffer from his classes, please stay away from him!!

one of the best Pchem profs at UCLA. He is extremely knowledgeable and confident in Physical Chem. His lectures are full of excitement since he usually derives formulas. He will really make you learn Pchem. His open-book exams are amazing as long as you understand the concepts. Overall, he is one of the best Pchem profs with strong Math background.

Prof. Dr. Felker is an extraordinary teacher. Actually, he is the hero in Pchem. He is extremely confident about his knowledge and can make the most difficult subject become applicable and enjoyable somehow. But, his tests are killers, you must understand the concepts to do well on the tests. Take him if u want the challenge in Pchem!!!!
If you aren't stupid and go meet with him during his office hours he is very helpful and you will do well
Writes extremely hard tests. Not very friendly to you or your GPA.
not a good speaker, isn't always there for us

If you are looking for an easy A, Prof. Blanchette is not the professor for you.  He requires both quality work and attendance.  His demeanor can be intimidating.  All that said, he is an engaging, thoughtful professor who pushes students to excel.  His assignments can be challenging, but the overall experience is rewarding.
You will learn a lot if you do the work, stay positive and respect the classroom community.

I have had Professor Blanchette for a couple of classes now and although he may come off a little intimidating at first he is an awesome teacher! If you put in the effort the rewards are ten fold! one of the best experiences I have had in grad school
I found IS270 one of the most interesting, practical and memorable classes I've had in the IS program. His lectures are easy to tune into and he's very entertaining.
No Comments
Arrogant. Not helpful. Lots of attitude.

Passive-aggressive, arrogant, and inconsistent. Lectured our class on our lack of email etiquette and complained about our frivolous messages, but did not establish a policy in writing. Felt free to email our class about a change in office hours halfway through the term, then sent another email to complain that we forgot about the change.

He can be helpful if you approach him in person, but in front of the class he doesn't appreciate your questions. While he claims to want participation, his responses in class don't exactly encourage it. He'll tell you you're wrong without much explaination, and he has little patience for ideas other than his own.
Snarky!
He can be moody and unhelpful. Sometimes his lectures drone on, and he can get annoyed when he doesn't interest the class in a discussion. However, he's funny and wears sexy jeans.
He's just ok. Sometimes boring, sometimes cracks a joke. If you like technology, you'll probably like him.

you are either going to love him or hate him. the other comment about close-mindedness and him playing favorites is spot-on. if you are willing to buy into his philosophy then you will like it and do well. if you challenge him you will hate it and he will fail you.
GREAT! One of the best and most life changing classes I have ever taken.

Very inconsiderate teacher. Doesn't care about student's learning although he says he does. He's very closed minded trying to teach a class that requires open mindedness. He plays favorites and puts people on the spot during discussions. Try not to take him if you have a choice.

This class isn't for people looking for an easy A, but if you want to challenge your perceptions of the world and make some good friends while you're at it, this is the class. I've never become so close to my classmates that I would hug them when I ran int

Rabow is one of the best professors. I have ever had. If you are looking for the perfect syllabus so that you can work towards your A+ then you will hate him, but if you are looking to gain an education in more ways than one you will be forever changed.
Awesome and inspirational professor!
I took this guy back in '97; the class was one of the worst academic experiences I've ever had. After his class, I converted to capatalism.
Lectures were interesting, though large -- he was nice enough to pass me after I was in the hospital for finals and therefore flunked the exam.

I take professor Rabow at CSUN and now I also help him with his classes.  If someone doesn't like him it is because they refuse to see their place in the maddness of this world.  His teaching methods are outstanding and no textbooks, real life stuff!
Worst professor I've ever had
Great professor!

Took him as a second lecturer in PhySci 5. He issued the final and it came out of nowhere. No one expected the small details/calculations to be on the test. Final dropped my A+ to a B. PAY ATTN IN LECTURE AND JOT DOWN EVERYTHING HE SAYS!!

Honestly, it's not as hard as people made it seem. Took this in the summer. Attended every class (the whole way through) and noted down in the reader what was missing from his lectures (not much). Only studied the day before the midterm and the day before the final and I got an A+. Just pay attention in class, you'll do well. Ask questions.
Great teacher, serious about health, knows what he's talking about.
No Comments
No Comments
I love this guy!

Pointless lectures straight from the reader.  Tests are extremely detailed, so if you are not a hard core science freak, ho ho, good luck (you'll need it). Class is NOT easy and you must work and work if you want an A. Please skip Roberts and find a GE that doesn't crucify your GPA.
Class is hard.. a lotta info to know BUT he curves it and the project is super easy so you do well :)
Dr. roberts is young energetic professor.take his class.

Dr. Basarudin is a great professor. I had never taken a women's studies course until this one and I had a great experience. Readings can be heavy and tough to read sometimes but she does a great job at explaining them for better understanding. She checks up on each of her students and seems to really care about each of us. I definitely recommend.

She's dope. I thought this class is all about feminist stuff but I guess not. It's more than just about feminism. It's about how gender is in every level of life. I like the contemporary topics she tackle and showed how gender works through these topics. Superb lectures, easily accessible outside of class. The TAs are amazing too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Basarudin's syllabus is current and interdisciplinary. I became a Gender Studies major because of her. She is an inspirational and compassionate teacher. She uses a lot of media and keeps the topics current while sticking to fundamental theories of gender. Super accessible on email and outside of class. She is young and hip!

Prof. Basarudin injured her leg but came to class in a wheelchair and had crutches for good measure so she can stand up. When UCLA classes had to be cancelled (fire), she finds an alternative day to schedule a make-up class and has extended office hours. If that is not dedication to knowledge and love for teaching/students, I don't know what is.

Ever heard of a Professor emailing students to check in on how they are doing in the course? Ever met a Professor who knows your name/remembers you in a class of 200 students? Me neither until I took a class with Professor Basarudin. She is all that and more. Want to be inspired and really learn? Take her. Mind blowing. I can't stop thinking.

Where do I start? She made me think of so many things. Made me re-evaluate my life and the lens from which I view social, cultural and political issue. Basarudin redefined simplistic understanding of feminism and gender studies. Many have said, take her class if you are ready to be enlightened. Work hard. She is worth all the work you put in.

Caution: Take Prof. Basarudin's class if you want an alternative way to understand the world and you don't want to be a generic person. After taking her class, you won't even be able to buy strawberries or underwear without thinking about the footprint and its political implication. I adore her. BEST teacher I ever had in my entire academic career

She will change your life. Her lectures are amazing, information and relevant to everyday life. She is smart, caring and overall awesome. Cares about student learning and will take the time to get to know you individually. Should be poster girl or UCLA and Gender Studies. Take her if you want to revolutionize your thinking.

Basarudin is such an inspiration. Shewill cultivate your interest in social justice even if you have none. She is that remarkable. Energetic, brilliant and compassionate, she is why higher education should not be an option. They don't make professors like her anymore. She is level-headed and talks to students. Actually cares about student learning

She is THE best professor I have ever had at UCLA. Inspirational, kind, smart, caring and hella funny. Her lectures are mind blowing and the way she teaches is sure to grab you attention like no other. Take her class if you want a life changing experience and a solid understanding of gender and social justice.

Don't take your first qrter. He said first day - its a hard class lots of writing - you might want to leave  The TA I had was tough grader & nit picky. I have never gotten a C until her.  4 800 word papers includ final paper. I think its screwed that a TA decides my fate! that's where they get you have to show up. Trying to drop it to save my gpa.

Pretty good lectures.Interesting material.Grade based on attendance/participation at TA discussions, 3 2pg papers, 1 4pg paper as final.Papers based largely on assigned books but not very difficult or long readings.TAs DETERMINE YOUR GRADE!
picky graders that don't allow individual thought
TAs determine your grade so if they suck or if they are harsh graders too bad
Fiske is a good professor
a lot of work for one class
Great Professor!  Class involved a lot of reading and writing but the topic was so great it wasn't difficult.  He is very easy going and easy to talk to, his class is worth it.

He is a great professor. The topic is very entertaining and intriguing. Will leave you thinking long after the quarter is over. The TA's are not approachable probably due to lack of time. Eye-opening class, valuable lectures but can be confusing at times.
TA's didn't want to help, not enough time for everybody apparently. Go to lecture and skim the readings and you will do fine.
Lot's of reading involved. Go to office hours. TA is fairly  helpful

Travis is a goof-ball, which made his lectures so easy to pay attention to. The material, although heavy at times, was always presented in an engaging way. I took this class to satisfy my GE-F and it was extremely do-able, not math heavy at all. Plus he bought us coffee on the last day of class.

I had Longcore for a GE class at USC. I've been interested in maps but this class takes maps to a different level and changed the way I think essentially every time at any map of any sort. He is nerdy funny and makes class go by so quickly. He even bought coffee for the whole class. He isn't looking to fail you. Pay attention and you will get an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Well let's just say he's not user friendly.  I daresay his education leaves a lot to be desired.  Knowledge of content is fine.  Not ready to help though.  Of all the PhD's I've dealt with over the years, he comes across as one of the more arrogant.
No Comments
Great class and professor.  Pay attention and you will be fine.
he is the only person that can make learning ecosystems fun. great class, excellent lecturer, an easy A as long you take good notes. highly recommended.
No Comments
Pretty Average Professor
good guy, boring class
Loves maps, culture, and students! Always willing to help outside of class.

Professor Hsu is a nice teacher, but the only thing I got out of his lectures was becoming more confused. I found that when I studied on my own and participated in the discussion sections I learned much more. His lectures have no structure to them and he often goes off-topic, as well as entertaining bad questions and acting like they are good.

Prof Hsu seems to be an incredibly intelligent man but the lecture position doesn't seem to be made for him. Although I found his accent to be rather interesting during week one, I quickly discovered that it made it extremely difficult to focus in class. Also, his handwriting is incredibly illegible and lectures are a bit bias.

Okay seriously. This guy is really really sweet and nice, but he is the worst professor I have ever taken. His lectures don't go anywhere, there is no train of thought and he lectures without a clear plan. He wastes too much time just talking to students about something thats completely off topic, poor syllabus, and poor structure to the class.

He's very verbose, which took some getting used to. Lectures are dense, but he tries to be as helpful as possible. Thankfully he offers more than one way of explaining most concepts, so if you still don't get it after lecture you need to try harder. He's very passionate about Philosophy, & soft spoken. Don't skip lecture! The recorder failed a lot.

Hsu was one of my favorite professors at UCLA. I feel his grading was overly harsh in his Wittgenstein class though. As a phil. major, I struggled to get over a B flat in his class even though he told me I was one of the top students in the class and wrote an excellent midterm

Professor Hsu is AWESOME! Philosophy 185 was probably one of the most difficult classes I've taken. YET, he was extremly helpful in unpacking the extremly difficult work of Wittgenstein's Philosophical Investigations.

He's a real nice professor but with that stated, he has been the worse philosophy professor I've taken. This is due to the fact that the subject is not the easiest and his way of lecturing is hard to follow. The problem is his monotone voice in combination with a overly thorough explanation Of EVERYTHING. I refuse to take another course with him

He is speaks as if he is writing. Means well and is a sweet guy. I would recommend turning on your recorder for his lectures cause, since he is very detailed oriented you may loose track of his syntax, a subject which he address in his Wittgenstein class as well.

The professor is pretty clear. He does excellent reviews of the content--reiterates content to make sure everyone understands it. I have no complaints whatsoever. I learned the content and did well in class but could have done better if it weren't for my lack of philosophy writing skills. But, he convinced me to major in Philosophy!

Most of the class slept during most of the lectures even the RAs would sleep. Hsu is a nice guy and means well. He is approachable and answers too many questions during class. The lecture started to get around 8 week. I was planning to minor in phil but this class changed my mind. Do not take this with him unless you really have to.

I took Bjork's Psych 100B class back in 2015. Mileage will vary in terms of final grades but it seemed like a pretty stressful class for all. I was pretty mad about my grades at the time, but looking back, Bjork was one of the more caring and good hearted professors, both on and off campus. You can do it as long as you put in the time and effort.

Despite getting an A, she's one of the worst tchrs at UCLA.Her lectures are extremely boring, her tests are unfair.  I got an A is bec I had to take this class twice. My GPA- 3.8. What do you expect,the professor teaches one thing and then tests you about another, duh,how am I supposed to know, worst teacher and her ta's suck too, boring and hard.

I'm beginning to think a lot of the students on this website, do not put in the work that is required for an A. UCLA is a top ranked school - it's not supposed to be easy. However, it is mostly fair. That being said, Professor Bjork was extremely clear and caring. Psych 100B is a challenging class but you learn a lot and it can be fun!
She has no idea about what's going on in class.  Her lectures are boring. Her master TA's are the worst on the planet and her regular TA's don't even know the material.

Wow. That is what I have to say. She was one of the worse professors I have ever had. She was not clear in her lectures and, sadly enough, I know more about the birthday cards her sons had sent her than the actual research methods needed to do proper experiments. My advice to you reading this, take Geiselman. He was a great professor.

Like the person said below, she doesn't matter all that much. It's more dependent on your TA. Make sure to understand e/t she lectures about, which is pretty clear and gone over again in section. And work really hard on your paper. There really isn't anyone else to take for this, so take her. I doubt anyone else would make this class any better.

She was no help at all.  I found her to be one of the worst professors I have ever had, biased opinion or not.  Even the TAs were no help.  She was not clear on the material, she would stray from her lectures and when she presented material, it was only half finished!
Material on the exams is very tricky.
Average teacher. TA matters more for this course. Exams were pretty clear.
She got confused during her own lectures.  The exams are tricky!  You need a good TA to help you through, and also there is a long report you have to write.

Honestly, took this class as the art history classes I've taken have been v chill/accessible. It just feels like this Prof takes the class WAY too seriously. The did not have the correct class code, but the class I had her for was Chicano/a art and artists.. Literally so much reading, and a lot of it is written by her, such dense writing. v mid
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Profe is one of the best professors I've had. You MUST attend lectures, because she uses clicker questions to check attendance, but the lectures basically provide everything you need to know for the tests. Be sure to do the readings or else you won't pass!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: She's brilliant. One the best professors I had at UCLA. She may not be super friendly, but I liked that she was strong, intelligent, and passionate. I loved her.

She is a good professor and will make you see Chican@ studies from a different point of view than Americans are used to. However, she is very obviously biased because she is a lesbian feminist who grew up in El Paso. Some of the stuff she says can be radical as hell.
I took a fiat lux on the Women of Juarez. Really informative!
I took various classes with Prof. Gaspar.  Yes, she is not always friendly, and yes she is hard.  However, her readings and lectures are awesome, and you will learn soooo much!
She is strict, not always friendly, BUT you will learn so much!  Great selection of books, powerful lectures!
Wow, one of the best prof. in the Chican@ studies department
No Comments
Excellent professor, tests quizzes everything the whole package.
Hands down the BEST professor at UCLA. Enough said.

Gussin is the Man! I learned a ton, class was somewhat fun, and he was funny and a genius. Can't really ask for more. I made a study group for the midterm and final, which helped a lot with splitting the reading, I would highly recommend doing that. No surprises, he gives an exhaustive study guide. If you don't ace this class.... you suck at life
A is attainable if you go to class, go to office hours, build a study group.

One of the best professors you can have at UCLA very down to earth and extremely fun class if you get a chance to take his class put everything aside and register 1st or you will regret.... go to lecture, go to office hours, get to know him awesome professor.

Really straightforward class. As long as you show up, take notes and prepare well, you'll do well. He's not boring, very down to earth and he'll test you only on what he covers. I have taken four different courses he's taught and he has conducted all the same way. I like many others who have taken his class, recommend him highly.

Lectures are organize, ur given an outline to fill out. test are based on lecture, some book material is also included but mostly lecture. professor is willing to stop and make sure info is understood, very approachable , truly cares about students. holds online review night before exam along with complete study guide. you have to try to do bad

This professor really cares about you understanding the material. He gives you outlines of the lecture so you just have to follow along and insert info. His lectures are also podcasted. The essay portion of the test is lecture based, multiple choice is book based and worth only 20% of test, so go to lectures! good lecturer

You have to be kidding me. He worked at UCLA once and then the class complained because he failed the class so he was pretty much history after that.  His class was useless in the end since you have no strong evidence about the campaign process and his class(and Prof.Hussey) proved that. What a waste of time. NEVER TAKE HIS CLASSES!~~~~~

Professor Gussin's class is not all difficult as long as you do the reading and attend class on a regular basis. Everything he tests is covered in the reading and lecture. He even conducts online review sessions before the midterm and finals. His lectures aren't long winded and boring. He is a very likeable, down to earth professor and I would high

Phil is a great guy. He is still figuring out how to teach, but is continuously improving. He genuinely cares about student learning- to the extreme of sacrificing his personal time to hold online review sessions before exams. I highly recommend taking classes with him and attending his office hours.

AMAZING PROFESSOR! He makes medieval literature very interesting and also quite modern for us millennials. He's also very accommodating and helpful whenever you approach him for any help or feedback. I definitely recommend this professor because he will challenge you while enriching your literature learning experience.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Jäger is a very passionate professor. Jager's lectures are always entertaining and his energy makes you want to participate even if you're usually the "quiet" one. Jager is very clear on the grading criteria and as long as you do the reading, you'll be fine. Definitely recommend Jager for Medieval lit but I heard he is great for Chaucer too.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Unlike some other professors I've taken, he seems to realize that he's dealing with full-time students and so doesn't assign a ridiculous amount of reading. Everything is manageable. You DO have to keep up with the reading, though, but overall he's a great professor who's really fair and considerate.
Jager is both very knowledgeable and entertaining. His grading seemed fair. I would definitely recommend him for Chaucer.

Jager displays a deep interest in his course material and can really suck in those who have had limited experience previously with Anglo-Saxon literature.  His course covering Beowulf is extremely interesting.  His requirements for letters of rec are bogus though, as he tends to make up ridiculous reasons not to write them for straight-A students

Prof Jager is a charismatic, inspiring teacher who brings Chaucer alive to his students. He really cares about student learning. He even gave an invaluable workshop to help improve our writing skills. If you keep up-to-date with your reading each week then your Middle English will really improve, plus you will be well prepared for the final.
I took his class during the summer.  He was an awesome professor who made Chaucer understandable and interesting.
A wonderful teacher who encourages you to think outside of the box.  Taking a class with him is a great experience.
Awesome! Best Professor at UCLA
No Comments
Professor Nelson, is great! He is entertaining and the lectures are interesting. He knows the material well, and has been teaching this course a long time. I recommend.
one word, AMAZING! Best teacher at UCLA! Sitting in class with him is a breeze. Assignments are papers. Readings go along with his topics on lecture. Overall best teacher!!!!!
Great professor! He's funny & can sometimes be repetitive. Great class for any type of major, recommend you take this class.
A Prince of a Professor.

pluses - really fantastic prof. ...makes coming to class not so much of a drudgery, unique assignments. negs - about70 slides for memorization for the final in addition to comparison/contrast and essay. that's not unusual for an art history class though anyways.
midterm is a nightmare. but he is hilarious, and his lectures are interesting.
His lectures are great but work load and midterms are horrible

One of my all time favorites.  He is fun to watch and listen to, highly intelligent and well-educated but not pretentious.  I wish I had more than just one class with him.  His assignments are thought-provoking and encourage the student to be creative.  His lectures are fun, provocative and punctuated with his sharp wit.  I miss you, Prof. Nelson!
No Comments
Very smart and funny. Makes the class go by really fast.

David is one of the most dedicated profs I've met. Every lecture was entertaining and designed to make you think. If you got a grade you didn't like on any assignment, you could redo it for full credit and he was there for you if you didn't understand anything. He spent weeks helping me apply to field school and was extremely kind. Get to know him!

Professor Cheetham is just brilliant. Anyone bashing him, or critiquing him in a negative manner must have gotten a bad grade. Do not listen to negative feedback. Take him. You will not be disappointed. I hope UCLA gives him a permanent position in the Anthro dept.

I LOVE Professor Cheetham or David as he likes to be called by his students. He is  super funny, extremely intelligent, and truly cares for his students. He will be teaching this class this fall quarter, so TAKE HIM. Oh, one more thing, he is super HOT =)
David is a wonderful professor who compellingly presents his subject material. Would love to take more courses with him!
He is a wonderful professor! David is intelligent, approachable, relaxed, and passionate. I would highly recommend taking his class.

I adored this class. I always looked forward to coming to lecture, and can honestly say there was never a dull moment. Dr. Cheetham is very concerned with students' progress, and will go out of his way to answer questions. He has an amazing amount of experience, and shares it with grace and enthusiasm. I feel honored to have taken this course.

Dr Cheetham has been a great professor this quarter. He is extremely willing to help his students in any way he can and actually makes the effort to know his students' names. The class was pretty interesting and I would be interested in taking another class from him if UCLA would bring him back again.

The courses are not very well-organized and he is sometimes a boring teacher. We use books a lot and we are expected to know every word of every reading. It is a course almost only based on books. Exams questions are very precise but sometimes quite strange as "is a mouse larger than an elephant?".

Cheetham is a very relaxed and reliable teacher. He comes off as fairly nonchalant but is still very concerned with student comprehension, he wants his students to do well. Great use of personal anecdotes and makes modern and historical references to help students remember things/make connections,& keeps things interesting. Highly recommend!

Dr. Cheetham was excellent. Lectures are flexible and fun. He seems to have more field experience than most professors but doesn't have an 'Ivory Tower' ego so it's easy to ask questions. He doesn't make you feel stupid for not understanding something and will actually return an email if you need more explanation. Definitely take his class.
EXCELLENT TEACHER! Take her if you can, you won't regret it at all.

Representing Race, Temple University. She provides all the material for readings. The class is challenging and worthwhile. There is a lot to read but that is expected of a college level course. She promotes actual discussion in class and I always left feeling like I've learned something.

This class at Temple University (Representing Race) is a great Diversity and Race requirement. It may be a lot of reading, but the class doesn't use a textbook--she gives you all the articles. The class is discussion and the testing is minimal. If you study the slides and see the T.A for any questions you may have the exams are super easy.

She was great at explaining the readings and she was extremely helpful if you went to her office hours.  There was a lot of reading.  The only thing that I really didn't like about the class was the group ethnography project because it was a lot of work and I ended up doing most of it.  Midterm & final are easy if you study.  I got an A+

She presented interesting material, but the workload was way too heavy to be able to complete it all. She's nice, but her lectures are almost useless if you do the reading. But the reading should be done. Or at least skimmed.

Meacham is not too bad. Don't listen to what everyone says about her. I got an A+ in her class and I didn't even study that hard. Just do the reading and go to the TAs office hours if you don't understand anything and you will be fine. To those complaining below... you go to UCLA... step it up she wasn't that hard. She's just a bad lecturer.

Awful, awful, awful. Too much reading. Soooooo BORING. Doesn't teach, she just reads the slides that she makes off of a powerpoint. Avoid this class, if you can. So unfortunate, because this could be a really interesting topic if it wasn't her teaching.

Possibly the least effective professor I've had here. Lectures are unorganized and dull. Handouts are useless reproductions of the barely comprehensible slides. Concepts are introduced with little effort to relate them to our lives. She seems nice, but cannot teach (or at least needs a LOT of work.)

Really a terrible lecturer and an ineffective conveyer of information. She rambles in a low monotone without ever leaving her podium, and expects you to do literally thousands of pages of reading. Do not take her class, thank me later.
Horrible class. lots of material, very difficult to read!
Awesome course.  Introduces several different religions in a non bias way.  You will LOVE this course as you travel on your personal spiritual journey

Awful class! I would never recommend this course or professor to anyone! Lectures are hard to follow, has no direction and is not clear. I went to office hours with specific questions, and instead he went off on tangents talking about who knows what, and asking me about his teaching style?? Wouldn't recommend - teacher or class
AMAZING professor. Really brilliant and knows sooo much about his subject. The best teacher I've ever had.
great, brilliant guy. worth while material.
Pretty funny and very interesting. He goes off on a tangent sometimes, but they tend to be interesting still. I loved the class

My favorite teacher so far at UCLA. Although he does go off on tangents in lecture, I learned an enormous amount and felt like unlike other classes the information has stayed with me. He is very approachable and clearly loves teaching. Highly recommended.
This is one of the kindest and most approachable professors I have ever met.
Great professor. Knowledgeable. Passionate about the subject. Sensitive to people's beliefs.
Lectures not too organized/clear. I still have not received my final paper back. He does not respond to my emails.
Great professor, I highly recommend him.
Very engaging and knows exactly what he is talking about!!

This was one of the most challenging classes that I've taken at UCLA, but also one of the classes where I've learned the most. Professor Madley really takes the time to go over essays and gives amazing feedback. He surely is one of the best professors on campus.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He's incredible!
He is a remarkable professor and very ready to help. Very engaged in the subject youll enjoy! Alot of reading and work but do-able!!

Dr. Madley is a true inspiration.  As a professor, he is engaging, entertaining, and very informative.  Even though he assigns a substantial amount of reading, it is all relatively fascinating.  His class is not easy whatsoever, but hard work does not go unnoticed and is rewarded generously.  One of the best professors at UCLA, no doubt.

Really amazing professor. Makes the subject interesting for someone who might not be. Extremely well done lectures and well thought out. This professor is brilliant. Great study guide for the final (50%) and he allows you to choose 2 of 3 essay options to write 2 5 page papers about (25% each). Would definitely recommend him.

Awesome professor, one of the best at UCLA. He really helps students write well thought concise essays. He is very passionate something that not a lot of UCLA professors are. His lectures are well planned and engaging. Whoever takes this class will gain an immense knowledge of American Indian history. He also gives a study guide for the final!

Awesome professor, one of the best at UCLA. He really helps students write well thought concise essays. He is very passionate something that not a lot of UCLA professors are. His lectures are well planned and engaging. Whoever takes this class will gain an immense knowledge of American Indian history.  He's also quite handsome; I'm jealous.

Professor Madley is passionate about what he teaches which makes class all the more interesting and fun. The assignments are crystal clear so that you always know what you need to do to get a good grade. If you have any questions don't hesitate to ask him! He is very approachable and ready to help you succeed in this class.

Professor Madley is incredibly sweet and knowledgeable. I'm so thankful I took his class. He's a fair grader, his lectures are always interesting & accompanied with pictures, & he is eager to help anyone who needs it. I hope to take as many of his classes as I can! Even if you aren't that interested in the subject field, he will make it fun!

Great lecturer, explains history like it's a story - can sometimes be a bit dry, but explains why an event happened (including the external factors and supporting characters). TONS of reading, so make sure you take notes in the margins and highlight recurring names. Definitely visit his office hours, even if it's a small question-he's there to help
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Took the course during the summer. TON of reading and LOADS of information to learn from the readings and from Professor Langdon's lectures. But you will learn ALOT. Just prepare yourself.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Extremely knowledgeable and tirelessly works to make sure you understand the core themes of the Byzantine Empire's lengthy history. 114B is not at all easy, it is a class for passionate history students who are willing to put in the time to get something out of it. His lectures are dramatic and funny, with both tragedy and comedy.

I had him in high school for ancient civ honors and he inspired my love for history. Every class is a story and it's amazing to listen to! I would definitely recommend taking whatever classes you can with him.

The best professor I have had the fortune to take at UCLA. He loves what he does, and that bleeds through every facet of the class; his lectures, even if you don't particularly care about Roman history, are geared to teach you moral or philosophical lessons. He is an example of how history can be taught engagingly, rather than as a dull chronology.

Great professor. Made class fun and interesting, if youre not good at listening and taking notes, dont take him, hes all about telling stories in his own words and there are no powerpoints. he hands out candy too! his course reader is actually really helpful and full of notes. Hes a very knowledgeble professor and i would def take him again!
My favorite professor of all time, he's absolutely infectious.

Though he presents in a style heavy w/ adjective-fortified narrative, his enjoyment of the material is contagious and he gears things in such a way that students have every opportunity to succeed.  He presents a deluge of information (of which if even a fraction is soaked up during his lectures a satisfactory grade should result for most students).
No Comments
Very caring professor, must take a class with him!
Difficult class relative to other history courses. Too much reading. Difficult to even meet her, given the massive size of the class.

I was very excited to study with Waugh. She is an expert in her field! Her lectures always stay on point, very well organized. Very detailed website with extra materials. Readings seem useless during the quarter, but you NEED them for the paper and take home final.
Very knowledgeable though somewhat moody and difficult to approach.

Nice enough professor but she has some odd requirements.  Papers must be exactly to length - no more, no less than the pages assigned.  Midterm was insane and no study guide - exam had short answers/multiple choice plus 2 essays in 1.25 hours.  Sheesh.

Her Civil War class was the best class I've ever taken. She uses every type of teaching tool- lectures, viceos, music, handouts, so she hits every learning style. Plus her website is incredible. It is a lot of work, and she does expect a lot, but I think it was totally worth it.

Her class was engaging. She used many different formats to get her point across in lecture and made (what seemed to me) a dull period in American history very interesting! As long as you take good notes and read over them, you're gold.

took her for both civil war and gilded age.  she's a nice woman, she'll make time for you if you seek you out.  material is very general, nothing terribly original or new.  also, grading is very much based on your ability to regurgitate, if you attempt to offer an actual argument or critique, it's an A- for you.
Not the nicest person in the world but the class itself was not too bad.  Worth taking anyway but don't go up to her to ask her any questions or she'll bite your head off.

Waugh is a great lecturer that uses contemporary technology to try and bring her lesson plans to life. She is flexible and wants you to learn. Although 500 pages a week isn't ideal, the books were great and you learn a lot about the civil war and how bad i
No Comments

Randy is very different than other English college professors. The fact that we can call him "Randy" instead of Mr. Fallows is awesome. You get graded on participation and it's great because it's not intimidating to participate when the class is a small group. The essays he makes us write were related to things happening in our world too.

not your average class. I took Prof F. for an SMC extension class. I may only be a freshman, but so far he's much different than the other professors. Never condescending and genuinely tries to help you out. Just read the plays, write commentaries, write a play/essay and you'll do fine. Easy and Interesting =best class so far
Professor Fallows is amazing!His classes are fun and he is very mellow. He lets you make up work if you miss a class, and his main focus is to get you to think about the text you read! take him!

Contrary to what the last person wrote, Randy does not have a large ego.  He asks to be called by his first name, elicits students for their opinions (rather than pushes his), and admits that he doesn't know all the answers,  His main goal is to get you to think for yourself, rather than repeat his opinions like most professors ask you to do.
Nice guy, but has a large ego.

Awesome professor and extremely helpful. But don't expect to turn in a paper and get an A right the way. He will make you revise it a couple of times. But you have control over your grades since he lets you revise your papers til you get the grade that you want.
No Comments
No Comments
Really thoughtful and sweet.  Good writing assignments, good amount of reading, always interesting classes.
Cool, funny and great looking guy

So easy! I skipped a lot of film screenings in class, but if I took the class again, I probably wouldn't have skipped -- it made the midterm and final a little more challenging. There is an in class essay-style midterm and final and one paper. Fairly easy -- just get to know your TA. Ended up with an A with minimal effort. Never read the textbook

Excellent class.  Professor is a walking encyclopedia of American motion picture history.  Good sense of humor. Loved his choice of films screened.  Great lectures that are well organized with interesting Power Point images.  Highly recommend him and the course.

Was GREAT lecturer. Really made all the topics interesting. Movies were all enjoyable too. I also had Phil Wagner as my TA, and he was tremendous. He had a large amount of knowledge on subject, and was very helpful and cared about his student. He graded tough, but it paid off in the end.

Professor Kuntz is one of the best professors I've ever had at UCLA. He is a joy to listen too and extremely knowledgeable about the history of Los Angeles and film there was not a question asked during the course he could not answer. I'd take his class again in a heartbeat.

His class was a lot of fun. It was usually an hour or so lecture followed by a movie or a very quick lecture followed by two movies. The book is easy and interesting to read. Two papers and a midterm and final. All very straightforward, and the sections prepare you for them well.
nice guy, great class, clearly passionate about his subject

Awesome class.  Professor ****z is like a walking encyclopedia.  I took it for summer but I wouldnt mind taking it during the year and gaining the full experience. I recommend it to everyone who watches movies.
Fantastic teacher! very energetic and interesting, I would highly recommend this class to anyone interestd in movies!
Great Class.
Absolutely wonderful class in every way.  Highly recommended for anyone who has ever watched a movie.

- I actually took SOC 101 but there isn't that option to choose from
- Super easy workload: only 3 assignments per quarter which are the midterm, final exam, and final paper
- exam questions are really similar to discussion questions 
- if you don't read the textbook, attend lecture and you'll be fine
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: 1 is too high for him. Test on really detailed things that only mentioned once in class, and be ready to read 40 more pages per week.. He never has a slide or something to teach in class but only sharing his subjective opinions. No idea why does an introductory class need to be this hard.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Not a good professor. Has no respect towards students. Has terrible etiquette when students share vulnerable and valuable information in lecture halls. Discussions are mandatory. Readings for class are extremely dry. Would not take this course with this Professor again. Bluebook testing and no notes allowed for the dense, not-so-engaging material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: As someone who has heard this professor say really unkind things about his UCLA students outside of class, I cannot recommend him to any student due to his lack of professionalism, integrity, and narcissistic attitude. Outside of the classroom, the only things he talks about is how "entitled" or what "brats" UCLA students are. Very disrespectful!

Jepson's exams are based on readings in discussion AND lecture. Even if he doesn't go over it in lecture yourself, he still expects you to know it because you should have read it. Thankfully, he gives a study guide and the exam is based on it. Just make sure to attend lecture in order to understand and receive all information
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: All the questions on the test were based on the course reader, not on his lectures, which was kind of annoying.  He's a nice person with interesting opinion, but going to his lectures were only useful for the movies that he showed which would be on the test.

I thought he was great. I loved his lectures. There is some opinion mixed in there, but it is educated opinion. Usually the ones getting offended are the students with the uneducated opinions they still hold onto. Jepson is a smart mofo and has made a lot of connections that most people never become aware of.

Professor Jepson is a joke.  I am an English major who took this class as an elective and regretted it.  His lectures are nothing but a comedy routine & all he does is spout his personal beliefs for the entire class.  The topic (collective behavior) is interesting, but I would not recommend this professor.
loves what he teaches. lecture is actually interesting to go to. grading is really difficult though. this was the one class I didn't mind getting a C though because it was really interesting.
No Comments
Literally the worst. Worst lecturer, literally just reads slides. 40% midterm 60% final. Curved but who cares. Likes monkeys too much.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This is the first time any of her courses has had a TA, which makes the class way better. Course reads more like a biology course than an anthropology one, but gives very good curves on the midterm, with a 5-page grant proposal as the only two grades in the class. Very helpful in office hours, easy grade as long as you go to discussion and skim.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Your final grade is determined by the Midterm 40% and the Final Exam 60%. The exams were extremely difficult and not representative of the course material (lectures, notes, videos, readings) I attended all lectures and studied 10+ hours for each exam, I passed the class with a C. I am extremely disappointed in this class and would not recommend it.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: #1 turn off she speaks about the material as if looking in the mirror, so it's easy to see why most of the students cant stand this course and are failing, we are not PhD-holders! Its mostly irrelevant facts about monkeys that have no grounds in the real world, in addition to advertising her pointless book, she has no TA! You're on your own in this

This class is hard! The reading is a lot and doesn't really help answering questions on the exam. Her lecture is very important, because she will be asking a few question straight from it.This class also have a research paper which is quite annoying, unless you enjoy doing some kind of research. Not recommended if you want to take it as an elective

She is very knowledgeable. You gotta be aware that you read the material & understand the concept b/f lec. so you can follow up with her lecture. If you don't do the reading and seek for help and expect to do well on the exam, there's no way. You have to study, but the material she makes you read is extremely relevant to a lot of subjects

actually she is not that bad. class was quite boring n unorganized. handouts are posted online, but u still need to go to class as she gives more info than the notes. she curves a lot, i got D n C on exams, but end up with B+.

This was the single worst experience of a class and professor I have ever had! Horrible teacher, unreasonable grading. Judgmental and rude when approached at office hours. For the final she had 200+ students single-file into an auditorium, waiting for 1.5 hours before starting the exam, then didn't even give enough time to finish. DO NO TAKE!

awful. awful. awful. boring lecturer; clearly she'd rather be doing research than teaching.  she's not available or approachable and her exam material include way more than just course content/lectures.  i'm an A student and i have never worked so hard for so little reward in a class before.  stay away!
Just no
Prof. Hayes is one of the best instructors I've ever had. He makes the subject so interesting and his passion for phonetics is contagious! However, his test are not easy. TA matters too!

During FALL '10, he rewrote his online book. As a result, there were many ERRORS! HW was HARD. The examples the professor emphasizes are generally NOT on the quizzes! He speaks in a patronizing tone and answers questions with a question (i.e. what do YOU think the answer is?). Save your GPA - choose your TA wisely. It makes a HUGE difference.
Awesome professor

Bruce Hayes seems to live in his brain and has trouble relating in a personable way to real people.  As a result, his efficiency at teaching fails because he alienates students who really love the subject.    He talks with a baby voice that sounds fake and is sometimes intimidating.  I wish he has just been more normal a teacher.

Who said Hayes is mean? That's just crazy. He's a gentle, kind person who happens to be really into phonetics. He actually goes out of his way to help people, even those of us (like me) who aren't naturally gifted at this crap. As for egotistic, that's ridiculous. He's a bit dorky, but so what? He's a great professor.

I was shocked to see negative reviews here. The material for his intro class was interesting and clearly presented. He went out of his way to make sure everyone did well, and he has been accused of making finals "too easy". He's enthusiastic & humorous. 1 assignment/wk (takes about 1hr to do), attendance not manditory, text is free PDF file online.
Very egotistic

Hayes gives clear and organized lectures, but he's lacking some important social skills.  He doesn't understand any questions asked of him, and he goes out of his way to humiliate his students.  You might learn a lot but be prepared to have your self esteem destroyed.
Excited about the material, and transmits that enthusiasm to the students.  Makes himself available for office hours, questions, and help.  Great!
Way overrated. Unprepared and a rambler. Tries real hard to be hip and cool. If you are naive and lazy you will love him. If you want to truly learn, you will be disappointed.
Very nice guy. its fun to see your professor on CNN or Carson Daly. That's hot to me!
Loved him.
Great Prof.
He was excellent!
excellent prof
too liberal
Prof. Sawyer is absolutely caliente and one of the best in the department. He is also very helpful friendly and really cares about students. Take his class you will learn a lot about urban politics!
The Best and Hot too!

He has much to offer. A academic star with his feet on the ground. He would do well on all levels of instruction but he does know who is better students are and if they need to be in his class. So, judgemental.

Munzer provides exceptionally helpful summaries after each section of the Contracts course, and is genuinely interested in facilitating students' learning.  His final exam is demanding, but there is an ample bank of prior exams and sample answers so you can ascertain your progress throughout the class.

He's interested and interesting teacher. Took advanced (unrelated courses with him), and he was gracious enough to be me adviser re law review article. I graduated few years ago, but definitely remember him (and into 1L contracts) as highlights from UCLA law.
The only thing Munzer is worse at then teaching is grading.  If your a 1L unlucky enough to be put in his section, don't bother studying.  His tests are more random then his choice of polo shirt.
An easy teacher but I felt some pressure to feed back his ideology in order to do well in the course.
The guy is awesome.  He is hilarious, caring, patient, and smarter than most of us realize.  I loved his class.
Not very clear with some difficult material.  Also seemed to be a bit of a ****.
Remains the paragon of law professors and his class of law school classes.
No Comments

This professor enforces mandatory lectures that primarily consist of her personal conjecture on political events. She will rarely if ever, delve into the required course readings that are both excessive and frequently irrelevant to her actual assignments. Her student responses range from passive-aggressive to outright rude. Do not take her class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: 2 stories: 1. A student asks for advice and is told to just drop the course. 2. A student asks for clarification and is accused of not attending class. Enough Said.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: On the first day of class Lebow said her class might not be for you if you have a "boyfriend or a job". I literally have to work to survive. The work load from this class is unmanageable, you can only keep your sanity if this is your only class for the quarter. Avoid at all costs.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Lebow can be best described as fair. I have taken 3 of her classes and in all three of her classes, there has been a lot of reading and a lot of content. If you are willing to put in the effort, you will get an A. she is not out to trick you. Professor Lebow is also always willing to help her students.

One of those classes that are hard to get through but once you have you walk away appreciating it. The vast amount of knowledge you will gain about the Court system, major cases, the federal government, and law terminology makes this class worthwhile. Especially if your planning on law school. Lebow is attentive,clear and ready to help in any way

If you are interested in the supreme court and possibly going to law school then I recommend this class.  There is a TON of reading but if you go to all the lectures then you can get by by just skimming the book.  Also be sure to go to office hours because she's happy to help you out if you just make an effort.

The Supreme Court and other classes: This instructor is difficult but excellent. Lectures are very clear and are directly related to the cases and textbook readings. Go to her office hours if you need help. Speak up in class and do the readings and you will be fine. She is always willing to listen and help students succeed. Recommended!
Tough, but very informed, knowledgeable, clear, and helps her students grasp the material.
The worst teacher, and the most hardest. She is very tough, if you don't comment in class. She will mark you down. Don't take this class, unless you have to

I had Professor Allen for 1, 100a, 197 and for a seminar in graduate school. This was back in the late 50s and early 60s.. It is hard to overstate my appreciation of him. He was one of the few great teachers I have had.

His distinct presentation of Elementary Principles of Microeconomic Theory reached and engaged my Economic Mind in ways that no other Economics Professor has.  I miss his talks on Mouse Wisdom and about Winnie.
Funny, makes the subject material interesting by talking about it in the context of real-life events.  Very biased and opinionated, which can make the class readings humorous at times.
sucks
Ridiculous, although funny at times. However not an efficient teacher for an introductory class. Not helpful to students
I find him ludicrously unamusing
He is one of the best professors I ever had.
as long as you do the reading, it's no propblem
worthy of admiration and distinct honor
I loved his lectures: brilliant, engaging, and very thought-provoking.
Very great professor.  Knows a lot about lit. theory
Very involved and helpful.  Liked him so much, did an independent study with him.
an amazing lecturer with a finely tuned vocabulary - i loved his lectures.
intense lectures
Too much thought and theory about Shakespeare. Too much.
Prof. Gallagher is SOOO smart!  His lectures are intense, so you can't sleep if you want to pass.  A brilliant man - so honored to have learned from him!
No Comments
No Comments

The midterm is part essay (gives you prompts ahead of time, chooses 1 out of 5) and 8 MC questions. There's another take-home assignment that isn't too hard, and the final was take home as well. She's a very caring and loving person, and if you're struggling, she'll do her best to help. Lectures can be boring, but it isn't a bad/super hard class.

I've taken more than 1 class from Dr. Yeager and have found her lectures to be enlightening  and course material interesting. She was always very approachable and ready to help. She is bright and a breath of fresh air in a field that can DRY. Nice person.

Professor Yeager is wonderful. Her lectures were great, workload totally doable, and grading fair. She is super sweet and approachable. She even held a review session for the final on a Friday night because several students said they were having trouble with the material. Please disregard anything negative about Yeager. She is truly awesome.
Her husband is the Trinity Killer!  Eep!

This prof has this facade of being a nice and easy teacher BUT she has quirky ideas on what her class is about. its HARD to understand what she is trying to explain AND her lectures are NOT even related to her question; if they are its in a very abstract way! I had a 3.9 gpa before yeager...she gave me a C...

Thought she was on crack.  This class is boring and excruciating, so don't take it if you can help it.  On the plus side, she will give you an exam study guide with exact questions as they will appear on the test.

I already gave her a bad rating, but I felt it was not totally fair. It is hard to make economic history interesting. Maybe some visuals would help(film footage, powerpoint, etc.)  The best lecturers in college tend to provide lots of visuals in class.
Intellectually stimulating. Didn't always agree with thesis yet an essential course for a history major. Dr. Yeager very approachable.

It's brutal. I am  not the only one who feels this way. I wanted to escape the classroom. This is another case of a professor who was never taught how to teach students. The lectures are boring and unrelatable. I would have no idea what happened after a lecture in that class sometimes. I stopped showing up. Others played games on their laptops. Run
Super funny professor. Goes into great detail about the novels being discussed. Wasn't my cup of tea but if closely analyzing novels is what you're interested in, it's a great class.

He is a solid professor, a bit weird, but okay. He is very helpful if you go to office hours and really wants to speak with his students. In terms of grading/workload, make sure you have a good TA, like I did, or else this class can become a true pain.

Not an affective teacher: there was no lecture or proper materials for us. He was goofy and fun and class was a blast but he didn't help with the reading material or come prepared to class. If you're used to "normal" professors, don't take him. You'll be  having a good time but HE IS A HARD GRADER; you will suffer at the end with the final essay.

I took two of Professor Mott's classes, and was thoroughly engaged. I am an AP English Language and Literature teacher now and use so many of his strategies still. How great of a professor is he? He had a full house the week of the Northridge earthquake and we didn't skip a beat during an aftershock. Okay maybe I screamed, but we kept at it still!

I used to hate american novels before i took this class, but now i love them! Mott is hilarious, so his lecture are interesting, but he can sometimes be hard to understand because he doesn't really tell you what he's explaining. but that's ok because you don't REALLY have to go to lecture to do well in the class. just read and know all the novels!
I love him!
No Comments

Just a great, great guy. Made lectures a ton of fun. Never fully clear about what he wants from the papers, and a difficult class to get an A in. However, I would still recommend this class highly as a GE that I enjoyed.

American Literature and Seminar: the Politics of ****graphy.  Plus 199's. He is fabulous: innovative, edgy, great sense of humor. Not an easy A but you learn and are inspired. He guides with a light touch. Some wanted more specific guidance. I didn't.

Wouldn't take this class as an undergrad unless you are a dedicated student- terms are hard and you need to study.  BUT he gives you study objectives- if you make note cards and actually study, you'll be fine. His tests are cut and dry. He replaces 2 quiz grades and drops lowest test score. Stay on top of things and it is an easy A (or at least B).

He does a lot of fil in the blank and if you miss one word, you get it wrong. Nearly my entire class failed his class, and yet the other sections did well. Unhelpful when seeking extra assistance. If you can memorize chunks of text, then this class is for you.

I was a highschool freshmen when i first took this class, and even I thought it was pretty easy. Just be sure to do what he assigns, and also to pay attention to his lecture. Dont necessarily "believe" everything he states, unless it is in the text book, because much of his lecture is very opinionated and pro-athiest, other than that he was great

Memorize, Memorize, Memorize. A lot of information. He is very funny and sarcastic though. IF you're up for a quiz every day of class then this class is for you. Studied and stressed a lot and still got a C. Learned a lot though. Not a class to take if you have a full load already.

The book is what you rely on for this class, but an A is easy and if you take all of the quizzes from the book (2 each session), then you can practically skip the final!  He goes quite fast and expects people to know what he is talking about, so if you don't catch on quickly, do not take him. But he really knows his stuff!  Good class!

Don't flunk a single test if you do the best you can get is C. He doesn't curve. The remedial test only gives you a small boost. If you take him for summer. Study. I regret taking the class. Killed my gpa!

I took his psych intro class as a high school sophomore through UCLA extension. I'm now at UC Berkeley and I have yet to have a better class. The professor is hilarious, the lecture extremely interesting, and the quizzes so easy, you can study right before the class since it's just textbook definitions. If he's still teaching, you should take it!
weird at explaining things, so so teacher
Such a cool professor!  He is in a band!  Super nifty!

He's a great instructor. His classes are very fun and he makes group interaction easy and explains things very clear. Please get to class before the scheduled time because he WILL kick you out if you're there a few seconds late. He does not tolerate ANY LATENESS. He's nice and likes people to write A LOT on the journals.

THE BEST professor at UCLA. He correlates a very dry subject such as Sociology with current events and movies. He is, BY FAR, one of the best professors at UCLA...way better than the  overrated female Soc. Prof., whom I can't even remember her name now, which just goes to show the difference in a lasting impression. Steve is down to earth and COOL.

I had this guy a couple of years ago and couldn't stand him!  Sure it's an easy class, and he frequently uses class time to watch movies, and lets class out early.  Still I was really bothered by his teaching style.  He is intolerant of people with other opinions, he singles out students and twists what they have to say to make his point

The SHERMAN! he is out of this world, unlike anyother professor i have taken at UCLA. HE is into the field and he brings the film perspect into the soc world, adding a twist that keeps you interested. difficult grader if you dont give him what he wants. overall a great guy
Best ever! He makes class interesting and fun, and he puts the notes online! He's not difficult at all, but you have to go to class and enjoy!
No Comments
No Comments
Steve is brilliant and sexy. He makes Sociological theory interesting.

his notes are online, he gives out a study guide, the paper is short and on a personal experience and the exams are multiple choice. this is for intro to sociology. however i still found him really annoying, probably b/c he has a somewhat confrontational lecture style and he picks on people to comment a little too much. overall ok. not neccessarily
This rating is for his SCAND R5B at UC Berkeley. Amazing professor and engaging lecturer. Such a chill class, and favorite class I've taken at Cal so far. Low stress and you learn a lot.
Love this class

Professor Crawford's classes were a highlight of my time at UCLA. Probably his best quality as a teacher is his desire to make Old Norse literature and mythology accessible and interesting to laypeople. At least with me, he definitely succeeded.
Wow, amazing course, amazing professor. The most fun you'll probably have in a UCLA class. Handsome too, that never hurts.
Makes the language come alive.

Crawford is a good teacher. The class was VIKINGS and he presented the availible (scattered) material in a really cohesive way. This is a great class, by the way, if you need a GE. The material is a trip and Crawford has a great dry sense of humor. This class was a blast.
He's a great professor and really wants students to care about the subjects as much as he does. I've taken a few classes with him because it's either fun or interesting or both!
He really cares about what he taught and made sure everyone understood it.
He knew he was working with difficult material and tried his best to make it clear and concise.

I took her class in the 90's and judging from the posts she is still just as bad. All she did was read the powerpoint and if you asked her a question she would have to scroll back through the presentation to answer it.

Professor Repetti's class was very interesting. Her exams are extremely straightforward, so if you study it is not difficult to get an A. Also, the class is not curved so it's possible for the whole class to get A's. She even drops one of the exams.
Horrible class, ever worse prof. Her tests are so tricky and hard, worst class ever! Prof Lee is wayyyy better, take it with him if you have a chance.

WORST CLASS OF MY LIFE! I HATED GOING! ATTENDENCE IS MANDATORY. YOU PRETTY MUCH HAVE TO MEMORIZE HER ENTIRE LECTURES AND EVERYTHING IN THE BOOK AND YOU STILL DONT DO WELL. HER TESTS ARE SO TRICKY AND HARD. SHE IS SUCH A HARD GRADER. I WAS BARELY ABLE TO GET A C- IN HER CLASS AND I ALWAYS WENT TO CLASS AND DID ALL! THE READINGS. DON'T TAKE THIS!
very nice, and helpful. tests are really fair.
Very approachable and clear.  Tests are challenging due to amount to testable material.  Still, its a highly interesting class.
Her lack of teaching skills and reliance upon her lecture notes to answer any questions made her class Boooooooooooooring!
I felt Dr. Repetti was an enthusiastic and clear lecturer & an approachable professor outside of class.  Her tests were very fair.
No Comments
Great professor! Funny accent, but clear lectures. Tests highly based on lectures. He provides a study guide and makes tests super easy!

I have to disagree with the comments. Yes, he is boring. Yes, it would be useful if he could put some visual presentation in class other than just talking (he doesnt allow recorders either) but the readings he assigns are interesting also the movies. Just pay attention to his lectures and you will walk out with an A like I did. It's not hard!
Awful tests. Blew my GPA.

This teacher is horrible. The class would be one of the easier classes if it were not for the curve. I aced the midterm and i'm pretty sure I did well on the final but enede up with a B-. Do nopt take this class if you care about your GPA!!!

The most annoying class I've taken. He is very incomprehensible, unavailable, and clearly doesn't care about his students. DO NOT TAKE HIM! Grades are based off a midterm(40% of your grade) and final(60% of your grade), but he grades on a curve, so beware since majority of the class will get over 90%. If you plan on taking him...GOOD LUCK!

Gupta is not even an anthropologist. His lectures are dry, boring and incomprehensible. The class is based on two exams and he uses graders to grade them and they are VERY unfairly. DONT TAKE THIS CLASS. He's a bad professor who didn't even show up for our final! He just doesn't care about his students.

Going into this class I was really excited. Then he started to talk...boring! he made the subject of food boring. Futhermore, his grading style has no logic. He had all of the graders grade our exam and he did not even look at them. He won't even regrade! He exam questions were worded in an incomprehensible manner.

He is one of my favorite teachers! He gives us interesting readings. I like how he doesn't stand there with a powerpoint but lectures in a discussion-like style.  He's also fun. His class is based all around great discussions. I find his approach to anthropology refreshing as he comes from a different field. Want to learn? Take this class!

Completely boring.  Adheres to a classic anthropological approach.  Very formulaic.  Definitely not meant to be a professor.  Should have found another niche.  Readings are good but he has not figured out how to moderate a good discussion.
What a Guy, I found science boring as hell until prof kirlikovali taught me, now I can't get enough!
Professor Kirlikovali is the man. He is very helpful, smart, and has a great understanding of what it takes to succeed in the classroom. Not to mention, he is very easy on the eyes
Best, most beautiful man I have ever had the pleasure to learn from and know. What a pleasure.

Ask this guy anything and he knows the answer.  He's super smart and willing to help, not to mention incredibly witty if you get to know him.  Easily my favorite prof. so far, now if only I could grow the flow like him.
Professor KK was so clear and helpful ! He has a great sense of humor  and always made learning fun.
Kent has the sweetest flow around, a great mustche, and a amazing sense of humor. I honestly couldn't tell you what we are learning becaue his stunning good looks distract me the whole time.
Kent was the best teacher I have ever had, and he is super good looking.
More like Kent Kirlik-I-freaking-love-this-guy :). But don't expect all rainbows and kisses. He'll make you work for the grade. Fortunately, you'll never be more motivated to succeed.

Kent is my TA for Chem30al, and even though it's only the first week I can tell this semester is going to be AWESOME. Super nice, really understanding, and honestly great hair. I think the only reason I put 2 for easiness is because I am already putting pressure on myself to impress him. This guy is The Dude cool, highly recommend his lab.
Steals belongings and violates Title VI. Embarrassment to UCLA
Hard to understand her lessons,her course is really one prospective and not a lot of room for creative freedom

comment: Never knew what she was talking about! Not educated on what she is teaching. Disrespectful to students
She tries to steal your personal property on campus.
She often went off topic and discussed non related political views. She did not consider any dissenting voices.  She does not understand the first amendment.
Horrible class, horrible prof
Thief

I took an upper division WS class with Prof Lee back in '99 or '00, and it was not a pleasant experience for me.  I enjoyed the content, but she had a hard time leading lectures.  Lectures were limited to the same 1-2 very vocal students interjecting who always felt the need to speak while most of the POC students had a hard time getting a word in.

She lectures in a low, one to one volume. She reads passages & doesn't clarify or expand. Its hard to extract the point most of the time. This makes her high volumes of reading & 400-word minimum weekly posts painful. Essentially disorganized & clunky with speech, she frequently utters "Um", "Uh", alongside her irrelevant Power Point slides.
Just a bit difficult, he cares for his students. He tries to make his his tests are fair as possible.
Does he speak Spanish? No.  The least of his problems.
great class.  lectures extremely interesting and well put together.  if you're looking for a class with fresh perspective and insightfull observations, take avila for anything.

Avila is great! The best professor at UCLA. By Fall 06 I will have taken every single class he teaches. There is a reason he keeps students coming back for more.
