He knows his stuff, is engaging, and interesting. Avila's goal is to make his students critically think. His classes arent always the easiest but the knowledge you gain is life changing.
Very interesting course content.  Clear, and eager to hear what students have to say.
He thinks he's all that, but he's arrogant and rude and God help you, if you need to talk to him, he won't give you the time of day!
If you like history. You will love this class. He is amazing. He is hard to approach, but is lectures are fresh, dynamic, and enthralling.
The most arrogant and full of himself professor ever! Uncaring and dismissive. Awful

Getty is one of my favorite professors at UCLA! He has a passion for what he teaches and knows how to effectively teach. The grading scheme was very fair and the lectures were smooth and easy to understand. Take History 22 with him if you can, it's a course I HIGHLY recommend to my peers.

I took Russian History in Spring 2007. He is AMAZING!! I am Russian and i found his stories to be interesting. He brings a lot of extra depth to the course from his personal experiences. I will admit that I watched every lecture and took notes and online, read the book in full and the novel in full, the course did require a lot of work,but worth it
The guy is ****en tight.
No Comments
Getty is one of the greatest professors at UCLA, period.

I had Arch in 3 classes before he left UCR and went to UCLA. Y'all are missing out! Take a Soviet course with him and see how much you learn. Put in the work and you will be rewarded. He'll give you thoughtful and insightful guidance if you're willing to ask for it. His stories are good, and, YES, they are true.

Awful. Boring, predictable, pompous, unfair in terms of grading, gives exaggerated accounts of history, and has had some of his scholarly work discredited by colleagues. After taking Getty's course, I wanted my money and my time back. And the movies? Any professor who shows movies isn't earning his paycheck.
Great professor! His lecutres WILL keep you interested as he includes great power point slides, movies, and historical anecdotes. Grading is very fair and easy.  Take him, you won't be disappointed.
Dr. Getty is an eloquent speaker and his looks don't hurt either. I was never interested in the soviet union before I took this class but because of him, I just ordered a russian bride online!
Insane. Teaches feelings over facts. Surely, UCLA diversity hire and nothing more. You'll learn nothing here
She can't even proofread her own work. So won't even bother to read yours.

Dr. Cooney has a really easy lecture style and she's very funny, which helps things stick in your head. She knows her material and is really willing to help, returns emails and will make flexible office hours if needed. Great teacher. Take any class with her.

She is rather a good professor. The courses are well-organized and she is helpful. But during one course she said something bad about European people which I did not appreciate at all as an international student. By this, she disappointed me a lot.

Great teacher, easy to follow. She gives you all the information you need and grades liberally IF you can show that you understood the concepts in your essay's. I enjoyed her so much I took a second class with her.

I would take her class if she was teaching the history of toilet paper. She is so fun and interesting that even though I'm not all that into Egyptian art history, I've taken two classes with her. She's hilarious and inspiring, and I totally recommend her!

Great professor! she's a lot of fun... very dedicated, loves her job and her students. Very helpful. Doesn't give a straight answer, "may be this, may be that... we don't know". If you love art, take her class. you won't regret.
Smart and articulate.  The class was challenging but she made me want to work very hard to do well.

You've got to be kidding me. Cooney was fantastic-- smart, relaxed, great sense of humor...only a midterm and a final and that's it! It's been refreshing to see a woman so young and so driven do well as an art historian and archaeologist. She totally changed my opinion on Egyptian art. She is not to be missed.
Michelle Craske announced that she herself is a white supremacist twice in front of a group of students each time so I suffer feeling terrorized a year later.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Not really supportive. Got nowhere with her after a long time.
Extremely knowledgable about anxiety disorders-if you show willingness to learn and grow-she will support you all the way!

I am now in grad school in another state but I still use the text and remember what a great prof she was.  She is not boring, just low-key.  Approach for help and she will. Loved the class. Taking a grad version of it this coming Fall.
Dr. Craske may seem hard to approach or too quiet and shy.  But approach her any way and you'll find that she's amazing!
Dr. Craske my seen hard to approach, but when you do, you'll find that she is amazing.
needs to improve communications skills
Nice enough but so boring
He is very good professor. LS4 is hard, so study as much as you can from the beginning. He gives essay questions for exams.

Boring teacher - he simply just reads from the book - waste of time. He is a cool guy though - he'll help you out with your grade if you need it. Just read the book, make good study notes, and you'll kills his exams. I got an A in his class, and I just memorized the book.

I had a wonderful experience learning under a gifted lecturer whose primary aim seemed to be getting concepts across rather than dumping facts. He kept the class animated w/ anecdotes and us on our feet with frequent surprise pop quizzes, which I much appreciated during the real exams. Way to go!!

Mr. Strathearn is a great prof! He has been the most helpful professor I've yet to come across. He is definitely not one of those teachers that will give out an easy A, but if you put in the effort, you will get your grade. He is always willing to help those students that want to be helped. Plus he is super funny!

His lectures are difficult to follow if you haven't read the material in advance. He speaks too fast for you to write notes. Lectures match about 90% of the exams but you must know all the details. To succeed practice on sample questions. If he was more systematic in his lecture which allows for better note taking that would solve most complaints.

His lectures are extremely boring and hard to follow, he lectures directly from the book. His midterm was so detailed/hard (MC, Essays, illustrations, definitions, short answer), he assigned a 10pg single spaced research paper, a take home final (4 essays, 1-3pgs each), AND an in class final.  For the exams u must memorize EVERY detail in the book

he is the cruelst of all time. he uses overheads in class and lectures so fast that by the end of lecture nobody gets anything. you have to study by ur own from the book. he gives suprised quizes and basically preparing for the class with the high amount of material is impossible. dont take him!
He is funny, but at the same time a cruel individual who thinks students should only get A's if they are at his level of understanding the material.

the most useless professor I've ever encountered. I would love to meet the person who decided she was qualified to teach at UCLA. I can honestly say that I did not learn a single thing in this class. she usually can't keep track of what she is saying for longer than 5 min, yet attendance is mandatory, which makes for a complete waste of time. AVOID

If you actually went to class then you would she is very thorough. She doesn't even have an accent that would disrupt with learning the material--just a personal attack. She was extremely nice/helpful to me when I visited her. She probably thought you were rude....BECAUSE YOU WERE RUDE. just mad b/c she called you out.
You guys are just hatin'. If you actually were there in class-- she taught the material well. She wasn't boring-just throughout. TAKE THIS CLASS. VERY HELPFUL.

she is disorganized, un professional, boring, and you can basically study of the slides she provides, you wouldn't have to go to class at all, IF she didn't force you to sign the attendance sheet everyday. Take work for another class in there, since your forced to stay

If you can understand what she is saying through her accent then you'll see how confusing she really is. She would get into arguments with the TA all the time about the material. She takes attendance in class which is counted towards your participation grade. One of the worse classes I have ever taken in my college career.

Forget boring, that's not even the worst part.  I got the highest scores on the exams and she penalized me for not signing the attendence sheet one time.  When I tried to go over my final grade with her, she literally put me down and told me that I'll never succeed academically because I don't respect my professors.  By far the most INSULTING exper
This is by far the most boring teacher I've ever had.  I got an A in her class, but damn, it was painful.

I thought the class was going to be intersting since it was sociology of family, however, the prof was the most boring teacher I have ever had. She kept on talking about her own divorce in class. I slept throughout the class. Although I got an A, I thought she was a really boring teacher!!1

i took 183A and 183B. the Man is brilliant and extremely insightful. 183A is easier than 183B. Great courses. Attendance and taking good notes is mandatory. Get to know ur reader since they read ur exams, NOT Friedlander.
A world renowned historian on the holocaust. His background is also very interesting: Read When Memory Comes. Helpful man, really.

I took his Holocaust class (183B), got an A- and loved it. I thought it'd be great to take his history seminar, but it wasn't nearly as good. 5 of the 15 students ended up being grad students who got a lot of the focus and changed the whole dynamic. He assigned a lot of reading and then never really had us do anything with it. 183B was GREAT!

I am a Psychology major, interested in the Holocaust & decided to take his class. He has changed my aversivess to learning History. He tells History like a story-- he is factual & encompasses all antecedents to understand outcomes. I wish I could learn more from him. Fascinating class and an honor to be taught by this man.

Friedlander is brilliant. If you are going to learn Holocaust history from anyone it should be him, there are few that are better qualified. I don't really inderstand the full of himself comment, I suppose if someone knows what they are talking about then they must be full of themselves.
very interesting but a little full of himself!
I don't recommend him.
No Comments

Teacher is hard and unprofessional. I didn't care for her monotone lectures and bad attitude about morning classes. I spoke with her a few times and always felt like trying to give my opinion wouldn't matter. Basically, it is her way or no way at all. Told everyone in Anthro to not take her only if you have to.

Didn't like her. Yes, it is good to be challenged but personally didn't like her and would not recommend her to my friends. I'm an athlete and shared with everyone she is tough!!! I should had dropped the class.

Yes, Muriel is a hard grader but she is a wonderful  Professor. She explains things to help every student. She challenges students to become a better writer and student. The materials she assigns are very interesting along with her lectures. If you want to challenge yourself and become a better student her tests and reading materials will help.

Very Tough grader. I personally did not care too much for her, but loved the reading materials. I lost respect for her once I felt she was trying to be a "friend" rather than a Professor. I almost felt like a student was teaching the class (she swears in her emails and in class) unprofessional. She is a nice woman, just not my cup of tea.
HARDEST Grader ever! Don't take her if you want to keep a good GPA. Very tough!

Medical Anthro was awesome! Yes, Vernon is a difficult grader.  It isn't too hard though. Her class is worth it! She is very funny and good at communicating! I disagree with the other comments. She responded to my emails and questions with long and thoughtful responses.

I hated her, she was not a good teacher. I felt like I could not openly talk to her and felt she judged a lot. She is passionate about her subjects but she is really harsh grader. Personally didn't like her and would not take her again.

She is an okay teacher but not really good. She says likes to get to know her students on a "personal" level but it doesn't work for her. Also she swear ALOT for a Professor. I didn't really like her or her class. She doesn't seem like a fair grader and completely plays favorites. I wouldn't take her again
She was a really dedicated prof. who was fair with both students and faculty. We learned a lot from the area fields in which she had expertise, Spanish historical linguistics and Spanish syntax.
Amazing Caring mujer, she is really knowledgeable on the field of linguistics. She is quite flexible and humanizing.
She has a different image now and started anew.  Very soon she'll be just fine!
No big deal; it's actually basic.
It is useless to take a class with her.  Her material is outdated and she is not on top of the cutting edge of Spanish linguistics.
I'm not impressed with this instructor.  She talks too much in class but has no direction.  Grading is always a problem, and she won't listen when you make her see her own mistakes.
She's not bad teaching all the courses of the section. Grading is always a problem; expects too much and does not add all the grades correctly. Same old problem.
Not too bad. She's been teaching around here for a while. She is not too strict.

Milka has made a life long impact on my graphic design career and I am in debt to her for it. I came to this realization after taking her class with other teachers and working in the outside world seeing how much she cared and was preparing us for our field of work - we didn't get it! Her class is very demanding but it pays off big with top jobs.

Milka is an extremely dedicated professor and visual communicator. With 4 projects for the semester, she was constantly pushing the class to take their concept and design skills to the next level. If you can't take constructive criticism or tight deadlines, Milka is not the instructor for you. Only criticism - she did not stay in line with rubric.

not clear, incredibly inconsistent in terms of crits and expectations. She says one thing you do it for next week's assignment, tells ya you did it wrong. Easily worst prof I have experienced. Came in 20 minutes late the class, everyone respectfully stayed, she then took roll?!?! way out of line for adjunct.
Horrible professor, would not recommend to ANYONE. Treats students as though they were professional graphic designers, and not students.
Milka has a great amount of energy and enthusiasm. She genuinely wants all of her students to succeed. Without hesitation I would recommend this class to anyone in DMA.
She is awsome. Very knowledgable with both academic and the out side professional side. Very helpful and cares a lot about her students. I also learned a ton.
No Comments

She makes you work very hard and it's all worth it. She is full of energy, enthusiastic and caring. She runs a tight ship, knows her stuff and knows how to really push her students to their best ability. I learned alot and got a lot of amazing projects out of her class.

Prof. Throop is a very clear lecturer and the exams are not hard at all. Once I got adjusted to reading around 100 pages of ethnography/ research papers per week, it turned out a lot easier than I had anticipated. Prof. Throop also used be in a rock band, so he has these cool tatoos on his arms and plays rock before classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Hands down one of the worst classes I have ever had the misfortune to sit through. The lectures are dry, monotonous, and the take home exams are so ridiculously difficult that the question prompt itself is a nearly incomprehensible full page long. This class is obsurdly difficult and completely irrelevant. Unless you want to resent school, AVOID!!!

had him for ANTHRO 9. one of the least interesting classes i've taken and this is my major. 8 pg. research paper at the end - he is very particular about what he wants and has very intense and strict guidelines on how to write it. overall, i'm not a fan of this professor. course would have been better w/ someone else.

Good amount of readings but not too difficult.He basically tells you in lecture everything you should know from the readings.Grade based on midterm and final (mult choice, true false, essay).Plays good music before class starts!Good class overall.
Professor Throop is absolutely wonderful- if you have an interest in psychology, take one of his classes. He teaches in a straightforward way, he's a great lecturer, and very kind and approachable.

The subject matter was all presented very clearly and in an orderly matter. I did almost every reading and it really paid off, but in the few instances where I didn't read his lectures were so thorough that I was able to get by.

He's pretty hot. There are no in class exams but hte take home essays are extremely difficult! He's a pretty good lecturer. There were 2 TA's for this class. Anthony Estes was awesome and the other one I think her name was Murial was the most horrible person I've ever encountered. I worked my butt off for a B-. The content was abstract for this cla
must read the course reader. there are no in class exams. only takehome essays. he talks kinda fast

Egotistical doesn't even cut the half of it. Apparently it's fine to use your laptop or phone in class but god forbid anything else. He talks like he is the center of the universe and no one can prove him differently. Class has no structure other than his "look at me!!!" life stories and tangents. Would not recommend even to my worst enemy.
Awesome professor that will teach you many life as well as academic lessons. He may sometimes mutter but be attentive-- for it's always something that will be on the exam.

Professor Stanish lectures are not helpful. Majority of lecture slides are irrelevant when it comes to the exam. You should focus on the articles. Its worth more your time than paying too much attention to his lecture.

Stanish was a great teacher. He is very enthusiastic and can tell when students begin to get reckless and he'll change it up with some relevant stories in his life. Read the articles and understand the main concepts. Also come to class, most of the stuff on the tests are in his lectures. They are not hard concepts but study!
A great professor
Amazing man, I love love LOVE him.

this class is easy but the prof is an egotistical & condescending blowhard who lets his ego come before professionalism.  he often has a temper tantrum if people talk during class.  sure, these people aren't supposed to be talking, but since most of the class doesn't even notice, his public scolding is far more disruptive than those people talking.
Outstanding professor.  Will challenge you and encourage your best work.
One of the Best teachers so far I have studied from. Really explains the stuff well.

Not recommended. Tough tests and barely explain anything. Requires the homework to be done in advance for the next lecture that we haven't even opened yet. participation only to a few people that are funny in the class. the rest are just sitting there having no clue what's goin on

The class is test heavy.  The exams are long, a system whereby the sheeps are separated from the goats, and most people are in one herd.  You have to perhaps do each long problem five times at home to be able to finish the long problem without error on an exam.  That's 120A.  Not sure how 120B or 120C is like.  Felt lost on exams    lots of hw.

Tony's class is very challenging at first, which makes everybody nerves. But later, you will find that the class becomes easier, because he will repeat the most important points several times and let you understand thoroughly, which is actually good for you to process. In the final, he will give you an amazing extra credit to raise your grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Tony is a very challenging instructor. He makes you work for it. Definitely do the homework! This class is the basics of accounting so he is hard on everyone for a reason. He is a real jokester, very sarcastic which I enjoyed. Don't worry if you don't understand a concept because he is willing to break it down in class step-by-step so go to class!
very good professor, very nice, explained clearly.

TERRIBLE teacher. he expects you to teach yourself the material.  class time is wasted with him quuuuickly going over homework and playing favoritism.  he offers extra credit on the final exam so focus on that and kissing up to him.  he expects you to remember A LOT of prior material and has very hard exams.
He has a big ego and is of no help when it comes to answering questions.  I suggest taking any other teacher unless you want to have to teach yourself the material.
I don't like him. I asked him to regrade my paper and he didn't look at it and just said that whatever my TA said goes and wouldn't help me learn

History teachers can get bad. He, abeit a bit boring, was really dependable and nice. He gave study guides, posted his lectures and even planned voluntary class field trips. Although some of the lectures were off topic and not interesting (he doesn't have the same interests as students...) he was a good professor.
Wonderful.
Very nice guy.
Professor Gurval brings Roman history to life!

do well on his papers and you'll be fine. i took the summer course, never read the books, and got a 'B'. watching all the movies is very important. extra credit assignments are available. he hands out outlines of his lectures (helpful for the final) and gives you possible essay topics that will be on the final.
Very thorough. Nice guy. Knows his stuff
very snotty
He's a friendly professor who gives solid lectures.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Really good professor. He is not intimidating to talk to and is very willing to listen to his students during office hours or after class. YOU. MUST. DO. THE. READINGS. The class is a breeze if you do. Easy grader as long as you don't summarize the content and have some idea what you're talking about. Lectures are very helpful, just pay attention.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Constantly and desperately seeks validation through contrived jokes, will openly disparage a class non-complicit with this vanity. His powerpoints seem custom-made to detract from lecture cohesion and confuse students. Not a bad person - Just a bad professor.
Lectures are a bore. Reading is plentiful, and the midterm was HARD. Stay away from this professor/class if you can.

Very well prepared lectures.  The material was an excellent selection of primary sources -absolutely facinating information.  I LOVED this class and Professor Frank - looked forward to classes every week.
boring, the TA was very helpful though

give me a break! this clown is teaching is like fk hell! he's such a fk joker! yeah, take his arrogant stepping on the fk lacture and saying"so Peter the Great is 1st imperial czar of Russia. Look, he's like 12'6'" PATHETIC INSOLENT REVOLTING FOOL! Yeah, AN EXCELLENT CHOICE FOR YALL TO BLOW UR GPA! Hurry & get him!

This guy seriously doesn't know how to teach. Might as well go party and @#$% Russian chicks. He nearly never reply to our emails and always acting so arrogant when teaching. His lectures r BORING AS HELL!! Many people even slept in class. He NEVER engage the class to the materials were learning! So useless to even take Russian History with him!

Don't take this class if ur not a poli sci major. not worth all the work, extremely tough grader and gives a short amount of time for very large assignments. you will learn a lot but you are expected to complete a ridiculous amount of work. even for poli sci majors I recommend taking literally any other lower div.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: His lectures are amazing and actually interesting. He's extremely knowledgeable and he's a nice guy but way too much work. 4 short quizzes every week and 3 papers that are barely related to the lectures. I understand that he wants us to research and come to conclusions but these papers do not accurately test your understanding of the lectures.
dont take this class

This is definitely a challenging class. Attendance is required since he gives pop quizzes. The readings from which you get quizzed are not lengthy at all but you have to read carefully. He did curve the grades for the midterm, final and overall grade, so don't panic if you think you did poorly on any test.

I left a review while I was in his class, now I'm writing a new review after completing the course.  There is ALOT of reading.  About 5 pop quizzes which are difficult but good thing its curved.  Lectures are dry, but clear and comprehensible.  Exams are very lengthy.  Pros: there is an underlying theme, main ideas clear.  Straightforward.

A 'textbook' professor = smart, tedious, very dry lectures.  Tested on specifics.  Alot of reading, more than 50 pages per week.  Five short pop quizzes, first quiz average was less than 1/5.  Does not answer emails.  A 'do as your told' type of professor.  If you have no life outside academics you might like his class.

Very Knowledgeable. Midterm on spatial modeling-Hard!Median grade 17 o/o 30. Lots of Reading and homework. Group assignment-constitution for a country in list of 12.  AND for final grade must write INDIVIDUAL Constitution for another country.  Requires a lot of time. If you are not serious do not take.

a bad teacher. even tho he warns u its gona be hard and says he treats everyone fairly, his tests are unfair. people who did well had a lot of upper div ps classes on their belt. this is not an intro class at all. He spends most of the time defendin his system of grading than teaching.

I've taken Professor Levine for two course (145 AND 163). She's amazing in both! she was a lot more involved in the lecture/discussions in 145. In 163, her TA did most of the work. She records her powerpoint lectures beforehand and posts them to watch over the weekend. She had 5 quizzes(6 questions & 15 mins), 1 group project (easy), midterm,final.

Dr. Levine is very knowledgable in the field, as she has done research in kinship and marriage practices throughout her career. Although her lectures were mildly interesting and i never fell asleep, I wouldn't describe them as fun. She is an easy grader but her TAs are NOT, and they grade the midterms and finals.

Graded on: 2 exams (midterm and final) and 1 paper. Be sure to go to class and do the assigned readings! I didn't get the grade I wanted but I fully acknowledge that it was because I didn't put enough effort into the readings; nonetheless, Dr. Levine is incredible. She reminded me of why I choose to study anthropology. I recommend her class!

Yes she is tough. Theres about 5 book requirements but the material is so interesting that it's not a bore. Tips: Must be motivated or else you'll slip through the cracks, don't buy all the books just lend some from the library. She is down to earth and funny, don't mistake her for a pushover cause you have to work for your A! I recommend it

Great class! She is very organized and the readings are mandatory to pass the class. She gives several readings, but since they are very interesting it's easy to focus. class consisted of one midterm, one 8 page book report, and the final. My recommendations is: READ and ATTEND CLASS and you will be fine.

Fantastic professor! Made me very interested in the topic and organized the class well. Tests are very fair, if you go to lecture and skim the readings you'll be fine. She tests on understanding of general topics, not random details in some article she assigned. Very articulate and the course flows nicely.
the help was available when students needed them.When the subject wasn' familiar, she made them understandable with her sense of humor. There was nothing bad about this class at all^^
Terrific lecturer, midterm is very straightforward. As long as you attend class and do your reading, you'll do well. Only an absolute imbecile could fail this class.

Class was online for the fall quarter. Lectures were tenuous and very difficult to sit through. The class consisted of a midterm, research paper, and a final exam. The communication between the professor and students was lacking entirely. If this class is the only one available in myucla, look again because this is not a class worth taking.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Took this class as an upper division elective, after having the class go online and strike through the second half of the quarter. Did not make study guides accessible to anyone who was not in the lecture, made final 1 hour time limit online for 55 questions. Essay prompt was broad with little guidance given by prof. Class needed a TA desperately.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: never again
Jamie was great, but this is pretty difficult material. Wasn't happy with my grade. Expect 30-100 pages of reading per week. The final paper was pretty demanding too.

Very clear and tests are not too tough if you show up to class and skim readings. Gives extra credit on tests which are multiple choice. Would def take again shes lovely. Would recommend to any geography or non-geography major for an easyinteresting upper division.
Love her! She's smart and sassy - great lecturer!
knowledgeable professor. Very approachable and helpful. As long as you do the readings and assigned work you will get an A.

Nice lady, very knowledgable, but a bit ambiguous in her teaching style. To give her credit the subject itself is very fluid and hard to understand, but I had a hard time following her at times. Class was a midterm, 5 page paper and a final. I think I am getting a B. Just do the reading and pay attention and you should be fine.
Great Professor. Take his Comm St. 170 course! He is genuine and makes class interesting. His class materials are very interesting as well. Overall, one of my top pick professors!

rosenthal had awesome lectures!  i always looked forward to his class and the great stories he would share.  it's not an easy A.  you've definitely got to earn it.  his persuasive communication class is most definitely worth taking.
Ask him about the time he was on a Jury in a DUI case, and the girl got off because of resonable doubt.  He tells great stories.  This is one cool cat.
It's Kramer from Seinfeld meets Elvis and Al Pachino.  Always has interesting stories and keeps things topical.
Well structured. Fair grader.
No Comments
LOVE this class...must take if you are considering law.
he is such a sweetie! and a total expert on the field. i had him for summer school, it was actually quite enjoyable for school
He post lecture notes in latex online; I saved so much time on boring writing to attentively listen to class. I love this man 3

Dr. Jura was my u'grad advisor and my all-time favorite physics & astro professor at UCLA. He's a mild, gentle type who's SUPER helpful during office hours and will never make you feel dumb. Took him for Phys. 2AH, 2BH, 17, and Astro 117. DO YOUR HOMEWORK!! He passes out great review sets prior to tests, STUDY THEM! Kind, quiet, caring teacher :)

Dr. Jura was my u'grad advisor and my all-time favorite physics & astro professor at UCLA. He's a mild, gentle type who's SUPER helpful during office hours and will never make you feel dumb. Took him for Phys. 2AH, 2BH, 17, and Astro 117. DO YOUR HOMEWORK!! He passes out great review sets prior to tests, STUDY THEM! Kind, caring teacher :)

This guy picked a really confusing textbook for Physics 17 (T.A. said that, not me, though I think so too). Lectures are monotonous and boring. I have no idea what's going on. Homework is effing hard.

Professor Jura is very decent. The lectures are a bit dry, but his online lecture notes are excellent, and the course is based on them 95%. The two textbooks that are used in this class are almost never used as he assigns his own homework problems. Exams are straight out of his lecture notes, so learn how to derive every single formula by heart.
The most difficult teacher! worst physics prof at ucla! avoid at all cost! yuck!
The worst teacher i've had at ucla.
No Comments

I really enjoyed class with Bryant. He took a topic I was iffy about (evolution of interpersonal communication) and made every lecture unique and engaging. I enjoyed going to his lectures every time because he was not only clear in the information, but super helpful and a great speaker. He knows his stuff, and you read some of his work. Please take

I was nervous at first when Bryant said that the class would be based from a cognitive/evolutionary psychological perspective, but fortunately he is a very clear lecturer and he is not one to try and trick you on the exam. He is HILARIOUS and I enjoyed him so much I am taking another class with him this quarter. TAKE HIM!
He is not a good communicator.

I don't think the person below me took the same class I did--Bryant's one of the Top 3 favorite profs I've ever had, if not my favorite. The "research paper was a pain"? He lets you write on any topic you want, so I'd say it's a good deal. As for his teaching style, he's clear, passionate, engaging and funny. And tests are definitely doable.

I Didn't like him. He is unclear and likes to talk in circles in a way that is very confusing. The definitions he writes on the board are hard to read (he has bad handwriting) and even harder to decipher the meaning... readings were really boring and the research paper was a pain. I would avoid him if possible

the midterm and final were six essay questions, but they were really not that hard as long as you studied. the reading is a little bit difficult, but he goes over it all very well in class. when studying for the exam, the notes are more important. he didnt ask about anything he didnt explicitly cover in lecture. HE IS THE BEST PROF EVER! take him.

I love Greg's class!!! He is funny and knowledgeable, also very passionate about class materials. Taking notes aren't hard since he writes important point on the board. The readings are not easy easy but interesting. Knowing the concepts/ideas are more important. If you have studied you shouldn't be getting bad grade cause he is really nice! 2T, 1P

Very funny and young teaching style. Very informal lecture but writes slowly on board which is boring.  The reading is hard and you have to understand it for the tests which are essay and pretty difficult. He gives no study guide so its hard to know what to study from all the long research articles he assigns. Very friendly and helpful, easy paper
Dush bag, thinks he walks on water. Puts students down , horrible lecturer and rude. Does not explain criminal procedure clearly, also spits when he talks. Class of 1996 UCLA LAW

Visiting professor at University of Washington School of Law. Not a good experience because the course materials were presented in such a disorganized manner ("The way I do it makes more sense", he arrogantly announced during class one day). I don't see what the other raters see in him, to be honest.
Arenella is kind of old and crazy, but a good instructor.  If he's in a bad mood, though, you should lay low unless you're sure of your answer
Including instructors in the LLM degree program (obtained later), I've never had a better instructor.  Brilliant, entertaining, organized, challenging, you name it.

students who dont like to be intellectually challenged really dislike him but if you have any genuine intellectual curiousity about the subject he teaches, he is incredible-charismatic, articulate, and able to offer competing perspectives on any subject-to describe him as hot makes sense only if you are into older guys with saltpepper hair
tough, demanding, but brillant
undeserved reputation as someone who enjoys to make students suffer, he is very demanding and requires students to think critically in class-something many students dont appreciate
not good

Genuinely might be the best professor I've learned from at UCLA. He subbed in for a class that I was pretty lost in and I was basically completely caught back up after the 3 lectures he taught. He's really good at explaining engineering concepts without just throwing endless formulas at you. This guy makes me wanna become a teacher someday.

French 2 with Wadie was an outstanding experience. He was unbelievably nice and you can tell he really cares about his students' learning experiences. French 2 is a hard class but Wadie makes it manageable.

I really enjoyed taking French 2 with Wadie at UCLA. He is very nice and was really accessible outside of class over email and in person. You could really tell that he genuinely cared about students' learning. He's a great lecturer and encourages class participation to ensure comprehension. Overall, I had a great experience.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Wadie is a great TA for french! He really cares about how we're doing in the class and whether we improve or not. He tries to help as much as he can in any situation. The lecture slides are great too, you can tell he takes a lot of time to prepare them. They are entertaining and so are the games we will play to prepare for tests.

Wadie is amazing. He is seriously one of my favourite teachers I've had at UCLA so far. I had him as a French professor ( TA led french classes). He really cares about everyone and wants everyone to do well. He also does his best to add fun videos and activities as supplement to the mandatory slideshows.
Super awesome professor. Very caring and hopes the best for his students learning. He is a must take because he is willing to go the extra distance to help you make the most of your time.

Wadie is truly the best TA (not only in French but at UCLA). As a senior, this is the first time I've ever posted on this site and I think that speaks to just how gifted Wadie is. I had rough quarter when I took French 2 and in many cases, my day was uplifted by just knowing that I had French with Wadie! An absolute gift to UCLA!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: Best French teacher; hope I can take French 3 with him too!

Kernan is a great professor. You just need to show up to class and show interest in the material. Hes very considerate and helpful. Only critique is that it can be a little difficult to hear him at times.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: One of the best professors I've had at Rutgers.  Really knows his stuff, and only really asks you to care and try.  If you're out to really learn theory, this is where you want to be.  If you just need the credit, you probably should look elsewhere. He's serious about intellectual passion. I just wish the class was smaller.

Mumbles and stutters constantly. Very hard to understand in class (and I sit in front), although relatively easy to talk to. If you're not interested in theory and only need the credits, get another teacher
The hottest and most brilliant professor I've ever had.

Kernan is a curveball of a prof. Show up, show some passion for the topic, participate in class, and you'll get an A. He's not asking for brilliance, just wants you to show that you care. His approach to teaching is really cool and I admire him a lot. Makes himself available and lectures are always entertaining and enlightening. Great, no B.S. guy

Graduated in Rutgers in 2010 and Professor Ryan Kernan is easily in the top five most memorable and inspiring professor I had. I highly recommend him if you are of the artistic and philosophical minded. Especially if you are into 20th century art and philosophy. Very compassionate and inspirational. Good sense of humor too, I remember many laughs.
This is the only professor that's taken the time to give me one-on-one grading of my papers.  Lectures are interesting and clear, and grading is very fair.
mumbles through his lectures, so it's impossible to understand him.  Not at all helpful, kind of disrespectful to his students.

Professor Prager is a really sweet man. His lectures provide basically all the content you need to know for half his exams. The other half is actually reading, because you'll need to fill in the blank for quotes from certain authors. It's not entirely impossible, just figure out which words belong to who and spend time with the books beforehand.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: The reviews said he was great but his midterm was 50% graded on direct passages from the texts. There should be no right or wrong answers in a social theory class! What an awful experience :/

This was one of the hardest classes I've ever taken, but I LOVED it. I'm taking him again for soc 102 bc his lectures are incredible and so well explained. Exams are tough. You really do have to read all of the readings, multiple times, to have a good understanding. Still, he is wonderful and kind and I can't recommend him enough if ur a soc major.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Refused to let me take my midterm at another time when a business trip had been scheduled for 5 months and so I had to change my flight which cost me $250. He is such a nice guy though so that really through me off! Material is tough his lectures are good but also his midterm and final were really tough you basically have to memorize the works :/

Prager is a great professor. Soc. 101 and 102 are very difficult but he manages to make them fun. Believe you or not but it is actually fun to discuss Marx or Foucault. The only thing: people say that they got As without reading the material. I read everything and I got A-. How do they do it?
LOVED this class and Prager in particular. The material is difficult but interesting.

Prof. prager is awesome, not only is he a very intelligent individual but he's incredibly helpful.  There is a ton of reading in this class (as would be the case in any Soc 101 class) but he's really great at teaching it in a clear way...take him cuz he's cool as hell!

I hate reading assigned texts with a furious passion matched only by my hatred of all things from France. With that said, I was able to get an A- in Prager's class without reading because he explains everything so well in class that if you pay attention and at least make some intelligent insight about what is said, you'll do well in the class.
Absoloutely horrible. A complete waste of time.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: All this professor's classes are useless and it's clear that she is only in the Department because otherwise she would be unemployed.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This professor demonstrates a lack of care, and constantly tries to attempts to indoctrinate students with her personal agenda in a way that is so obvious, everyone is left very uncomfotable. Additionally, she shows clear preferential treatment towards some students over others.

This professor demonstrates a lack of intelligence, evident in her assignments of useless content and attempts to indoctrinate students with her personal agenda. Additionally, she shows clear preferential treatment towards certain students, which undermines fairness in the classroom.

This professor lacks knowledge and tries to indoctrinate students with her political agenda. The assigned materials are poorly written and valueless. Critical thinking is not encouraged; students must regurgitate her views. She makes illogical connections, creating an uncomfortable atmosphere for open discussion.

Even though she's clearly got her hands full, Dana always makes her seminars interesting and demonstrates a real interest in the work her students are doing. She's especially good at getting you feedback on your writing--that does mean she'll end up pushing you to produce good work, but at least you won't be left guessing how to do that.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Had a very pleasant overall experience with Dana in her seminar on utopian fragments! The subject matter was fascinating, and despite having a TON of things going on, Dana seemed very personally interested and invested in the work each student did throughout the quarter.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Pseudo-intellectual whose research is as unresolved and flawed as that of a High School paper.

You work hard to go to college so you may have an opportunity to sit in one of Mark Mc Gurl's lectures. He doesn't just teach literature but discusses film theory, poetry, history, art and music, and uses mixed media. A good balance to decompress with film some days, or present paper as a video or art form. Also! Truly earned his knowledge & KIND.
Great Prof
Hot. Oh, and a great professor too.
One of the most interactive and entertaining lecturers you'll have at UCLA.  He's extremely accomplished, but humble and approachable and funny.  Kinda hot actually.
Great class. I thought Chandler Bing was my prof!
He is a wonderful professor with a great teaching style ... and is readily available outside of class. He spurred my interest in 20th C Amer Lit.  Plus, he's incredibly HOT!!!
I loved him.  great teacher. really nice guy.  class passed by so quickly, it was like entertainment.  novels were great!
Very interesting and entertaining lectures.

Exams were very difficult.

Expect homework to take up to 30+ hours each.

CS97 is something new each week, covering everything from Emacs to Python to React/Node. It's a lot of material for a short quarter. Everything is interesting and everything is worth learning. I really liked the class. Note: if you are not Linux friendly it will be difficult. But maybe it's time to learn Linux. Totally liked the class.

The class was so different from the assignments that I really wasn't learning anything. His lectures were all over the place. I don't think I've met any student who has taken this class and not hated it (or themselves) by the end of it. Run.

Well, what can you say about him? His tests have no answers. Even if Einstein was whispering in your ear, you couldn't be sure if that was the answer. The specs never change they remain convoluted and full of typos. They are more confusing to understand than inception's plot. They have no relation to the material taught in class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor is extremely difficult, as if the material were not difficult as it is, his assignments are very challenging and time consuming. Very smart and knowledgeable, if you are up for a challenge be ready, i mean it, are you top 1%?
It's a hard subject, so it's gonna be hard to teach. He's extremely knowledgeable though.

I'll admit, Eggert isn't the easiest professor, but you actually learn your stuff in his class.  He has an excitment and a passion for what he teaches, and that translates into a class that students actually enjoy and pay attention to.
He is a very difficult teacher

Completely inaccessible outside of lectures, NO discussion is encouraged, the only feedback is given is a question mark with no further context of insight. It is a cruel punishment to be a student in this professor's class.

She is a tough tough grader, watch out! The course only has a few assignments so one screw up and your grade is finished. I found her a little hard to understand, especially because the lectures are slow and difficult to follow as she jumps around with little organization. I would avoid unless you've got a lot of time, patience, and work ethic.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Lee is a very intelligent and kind person who knows her material in and out. I wasn't especially interested in Chinese art before I took her class but now I find it fascinating.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Lee may be a bit hard to follow and she may grade hard, but she is an extremely kind woman and if you go in to talk to her she is more than willing to help. She really cares about Chinese Art History, and is clearly well versed in the topic.

I am going to flat out say, expect her to grade you hard. She is expecting you to be top of your game and expects you read everything before coming to class. I am alright with her lecture though it does repeat a lot on aspects she wishes you to know. Don't hesitate to ask her for help on finer points in the essay, she is there to help.
I lost my interest in modern Chinese art after taking this class.

She approaches the materials thematically, versus chronologically, which might be difficult to follow if AH isn't your interest. She was pretty clear about what to expect on the final, and repeated those points often. Her lectures weren't the most thrilling, but you can tell she loves Chinese AH and tries her best to share what make it special.
Her lectures are very difficult to follow.

i agree with the comment that said taking his tests were fun! Yes the Homeworks were WAY too hard but if you go to disc the TA gives you the answers. a lot of my friends had to take pic 10a too and they had the same homeworks with different professors so i think that comes from the department. he posts many of his old exams online study those!

class is ridiculously demanding be prepared to spend 15 hours on hw everyweek.He's also inconsistent with direction,one day he tells you this way the next day he tells you another.He's only nice to smart students and cold to the rest.Doesn't help you much on the hard hw.

I killed my self in his class, I used to work on the homeworks that each used to take me 25 to 30 hours. I ended up receiving a C+ with 79.7. I deserve a B or a B- at least! don't take him unless you have enough time to work on the homework at least 30 hours every week.

He is a nic guy, but you wont learn any thing, he spends the class time with teaching useless materials. the homeworks worth 40% of the grade and they are really hard, at leat 20 hours for each of them. exams are hard. again I should say, the homwworks are really hard, the whole week you have to work on the homework.

One of the best professors at UCLA, and probably my favorite teacher ever.  He explains things very well and I found I learned a lot from this class.  I actually ENJOYED taking his exams.  How crazy is that?  If you want a good experience, take professor Wittman!
This guy is great, take him if you have the choice.  He's so funny and he's my favorite teacher ever at UCLA.
Awesome teacher, perhaps a bit to oriented on LOTR. Really funny, makes the subject interesting and keeps lectures humorous. Wish I could take 10B with him.
Very helpful teacher. His tests are fair but not too hard. His homework assignments are good and his lectures are interesting.
He's very hands on and what he teaches is what we have on the tests. Very easy to talk to and get help from. Over all a really fun class.

Overall I had a good time in his class. The only homework we were ever assigned was readings and 3 essays. He make philosophy fun and engaging. He never brought his own opinion into the lecture. His lectures expressed both sides equally and fair without bias. You can really see the passion in his eyes when he teaches. 10/10!!!!
Have no idea what he was talking about

If you like logic to begin with, this class will be great and he will make sense. If logic isn't your thing, it will be confusing. But he is always there to help via email and consistent office hours. Textbook is overly complicated and therefore useless, but you learn everything you need to know from lecture. Good class overall.

Luca Struble gets easily distracted, and sometimes doesn't explain things in a straightforward or clear cut way, but if you ask for help or clarification, then he will always find a way to restate the ideas. Very passionate about Logic and Philosophy.

Used an outdated program as the primary class material. Easily flustered, lectures change direction rapidly and can be very confusing, will answer questions in a way that can make the entire subject more confusing.
Luca is very hard to follow, all over the place, and disorganized. He often went wait way too quickly through material and was very unclear. SAVE YOURSELF. do not take him if you can avoid it.
Solid teacher.

The most horrible person / professor I have ever come across at UCLA. Told me I do not deserve to be here because I am a transfer student. Truly disgusting behavior for a professor with tenure. Class isn't too hard tho, but she honestly made me regret going to UCLA.

P. Carney is the most amazing teacher everyone adores here. Her lectures are fascinating and she is a very positive person and encourages you to succeed. Will definitely be taking more classes with her. Need to go to every class or get good notes from peers. This class requires a lot of reading but it is intriguing and not too difficult. BEST PROF!
Pretty good, became a geog major after her class. Has strong opinions that you should probably agree with on the test.

She is the most passionate and inspiring professor I have ever encountered. She is realistic, yet positive about the future of Africa. If you are a serious student, and not a slacker, you should have absolutely no problem in her class. Listen to her instructions about the test format and her expectations and you will be fine. You will learn tons!
She's awesome!

lectures are interesting, she has personal experiences in africa that she can talk about, but you have to share her interest in the welfare of people and not just pure geography, if u take good notes u will do well in the class, she really tests on the readings!
No Comments
No Comments

Doesn't care if he messes over a student's future, even when true effort was given for the entirety of his class. It would be overall better for everyone if he just advised his graduate students to drop instead of failing them, but no thought is given towards his students. Thanks Biskup.

After spending the entire quarter doing all of the homework, which there was simply way too much of, attending lecture, and studying for the final, I was given a C in the course. What this means for a graduate student (myself) is that not only did I waste my quarter TRYING to pass and NOT getting credit, but now I am a class behind w a lower GPA.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: He's an engaging lecturer and provides good feedback, but his class is incredibly difficult. The quarter I had him I ended up spending more time on his homework than on that of all my other classes combined, and my grades in general suffered. I barely even managed a decent mark in his class. Honestly regret not dropping.

The homework is very challenging, and all the problems are special examples, but if you take the time to understand the problems then you will learn a lot.  If you can understand why behind the problems you will do very well, but be prepared to work to get to this point. I highly recommend taking this class if you plan on using the material later.

You practically need a PhD in math to pass his class. The homework is near impossible and requires you to go to office hours where you can't even take notes anyway. The TA's even had trouble solving some of the homework. About 2/3 of the class dropped before the final. I passed AP Calc BC and still failed this class, even though its the same stuff.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: No Comments

class was super hard. but he really wanted you to learn. hw counts for a lot, so do it. his office hours are helpful too. all in all, if you want a better understanding of the subject, take his class. but he prepared to work your ass off

lots of work, but the class was extremely well taught.  professor biskup is a terrific professor who expects alot from his students although at the same time he spends alot of time trying to help students really learn and understand the material.

Sam was great and I highly recommend him to future students. There were three 4-page papers, and participation - each accounted for 25% of the grade. He is a very forgiving grader and he gives very helpful feedback on papers. Class discussions were great. I really appreciated how he treated students. He genuinely cared about our opinions/ideas
Super cool. Special mind
Not that interesting and not a very good teacher overall.

He is such a sweet teacher and exceptionally intelligent. He just recently published a great piece of philosophical work in 2011 and really shows true potential as a professor and mentor. Plus, he's super attractive and from Australia! Too bad he's married!
Rutgers guy and very smart. He is young and a bit unseasoned but overall a promising teacher and researcher. I left being very interested in philosophy of language and communication.
Awesome dude. Super sweet and helpful!
He's such a sweet guy! Very interesting lectures, just really hard to follow--you need need need to ask a lot of questions. He's really smart but kind of bad at explaining things orally....

he's great at explaining things in office hours, but his ramblings during class are really hard to understand....pretty much the only thing that keeps you attentive is the fact that he's really hot and has a sexy accent!

Best professor ever. Take him if you can. Not an easy class, but you will learn a lot. Five short papers, but he will drop the lowest grade. Two midterms and one final, which are essay format. He is so nice and helpful.

if u a not interested in archaeology, don't take it. not a easy class. he is a great teacher n concern his students, even reply emails on Sat. also gives comments on papers. reading n txtbk help a lots on exams. n he is reli HOT n funny!

Trying to get help in this class was very difficult, every questioned that you ask if answered in a very unclear way so you never know what exactly to study or how to study. Very unclear and all over the place.

Great professor! Very engaging speaker. His lecture slides are avali. to print out. Readings can be a bit long and boring, but important for exams. I didn't read many and I got a B. Could have been an A if I read more. Multiple choice exams and two short papers. Finally, he is very funny and "nerdy" hot. Made me want to go to class everyday.

His lectures are dry and he is pretty boring. He is also very sarcastic which could be irritating. He posts slides online, but you shouldnt rely on that, his lectures are more informative for the essay exams. Papers can be difficult but drops one or two. He makes time for appointments. Overall the class is alright/average.

His lectures are very structured and organized. His grading system is fair (2x 1 page papers, a midterm, a final). There are no surprises in this class, he basically gives you what to study. As long as you do the work, you'll be fine. I ended up with a B+ but didn't do any of the reading, I just attended lectures (which is highly recommended).

Most organized professor I've had at UCLA!  Very clear directions and you know what's expected of you for the midterm and the final! You will learn a lot of valuable information! As long as you work hard and do your part, you should be fine!
Clear lectures, no surprises. Great class to take if you're looking for an Archaeology class from a professor who knows the material very well!

Professor Alim is an amazing individual. He is not only passionate about his students and their success but also their roles and perspectives on current issues. His lectures were always so engaging and you could see the passion for his work. There were 2 papers (supposed to be 3 but things changed because of the blm movement) and based on readings.

Despite the other reviews, I really enjoyed this class. Professor Alim is very passionate when he's teaching. I thought the class was very easy and pretty interesting. I also didn't bother buying the book we were supposed to get, and we didn't even end up using it. He also gives EC opportunities which is nice.
I thought this class would be hard, but because of Alim I was able to do really well and he gave a lot of extra credit along the way to help boost grades, great guy

At first I hated this course but overall it end as bad as it started. There was an immense amount of reading and a hard mid-term but after that the class kinda got easier. Very nice professor, very approachable, and engaging, I liked him but did not find the material overly exciting.

He's not that bad as the people below said. Yes it is true the readings end up being a waste of time, hard to understand, and so long, but he makes up for it on his exams. I barely glanced over my notes the night before the midterm and still got an A on it (all you have to do is throw in terms and your answers will be fine)
most UNORGANIZED class I've ever taken in college.  reading is assigned as if its the only class you're taking.

This class sucks!!! I have never read so much in my life only to retain such a minimal amount of information. Dont take this class unless you want to persue a PdD in Linguistics which is pretty much what you need in order to understand the material.
Unless you love stupid pointless linguistic theory, stay away. Worst class I ever took. Do not take this class. It's absolutely horrible.
Very unprofessional woman who will argue semantics with colleagues in an antagonistic way while shifting the blame away from her at any chance.

She's a very intelligent, well spoken person who really gets you thinking.  I got to read novels that I might have never picked up before and her seminar has helped me in other classes. She's very frank but not a hard grader like others say, like with all classes, if you don't read, your papers will suck and you won't get a good grade.
a great human being.
unenjoyable, difficult to understand. unfair grader. do not expect an A because she does not give them. avoid at all costs.

Professor McClure is a tough teacher and a hard grader but an awesome lecturer.  If you read her material throughly, she usually assigns about 100 pgs. a week, then the lectures will be valuable.She is very approachable in office hours and will help you if you need it
No Comments
No Comments
Amazing lecturer, very enjoyable and interesting to listen to. Not too hard or too easy.  Very fair (thus far).

Do not take this guy, I had him for both Lab courses, he's condescending and doesn't care about his student. His exams are not designed to test your knowledge but to bring your grade down. That being said I feel like it was impossible to get an A in his classes. Take any other professor who teaches the labs or prepare for a hit to your GPA

Pang was a very good lecturer. He managed to get through a lot of material over a short amount of time and make it clear as day. His exams were nothing out of the ordinary so that was nice too. He is, however, a hard grader, marking you off for the tiniest of errors. Regardless, I'd recommend taking a class with him.

In order to get an A in his course you need to be a natural chemist. His lectures are great in that they give you the basic overview of what he expects you to know, but in order to do well on tests you need to have outside knowledge and an elite understanding of the material learned in 20L, 30A, & 30B. Be prepared for the Soil Project.

I think many judge Pang unfairly.He really is a nice guy.He really cares about his students & them learning their stuff.& if you ever have a question hell be more than happy to answer and even sometimes give you "tip" questions while doin

Tough exams.  Have to know concepts & all details thoroughly.  Appears bit intimidating during class.  However, extremely approachable & helpful during OH.  Will thoroughly go over any lab & exam quest. you may have until you understand it.
seems almost impossible to get an A, yet professor isnt bad at all.  Hes competent and provides really useful handouts.  Lectures help clarify lots of material.  overall a pretty good professor
Unfair grading.
was put on academic probation for failing too many students. need I say more?

Yirush is great! Super helpful in office hours. His enthusiasm for early American history is infectious. Get ready to read a LOT every week, 150 pages a week of dense primary source material is not unusual. But if you enjoy American history you will love his class, one of my favorite profs at UCLA
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: You will do a lot of work (if you want an A) and learn alot. Great professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Yirush is very challenging, but he makes you a better writer while teaching history in an organized, logical, but interesting and fun way. His use of primary sources is incredibly beneficial, and he essentially provides you with all the evidence you need for your papers. Again, he is tough, but his criticism of your writing is truly a gift.

One of the toughest classes I've ever had, but it was worth it because it made me a better writer.  It also made me better at analyzing primary sources.  He pushes you to give him your very best, although if you're looking to help your GPA more than your writing skills take someone else.

I enjoyed this class alot. Professor Yirush really knows the subject and is passionate about it. There is a lot of class discussion and he likes to call on the unsuspecting (always be prepared). Lots of memorizing dates and reading from primary sources. I would definitely take his class again.
Yirush is an excellent lecturer - kept things interesting and fast paced.  He is tough but fair & consistent.  I would highly recommend this Professor.

He was very excited about the material, which makes the class more interesting. Make sure to do all the readings. He gives a helpful study guide a few days before the final so you can narrow down your studies. Very friendly guy.
Really knows the subject but could  lighten up on the primary source readings. He seems to take this a little too seriously. Attendance is mandatory.
Lots of extra credit it is wonderful especially i from china and no speak good english so extra credit give me C
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Babak is a stud he is good and brings the class fruit snacks and caprisun
He is open to help his students and he is cute.
Hard tests but if you show up and study youll be chillin ay lmao
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Babak is very understanding  and a very cool dude.
I love it when he brings his oldest son to class. He's such a stud3
It was several years ago, but he wasn't a nice guy.  Didn't seem to care if you learned anything or not.  VERY UNHELPFUL.
He sucks. Don't even take his class because he will not help you with anything
She tends to tell you that you do good on your drafts and then she gives you a low grade. She's sweet though!

Dr Westbay is quite a nice teacher.  She is passionate about what she teaches and is willing to offer help to students when needed.  However, she is very unclear about the assignments, and sometimes tend to grade according to effort rather than the actual quality of the piece of work.

Real good teacher but there are shortcomings to being clear with what she wants you to do assignment wise. Essays are simple and the hardest essay to pull off will be the last one. It is a good class in many ways for people with intermediate English composition skills. I actual got something out of it.
Awesome teacher
Very good professor. Gave good criticism and was very helpful in writing papers. Very willing to help.
Great english teacher, nice, helpful, interesting readings, and helps you become a better writer

Dr. Westbay is such a great teacher! I suppose I am somewhat biased because I got an A in her class, but I thought she was very fair and straight-forward. She actually gave honest criticism about my papers instead of meaningless compliments followed by miserable grades. Take her class, it's great!
No Comments

I'm not sure what everybody's complaining about.  Perhaps the same person over and over.  I rather liked her teaching and knowledge.  I felt I learned a lot.  Was she challenging - yes.  But I had a good experience here. And she is a nice lady.

HORRIBLE. her assignments are unreasonable. our assignments were posted at 6 and then due at 10 the same night. extremely unreaslistic standards for grading. The class material was really interesting, but not due to her efforts at all.

WORST TEACHER EVER!  Don't do it!  She's incredibly boring & takes it out on you when things like national holidays interrupt her lecture schedule.  She assigns papers at 5pm on Wed and wants as many as 8 pages by Fri at 10pm.  You can't cite anything!  Last quarter, she turned in 11 ppl to the dean of students for plagiarism!

WORST TEACHER AT UCLA! AVOID HER! Extremely boring, accent is terrible, cannot form a complete sentence or thought. She assigns "cold" papers where she posts questions in the morning and makes you turnitin.com that evening-AND EXPECTS 7 pages! I have a MW class, and every 1 of our assignments is scheduled on a friday! What were you thinking UCLA?
she is a very sweet lady. a bit all over the place with her notes though
cold.  you feel uncomfortable in her presence even in the far back of lecture.  the combination of her accent and her lectures makes you suicidal. and her assignments suck.

I can't remember which class I had with her but she was the most boring teacher ever. All she does is read off her notes on Pwerpoint for every single class. I actually never took a test with her because I had dropped out before I could take anymore of her. She's a nice lady but she needs to learn how to teach right.
No Comments
Best of!

If you haven't had Ciprian for any Math class at UCLA, you missed a lot... He leads you to understand Math concepts in fascinating way...The downward of having him as a professor is you end up comparing every other professor with him and gets disappointed. His tests are easy if you understand the concept. Final is little harder, but still manageabl
The best teacher ever
He is so nice! He really tries to make you understand math, poor guy. I understood all of the content, and whatever I didn't, he was there to help. His class was definitely not what I expected!
HE IS SO CUTE WITH HIS ACCENT AND HE IS SO NICE. I JUST LOVE HIM. GREAT TEACHER OVERALL.
Most helpful teacher ever, more of a friend than a professor.
take class with him, and you won't regret
The best math professor I have ever had. He teaches you to "feel" mathematics.

I'm far from being the best student in the class. But the thing is, Prof Lefkowitz actually cares. He tries to help. He reaches out. And he is so passionate about music theory, that it makes you want to love it (even when you hate it). The class itself isn't difficult, unless you zone out and fail to put in the work (like me).

It’s been more than 15 years since I attended Professor David Lefkowitz’s theory and composition classes. Since then, I’ve had the opportunity to compose, conduct, play and study in a variety professional situations. Not once I have I employed or referenced the materials, techniques or theories offered by Lefko. Patriarchal and patrician. Run.
He isn't a good representation of what the UCLA name should represent.

A terrible teacher and one of the worse communicators that I have ever met. An extremely poor representation of what this school SHOULD be. If I knew that he was my theory teacher I would have either gone to a different school or purposely FAILED my entrance exam to get placed in a nother class. STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS.
Let me add another work - hyprocrite!  What he expects you to compose is at a much higher level than what he can ACUALLY compose!!!  Oy!

The first word that comes to mind is careless. He teaches. If you have a problem, he tells you and doesn't try to fix it. He is obviously very proud of himself and pats himself on the back every class. HIS WAY IS THE ONLY WAY TO DO MUSIC. I totally forgot, art isn't subjective or anything...

Yes, vey pompous, arragant, thinks that HIS way is THE way to analyse post-tonal theory.  We only read his work-in-progress texbook with quite a few errors, and his dissertation, which is typical Eastman know-it-all rhetoric.  Too bad, he is a good guy!

The first word that comes to mind is pompous.  He comes up with wacky ideas that disagree with common analytical practices.  I found his class to be more about his little world and didn't really deal with reality.  (RUN AWAY and hopefully you won't have to
Midterm and Final are 85% in total of your grade, with each 16 points. One mis-step/losing one more point means your grade will be in trouble.

By far one of the best professors at UCLA. Had a disappointing experience with Terri Anderson and he definitely made up for it with informative and intentional lectures. The dense workload and no computer rule was intimidating at first but he was very attentive. This course improved my retention, critical analysis, and note taking skills.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Rossman is 100% one of the best professors available at UCLA. I was so nervous to take this class because it seemed very dense and hard. I am so happy I stuck it out for the long run. Professor Rossman is one of the most intelligent professors and so good at making the information understandable to everyone. I recommend this class 100%
Dr. Rossman is one of the best professors I have ever had. Such a great lecturer on fascinating material.

He was a good professor in retrospect; although sometimes he does talk fast, in isn't that difficult to keep up. Only a midterm, final (each 40% of your grade) and 6 or 7 mult. choice reading quizzes for 20%. It was interesting material and every lecture with never-before-learned material! It REALLYYYY helps to go to his office hours

He was a good professor in retrospect; although sometimes he does talk fast, in isn't that difficult to keep up. Only a midterm, final (each 40% of your grade) and 6 or 7 mult. choice reading quizzes for 20%. It was interesting material and every lecture with never-before-learned material!

The grading is subjective and the Ta's are incompetent. A student had her grade jump over 10 % after getting  the midterm re corrected by the professor.  Though the professor himself is detailed and clear, the only down side is he talks to fast.

Although I thought he was an effective teacher, since grading is primarily based on essays, grading in my opinion was extremely subjective.   In addition, papers were graded by TA's and not the professor.  Despite this, I do feel that the class was interesting only due to Rossman's lectures.

Prof. Rossman is one of the best at UCLA.  Not only is he incredibly smart but he is one of few teachers who can really teach in an effective and clear manner.  There are 3 take home papers and 3 in class exams.  Not very much reading but lectures are essential.  Take his class you will freaking love it!!!

Stay away! I dropped week 6. Carson makes no effort to teach to an undergraduate, lower-div level. He has clear communication, but grades all assignments harshly. Each homework (one/week) took me HOURS to complete. He is frequently late/absent for office hours and doesn't care if anyone succeeds. I will retake with a prof who supports my success.

Professor Schutze is one of the best professors I have ever had at UCLA.  If you study everything carefully on the slides and treat the homework sheets seriously, you will likely end up doing pretty well. And when you have things that you really don't understand, either email him or go to his office hours. He is always willing to help.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Lecture slides and homework are very well organized

This was the most frustrating class I have ever taken. Its meant to be an intro to linguistics and yet he spoke to us as if we had been studying the material for the last four years. Even students who had previously taken this class at the community college level struggled to understand. He made everything WAY more complex than it needed to be.
not helpful, difficult exams and hard to get a good grade
He is extremely hard on his students. He is not generous with his curving at all.
i completely disagree- carson was wonderful, very willing to answer questions and help during office hours.
Horrible and boring. Had him for Syntax and thought this class, Language Processing,  would be better since this his field, but I was so wrong! The class was SO HARD and POINTLESS. Avoid if possible.
Prof. Lopez is an unfair grader, a boring lecturer and difficult to cont

She's fiercely intelligent and absolutely passionate about what she teaches, and it shows. She definitely makes an effort to expand perspective beyond dead cishet white guys which is great, AND she's approachable. Just be prepared when you go talk to her. Her time and yours is valuable and she knows it. She's also an amazing research mentor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: An earlier review totally nailed it. Lopez is an activist for chicanoa literature. While I respect the voices of non-canonical authors from different language traditions, I expect my English professors to teach (and to actually know about) the works that we came to college to study. 100% correct about that "nasty side," too.

Write careful notes since her slides contain almost no commentary. She's very big on discussion, but when she does present her own opinion it's rather politically-minded. In grading, she's extremely particular so follow instructions very carefully and read everything assigned. Her pop quizzes didn't present specific passages for our use.

Not a challenging class, but Prof Lopez is unprofessional and rude. She envisions her course as a form of activism. Instead of divorcing her own personal opinions from the material, she quite often merges the two. She also has a nasty, berating side. Avoid if you’re looking for an English elective.

One of the greatest classes I have ever taken. I learned so much more than I expected about The Alamo as a literary icon. Professor Lopez is great. Students feel comfortable talking to her and she respects and welcomes student input. Such a great experience. Not like other lecture classes were you are just a passive notetaker. Highly recommended!
