Lots of reading, some of which feels like a history class, but the professor is awesome. Definitely have to read and attend lecture for weekly quizzes. She is very approachable and her lectures are very interactive (unlike other professors). Course material and lectures were interesting. Learned a lot about the subject. Thanks Professor Lopez.
No Comments
Great professor. Concerned with students and their future.

he lectures very fast. i often found myself writing and hardly ever thinking about what i was writing in lecture. tests were fair, just re derive your notes immediately after writing them. his "mistakes" were not very confusing either. they were often minor things like sign errors which i found to be very easy to figure out.

The derviation he derive in class is always different from the book and also has lots of mistake. He might be smart but he doesn't know how to teach. He should stay in the Lab not in lecture hall. Since the book derivatio and his is different, you will be even more confused. Hope he never ever teach again. Just stay in lab

He is terrible. He always make mistake in deriving formula and make student confuse. He doesn't know how to teach. He think he is smart by skipping step but he is not. He should go back to MIT and teach them. UCLA don't appreciate how he teach and also he is always late for his office hour.
No Comments
Terrible
AMAZING TEACHER!

Greg Rubinson is probably my favorite and the best english teacher I have ever had.  He makes class as entertaining as possible, and lets you write about what you want to write about.  He cracks jokes every once in a while.  He also schedules outside appointments with you for ENGCOMP 2 to work on each essay.  Your best choice!

He's a nice guy and tries to be helpful, but the class seriously lacks substance or rigor and it's kind of embarrassing that it's at UCLA - it's more appropriate for a community college or high school class.  The students quickly caught on and basically checked out, making this an exercise in discipline in putting up with it for everyone. Oh well.
greg is a good guy...very helpful
yay greg

I am very very happy that i had him my very first quarter at UCLA. Although we clashed in our political ideology, he was always respectful, and i felt obligated to do the same, one of my if not my favorite profs.

One of the best professors I've ever had. He meets with everyone individually for each paper, and he makes you feel comfortable writing about personal subject matter. Take a class with him, he's great!!
No Comments

PS 30 was a struggle for me, though most people seem to achieve an A based on the dsitribution. I found Kathleen's lectures to be difficult to connect to what we were learning in section with our TA. There was a ton of repetitive HW, and testing was kind of hit or miss. She does care though, and both she and her TA's are always available.
She is the nicest professor you'd ever found on campus!!
Good Prof.
awesome prof.
No Comments

Took her for Game theory and Collective choice classes. EXCELLENT TEACHER! Cannot recommend enough. One of my best teachers that I took at my four year career at UCLA. Very clear, very intelligent, very attentive.
No Comments

Greatest class I have ever had in my life. life changing. If you have a chance to take this class please do so. If you care about the planet and people, please take this class. You will learn sooo much but in a way that you never have before. Peter is brilliant and caring.

This is one of those classes where its up to you to take it as far as you want to learn and experience what the professor is preaching. I feel Peter always leads you to the edge of the cliff (in an entertaining and provocative way) and you're eagerly willing to jump off the edge into the abyss of knowledge. DO NOT COAST THROUGH THIS CLASS!! DIVE IN
Excellent & motivation teacher. A genius at work.

One of the most inspiring professors at UCLA.  The class is more about social awareness and taking action.  There is a typical amount of class work, but as long as you do the work it is pretty easy to get an A.  He is more about learning than testing.  Promotes a stress-free environment.
Inspiring but doesn't work students very hard.
Nice guy, but hung up on his own fame. He teaches mostly about his own life. Better suited to production than instruction.
No Comments

There's a ton of work to do, but you learn a lot- you do a lot of the work outside of class and come to lectures for solidifying the learning through participation. She gives questions that are thought-provoking w/ irl context which I think would be helpful for the MCAT. Gives extra credit opportunities that are useful. Took LS7A.
Very confusing class and the tests are much more complex than the actual stuff that is taught in the class don't take it.

Professor Aliyari is very interactive with students, is approachable (via email/zoom), and is passionate about cell biology. Exams are based off of her lectures, discussion worksheets, and readings. One is able to succeed in this class if they have preexisting knowledge in basic biology and are able to dissect through large amounts of information.
I would not choose this class. It was confusing content on the exams at times and you need to study so much the whole textbook. Don't go by her slides and the lectures only.

She often confuses herself during lectures and never clarifies about them. She literally doesn't provide any assistance outside of class! No email responds to lecture questions, and no office hours She rushes through most of her slides and often tells us to read them ourselves Her teaching isn't worth 995 $. The book only costs 80
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: EXTREMELY HARD TO LISTEN TO AND UNDERSTAND! YOU ARE LITERALLY MESSING UP YOUR GRADE IF YOU ONLY COMPLETELY STUDY OFF FROM THE LECTURES ONLY! The book would save my grade! Her pronunciation is bad, and her explanation doesn't make sense due to poor grammar speaking

She is smart and very passionate on what she does, but she is not a good lecturer. It was hard to understand - her accent was strong, and lecture is not organized. Hard to focus on lecture. She wants your participation but she wants you to explain what you didn't learn yet. This was 100 - but you have to review science paper. HUH??!?

Without a doubt, the worst professor I've come across so far at UCLA. His grading is based on 3 papers and 1 exam, which is fine for an English class. The professor is funny during lecture, but it doesn't matter because it won't help you understand his assignment. The majority of my classmates agreed that we don't know what he wants, TA's sucked 2.
I found the subject matter for this class painfully boring, but he was an entertaining lecturer. I felt his tests were more than fair.
Clear and often funny, Bristow is very easy to listen to and his lectures are fairly well-organized

Not a great professor.  At first I enjoyed the class, but then after the midterm he yelled at me for the way I was writing, gave no constructive criticism, and then told me to get out of his office.  And that was for getting a C on the exam.  Dont screw up in his class or else you will get chewed out.  I enjoyed the class till that point!
The really enjoyed his class. His accent and British humor enhanced the novels that we read.

He lectures very well, his exams were very difficult, we read some really good, and bad books, he is very serious at times, and doesnt like distractions and if you sit in the front make sure you have your books! He is very organized and knowledgable and sometimes funny....I liked his Brittish accent!

I have heard great things about this professor before, unfortunately I think I caught him on a bad quarter. He is obviously very knowlegeable about the subject matter, but tends to come off rather haughty and reads straight from a script (which I'm fairly sure is a good summation of his published book on Victorian poetry)
I know that Prof Goyal yells at department staff, showing elitism and poor character.

She hate females. Incredibly boring and opinionated. Many of us met after class for "therapy" to decompress because she is an awful person. Thank God I will never have to take her again, could not pay me enough. Her criticism is not helpful or contractive. Does not lend itself to improving. Take only if you are a masochist.

This class was taken on Zoom due to the coronavirus. Professor Goyal was very understanding and nice considering everyone was quarantined during class. We read a lot of books and had mostly lectures/discussions each class. If you do the work on time and put in effort, you'll get an A. She is not a hard grader. I recommend her
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Goyal is extremely knowledgeable about African American History. Always available during office hours, she genuinely cares about students. She is a fair grader and gives great feedbacks. She is brilliant and her passion for the topic is contagious.I loved her class and style of teaching.

WONDERFUL! Clear, organized, prepared, she makes class a breeze. The books were great and her lectures were heavenly. Study guides match the tests so easy As. Great to talk to in office hours, great to do honors with, GREAT PERSON. She was concerned for our learning and the whole class felt appreciated and respected by her.
She is a great, extremely intelligent teacher.  However, it is essential one keeps decorum and writes well in order to succeed in her class.

The readings were very interesting. That's about it. The seminars were super boring- half of the class would fall asleep. I found more amusement watching people's heads bobbing then I did trying to decipher what she was saying.
Claire was a phenomenal teacher.
Great teacher!

Rating cont. as it was cut off. She is passionate about this wonderful philosophical man, and I felt my own faith stirred after taking the class. She does talk fast, so I would sit up front, come to class early and contact OSD if you have a learning disability to ask for a note taker. She is very understanding if you have an LD. See her in o.h.

Professor McEachern is a splendid professor! Her Milton lectures were like heaven to me. The first day of class she told us Milton was her favorite course to teach, and the last day of class, I cried because I could feel her love and passion for this amazing man. Milton was also a philosopher, and after this class, I felt more inclined to return to
She is unclear in her teaching. Half the time I did not understand what she was saying because her thoughts were scattered.

She is great. Encouraging and practical. Milton is a bore but she actually makes it fun. She is easy-going and intelligent but she doesn't take herself too seriously. This is a required class for ENG majors so take it with her! But you have to do ALL the reading or you won't pass.
No Comments
Professor Levy is a fantastic teacher. Symbolic logic is not for everyone but if you do take a symbolic logic class, theres no one better.

I adore this professor, he is super kind and funny... But the subject is difficult. I dunno, I guess for some people it just clicked but there were plenty of us who struggled with Logic. No issue with Levy, though. I imagine he is the best person to take this with, you'll just have to work hard.

My absolute favorite professor. Really kind and passionate about philosophy. Do the homework and you're pretty much set. The material can be hard but Levy explains it pretty well. Exams are straight forward no trick questions.
Made logic very easy and entertaining.  Lots of fun jokes and really explained things very well.

Professor Levy is the BEST when it comes to logic. He is a must take for all Philosophy students, and anyone else who wants to learn logic, which is a skill every major should have. Levy makes it fun with a corny sense of humor,and a great teaching style. He really cares about student learning!
No Comments
Super nice guy.  Keeps class entertaining with bad puns and jokes.  Even when challenging, the class seemed easy.  If you're taking logic, this is the man to take it with.
Very good.
Pretty Good!
He was the most amazing teacher and person. I will always remember him.

WHAT A PROFESSOR.... NOT RECOMENDED. VERY HARD CLASS BECAUSE HE JUST READS THE BOOK.  I AM A NATIVE SPEAKER AND STILL I FELT THAT THE CLASS WAS HARD, WELL THE FINAL AND THE MIDTERM THAT ARE BASICALLY 80% OF YOUR GRADE. DO NOT TAKE HIM

C.B.J. is the man!!! when it comes to Don Quixote. Many may think he is not that easy, however, if you want to major in Spanish or Literature, this guy is a most have under your resume; I mean, he is Don Quixote himself!!! Take him and you will thank me.

This class was very hard, lots of reading-but it is a lit. class! I liked the prof. I thought his lectures were as clear as they could have been considering it's in Spanish and that I'm not a Native speaker. I would recommend him as a teacher.
Knows a lot, just not very approachable.

Prof. Symcox is amazing lecturer who really transmits his love for the subject matter to his students. His classes tend to be large so it students need to be proactive in seeking personalized guidance. Expect to read great amounts but this wasn't a problem for me as I already had great interest in the subject matter.
He's a really nice guy and really funny in class. His lectures don't really following the reading though and he assigns A LOT of reading. His tests are all open book and open note too.

Lectures can be rather boring and if you haven't done the reading, then you'll probably be lost. Midterm and final were both open book but he assigns so much reading and there are so many books that using them during the tests isn't always helpful. He does a poor job explaining what he expects on the tests. But overall an interesting course.

His reader is HUGE, so the open book midterm and final aren't really that helpful. He expects you to be able to use direct quotes, but the time limit makes it difficult to find what you need in the 350 pages of completely vital material. I would've chosen a more lenient grading system with closed books rather than what we had. Lectures were great!

I took his War and Diplomacy course and got a C.  Not bad considering i didnt read any of the books and missed several lectures(did not know about the podcast).  Tests are open book, notes.  Lectures were easy to follow.

Lectures are key but if you can't make it it's webcasted Prof. Symcox trully cares about subject lectures are not too bad.Open book and notes for midterm and final but still pretty hard unless you are well prepared

Class is all lecture and no work, just a midterm worth 25% and a final worth 75%. The class is also webcasted online so you'll never miss a lecture. The material is kind of dry and confusing though...unless you like European dynastic history with all those kings with the same names (I, II, III, etc) who marry their cousins and kill each other off.
He does something other professors won't do. Be Fair

I loved his Models and Simulation class and he was a great teacher. This class is also cross listed for HNRS, ANTH and Human Complex Systems so a lot of students can take it, which is great because I think that everyone can take something away from this class, regardless of major.

Professor Nardi is one of the best professors here at UCLA. He really cares about his students and is very open to letting the student experiment for themselves. I would advise anyone to take his class, no matter what temperament you are. I would also advise people to look into the HCS minor! Its awesome!
amazing teacher. has a passion for what he teaches, and is willing to help you if you ask. sometimes the class was a bit confusing, but mostly just because it is unlike any class you've taken before

Great teacher! He really wants to help students and he will take over an hour during office hours to discuss any questions a student might have.  I throughly enjoyed taking him for my last class at UCLA. Don't miss out on this great young professor who really wants to help!
Also teaches basic programming--taken over summer session, very easy.  One assignment per week.  Cannot believe it got me 5 credits.  Good sense of humor.

Dario is fantastic and the class is interactive and fune. he gives you a study guide with all the answers and there is a quiz every week but you have to be an idiot not to get all the answers right. AND he's HOT.. great eye candy

She can't teach well. She's very unclear about what she wants, because frankly, she doesn't know what she wants, because she can't program well. This was her first time teaching 10C, and what a waste of my time it was. if you have another option Take CS 32 or 33 or whatever it is instead. You'll actually learn instead of study-teach from the book.

I really liked her PIC class. She made things clearer, and after taking it, the Big C++ book finally made sense, and I appreciated it more. I'm going to miss her when she leaves for that awesome tenure track elsewhere. She wasn't a C++ master, but like, she did what she had to and she tried really hard for us. She's better at emails now. :)
SO EASY SHE GIVES LOT OF As

All the comments about her tests being straightforward are OUTDATED. Her tests are now impossible. She fails everyone. She made the second midterm which was given on the 8th week, cover everything since the first day of class. She expects you to know proofs and definitions, which is unfair. Avoid this teacher if possible. Take Dai/Oberlin for an A!

She is NO LONGER GOOD...she told us NOT TO READ SOMETHING A SECTION IN THE BOOK AND SHE PUT IT ON THE TEST..SHE MADE A PROBLEM VIRTUALLY UNSOLVABLE AND STILL TOOK POINTS OFF OF KIDS TESTS...SHE IS NO LONGER GOOD, I REPEAT SHE IS NO LONGER GOOD..AVOID..SHE IS WAAY TOO HARD AND GOES WAYY TO MUCH IN DEPTH..THERE ARE WAY EASIER TEACHERS OUT THERE!!!
she's easy gives alot of A's. barely went to class. she can be boring though.
chill class even for people that hate probability, tests are straightforward

Professor Terraciano cares about his students and the material he teaches them. He graded us based on 2 essays, a midterm essay, and a final essay. The work is fairly easy if you attend lecture or do all the readings. Great professor and class. Definitely recommend.
Great professor; glad he was willing to teach this very important material.

Professor Terraciano is very passionate about Latin American Studies. Office hours are group dialogue format. Reading-intensive course. Lectures highlight major themes and critical thinking points. Grading scale: 40% 2 essays, 10% participation, 15% midterm, and 35% final.

Extremely helpful when it came to finals, essays, and midterm. For the final and midterm, he provided a study guide that explain each part of the exam and even included essay questions that would be on the exam. He really knows what he is talking about in the class because his research is in the subject matter covered in the class.

He is very clear with what he expects, uses lectures to complement/clarify readings (of which he is the main author)...excellent readings...exams are straight to the heart of the subject matter, usually requires a paper on a related topic...fair in grading exams and papers.  Super friendly and is always available if you need him.

I took various classes with Dr. Terraciano.  His classes are very interesting, he is very clear, super student friendly.  Students do well not because he is easy, but because he has clear expectations and is always willing to help!
He is very helpful if you go to office hours. If you attend AAP tutoring, he'll review what is on the midterm and the final. Good Guy. Big Heart. Loves to see Chicano/Latino students do well.
Totally uninspirational. Last name suits him perfectly. Makes exciting composers sound B-O-R-I-N-G in his long-winded monotone lectures. Don't take!
Good lectures, excellent exams, interesting and challenging classes.  Ray is the bomb!
his name is appropriate.... k(nap)p... thats what most everyone did in his class.  perhaps he has changed.  i hope.
he's not clear
No Comments
great professor.
easy!

took his history 1A class as a pre-req. huge class. dr geary turns on his computer, gives a long (corny) lecture, turns off his computer, and everyone leaves. class is full of eager opinionated freshmen and there is a lot of fact regurgitation involved. simply not enough time to properly complete the midterm(s). a 'whatever' class.

I'll keep it short and simple, I am an honors student. I'm part of the National Honors Scholars Society and have won scholarships. Geary's class does not allow for creativity and room for thought. I've sent over twenty e-mails and visited his office over ten times. It's tough, he's not clear, and there are "set" answers for the essay tests! Beware!
His lectures are interesting and his exams teach you how to explicate sources.
This guy is BRILLIANT.  By far, he is one of the best history teachers I have ever had. He is challenging (lots of source material) but TAKE HIS CLASS!!!

The best that can be said for him is that he teaches important subjects and doesn't load the course up with a lot of make-work waste-of-time essays, like too many of his colleagues.  But the subject matter covers too much in the time alotted.  What you end up with is shallow and he too often makes cynical fun of Judaism and Christianity.
Good professor, and I loved his class
No Comments

lectures interesting. Still remember very  academic. too much crammed in 10 wks multip choice test not clear cut.  prefer cut n dry. felt like he wants to trick you. Didn't understand why he during mid n final went around helping people  some way too long. cmon its a test. know it or dont but no help nevr got to ask him why he did that.  not cool.

These lectures were amazing- I even saved the podcasts onto my computer to listen to again. Prof Barrett is speaks with incredible clarity, is kind, respectful and helpful in office hours, and posts all his slideshows before class and podcasts after class so you have everything you could possibly need to understand the concepts. The exams are fair.
There is no discussion section. All lectures are podcasted. Overall, his lectures are pretty boring, but his tests are fair. Be sure to study his lecture slides and you'll do fine.

He is super smart, and the material is interesting. I don't think the tests are too hard - they are just really good at assessing how well you know the material. Considering how light the reading, and the load is; there is no excuse for you not to.

Prof Barrett is really nice. He posts all his lectures online so you theoretically don't ever have to go to the class. Exams are hard though, questions are worded in a confusing matter so make sure to do all the reading and either attend or watch the lectures. Don't get behind just because they're online!
No Comments
sticks to book material for lectures

Prof. Burge taught some of the most difficult classes I took at UCLA. I took him a second time because the difficulty was a challenge, not an unnecessary obstacle. He respects his students and encourages growth. If you take his class trivially, it will be horrible. If you actually want to grow, then you will be rewarded beyond your expectations.
Best Professor in Philosophy department at UCLA, words cannot describe how brilliant he is
He is detailed oriented and a clear lecturer. Every word is efficiently used and examples are from and outside of the text book. If you like Kant and epistemology, take him. It was a privilege.

CRAZY BRILLIANT! Tyler is truly unique in that his teaching style and his personality make him a  perfect professor. Hands down best professor in UCLA's phil dept. Super fun in lectures and super helpful in OH. DO NOT LEAVE UCLA W/O a CLASS BY BURGE
This guy is obviously brilliant, sometimes too brilliant and it gets a little confusing. But he is really helpful with study sessions, and really knows his philosophy.
No Comments

This guy is brilliant - absolutely brilliant.  One of the brightest and most thorough minds in Kantian philosophy.  Made Everything much clearer than I've seen before - though the material is still (obviously) difficult.
Condescending and rude. Lectures comprised of unengaging slides and videos. Homework was graded based on what professor wanted specifically.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Online lecture videos show basically everything you need to know for the tests. He makes time for students online and on campus and provides good feedback.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Lew came off as monotonic at times. He is very knowledgeable about the subject of air and water pollution, but by teaching off Powerpoint, there were times where topic was interesting, but other times, lectures dragged. Provides these lectures in pdf format through class website for you to print out. Also provides podcasts of lectures?

?so you can listen to them at any time, in case you missed anything or needed clarification over a topic. This is important to have because when it comes to the HWs (6 HWs @ 20 pts each for 120 pts-out of 1000 total pts for the class), midterm (285 pts) & the final (595 pts), he is particular about how you answer short-answer Q's?

?(what he SAYS SPECIFCALLY about a topic such as population momentum, for example, rather than what is in shorthand in the Powerpoint or in the textbook). You won't get all pts for the question, & lost points do pile up in your grade. In addition, when it comes to numeric problems, he is particular about showing all steps throughout the problems?

?even if it just to convert measurements or to mention where a figure came from. Points are also lost that way, so be careful of doing everything in your head & not translating it on paper. Grade scale: 865-1000 (A), 730-864 (B), 595-729 (C), 460-594 (D). He may seem intimidating at times, but he is approachable for any questions you may have.

As for Lew's teaching assistant, I have no idea how much longer Tersi Arias will be the TA, but DO attend her sessions. She is extremely nice & helpful with explaining the topics of the previous lecture & especially with the HW problems. It's made much more comprehensible, & she even provides examples of problems similar to those of the HW.
Best class ever at UCLA. Most analytical Professor, highly organized, and very structured. I recommend it to all Historians at UCLA.

If you have any interest in doing historical fieldwork in Mexico, his courses are indispensable in terms of how to do research.  He knew or knows personally many Latin American politicians, and thus has great insight into political decision making.  Likes to demolish stereotypes about Hispanic culture, so leave your sensitivities at the door.

I agree with the other comments. He's a nice guy but VERY unorganized. The TAs do run the class. Technically, you can get a good grade if you never attend lecture but ask the TAs for some help because the assignments are based on the course reader and not too much on lecture.
Very unorganized in his thoughts and teaching. TA's run the class so try to form a good relationship with them.

To be fair I only went to 2 classes, but his lectures had no structure and he spent half of one talking about verzion's all north america plan, it was totally ridiculous. He had an interesting subject but the lecturing was just bad. PS just FYI he's been at UCLA since 1968

The TAs run the class. Keep it cool w/ your TA and you'll do well. The TAs are the key to success in this class. The paper, midterm, and final are based on information found in certain sections from the reader. Establish a good working relationship w/ your TA----afterall..they grade you

His lectures are anecdotal and without any clear framework.  If you take this class, know that you'll learn nothing, but it is an easy A.  You'll get most of your help from your TA.  Be prepared to endure his sympathy for illegal aliens, and open support of the amnesty lobby.  He also makes lots of references and jokes in Spanish.

time and time again I have met various former students of this monster in Los Angeles. all say the same sad things... basically he was abusive to the point of absurdity. gets red faced and mean whenever he speaks. always on the verge of an aneurysm. saw 2 actors walk out of his instruction and tell him to go F himself after he pushed too far

Such a knowledgable man.  It's a shame he is such a negative communicator.   I dread his harangues.  For all of his experience you would think he would be a better leader.  He expects us to read his mind. Terribly uninspiring.  Inefficient conductor.
Great teacher.  Very passionate.  Makes people feel a little uncomfortable by his enthusiasm and intensity at first, but he's great!
Thre is a method to his madness!  And he truly cares about his students.
A snob. Teaches with his nose in the air...ive never had a professer sound so condescending when answering student questions. His finals are torture as well.
I took his theater history class almost 15 years ago, and I still remember what ekkyklema and periaktoi are.  A terrific, impassioned teacher.
so fun and so passionate about performing arts. awesome and caring guy who plays the drums like no other! take his classes!

I have no idea how this professor has such good ratings. The lectures are long and boring, even for someone who is interested in the subject matter, and the only difficult part of the writing assignments is padding them with BS to meet the insane length requirements. Wen is also extremely inflexible and kind of rude. Avoid if possible.

Doesn't seem knowledgeable on subject, OR has a very hard time transferring knowledge to us students. I'm really interested in the subject matter, but feel so uninspired, and incredibly uncomfortable with his teaching style. Don't take a class with this professorer, you'll regret it.
When you look into his eyes, he looks like he's dying inside because he knows how easy his class is. Yet, he decides the material!
Patrick Wen was a very clear professor and made lectures interesting.

I honestly looked forward to coming to this class.  I had zero interest in the subject beforehand and finished it absolutely fascinated.  The best thing about this class was how much enthusiasm he had for the material, which made me enthusiastic too.  Who would've thought? Grading was reasonable and the exams were straightforward. The best GE ever.
Professor Wen's classes are always interesting.  His lectures are insightful and mind-expanding - and well prepared. His assignments are creative and interesting.  I highly recommend this Professor!

Pat is the hottest professor on the face of the earth!!!!   BUT... he is also the most interesting, interested, organized, and informative professor ever. He teaches you everything there is to know about Scandinavian culture, and his selection of books, which he requires you to read, are also great.
not helpful for students trying to improve and is very judgemental.

Introduction to Oceanography. This class lectures are all on youtube so if you are thinking to take this class, I'd go on YouTube first to see if it's something you want to take. Plus you can get a headstart watching the lectures, getting familiarized. I wish all classes were recorded. You can always go back on replay it whatever you missed.
I don't get why some people say his class is hard. Just read the textbook and go through his powerpoint. Take weekly lab quiz seriously and you will get A.
The professor was not very clear in lecture. The book is basically your only source of information. If you want to take an easy class, THIS IS NOT THE CLASS for you.
Professor Schauble is amazing! He's super approachable and nice and offers lots of extra credit!

The class was easy even if you are not a science-minded person. The lectures could drag on, but were helpful in understanding the reading material. The reading assignments did not match the lectures, but all chapters were tested on the two midterms and final exam. It wasn't the worse class, but not the best either.
No Comments

He's a very caring and forgiving professor. He says it's due one day but he honestly accepts late work and allows revisions on essays. Only thing is I feel like I didn't really learn. I based all my analysis skills from AP Lang and in class he doesn't even analyze it for us but splits us into groups to do it so you're sorta left on your own.

Professor Steinberg is a very laid back professor. I'm really bad at English but he made the class very enjoyable and easy. The class is mainly discussion (doesn't grade on it). Get ready to read 100 pgs a week and respond to them for hwk. I got As on my paper and his OHs made it easy for me to get feedback. Only bad thing is his handwriting.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: English classes have never been favorite of mine, but I actually enjoyed his class.  He gives you great feedback and really cares about his students.  He also gives great book recommendations as well.  8 years later and he is the professor I still respect and remember the most-- amazing, kind, caring human being.
He is freekin amazing!! He is super chill. Remembers yur essays and yur writing and really cares on yur improvement and is ALWAYS lenient on late material!
REALLY CARES ABOUT STUDENTS. EXCELLENT
great professor but a lot of readings
great coach. Really cares about his students.
Professor Kim is so amazing! He is so helpful and really wants his students to succeed. I learned so much from his class. If you study hard you will do well - don't let people scare you!
The worst professor I have ever had.
great guy, always willing to help
Great teacher.  Really knows his stuff and is very helpful.  Only downside is the difficulty of the class.
So helpful. I thought I would hate the class and it ended up being my favorite at UCLA. It was a lot of work, but the more you put into it, the more you will enjoy it.
No Comments
No Comments

Professor is highly qualified to do research and knows the material. It is possible to learn a lot. However, he is condescending and projects his anger at the atrocities of history on his own students. His biggest turnoffs are his rudeness, anger, arrogance and lack of clarity. Sad that UCLA has allowed him to disrespect students for over 40 years.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: As a U.C.L.A. alumnus and prior student of Dr. Juan Gomez Quinones, his intellectual prowess granted me a quality academic foundation. There are millions of intelligent educators in the world, yet very few intellectuals, such as he, whose demanding instruct helped expand both my academic potential and love towards my Chicano culture in Aztlan .
The man knows his stuff.

He is a very important figure in the Chicano movement. But thats not what this is about. His lectures are disorganized. Notes he writes on the board are barely readable. He assigns a ton of books, which he is the author. He is an easier grader though. AAP peer learning is a must for this. Midterm and Final were both take home. 1 term paper.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Worst class I've ever taken at UCLA. The professor speaks so slowly and quietly if you're not sitting in the first row, you'll hear about 40% of what he says. If you're farther than that? Zero percent. So much reading. If you want to include the rev commended readings, he asks you to purchase 14 books for his class. FOURTEEN. Utterly ridiculous.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: He is the "God Father" of Chicano Studies. Be sure to kiss his hands...Much more intellectual and sophisticated than Rudy Acuna hands down.  A great man w/ great work!!
One of the OGs... he is very good

Apter seems like a really nice guy and of course he's very intelligent...I just couldn't believe how horrible his class was. It was terrible. He never introduced a topic. He was the only one who understood what he was talking about. The readings were incredibly difficult- graduate level. Almost impossible to learn. He seems very nice though...

I took Professor Apter's class for my senior thesis, I had to write a 20-page paper at the end of the seminar. But the class was definitely one of the most unique and eye-opening course for me. I was afraid of speaking in class at first, but he is super friendly and helpful, so that helped me overcame the fear and really began to participate.

He is a very helpful teacher. The lectures are the most important and sometimes he talks fast, but if you type rather than write by hand it is very helpful. I recommend  him, the test are fair and mostly based on his lectures.
No Comments
His vocabulary is very advanced as is his passion for his work and for his students learning and teaching. I highly recommend the experience.
Lectures are hard to understand sometimes. It is important to do all of the reading. Makes it easier by telling you exactly what will be on the tests.
No Comments

master's program here, took his 215A class. The best professor I have ever had, his teaching is the best, his explained it so well, take his class was the best choice ever. He curves a lot at the end, so don't worry. If you keep your grade in midstream, even lower that mid, you will get at least B-.
Goat
God of microelectronics. You MUST take his class if u majored in EE
Simply, his way of teachingexplanation is too good to be true !
Best prof in the UCLA EE dept.  The guy is amazing.  Has great insight, can explain things clearly, and is very helpful.
No Comments
No Comments

This entire class is based on memorization. You must remember all of the vocab words just for her to put about  2-6 on exams. She gives no discretion on what will be on exams (exception of 1-2 in lecture).I would not recommend this class unless truly passionate about international law. I would definitely not recommend this professor at all.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She makes law seem so easy. Lectures and cases are so interesting. She posts all lectures to the class website at the beginning of the quarter, which lets you do things at your own pace. SUPER clear and makes things so easy to understand. ONE OF MY FAVORITE PROFESSORS EVER. Is always free to meet and gives tons of useful feedback. 10/10
Fun lectures, and super easy midterm with a nice curve, but walked out of the final feeling physically assaulted. I assume the curve was ridiculous because I still did okay in the end
Yikes, young and yet pedantic, arrogant, unapproachable. Dry, boring, uncessarily complicated. And the lady is a bit loopy and koo-koo, if you know what I mean.
Ugh, what a waste of time!

The textbook assigned does contain very dense legal material, however, she clears up any confusion with her lectures. I wouldn't suggest missing lectures or you'll regret it come midterm and finals time. If you're interested in international law, this class is for you.

Leslie Johns is an excellent professor, but her International Law class is incredibly challenging. There is a TON of reading and it is very dense legal reading that is required in order to do well on the 2 exams. The subject matter is interesting & lectures help to understand the reading. Make sure you have plenty of time to set aside to study!

Extremely strict grader. All his feedback on the papers he will return to you will barely have anything positive in them. I thought I had a good understanding of the material we went over in class. He will absolutely nitpick your paper so make sure you repeatedly go over it and make it the best paper you have ever written.

I have read a couple of posts saying that Huehls is nice when you get to know him. This was not the experience I had. However, his classes are meaningfully challenging and he grades very fair. I would suggest his classes to anyone who has a thick skin and is up for a challenge.

Prof. Huehls is a brilliant professor because he is unapologetic in what he expects of his students. He holds us to high standards and doesn't shy away from complex ideas. But though the material is tough, he doesn't just leave us to figure it out - he is very thorough in his lectures. He's hilarious and both creatively/intellectually stimulating.

This class was by far the most difficult I have taken in my three years of college. I thought I was following along just fine, but my grades in the class reflected otherwise. Everyone in my department raves about him, but I didn't really care for the class, and I will not be taking classes with him in future.

By far the best professor I've ever had.  His classes are not easy by any means, but if you're willing to put in the work you will get back what you've given tenfold.  He's engaging, hilarious, and does the best job possible to make certain his students understand his lectures.

Maybe the best professor I've had. He's funny enough to keep you totally engaged through frequently difficult material, and teaches well enough to justify how tough he is. He loves to engage his students, but doesn't force participation. Wish I could take more classes with him.

This is one of the greatest classes that I have ever taken. He is very passionate about what he teaches. This is a great class and you will leave it wanting to have learned more. Great teacher, great texts, great class. Don't get me wrong, this is not an easy class, but you will love the challenge!
rude and HARD grader!
HE IS SOOOO MEAN & RUDE!!!

I found this class to be very interesting and the lectures to be very well organized. Prof. Wohl does speak slow but that just makes it easier to take good notes, he seemed very friendly and ready to help, but it is true that you don't want to come to class late. It is also true that he is a harsh grader but if I had taken the optional midterm I would have found out sooner in which case he is very willing to point out what your paper lacked, if you visit him in his office hours

I cannot understand the negative comments I've read about this professor.  I found him to be incredibly interesting - his lectures are well prepared and well organized.  Very nice guy too. Perhaps you have to have an interest in the subject matter to begin with, but I certainly found his class to be very engaging and informative.
Gross! Bring a pillow; prepare to say goodbye to A's and hello to Cs! this guy's a rude, arrogant fking chump!

Prof Wohl is a very tough grader for a difficult class. Its basically a philosophy class - learn to love Nietzsche.  Optional midterm basically counts for nothing, grade is entirely based on the final (despite what the syllabus says).  Prof is a nice enough guy - just dont get to class late, or you will regret it.  Easy to take notes.  Expect a tough C.
The meanest and rudest and most boring professor I have ever had!!

I did not enjoy taking this class. In fact, if you're a poli sci major (or any major besides computer science) I would highly recommend taking just a regular stats class to fill your requirements. Professor Hartman places so much emphasis on learning coding that the part where you actually learn stats gets neglected and must be self taught.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Unless you have taken statistics before, or just enjoy teaching yourself material; don't take this class. Hartman is smug, and makes a clear effort to be condescending especially to those who are clearly struggling with the material. She's a smart person, but she absolutely should not be teaching an undergraduate lower division class.

You get whatever you put into this course. Keep up with the weekly reading, and you will do fine on the simple online quizzes. Honestly, do not miss class and do the reading and you should be fine. Learning how to code is hard, but that's why she puts you in groups so you can help each other out. Midterm and final are fair.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Don't take this class with her. Worst professor I have had. Not a good instructor; visibly annoyed when you ask questions or help solving a problem. Lectures from slides and textbook, does not walk you through anything. Group work, worksheets, academic papers. You know it's bad when the TAs don't know how to answer the questions on the worksheets.

Professor Hartman did an absolutely fantastic job of creating an environment where students from all ethnicities, languages, and backgrounds could excel in. As a Latina student who has always had much trouble in mathematics, science, and statistics I was worried that this course would be too difficult, but she made sure we excelled.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Stay away from this class. She does not care about her students and is truly the WORST teacher I have ever taken. She does not know how to teach and is too lazy to explain anything to her students.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Expectations are waaay too high. She kind of rushes you, which is not conducive to learning such hard stuff in a thorough way. Professor kind of expects you to be a coding whiz and about 90% of the material will go over your head. Most of class is spent asking for help and the readings are never clear & go over your head, which makes quizes hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hes a very good professor! Amazing class! I feel like I am learning more than being stressed about silly exams.

His accent is fine, the subject is demanding so don't no slackers need apply. The more I read up in this subject, the more I find his name cross referenced everywhere! He's an expert for sure and can answer any question your throw at him provided it's relevant. Difficult, but you'll learn so much. That's why were here after all right?

He is extremely well-educated and provides ample background on everything he teaches, going beyond dry facts. His attention to detail and knowledge of entertaining tidbits of history make for a very stimulating class. You write a lot but he is not a hard grader at all, and very encouraging. He is enthusiastic + informed. He made me a better writer.
Obviously LOVES what he teaches!
Very knowledgeable and helpful.
Personally found the subjects provided mind numbing.  Maybe it is his heavy accent, but I didn't feel like he engaged the class to participate in conversation/discussion of presented material

Some students felt that the thick German accent and esoteric nature of his teaching were difficult to understand.  But he was one of my favorite teachers, who got beyond the boring art-historical information and went into symbolism.

Gillespie was excellent. He's laugh-out-loud funny, very down to earth and super helpful. He really wants everyone to succeed and pass. You MUST attend lecture AND read the book. About 30% of the material on tests was from the book and the rest from lecture. Everyone should take this class (and be glad there is such a great professor for it!)
Professorn Gillespie was fun and interesting. He is hilarious and explains everything. He is able to have almost all 300 people there because he is just that interesting.

Pretty fair teacher, seems like he knows his stuff but also expects that you do, even though this is an intro class! Anyway gave him a Try and the class was interesting although the project was horrible. Also, almost always has vpl, if you are into that...

I have taken four classes with Prof Gillespie and he is by far my favorite professor at UCLA. He's incredibly easy, but he also makes the material interesting and applicable to learn so you're not just blankly memorizing stuff to later forget. I've taken 5, 111, 113, & 169 and received A's in all of them and I am certainly not an A student.

prof. gillespie is super nice (and, yeah, hot)- in office hours before the midterm and final he'd go over questions that ended up being on the test (like the ones the tas made). his lectures are really intersting & pretty organized. it was an easy class if you put in any effort.

A lot of memorization and a lab poster project that was too artsy for my taste.  Lectures were great, though-Professor Gillespie is funny and interesting.  He really makes you realize how much is out there to experience.  Also makes you wish there was nothing against professor-student relationships.  He's hot and his personality just adds to it.

Duane Champagne is a supa'star in the AIS field. Try to read any work pertaining to Natives without a citation from this man. If given the luxury of taking a class of his, I would highly suggest it. If you could care less about AIS, find another professor in the appropriate field. But as far as AIS goes, this is the dude you want to learn from!!!

He is a great professor and though some people apparently find him boring, I find that his lectures are extremely clear and I can take good notes. I guess if you're not interested in the subject, you shouldn't take the class because you'll find him boring, but he cares a lot about his subject and it shows in his lectures.
BORING AS HELL

Mr. Champagne is incredibly well versed in the subject. His lectures are extremely boring. I take rabid notes and type out everything he says (which is a ton) just to stay interested. He talks at great lengths without notes, as he wrote two of our three textbooks and doesn't really need notes. Tests are all take home essays with clear directions.
Boring Boring Boring Boring Boring
Gives a new meaning to the word "boring". Unbelivably bad lecturer

Professor Ford is exceedingly knowledgeable, and it was an honor to learn from her in a small 15-student seminar. (She's also very kind!) If you take Paris: Biography of a City, be prepared for 200-400 pages of reading a week, an 8-page midterm paper, and a 12-15 page research paper. It is A LOT of work, but it's worth it.

It seemed evident to me the Ford had interesting analysis on the topics, but they were presented adequately. Lectures are monotone and can be hard to sit through without getting distracted. In my section I was assigned a 500 word response to readings every week, there were two map quizzes, and two essays.

While the class is easy, the lectures are unbearable. Professor Ford is very descriptive, but often includes unimportant details. She is also extremely boring. While reading the textbook the material was rather interesting but when I got to lecture it was a struggle to not fall asleep.

Best  class ever. 10 percent map quiz . 2o percent participation.  20 percent short paper. 30 percent final and 20 percent midterm. Very straight forword class.Alex is a highly recommended ta. Easy A if u try. professor is a sweetheart!
Cannot recommend this Professor.  Highly inconsistent grading standards - petty and conveniently subjective.

Ms. Ford is all right. Overall, I hated her TAs cause they're the 1 who ruined my grades. When i went to see her during OFHr, she changed my grade, and i felt GOOD! Someone can say she's subjective & favor some students to others. But she's overall fair; what's NOT fair are her TAs, other insolent losers!

Gavin was very confusing in his lectures and very often went out tangents that seemed to have little relevans to the material. In general it was very hard to get practical information on the course such as curriculum or exam form.  I will never be taking another philosophy course after this experience, although I will keep reading it by myself.

brilliant teacher.  Professor Lawrence definitely made me fall in love with Philosophy,  I would always look forward to attending this class; in addition to that, this prof likes to jump a lot while hes talking .. his efforts to explain a point are extremely funny .. his eccentricities make the class worth while. great teacher.
Enthusiastic and wonderful.

He's brilliant and interesting, but wanders in lectures. Answers questions clearly, friendly and approachable. Sit close--his writing is illegible. Attendance optional, posts lecture audio online. Grading: 2 papers, 50% each, list of 6-8 prompts based on class readings, grading very fair, if show improvement on 2nd paper, can bring up grade on 1st.

My favorite professor at UCLA. His approach provides an intuitive pull that allows Ancient Philosophy to stand against many years of critical attacks on the subject that have been carried on for thousands of years. Equally, he seems to have a genuine respect for people and I believe everyone that visits him  in office hours will notice.
His writing is almost impossible to read, but overall I would recommend him to UCLA students.

Brantingham overall is a good professor, though I can't help but feel that his criminology course that I took was a bit too 'pop-culture' oriented. In addition, while small, numerous errors abounded in his slides and the possible quality of his information. Most annoying was his repeated misuse of "loose" when he meant to write "lose."
Brantingham is a great professor who goes out of his way to help students understand the course material.

The information was dry and quite boring at times but he is a great professor. He's very helpful and cares about his students. He's also very knowledgeable on China & Archaeology. Overall, it was a good class, he's a great a professor, and offers an optional paper which is amazing because it definitely helps your grade. Not hard to get an A.
Good Professor, and pretty straight forward.  Attendance is manditory at discussion sections, but the TA's when I was in the class were very helpful.  Interesting class and a good GE.
No Comments
No Comments
By far the most entertaining professor I've had the pleasure of having at UCLA, but be ready for some seriously corny jokes!

This class was my favorite this quarter.  Groeling gives awesome lectures and he really makes the information interesting.  There are 3 exams including the final worth 15 opints each and there is a group project as well.  Start the project immediately as it is extrememly time consuming!!   This class is an easy A if you do all of the work.

ok....not easy teacher....but reallllllly interesting...from his amazing articles to his captivating lectures...u'll love comm studies. NOTE: not a class u wanna take for fun...its a crap load of work.

The class isn't over yet, but this professor seems to be a very fair and nice guy. There are lots of oppurtunities to get participation credit, and he really seems happy to teach. Take his class if you get a chance
Timmy G is the man. His class is hella easy, but then again it is only a Comm. class, so what are you really expecting?
No Comments

Professor Jung is one of the greatest chemists and professors I've ever had the chance to know. He expects a lot, but it's an upper division class, so you should know your stuff. He is always fair and doesn't give questions on things he hasn't covered. Pay attention and go to lecture and you'll do fine.

His lectures are incredibly fast-paced, but his office hours are very helpful. The questions are straight-forward, but still difficult. He is incrediblt passionate and very helpful during office hours. Very hard class, but he is also a very enthusiastic professor.

He covers material super fast and writes everywhere on the board.  He does not have the best hand writing but he can teach you O chem really good. His test is easy. I think he even gave the class the old exams from the past.  Def easy A and fun lab.

I had Professor Jung as an undergraduate years ago and now realize he is one of the best organic chemists in the world.  He is also relatively articulate for a chemist.  You should value his instruction, take his advice, and work your a.. off in his class.  dude
No Comments
No Comments
Best professor ever
fantastic
Far and beyond the best teacher I have ever had!
No Comments
Excellent teacher
Freakin' Fantastic
Best professor I had in my freshman year at UCLA, engaging lectures and extremely helpful review sessions. Can't recommend him enough.

Conley is great and really cares. You should study before quizzes and tests. As long as you put in a little time you will experience the rewards. Amazing professor and really explains everything so that everyone cane have the opportunity to understand what he is teaching.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Conley is one of the best professors I have ever had. He cares a lot about his students and will voluntarily take time out of his schedule to make sure that you understand everything. While his tests are challenging, they really test students' knowledge and understanding. Take Conley if you're looking to really learn!

The other two reviews are inaccurate. I am a 3.5 student and have gotten an A- in Precalc in High School, and Conley is one of the worst teacher ever. I got all As and B on the quizzes.He has questions on his Midterm/Final never covered through lecture or HW. Exams are designed to trick you and ruin your grade. Learn some fairness, Conley!

He is extremely helpful in helping with homework and studying for tests. Very nice teacher. High recomend him. His quizzes are fair, but tests can become difficult, especially in the final which caught many people off guard. He explains things very well and makes attending class worth it.
he's a very nice teacher, pretty easy lectures and straightforward. He's very helpful! definitely recommend him! HW is not as bad either and quizzes are pretty fair.

Crager was really interesting. His presentations were always clear & organized. He took a lot of time to answer questions, even the most obvious, insipid or downright stupid ones he addressed with total respect & seemingly genuine interest. I find that really admirable and unique in a prof. Even the nice ones tend to condescend at times. Good guy.

Crager is not only competent in his field, but also great at teaching. His lectures are exceedingly clear; if you take good notes, class assignments (3 total) will be straightforward. The papers are not full-length argumentative essays. Rather they comprise 4-6 questions wherein you explain arguments from the texts to show comprehension.

He's a great lecturer who really demonstrates the importance and nuances of ancient Greek philosophy.  Extremely, extremely intelligent and always made time for me when I had questions on the subject. He devoted a lot of time to make sure I understood the answers to the questions I had.  Thank God he teaches at UCLA.
Super smart, approachable and nice, he's a clear and funny lecturer who will help students if they need it with patience. We need more professors like him around
Took Ancient Philosophy with Crager. Great lectures, and I hear he was good in office hours. T.A.s did the grading.
Really helpful and his lectures are clear and concise. Gives you plenty of time to finish assignments and lets you know way ahead of time. Actually, pretty funny and easy to listen to!
Great professor

Professor Neuman is a very nice professor. Shows enthusiasm for what he taught & toward students. Knows the subject of North Indian Classical Music extremely well and made it easy for students to understand the subject, as obscure as some of the topics became at times. Kept the class relatively light without making it too boring.

Assignments for this class: 10 quizzes (best 5 counts toward 75% of your grade). Some did prove tougher than others, but there are enough relatively easy ones that your best 5 will average out to a decent to excellent grade. Some quizzes involved listening to pieces of full songs, many of which he does send you through the class website.

Others involved determining what kind of raag a piece was (and you get to really learn what a raag is throughout the course), matching instruments with their performers, factual tidbits, etc., mainly in the form of T/F or filling in the blank (where most times, he will list the terms where one on that list is the answer).

The other 25% is on the comprehensive final, which did not involve any listening (at least on the one from Fall 2011.) Final will happen at the same time as the class normally meets and on one of the days the class happens (it was on Tuesday of Finals Week of Fall 2011). Also offered EC once during term where you create a bibliography of up to?

?25 articles on a particular topic he gives you; makes up for quizzes you may not have done well on. Overall, Professor Neuman is kind, approachable for help, & sometimes funny. Does give break during class because he noticed when members of the class glazed over. Had many guest musicians & speakers come throughout term-best part of this class!

She's Rude. if you try to give feedback to try to help her improve she will tear into your personality as a way to defend herself. Happened to students and SBA pres. Lectures are disorganized and unfocused. If you ask a question, be prepared to get an answer only to a different one of her choosing. UCLA is a worse school because she teaches there.

This professor is possibly the WORST professor at UCLA law. She gave me so much grief over things I couldn't control like immigration stuff for her clinic. I'm an excellent student and I've never had problems with a professor before. I hoenstly feel lucky to have discovered her personality before I enrolled with her. Save yourself the trouble!

Awful, awful professor. On several occasions, she refused to answer students' questions. We believe it's because she didn't know the answers. She is not very knowledgeable about Property Law -- or, at least, she's a horrible communicator. Regardless, a commercial supplement is essential for success in this class.

Truly one of the worst teachers I've ever had. She has no syllabus, no curriculum agenda,  no coherent lesson plan. Sitting in her class is like listening to a high person describe their dream - random disjointed streams of consciousness.  Whole class was massively angry and baffled by her utter lack of teaching ability or knowledge about property
her class is so soo hard.. I took her property law and since then I've decided never ever practice in that area.
Take her animal law class!  She is an amazing person and is extremely helpful as well.  You will love her class.  I certainly did!

Was extremely intelligent and belonged to 'net generation' before that generation came into existence. For that reason several students somewhat did not understand him. He was great and I learned a great deal from him.

INF STD 30. DONT TAKE HIM. HE IS LAZY, VAGUE, and BORING. THE ESSAYS HE ASSIGNS ARE VAGUE AND HE DOESN'T ELABORATE ON WHAT HE WANTS. THE CLASS MATERIAL IS ALSO USELESS IN WRITING THE ESSAYS. HE NEVER RESPONDS TO EMAILS AND IF HE DOES ITS ALREADY BEEN A WEEK OR TWO. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
nauseating
Ugh! The Worst! He's so antagonizing and unhelpful. He doesn't always know what he wrote in his syllabus and he's often unclear and un-constructive.
Smart guy, subtle humor. Classes are interesting and well prepared. Seminars have great discussions.
No Comments

I have never hated a class more in my life! She does not have office hours and is never available to help you. If you email her she is very rude in her responses and does not care at all whether you pass or not. This semester some of our class averages for tests were 40% and she did barely anything about it. She is a horrible teacher and is useless

In a weird way, I was able to learn chemistry more efficiently by taking class... Not from her horrible lectures but from having no choice but to learn from extra sources just so I could do homework and not fail the tests. Her exams were much more difficult than the material she "taught" during class.
WORST teacher I've ever had. Lectures right out of the book, very unclear, moves way too quickly, and rude if you ask for help. Made a general chem course way more stressful than need be.

She is extremely dedicated to having you learn the material. This class is not an easy A, but I feel like I really know chem. You have to work hard. Go to office hours and get to know her because she is actually incredibly nice, helpful, and she just really wants you to understand chemistry. Go to the weekly study sessions because they really help.

She really does lecture straight out of the book. She has an attitude problem. She really does not care how well the class understands the information, just as long as she finishes what she had done for the day. Read the book and do the problems she assigns and hopefully you will do better than I did.

She turned a straightforward class into one of my worst experiences. Her lectures are completely useless considering she just regurjitates the crappy book right back at you with power point slides. She goes so fast through the material that you can't even jot down a note. Plus she assigns as many as 80 problems a week. ULL REGRET TAKING HER!!!
Does a good job explaining things. Do the work and get the A. Its very straightforward and very interesting.
Really smart, has a good speaking voice.

Blank is good but the wife...prof: Atherton (sp?) who also teaches classics, is horrible! I had the sincere displeasure of having her as an instructor for the 2nd part of Plato. Absolutely horrifying experience. On the plus side, she's a Brit; awsome accent!
Take him...do the work and its an easy A
demanding but really smart and really clear.
Nasty.

This professor uses racist (against Asians and Blacks) and antisemitic language against Jews. She is also  a very bad teacher as other students have described here. She takes out her life problems on the class and everyone she comes across. It strange that a university like UCLA has some this negligent and incompetent teaching at this institution!

Not enough space in the text box to explain the pain this class brought me. No rubrics given for the essays, a total of 15 of them. Weekly homework graded on completion sounds nice, until you realize the final exam is two randomly chosen essay questions from the total 12 homework assignments and an additional personal social change one too. Awful

This professor writes vague test questions and expects students to provide ambitious responses that cover a wide range of terms and definitions that are neither listed nor hinted at.  The grading is extremely arbitrary - a 36/120 curved to a C and was considered average.  I am disgusted with this waste of tuition and taxpayer money. TAKE JEPSON!

Her lectures are well organized -- she always writes valuable information on the overhead. Her tests are somewhat lengthy, but are fair. Homework is quite a loadful. Nice professor overall; funny and tries to engage audience.
No Comments
No Comments

Sproul speaks with a monotone, but what he says is usually pretty interesting. Don't read the textbook, he covers everything in class. And usually, the example he goes over 5 times in class is the one that appears on the essay section for the quiz. Simple.

Mike Sproul is the most boring prof I have ever had.  Add to that the difficulty in comprehending him and he is definitely one I would have avoided.  He lowered my GPA significantly and bored the tar out of me.
Avoid this guy if you want to learn anything.  exams are impossible.
strictly abides by the ridiculous policies set by the department. too bad that the econ department does not care at all about its undergrad students. bleh

OK, his presentation is a little on the boring side, but I actually like how excited he gets about his own little theories.  Just study the NOTES not the book.  He has his own vision in the world, and I really liked it.  Oh, and if you take him for Econ 2 or 102, you'll breeze through 161.

Long monotonous lectures and tries to trick you a lot on quizzes that count a lot towards final grade.  Also expects you to hand in a set of notes and a long summary of one textbook chapter as part of grade.  Actually curves up!  Only good thing is that all exams are 90% multiple choice.
He's not deceiving as the previous person wrote. It's a very easy class. Just keep up with the readings do the one page papers and you'll be fine.

Do not take this class. Seems like you will do well, until the midterm. Then you think you can find redemption in the form of the papers and final. Then you cry, because you see your grade for the class and its nowhere near what you thought you would get.
I don't recommend
Boring lecturer ... the FINAL is your grade. The midterm and 4 one page papers have little impact on your grade. DONT TAKE HIM.
Great lecturer.

He seems so kind and erudite, until the final.  Just before the final he lost all clarity.  I couldn't figure out what the heck he wanted.  You'll think you are doing really well in his class and then when it's too late he'll get you.

I had Dearricott for Discrete Math at UCR a few years ago, and as a math PhD student now, I can really appreciate his class. He was very difficult(especially in his exams), but he lectures clearly, and he curves generously. If you take his course seriously and work hard, you will come out a much better mathematician, well prepared for what's next.
Hes very funny, but he doesnt seem to care about his students. He NEVER RESPONDS TO HIS EMAILS. He thinks he walks on water.

Good professor with a great sense of humor. He loves to pick on people in class which lightens the mood during the lecture. He basically proves everything in class, but then again, what is a math professor supposed to do? His test are on the difficult side but the class average is usually so low that its not hard scoring above the average.
Tests are really hard, and the homework load is so much that it takes away from being able to study.

Terrible teacher. He doesn't care about student learning. His lectures suck, so you'll end up learning everything from the book. He assigns TONS of homework that'll take you hours to do and won't be related to the exam. Do not take him.
An okay professor if you really follow his lectures and do homeworks. The tests are HARD yet not impossible to get good grades. Quizzes for this class can strike you ANYTIME so be prepared.
Worst professor I've ever taken at UCLA! Avoid at all costs!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: This lady now teaches at Texas State university. She is by far the worst professor I have ever taken. DO NOT take this lady. The way she grades is insane! You must get every part of the work correct to get any credit. To make matters worse SHE CAN NOT SPEAK ENGLISH so understanding her lectures is near impossible you will be teaching yourself the material if you take this course.

Worst professor I have  taken. Her lectures are worthless dont bother taking notes she goes WAY to fast. Her English is terrible. Homework is difficult and practice quizzes, midterms, and final were also hard. She posted the answers but it didn't help because I couldn't find out how the professor solved the problems etc.
Absolutely terrible. Lectures were useless and she gave pop quizzes to screw people over. Tries to catch you at your worst by giving hard pop quizzes and difficult homework.
She is a really hard professor.  Do not miss lecture or the sections/labs.  You will learn more from your TA's IF they know what they're talking about.  I highly recommend a tutor.
this woman cannot speak English.
She is a horrible lecturer. Never take any classes with her. She makes interesting modern art history bland and boring. Worst class ever.

Do NOT take this class. The rudest professor I have ever encountered. Read straight off her lecture notes, wasn't engaging, condescending Horrible attitude and I did not feel like I could approach her to ask questions because she always shot down questions in class. Should not be teaching. Big mistake in hiring this woman at such an amazing school.

Apparently UCLA will hire anyone. I thought that I was the only one who felt she was horrible until I saw this. I agree with everything the other three reviews have said. She isn't experienced enough to be as pompous as she is, and having a PhD in Art History doesn't automatically make someone a great professor. Take anyone but her.

Rude. Save your time/money and just look up modern art on Wikipedia. Gets snarky when people ask legitimate questions so nobody wanted to ask. It would have been nice to have had a professor who could lecture without reading off of notes the entire time and actually engage with the class. The only way she'll get a good rating is if she writes it.

She stood at the podium and read off her notes the entire session and didn't attempt to engage with the class. If anyone asked a question, she gave rude/condescending responses to mask her inability to answer them. She is too inexperienced and should not be teaching.

Despite the fact that I'm an AH major, it was difficult to enjoy this class with her approach. Most of what she says is the content of the readings spun into an repetitive web of jargon. Offered few new points and seemed offended when asked to clarify her ideas. Grades weekly responses/tests harshly and her approval rating is abysmal.

In my entire undergraduate career, this was the most valuable class I took.  I still apply the concepts to my everyday life.  Do NOT miss this class.  I would highly recommend taking personality assessment as well.

The most amazing professor.  I am not biased because I didn't receive the best grade.  However, he is brilliant and you can gain a lot of knowledge just by attending lecture.  Very strict and is by the book - no exceptions.  He also tends to favor graduate students over undergraduates, especially in respect of time and attention.

Wow, couldn't believe the curving (1 pt < Final avg + all other class pts = A-). Glad he goes by the book. Never took Stats before. Gave the top 4 in class before the Final a free A. Good/funny/boring professor. Tests you on all sorts. HW + online book are important. Iclicker for participation and quizzes. EVERY PT COUNTS: I was 1 pt away fr. an A.
Great prof for a difficult course that could be dry (lots of math). Available in office hours and very helpful. Take him for this course.
awesome class, even if you're not a psych major
funny lecture. he makes lots of jokes during classes. exam is not hard as long as you attend the lecture and read the book.
No
He can't teach at all! Thick accent - boring.
Easy class, taught directly from book, he wasn't very helpful but didn't impede learning.

He's a pretty good teacher. His lectures are pretty good and his accent makes them fun. Getting a good TA is probably the 2nd most important thing. The most important thing is how hot Aschenbrenner is. He wears the tightest jeans and has the nicest ass. I go to lecture just to stare at him, while sitting in the front row. Aschenbrenner is a hottie!
Great teacher, awesome accent, tests are reasonable, and hws aren't too hard and help you study for the tests. Definitely try to get a god TA, it makes a big difference (Sherman is awesome).
love the accent. fair grading and homework is helpful. get a good TA, though because they're the ones who do most of the real teaching

Enrolled course three days after session begun, I asked Prof. Cameron the deadline for assignments I missed via email, but never getting a single word back. A week later, he treats my catch-up assignments as 'regular' late work, by giving them all half credit no matter I turned them in ASAP. Where is all my effort putting in? What a waste of time!
Boring unenthusiastic lectures. Could almost ruin an interesting subject

Good professor, I liked the way he lectured, always very clear and organized. The class material itself was not incredibly interesting to me personally but it was taught well. Parts of it were pretty interesting and enjoyable but it could get really dull at times. Section attendance is mandatory, lecture is not. Overall pretty easy.
No Comments
No Comments

I didn't know anything about historical archaeology before this class, but Monroe totally taught us about how important a field it is.  Great lecturer.  Tests are not too hard, he gives the questions out in advance.  Be prepared for a lot of reading.

this teacher is amazing and so incredibly smart. I admit he goes on tangents during lectures and it can be confusing but he really knows what he's talking about and is willing to help. there's only a midterm and final and he also provides study guides for them. so if you do those, your certain to at least get a C. take him!! :)

Professor Boyd is awesome! The lectures are all powerpoint and most of them he posts are online. Also, all of the lectures are on bruincasat so it's way easier to study or if you miss a day. Due to budget cuts, all exams are multiple choice and have a really good curve.

great professor. wrote the textbook so lectures pretty much follow the book. he's super nice and doesn't care if you show up or prefer to stay home and watch lectures on bruincast. due to budget cuts, he had to change the format of the class: one midterm and one final (both scantrons).

Easy A. Not demanding and and only midterm and final in class multiple choice q & a. It was 30 questions and he gives you the Study Guide before. If you go to lecture, complete SG, your an idiot if you can't get at least an A-. The curve in this class rocks!!!!
I really liked that his lecture was available as a podcast and bruincast. The lectures were kind of dry so it allowed me to listen to them in the car and whatnot.
No Comments

A true privilege to study under Prof Ken Lincoln. His passion for poetry is infectious and while his lecture style and standards are intensely demanding, such is done to push students into the art of poetry, not for reading and memorization to get through a course but for personal development. Those looking for an 'easy A' ought to enroll elsewhere

Professor Lincoln is by far one of the best professors at UCLA. I took both his White Boyz Lit seminar and his Modern American Poetry course. He doesn't spoon-feed everything to his students and many find this difficult. However, he is interested in a true dialogue with his students. He is helpful to those who take the time to attend office hours.
Rude and Unhelpful
This was by far the worst class I took at UCLA.

Lincoln is a brilliant professor. The texts we read are engaging and politically charged. He has beautiful poets come in class to read their work to the class.  If you're a decent writer and you are creative you will do well in his class.

This guy is really wierd.  He doesn't talk about the texts in order.  I felt like I was in Kindergarten again because he talks down to his students and acts like we don't care about what he is teaching.

I hated this teacher, he was not only boring but he took very simple ideas and dragged it out to the point where I was confused and didnt even know what we were taking about. He also can seem to humiliate his students. He also took roll 5 minutes before class started and for all of us coming from other classes were late though his watch is fast
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Sitting through his boring lectures are beyond painful.
