As a high school summer studies student I really enjoyed the class. I found Prof. Urdank's lectures interesting. Although depending upon which midterm and final essays were chosen, there was no need to buy all the texts and this should have been made clearer at the start of the quarter.
had this guy in late '80's-early 90's and he's actually quite approachable and helpful and he made me realize that history is a rigorous discipline.

Prof. Urdank took a jockish, boorish, apathetic student and inspired a love of History.  That was me back in the late-80s. He's really laid back, but his methods are Socratic, so be prepared when you get into class or be prepared to shrink down into your chair.  My favorite prof. at UCLA, and still going strong

One of the best and nicest professors at UCLA.  There's a midterm, a short(5-7 pages)"thought piece" paper, and a final.  All the questions are straightforward; there are no tricks.  Lectures are very informative and interesting and the books he assigns very interesting.  Highly recommended.

One of the most knowledgeable teachers I've ever had in their field, and he looks like he's in his late 20's, which is saying something.  The best thing about him is that he's extremely helpful, and truly cares about his students having success though.
Amazing. Such a wonderful class :)
I LOVED this class. He is very passionate, and very nice and helpful always willing to help and give feedback
He's very passionate about teaching and just a bit of a perfectionist about it. But in a good way.
Amazing
Passionate

At the beginning of the quarter your study list will give you a couple of books that will be required for the class, don't buy them! He gives you the pdf version of everything you need to read (except one of the chapter books but you can easily find it for free online). This class is easy as long as you watch the lectures and browse the readings

EASY GE. Honestly, this was my primary reason for taking this class. I was looking to boost my GPA and this was one of the most recommended classes. Aside from that, this class was soo incredibly interesting! Worger and his amazing team were so educated on the topics and really taught the truth of Africa. I am so glad I took this course when I did!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Worger is such a nice guy! Very easy online class and accommodating for Spring 2020, our final paper was canceled! There are weekly quizzes which are pretty easy as long as you watch the lectures and do the reading (Sometimes a lot of reading btw) and occasional assignments every other week that took me less than an hour. Def recommend!
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: He's incredibly knowledgeable and overall a genuinely nice person and teacher. Gave extensions, was flexible, and his video lectures were AWESOME and filmed in South Africa.

Professor Worger is a nice person, he really likes what he is teaching and his lectures are inspiring. This class is about African history and it is definitely not boring. We get to choose our own country to study and I had a lot of fun.
Reading material is interesting. Prof. Worger is a good lecturer, very knowledgeable. His class discussions are fun!
Awesome!!!!!

Boring, but easy. Basically the class boils down to this: diversity is a good thing, let's unproblematically celebrate mulitculturalism. In other words: Little or no sophisticated conversation. She is extremely generous of students' comments, no matter how silly, thoughtless, or off topic.
As ever, Clara is great! Very helpful!
Easy, fun.

Easy, clear instruction, and you'll actually learn something about research methods. Sometimes it can get a bit boring, especially when she reads from power point, but overall I liked the class and the professor.

She's totally kind, easy and informative. She doesn't really challenge the opinions of her students - no matter how silly. Conversely, she encourages everyone to chime in. Sometimes class discussion can lag while other times it can be lively. Some of her assignments - like service learning - can be lame, but she also gets you thinking.
Prof is very interesting. Material equally interesting.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: A great professor! He explains things very clearly and with great knowledge. He is always free to meet and discuss.

Great Professor. Very approachable and is willing to answer any of your questions. However, lots of reading and study guides are very lengthy but do them as they will save you! Attend the review sessions as it will help you with confusing topics. But dont get lazy because a lax attitude in this class can quickly turn to a D or F.
It was an interesting class. It may seem like a lot of concepts to grasp, but if you keep up with the readings and go to the review sessions, you should be fine.
not a good teacher at all will give you an f even if you try an come to class and to much info in so little time so you are warned bruiners seems nice but doesnt care the TA are a pain

great educator, and immense knowledge of his field.  lectures are at times surprising, or funny, and always interesting.  Prof. Bradbury has a very personal, open, friendly, and clear style that makes the material easier to learn.
She's great and I love her street smart at Target
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: She's not bad. The powerpoint is straightforward and organized, but there's nothing you can't teach yourself. That's the problem with such massive classes. We'd all love  a Tony Robbins to keep us fresh and invested, but Shams doesn't seem to offer anything novel. Get that A and move along chaps. Scantrons and easy assignments, she's old school.
She's well-meaning and you can see she really enjoys the subject, but she's a pretty bad lecturer! She stalls alot while she's speaking and is kind of monotone:(

Interesting class; not for non-majors.  Focus mostly on vision, some audition.  Podcasted.  One written assignment, two exams, weekly homework.  Section not graded.  Cute, young, French.  Accent generally not a problem.

I loved my stats 10 class and loved my professor. I understand the material but Shams does not how to lecture.  She is confusing and drags on. The TA and Shams make some many errors on lectures and assigned problems.  The exams are not consistent with class material and there is not enough time to complete them. Avoid.
No Comments
Unbelievably cruel to students.

She is a no nonsense, intelligent woman.  I appreciate that all her assignments were specific and straight forward.  If you do the work and show up for class you will do well.  There are not a lot of assignment, but they are a bit involved.
If you want up to date, current information on user interface, searching, and automation you could find no finer professor. I found the classes and work totally fascinating.

The worst professor I have ever had. Her classroom environment is stifling and it is hard to find one’s voice. She obviously plays favorites among her students. She’s rude and lacks social mores and cues. She sticks to a rigid class schedule, even if you have questions about the course materials. She has a way of belittling people and a huge ego.
No Comments
No Comments

It's a challenging course for those of you that, like me, struggle with writing. She assigns long papers and is a tough grader. However, if you ask for help, she's always nice and willing to help. If you're good with writing and reading you'll be fine; I could've gotten an A. I wouldn't take it again but it was definitely a nice experience.
TOO much work. Her projects are interesting, but assignments are due every other day! Let me breathe, lady!
Way too much work bruhhh. Its not worth it.

Dr. Fretz comes off to me like a genuinely nice lady. There's a LOT of work and she's VERY tough when it comes to grading, but she gives thorough feedback on how to improve. There's also the nice thing of being able to drop your first essay if it tanks your grade (You write 3 in the quarter and the first one's 30%)
Don't do it.
No Comments

I loved Professor Jacoby! His sense of humor was great. His lectures were great! I loved that he assigned novels to read in addition to the textbook. I was just in awe of how much I could learn from him. I usually sit in the back of all my classes- for Jacoby, I was in the front row.

Excellent professor. He is very nice, funny and helpful. I dunno what the problem is with the other reviewers but they probably didn't bother reading their stuff. Jacoby is also an excellent writer - graduate students should not miss the opportunity of reading with him for it will be inspiring and good fun
so freaking, hard, jokes too much, grades very hard, I wanted to drop class, I wish I had...

Yes, his jokes can be boring and off subject but when he does lecture on subject, he knows his stuff.  Don't expect an easy grade, you have to do the reading.  Read and show up and you'll get an A.  If you think you can slide by skipping class and relying on what you know about subject, this is not the class to take!

Prof. Jacoby managed to make the most interesting subject of European History (WWI and WWII) horribly boring. Lectures were VERY vague and jokes did nothing but waste valuable class time. If you love History and value your GPA at UCLA, then don't take Jacoby! He's not worth the stress!

Professor Jacoby did turned the interesting subject of WWI/WWII into the more uninteresting class I have ever taken. His lectures are vague so you have to read all of the 6 books to understand the meat of the subject.Very unapproachable in office hours, and an tremendously hard grader. First, and only history class i've gotten a B in. Don't bother1

Really loved his lectures but you must do the reading in order to follow along otherwise good luck! He gives quizzes but 2 are take home. He gives you study guides for the final and a sufficient amount of time for essays. Easy grader as long as you put in some effort. 20% of the grade is just showing up to class! I think I'll get an A!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Colacurcio was really nice and funny. He gives easy quizzes--he basically hand a quiz to you you a few weeks in advance and you just have to listen for the answers. He is an easy grader too. I got an A in his class.

He is cynical and shocking but he is 100% involved in the learning of students. There are handouts, a reader and practice quizzes. He tells you what he wants for the tests, does close analysis on the texts and engages the class. VERY GOOD PERSON, very intelligent and very efficient. Straight forward class!
Professor Colacurcio is a man of staggering genius. If you really want to learn anything in an English course and you are not afraid to work, sign up for one of his courses.

You will read more than you ever thought possible in his class. He has no problem insulting people & saying crude things about them. BUT he is an absolute genius! If you do the reading you will do well. It's hard but if you do the work you'll get your A & more. The material is dry but he had many great lectures, especially  on Hawthorne and Irving.

Prof. Cola is a very intellingent man.  He does not tip his hand when teaching.  He expects you to learn, do the reading and participate.  I really enjoyed having an intimate seminar with one of the world's leading Hawthorne experts.  He is eager to see his students do well.

The TAs in this class are the MVP. It's difficult to understand what is going on in class because the outline isn't organized. However, if you ask questions during office hours and do the readings, you'll be fine in the class. You also have many extra credit opportunities. There's only 100 points total for your grade, so you can't mess up. GG

I've learned a lot from her.  If you take the Honors Seminar, she is incredibly supportive, but don' expect sugar coating. You don't always have to agree with her, but she tries really hard to be honest with her students, which is preferable to vague feedback. Also, she makes herself really available, so I would recommend going to office hours.

Her accent is not that bad. No term paper. Midterm and final(30 points each). 100 to earn.  4 quizzes (5 each). Reaction papers (5 each). Her lectures are interesting some times. She provides a lecture outline. It's a pretty easy class. Just do the readings and make sure you go to office hours. She likes to know that you're trying. Really nice!

No one can understand what the professor is saying. She seems to be going on and on about nothing in particular. At the beginning of each lecture, the TA's pass out outlines for the class, but you can still never understand where we're at in the lecture because you can't tell what she's saying. I was really excited to take this class, but hate it!

The professor is a poor communicator; she goes off tangent frequently. During several lectures, she literally stammered and babbled for 30 minutes about how conservatives are wrong.  UCLA deserves to be out of money if they grant tenure to people who can't teach.
Awful teacher. Incoherent and disorganized. Avoid at all costs.

Extremely passionate about the topic. She is very willing to work with you at your pace, but she does not accept lazy students and does not tolerate absences (unless it's justifiable). I have nothing negative to say about her. Not only is she a great professor she is very inspirational.
The best teacher and a role model for many students. Thank you Professor.
She very helpful, kind etc. She is the best!!
No Comments

Anahit is the best professor I have ever had.  Her class was very interesting and fun.  She is very helpful and works with each student individually.  She is  kind, friendly and very very smart. I strongly recommend taking  her class.

One of the most inspiring teachers/classes I've ever taken! She was so engaging and is, personally, my role model. In all of my academic career, I must say that this was my favorite class and instructor!

Really nice guy. He's always happy to answer questions, and cares very much about the success of his students. His lectures are also very intriguing and informative. One thing is that we only had 3 grades for the entire semester, which were all tests (could be a good or bad thing depending on how you do on tests), but for sure my favorite prof.
He's by far my favorite teacher this year. His lectures are amazing and the grade only based on 3 exams. If you pay attention in class and read the textbook you will be fine. TAKE HIS CLASS.

Very interesting class! It is rewarding at the end of the semester but you definitely have to  work for it. Do all the readings and keep all the homeworks. You will need them for the midterm and final! Great guy and good professor. He will usually sit down with anyone and help them with a problem.

Best Professor in the Poli Sci department. Most interesting class I have taken in Poli Sci, and its about congress, who that would ever be interesting. uses a mock congress to teach you workings of the house. seriously a must take for any PS major. he is very approachable and you really do learn a lot in the funniest way.
One of the best, if not the best teacher in the Political Science Department at UCLA.
Great class, great professor, would love to take him again if I got the chance

his class was interesting, but i think hes busy and its not his top priority, but that worked in my favor tbh it was super easy. had a group project/presentation that was pretty ok too. cancelled a couple classes, got dismissed early for a couple others.

Tyrone Howard is one of a kind. He is more compassionate than any professor at UCLA. He is there for all students that show an interest and will go beyond for those that have aspirations to pursue careers in education, as well as counseling. His lectures are amazing and he engages students with critical discussions on key topics. Take him--trust me

After taking Educ 130 with Professor Howard, I have never felt more determined to pursue a career path in education. He really cares about his student's educational goals and I learned a lot about my privileges and purposes from this class. I would take him for any other class that he offers. He's funny, approachable and someone to get to know!

He is the absolute BEST professor on this campus for ed and otherwise. Such a salient teaching style and so willing to help you in whatever way he can. (Bonus: Build a close working relationship with him and he will save your life time and time again.)
wonderful teacher, made me far more award of culture and race than ever before!

THE BEST professor EVER! I looked forward to every single class of his! 2 page journal every other week, one midterm 5 pgs final 15 page paper but it is sooooo worth it!! EVERY prof at UCLA should learn how to teach from him! you HAVE to take this class, its AWESOME!! HE IS THE BEST!
Take any class you can with him.  He is an outstanding individual and remarkable professor.  He made my UCLA experience very positive.

I thought this professor was really great.  I learn best with pictures being drawn out to explain specific science mechanisms.  Great class for visual learners.  Textbook helps but you really only need to go to lecture and review the slides for the midterm and final!  Would take this professor for other courses.
worst class, worst professor ever

Cooper is an outstanding professor. Very helpful and willing to answer any questions you may have. Two exams (2 Essays, MC, fill-in-blank & T/F) and labs assignments. Exams are very fair! As long as you study his lecture notes and understand the concepts you will do great. Book not necessary. I learned so much in this class! Highly recommended.

Has an accent, not an issue. Tests were not too good, but nothing compared to Fain's portion. Try to avoid. I hated LS 2 because of this class, but it's partly my fault for not knowing how to study for Biology classes at first. I liked LS 3 more anyways.
Interesting lectures, helpful. Tests emphasize writing so you should really understand the material. Need to study thoroughly, but not an impossible class to do extremely well in.
No Comments

Very fun and engaging lectures, as well as the Discussion Sections. The homework is easy and straightforward, but not overwhelming and also relevant. The class does start out a bit slow, but the articles you read and write about are all interesting and fun to discuss in class and in Discussion.

Diamond is, well, a gem. He imparts soooo much incredible information, and you remember years (and I would assume decades) later. I had him for two classes, both of which you must write an essay just to get into, well worth the effort. I feel fortunate to have been in his classes, he won't be around forever! Pay attention in class and you do well!
He's amazing. So nice & insightful

Extremely intelligent and insightful man.  Can be a little hard to get a hold of given his research and other obligations. Lectures can get a little dull, but overall a very informative and interesting course.
Yes, as an avid reader of Diamond, and a faculty member at another institution, I too am surprised to see no ratings on Diamond. He is like a real Indiana Jones. We need more like him in higher ed.

I can't believe no one has rated jared Diamond. He is one of the most famous professors in the country and a legend at UCLA. When you enter a mind like that you don't come out the same person. You will have a very different view on humanity and you can die knowing that you were taught by one of the greatest mind of century.
shes nice
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Too reliant on technology and has an incessant desire to make medieval history cool and hip. I may sound elderly, but I think this kind of mindset is what medieval history deserves. While the reader she provides for free is superb, the class was more directed than taught. The sources make up for what the course utterly lacks.

Her western civilization class at West LA College was fantastic. There was a lot to read and write but the content was really interesting. The best thing was -- even though this was an online class, she took the time to record her self teaching. It was really nice to have the human connection. She cares a lot about students learning and succeeding.

She is so sweet, loved taking her class. Lots of lectures and you definitely have to show up and take very detailed notes. No pop quizzes!!!! Midterm and final were easy. 2 papers-both graded easily. She's super passionate about European History! Overall, really nice professor, don't have anything to complain about.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took Kristina's class at LMU and she's inspired me to be a history minor. An amazing professor that respects hard work. Lectures are long but very interesting. Take detailed notes and do the reading! Her expectations are clear so just follow directs on the papers to the T and enjoy her dedication to the subject. A TOTAL GEM!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Kristina (yes you call her by her first name) was my professor at LMU. She is such a passionate professor on European history and is incredible intelligent. She prepares us well and gives us difficult assignments but typically grades them easily & understandingly. I highly recommend taking a class from her, but do be prepared for lectures.

She is very nice and approachable. I would suggest going to class, taking notes, and reading the book. I think if i would have done all three I could have gotten an A+. Spend some time on the paper. I thought the class was so easy i did not dedicate enough time as i should have and ended up with a C+.

Dr. Stanton lectures very clearly and is engaging. Other teachers should model after her because she truly makes every person feel important in a class of 200 while lecturing. Her lectures are such that you have to come to class, which is what college should really be about. Other professors can learn from her how to be effective using blackboard.
Pretty good class, but way too early in the morning. She seems easier though than she really is. The paper doesn't count for much but the TA's grade hard.  I still recommend it.  Take it!
read the material well and pay close attention to her lectures.  other than that, she was a really neat person.
No Comments
Good professor.  It's not the easiest class, but it is fun and interesting.
Really hard class hard grading but Prof was really helpful if you talk to him

awful professor. studied the textbook as hard as possible but when it came to exams he threw tricky problems at us that we would never expect. Ton of our exam questions were not covered in the textbook.. then how are we supposed to know how to do them? we don't have phd's in psychological stats! there were 3 midterms, YES 3 midterms!

He is probably the worst professor at UCLA. He would FAIL his own course, just remember that. If you want to preserve your GPA stay away at all costs. I heard Mcauliffes class is easier than this. Good luck!

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR, FOR YOUR OWN SAKE! He does NOT know how to teach, and his tests are horrible. 90% of the questions, we did not cover in class, and are not in the textbook. I am studying my butt off and am barely getting a C. Trust me, you will regret taking this professor.

He will fail his own exams. His exams are taken from the online text he forces you to buy which is filled with errors. Exams are not hard but STUPID. He wants to be able to do his ridiculous curve. His TAs have no idea. I dont know how UCLA lets him teach there. He himself has no background in stats or math and yet he teaches it.
Nice guy who likes to help his students.
Pretty interesting class.
Interesting, insightful, great lecturer. And extremely good-looking
Like the best grad student you've ever known elevated to professor status. That's not a bad thing. He understands what students want and need -- and he is a stimulating teacher.

One of the best professors I've had at UCLA. His courses are interesting and intellectually stimulating. He's also very approachable and not intimidating. I'd recommend him as a professor to anyone who wants to have a great class for a quarter!
No Comments

Professor Presner was an amazing teacher and mentor. I was always excited to go to class... I don't know if that was because the course topic was extremely interesting and well taught or because he is absolutely gorgeous!

Her lectures provide EVERYTHING you need for the exams. The best way to make a study guide is to just follow the lecture guides she posts online. Homework is super easy, my TA usually went over it before it was due. The most difficult things were the group projects, but if you have a good group it should not be that bad. Overall, a good class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Professor Stivers was one of my best at UCLA.

Not only is she the worst professor I have ever had the displeasure of having a class with, but she also was able to score a spot among the worst people I have ever met. I would avoid taking a class with her like the plague, even if it means taking a course that she only teaches at a community college. Its sad there are people like this teaching.

Great professor. She doesn't upload lecture notes so GO TO LECTURE as she clarifies textbook material in detail. Workload is manageable and the TA's (Nicole and Sarah) are extremely helpful. Exams are decent with majority of the class scoring B's and above. Great professor overall and she has an awesome attitude.

Professor Stivers is probably one of the best teachers I've had. There is a lot of work to do in this course- 2 big projects, 2 tests (midterm and final), and 4 homework assignments (basically something due just about every week). Although a little daunting in the beginning, I am really happy I took her class. She is a great professor!

Professor Stivers is a fair teacher. She uses powerpoints, and all the information from the powerpoints are on the test. Be sure to pay special attention to the studies she uses as examples because she does use them on the test. There are two group projects, two tests, and a few homework assignments so there is plenty of opportunity to get points.

Took his class for summer session I. Attendance counts for submitting online participation during class. His videos and graphs make concepts in health policy much clearer and more interesting (concepts are dull otherwise). Midterm & final are both MC, midterm was hard but final wasn't as bad. Small curve applied on the midterm at the end.

He really cares about the growth of his students. His lectures are interesting and funny. After the midterm, he took his time to go over questions that most of the class missed and explained why we missed them, and asked the class how he could create better questions to rule out confusion.

One of the best professors I've ever had. He doesn't allow technology, but it really is for the purpose of the class understanding the material more. GO TO CLASS, even if attendance isn't mandatory because he drops hints for the exams. He teaches everything like a story so it makes sense from beginning to end. Great professor.
Easy enough class, easy midterm, easy final, and optional extra credit paper. An A is easily achievable. Super nice guy, pushed back assignments that he saw as unfair or untimely.

He is a nice guy, but his lectures are incredibly boring. I guess you can't blame him since the material is so dry, but he could at least try to make it somewhat exciting. I put a minimal amount of effort into this class and wound up with a B, so if your GPA is all you care about, take him.

Taken 3 classes with Wilford- he's amazing. Clear, concise, organized, interesting, fair, and concerned. What more could you ask for in an upper div prof? He's not tenured but hopefully will be soon. Take him- he's not easy, but you will learn a lot, and you'll get what you put into it. He posts lectures online, but attendance is best.
Everything is on quizlet
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Anderson was awesome!  I took Accounting 1 with him at UCLA extension.  You will KNOW basic accounting if you take his class.  He gives great packets which he works through during class.  These are really helpful.  If you want to learn accounting, take this class.  He's very caring and very funny too.  Great teacher overall!

Anderson creates his own packet for students to work with. He works through problems all class, it is up to you to read the book and learn theories. He is very interactive and tests are easy, they are like the problems from class. I love working through problems and understanding how to do them. I'd rather do that then be lost during a lecture.
Anderson is great teacher. I have taken him several times and would take him again if I could. He has a way that makes you really understand accounting.

Very good teacher, very patient. Makes accounting seem like fun. At then end of this class, you will know basics of accounting, book keeoing and how to interpret Financial statements. No home work. Easy exams. Little repetitive, but thats how accounting is.

He teaches UCLA Extension accounting classes at all levels and he also teaches at Azusa Pacific University. He's got a twisted accounting sense of humor, but he also knows his stuff. Accounting isn't the most exciting thing in the world to do after a day of work, but he got to the point fast and we got out of class early 50% of the time. He always returned my emails and phone calls for help and he was very flexible. Exams were computer-based and handwritten take-homes, ok to work in groups, no homework.
very good professor
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: Hate hiim
Lousy teacher
Such a jerk
Excellent lecturer and researcher. An top-level expert in his field.

Korf is awesome.  He has extremely high standards, but he is clear and precise in lecture and cares about students learning.  I have since gone on and become a professor myself, and I try to pattern my AI class after his.  I hope I do it justice.
No Comments

I have taken many lab classes in which the professor was helpful and kind. As a stark contrast, Dr. Nakamoto is unclear, rude, and condescending. By senior year, we have learned PCR/cloning 4-6 different times. Nakamoto teaches this in the worst possible manner. It is ironic she has a gigantic chip on her shoulder when her teaching is so poor.

Her teaching was alright, however, the students could've been told the same information without her rude attitude. She could teach and be remembered for the great, nice professor she was, OR, teach, and be remembered for her rudeness... don't understand why she picked the latter.

Clearly knows very little about biochemistry.  Shows slides and just lists the different functional groups on molecules as if we never took organic...Half lecture time is spent discussing fun facts about biochemistry.  Has you memorize tons of molecules and fats.  She has difficulty distinguishing between the different intermolecular forces.A GRIND

hard. took the class fall 08. so much memorization and the final was killer. the midterms were easy compared to the final. i had an a-/b+ going into the final and got a B. i really studied a LOT for this class.  i have no idea how anyone managed to get an A.
Uses someone elses notes on a projector. Just reads off of projector and underlines words. Not helpful at all. Lectures are essentially useless.
No Comments

Comparative Psychobiology (118) with Minor was an awesome upper div class.  It really gave me a good grounding in evolutionary psych, but not the kind you get from some social psych profs (who say every human behavior however small was selected for--stupid).  We learned all about the different evolutionary explanations for altruism.  Good prof!
He's pretty funny. Clear lectures, but course content is difficult. Exams were okay, a lot of examples from lectures were on it.
No Comments
No Comments

He is the nicest, funniest, and most intelligent professor I've ever had.  He really does his job; he actually teaches! His course was EXTREMELY interesting and he is just an amazing person. He certainly motivated me- academically. Always has interesting stories to drive the point home- he's cute in an adorable way.
Very nice professor. Chem 14A is the easiest course I'm taking this quarter.
Had for Linear Programming. nothing too special, except that he calls everyone in his example "Jake" for some reason. Interesting to stare at if you get bored

No patience for students of any kind, slackers or no.  Compares his students to 14-year-olds, high school students, etc and makes them feel stupid for asking questions.  Refuses to answer questions if he doesn't have an answer prepared.
Bitter old man?  Yes.  Chip on his shoulder?  No.  Schacher has no patience for slackers, but he's a brilliantly clear and concise lecturer.
Bitter old man. He frequently likes to compare course material to 9th grade math - a sure sign he has a chip on his shoulder.

Many graduate level music classes for conducting majors at UCLA.  Be prepared!  Do your best!  Soak up all he has to offer. Even if it seems extreme (perhaps?), you will be able to apply it in the future. No nonsense. Full of artistry, talent, and methods that WORK!

An inspirational professor who is a breath of fresh air in this world where society beats around the bush, gets nothing accomplished, and then congratulates themselves.  Neuen is the real deal with the experience and international accolades to prove it.
Worth living in LA because of him.

brilliant... one of the most interesting and insightful professors i've ever encountered... always has useful and pertinent commentary on almost every topic a student could come up with... an extremely talented conductor and evangelical teacher...  one of shaw's most brilliant protoges.
This professor is innovative in course design and knowledge delivery
Very organized and clear...examples are relevant to current topics, excellent speakers. I have also taken 156, and mandatory 150...if you want an A in the class read and do well on paper!

He thinks that all of his female students like him. He really is FULL OF HIMSELF. His looks are ok, but he wouldn't pass for a model. Teaching wise, he's ok. He obviously doesn't have enough experience in his work. I had plans to sue him for some inappropriate handling of an issue. He's lucky I didn't pursue any action against him.
I really liked Steve's class. He is very accessible to students. He makes himself very available through email and is very organized.

Very helpful, but VERY full of himself. Lectures are very dry and boring and subject material can get confusing. He is fair if you make a good case and always makes himself available to students...although he's full of himself.
Engaging, but makes some weird comments sometimes.  Class itself has lots of variety, but can sometimes be boring.  Be wary, the class seems easy at first, but he uses a bell curve!

he was very disorganized and his lectures did not relate to the readings at all.  he was so into his new CD-rom that I felt that's all we talked about all quarter. and he kept contradicting himself about what he meant by popular culture.  some teachers should stick to what they know.
No Comments
No Comments

I took this professor for Arts and Architecture 10 in winter '05. He knew what he was talking about, since he was the one who created the class. He's an articulate lecturer and just an overall smart guy.   His exams were 'recognition' based, meaning if you recognize an answer in a list of choices, there is a high percentage that that response is
Great lectures! The assessments were very relevant, no trick questions. Very efficient and dedicated professor. Definitely learned a lot in his class!

Geiselman is one of the friendliest, most helpful Psych profs at UCLA, hands down.  I took 187A, 187B, and then TA'd for him in 187A.  Just an awesome class and prof.  I regularly tell people about things I learned in 187A/187B, and it's years later; that's how interesting it was.  Whether you're psych, pre-law, or poli-sci -- take it!!

Great class. Although I received a C, I still think this was the most interesting class I took at UCLA. Professor brings in Police Officers, judges, etc. to speak. The material was so interesting. Although the profesor often expressed his liberal views, he was very knowledgeable and laid back. Be careful tho, there's only 2 tests, 50% each.

Overall good prof. Had trouble staying awake for some lectures. One midterm and one final, 50% of your grade each. Make sure you do well on BOTH. Material relatively interesting, even if you're not going into law or forensic psych.
Great professor! He was fair with the material.  I had him for 100B also and he was the best!

professor miller is not a very helpful professor at all. He taught a class Spring 17 that didnt have a syllabus until a day before class started. He also rambles in a nonlinear way making it hard to determine what facts are important and what isn't. If you want to pass, take detailed notes. He is not helpful and sometimes even rude in office hours
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Comments below is just too harsh. Rick is an awesome professor, who is equipped with deep thoughts and teaches well. However, you do need to read a lot and discuss a lot in the class. If this is not a type for you, don't take the class, but he helps students to engage in discussion and clarifies their arguments. He can go little too vague sometimes

He goes over history of the US and heavily emphasizes on the military and explained to class for 20 minutes how missiles are made. Not a fun class AT ALL. No one wanted to go but you have to bcz 20% is attendance. Quizzes are 30% and everyone failed those. Tried so hard on midterm and final papers and received a C and B even tho instructions VAGUE.

He is the worst teacher. Not UCLA worthy. Avoid at all costs he is vague about both the midterm and final project and is a really harsh grader. Office hours will not help. He looks like a vampire and is extremely boring and gives pop quizzes so attendance is mandatory. The info in class is useless for both projects. AVOID if you value your GPA.

He's a quiet dude whose lectures and thoughts are a bit disorganized, but he sure knows a lot about Los Angeles. He picks really good readings. Make sure you do them, and talk about them in class. His assignments are easy but pretty open-ended, so if you're confused, just ask. Pick his brain about LA--you're bound to learn something!

THIS IS THE MOST BORING CLASS YOU WILL EVER TAKE. He talks super slowly, for example his sentences will be like this. "Okay class today.. we are going to talk... about.. the reading..." Do yourself a favor and take another class, attendance is mandatory also. The lecture material isn't even hist related, and you're expected to write bs papers
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Run away in the other direction.
Read a 100-200 pages a week and write a 5page paper every week.  It was set up as a philosophy class more than a history class.
Give you a paper to write every week with little guideline. More like a philosophy class. Confusing grader. Didn't learn anything about history,

Very descriptive about the material covered in class.  Always hands out the outline for each lecture before the class begins.  Lots of reading but doesn't grade very hard when it comes to the essays and tests.  4 assignments overall but you can choose 3: either 1 essay, 1 midterm, and the final, or 2 essays and the final.

The reading comes in small doses but is very heavy and you need to dissect it. Take notes on reading. She is very approachable and knowledgeable in the subject. Does not allow computers. Lets students go on pretentious rants sometimes. Overall, knows her stuff and cares, but it's a tough topic. Don't be afraid to ask questions.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: The best philosophy professor I have taken so far. She has a great way of putting complex material into an easier context making out more enjoyable and understandable. She's funny and extremely knowledgeable on ethics and life overall.

perhaps it was because I loved the subject, but all my senses were focused completely on her and her words when she lectured; a very engaging, calculating lecturer, and always was concerned with student questions
The foremost leading authority on Kantian Ethics and Moral Philosophy, AND a very good teacher; a must have as a student of philosophy.
Really fun teacher. Easy to understand. Really fair. Really nice.
Definitely knows her stuff.  For some reason, the other students don't respect her.  She shouldn't worry about that, she's better than that!!!
sdgsdy
can't teach

Simple rule for taking this class: you must WANT to take it. Study a little each week. Cramming will NOT...WORK. Ohyun and Rey(TA) are very approachable and eager to help you in and out of office hours, though.
No Comments

HE's awesome. Just do the problem sets and you're good to go. Attendance is not mandatory but that's how you can learn. He does a lot of demos in class so that's super helpful. He's only teaching it once a year, if he does, TAKE HIM!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Excellent professor! In fact, one of the best I have encountered. The other reviewers will say the same thing except, I found my TA extremely helpful and prepared. My discussions on Thursdays were always packed with 60+ students and after he would always stay after to help us out. Overall, this was a great class. Attend all classes and do all HW!
Excellent lectures. You learn so much. TA's not so good, so stick to the prof, and attend all lectures and you will be just fine.

Very well organized lectures. Hes is helpful and polite. Takes the time to teach so you really learn from him. TA's not that well prepared - so attend all lectures & do all homework and practice tests and you will do fine. PS: see him on YouTube, look up UCLA chem American Chemical Society video and comment !!

The best chemistry professor I ever had as undergradate at ULCA.  Kaner is very knowledgeable and very caring to his students.  He is young and energetic... has a profound passion in teaching.  Take his class... you will learn so much.  Kaner rocks!!!

Prof. Elieraas is a one of the best professors I've ever had. She listens, she cares, she is passionate about learning, and what she teaches you in class is very near and dear to her heart. Everything she says is worded so beautifully, she'll be lecturing, weaving her tale of truth and justice, you're just sitting in awe like 'YAS TELL 'EM SIS'.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Eileraas has been, HANDS DOWN, the greatest professor at USC I have had so far. Everything that comes out of her mouth is intelligent, sharp, and clearcut. Her lectures are long and she does assign a lot of dry readings (the ones I read were v interesting.) Have to be interested in the subject or she will bore you. PARTICIPATION MATTERS!

Dr. Eileraas is a wonderful professor with an amazing ability to articulate her lectures clearly and challenge student's generalized thinking. Her lectures satisfy many different learning techniques as she incorporates music, quotes, videos, additional literature and great insight concerning the subject material. The absolute best professor ever!
amazing and inspiring.

An extremely helpful professor. Cares about learning. Seems somewhat unapproachable but very pleasant if you do. Teaches all sides of feminist theory without personal bias. One of the best WS professors at UCLA.

Dr. Chatterjee provides a vast amount of resources, that if taken advantage of, can help you ace the class.  Her lectures are very thorough and cover all the material you need to know. Her practice tests and recitations are a great way to enforce the material you learn. Her office hours and review sessions are amazing and highly useful to succeed.

Professor Chatterjee tells you how the class goes from the very beginning of the course.  She recommends reviewing the notes at the end of the day and to do the homework. She does lag on assignment postings though. It's important not to miss a single class.  I highly recommend the solutions manual for the course, otherwise you'll be lost.

Took Prof. Chatterjee for 30B.  Not sure how I did in the class but when compared to 30A, which she also taught, she was not as lucid in the subject matter. She gave a lot historical and technical background, which I thought was unneccessary. Instead, she should have focused on more examples when explaining IR, H NMR and Mass spec. topics.

Prof. Chatterjee is challenging which is good to some extent.  Her exams are long, and require you to be a good speed test taker. I would have to say 30A was mainly lecture based but you still have to do homework to fully understand concepts.  The class is quite fast paced so reviewing notes at the end of the day is crucial.

DO NOTTTTTTTT take Organic chemistry with this professor. I took Organic chem 30A with professor merlic and I got an A, I took 30B with this professor and I got a C. She does nottttt teach well, her exams are not well written, she does not curve the way she is supposed to. Its one of those classes that you are going to just hate everything about it
Is pompous and a know it all.
Best teacher at UCLA Law
No Comments

Professor Beard is one of the more engaging, realistic and fascinating teachers at UCLA. He  is a student favorite and one of the only professor that has extensive experienced practicing law. Don't miss out on taking his national Security or International Law courses; they are fascinating.
Fantastic teacher, one of the most knowledgable men I've ever met.  Refreshingly bitter and cynical about most things.  Tough on tests, but you learn enough it's worth it.
Adored this professor! Caring, helpful, and makes class interesting; knowledgable in the field and often spoke from experience with poets/authors/artists. A LOT of reading, but all enjoyable.

OMG I'm dying in this summer cover 19 era. He expects us to write so many papers and the reading is exorbitant. I wish so badly somebody would have written a review letting me know these things. It's so unrealistic, the workload. He's super cool though and the articles, books and movies required are stellar.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Stefans is one of the kindest,interesting professors I've ever come across. His methods for teaching are relaxed and he encourages participation from everyone. Lets the class build off of what other students contribute rather than just focusing on lecture. Books are the most unusual but really intriguing. Lots of film analyses with lit. Easygoing

Took his Visual Lit class because it sounded interesting. Total waste of time (and money for all the books he asks us to read). Very disorganized, and outlines what is expected of you very poorly. Each lecture he expects you to be an expert on subjects he doesn't bother to explain. Only one paper and no midterm or final, but still can't recommend

What a complete and total waste of time. Stefans never explains anything, adds a ton of reading to what's already assigned, shows up late, and doesn't say anything about his grading policies. I'm not afraid to work hard, but after  week two, I was over this guy;  this class is a major outlet for his pretentious, hipster poetry. Worst class taken.
The best professor I have had at UCLA. Many of us have a lot to thank her for.
Ugh. Professor needs to get over herself.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

It's a lot of reading a writing about Sumeria. The lectures are unorganized and occasionally simply repeated with a different narrative. Comprehensive but redundant reading. Non-majors beware, this class is heavy.

Took her for an Assyrian course and she is by far the worst professor/teacher I have ever had. She is passionate but her lectures are hard to follow and boring. She never followed our course reader and expected us to know all about the Bible. If you are a biblical studies major she will probably love you but if you aren't, STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Mixed.  Condescending to some students, helpful to others.  Decent papers, but horrible examinations with an infamous misleading essay question on Gilgamesh.  Strict on grading despite versatile topics.  Passionate but downplayed in lectures.  Classmates were often bored.  Lot of computer troubles.  Not a bad class at all, but not that exciting.
I would rather pass a gall stone during a Yanni concert.
if you can help it, don't.
This professor makes things much harder than they need to be. If you can avoid him, I would.

I did not enjoy this class at all. Was disappointed due to my original liking on the topic being changed because of his teaching strategies. He is extremely knowledgeable in every course he teaches, but expects you to be on the same expert level as he is. He is also unclear on his expectations, then gets confused as to why they were not met.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Very knowledgable about subject matter and dedicated to his field. Always up for out of class discussions about philosophy and behaviorism and very reachable when needed.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Personally knowledgeable about subject, terrible teacher who assumes that you too are a learning expert.Exam questions did not fairly represent the material learned in class, responsible for information in text even if it it not covered in class. can tell that he didn't know how to write a good exam yet...maybe in 10 years he'll be a better teacher

This class was a struggle. The material is difficult to grasp and it seemed like he was not willing to help at all. He does not care about the students learning at all. His first test is very easy but the remaining two are very difficult especially the second one. If you want to have a enriching course where you will succeed don't take him.
lame
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
loves those cadavers a bit too much

These comments are terribly unfair. Dr. Maack has won teaching awards at UCLA. She is a dedicated and caring teaching who provides a solid foundation in her courses. I've taken several classes with her and would take many more. Dr. Maack made a major differenc in my career, as a mentor and supporter. Don't believe everything you read on this site!
She makes me feel uncomfortable in class because of her cold, indifferent gaze.
Guest speakers are interesting. They range from good to excellent. Easy class that can occasionally get boring. Sometimes she ends class later than the class is scheduled.
Boring, and the assignments have very detailed, unclear directions. She hasn't really been in the trenches of reference for years, and it shows in her assignments. She's approachable though.
Think her voice is bad, try her assignments.  This woman is A-W-F-U-L.

Grading scheme is more confusing than the material. So many random extra credit opportunities that no one knows that they actually figure in. She assumes everyone has taken AP Physics (which will help you a lot) so she never teaches any basics. You end up doing okay though because she really wants you to succeed whether or not you learn.

After having a good experience with her for 6A I figured, why not?   Big mistake.   It was her first quarter teaching it and man oh man did it show. I feel like I retained nothing from the class and it was very tough for someone like me who's not all that good at physics.
The quizzes correspond to a large chunk of the grade but do not make sense ,and there is no make up.

Dr. Shaked managed to make physics VERY engaging, something surprising as Ive always despised physics. That being said, her in class examples were WAY simpler than the examples given on tests and her practice exams seemed far too easy in comparison to tests. A tough class for someone who never really cared for physics like myself.
In class examples are easy but homework is hard. Doesn't allow calculators on test
Best prof at school. Super clear and caring. Wishes hbe were joel mchale

Doesn't have the slightest clue on how to teach. He thinks he's funny but he's not. He is trying really hard to imitate some of the more liked professors in the management department but I don't think he'll ever get there.
Take this professor, he's cool.
so funny also the content is super useful if you are entering the managerial finance realm.
He's a good guy, very organized, and funny

He is really knowledgeable. He lectures with passion and enthusiasm. There is a couple of assignments but he does give clear instructions on what he wants and what he looking for. Will fail students for not citing correctly or at all.

One of the best professors at CSULA. He is too smart for his own good. Extremely passionate about his lectures and gets students engaged. Talks fast as hell so try and keep up. The readings are complicated and semi-boring but once you hear him explain it, it all makes so much sense. No text books, everything online.
Be on time!

Duhart is one of those professors that reminds you why you're majoring in sociology. He is engaging during lectures, and clears up any difficult concepts. He assigned one midterm, final, and weekly memos from the previous weeks  readings. Material he utilizes is very educating.

In a field of study that has a tendency to be confusing more often that not, it helps to have a professor that is willing to explain things until everyone has an understanding. Professor Duhart knows how to communicate ideas,command a classroom, and be approachable at the same time. He encourages questions and creates a noble learning environment.

Took American Literature with him last quarter. He's a great and his lectures are both engaging and funny. Also, British accent!! We had one midterm essay, one final 6-page essay, and an annotated bibliography. Not a harsh grader. Takes attendance. The reading is very manageable, and you learn a lot going to lecture.

Overall I thought this class would be harder but as long as you do the papers and read required texts you should get an A. Very lecture heavy but group work as well. Not easy to reach outside of class.

Hot, funny, and British! He mainly lectures and expects you to have read the material but understands when you don't. Ten percent of your grade is based on attendance (he's funny, you won't fall asleep) The other ninety percent is based on the midterm paper and the final. I think he's quite an easy grader. And hey he's nice to look at!

Dr. Salway is an engaging, thoughtful, and insightful professor. He is extremely passionate about what he teaches and his lectures are thought-provoking and interesting. I would happily take him again!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Salway is awesome. His lectures are really engaging and involves a lot of class participation. He does discussion type lectures rather than PowerPoint-which I really enjoyed. I would definitely recommend taking him. Make sure you do the readings and participate in class.
He has a soft voice so sit near the front. Listen to every word he says. Don't be afraid to ask for help.

Antony Orme is an icon in the world of physical geography.  I have had few professors that can stand up to him on the basis of sheer knowledge and expectations.  His classes were challenging, but always enjoyable and full of interesting information. Ten years later, I am still more grateful for his classes than just about any others.

He's an excellent professor and really knows his stuff.  Exams are challenging, so a few days of studying is mandatory prior to taking them. 1 final, 1 midterm, 1 term paper.  Go to class and you'll do fine!

I was very excited for the class, unfortunately his lectures only focus on how fantastic his work is, which was a disappointment.  He also makes discouraging comments and plays favorites; if you're not one of them you don't have a chance of a fair grade. My advice: theres so many better professors in the department, take a class with one of them!

By far the worst professor in my entire academic life. I was really passionate about the subject before I took his class, and he has truly taken away from that. You'd rather not go to school than take his class, most people I spoke to in the class agreed. He doesn't cover any material on the tests, just rambles on and on and shows pointless slides.

Profesor Larkin is VERY smart, but his lectures are structured completely around conceptual ideas, and his exams are all problem-solving. It makes no sense how we are actually supposed to learn the problem solving. He maybe walked through a total of 10 problems the entire quarter. The homework also was not helpful. He was quite rude over email.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment:
Larkin explains topics quite well and is quite funny during his lectures. The only gripe I think many of us had is the hard to read handwriting on the tablet, but it's okay. He focuses on understanding the material and gives many practice problems for midterms and finals. Focus on understanding the material and you'll pass. 
(Not on Bruinwalk yet)
No Comments

The professor answers questions during lecture and is extremely detailed and obviously knowledgeable about the subject.  He talks very fast at times but the Powerpoint presentations he posts online are a great way to supplement your notes.

Funny Guy! makes astronomy come to life for both astro majors and non-astro majors alike! text book is very vague and does not provide concrete mathematical rigor that is required to fully understand concepts of astrophysics, but all and all great experience! Highly recommended professor!

Cortinez was a VERY good lecturer and made the class go by effortlessly with her unique sense of humor. As has been said, she had a passion for the material that really conveyed itself well. Tests were a bit tough but she didn't ask for anything out of the blue, everything was manageable.

From the first day I walked into the class, I noticed that she was VERY passionate about the material. She had the sense of humor to make a two hour lecture breeze by. A crystal clear lecturer, she was extremely approachable for questions if something still didn't make sense. Definitely one of the best professors at UCLA.

She is a great professor, she's always asking and worried that everybody is understanding the material :) Her tests are easy! because you get to choose which you want to answer. If you go to sections, read and go over the material in class and with the tutors is easy and entertaining ;) And she is so great, just pay her a visit during office hours
No Comments
Excellent Professor!!! Check out the UCLA Ratings, no othe professor acheives  9 's on rankings like this instructor.
Edward W. Soja exemplifies what it means to be a professor. He is intelligent, enthusiastic, well-published, and interesting. He is a legend in Geography. I love this man.

This is an interesting class that makes you think.  Soja is quite bookish and theoretical, but presents the material in an interesting way.  Mostly lecture, but I could listen to him lecture for hours without falling asleep.

Ed is a living legend if you follow postmodern theory, especially as it relates to geography, urban planning and architecture.  He will challenge you; he will make you read; he will demand solid papers.  But it's all worth your effort.  You will walk away from every lecture feeling enlightened! Take his course and do well!
Incredible instructor. One of the most intelligent and kind professors I've met at the graduate level.  He is very supportive of student's work and projects.
He is what higher education should be: knows the subject through and through, important figure, boring and incoherent at times, great person, amazing intellect, rambles, enthusiastic all the time.
I would not recommend this course.
This course is boring and more of an undergraduate course that should not be taught at a graduate level
Course is appropriate for undergraduates rather than graduate students. It was not intellectually engaging for me.
Noel Enyedy is my favorite uncle
Noel is my hero.

Facts: 2 Books + online Articles (50-100 pg/week)PowerPoint & more information. Average midterm grade a â??Dâ??. He flunked the whole class for the final paper. Midterm and final are short answer. His curve will make an F into a C, He is in his mid 70s and his class style reflects that. He is a nice guy and a Poli Sci expert but your GPA WILL suffer.

I took Political Psychology and an eating disorders seminar (Feeding, Food Fads and Fat) with  this Prof in the 80s. Dr. Sears was very interesting and one of the more approachable Profs on campus. Visit him during office hours.

Very knowledgeable on the subject, but a poor lecturer who speaks softly and doesn't use a mic. You are unsure of what will be on the test. WAY too many readings in a very expensive $70 reader, along with a few other textbooks. Nice guy, but I feel he teaches the class like a graduate level seminar.
Extensive reading with too many information to digest. Tests are all short-answer essays.
No Comments

Great teacher.  Sometimes ahead of schedule (not a problem).  Fair homework assignments, smaller during second half of course.  Difficult tests, though there was a curve for overall grades so it didn't matter (~33% As, 33% Bs, 33% Cs).  I'd highly recommend, knows his material and is very engaging.  Do well on homework and study and you'll be fine.

He is very helpful and he cares about teaching, and getting a professor who cares about teaching is a privilege at UCLA. Exams are fair if you study, I got 99% on both midterm and final and 100% on all homework and quizes, but you MUST study. I enjoy Prof. Antieau going through proofs in class. IMO that's more meaningful than formula memorizing.

His exams for an honors course? Entirely computational. His class is not worth attending, just read the book and be prepared for mind numbing computation that doesn't test your intellect-- it tests whether you can multiply 17 by 354 and divide that by 218 without a calculator. For an honors course, quite depressing.

I enjoyed Professor Antieau very much. Lectures were clear and understandable, although he had a tendency to fall behind the syllabus, which meant we occasionally had to speed through material in order to cover what had to be covered. Tests were fair and  on the easy side, but some of my classmates thought they were more difficult.

Professor Antieau is clean-cut, punctual, and knowledgeable in his material (discrete mathematics).  His tests were fair (studying lectures, homework, and the practice midterms he provided was sufficient to do well on them), although the final was somewhat proof-heavy.  He answered all questions and replied quickly to emails.  A great professor!

Prof. Harrison has moments of clarity, but tends to like hearing himself speak. He often took a bit of a sexist read on many of the films we watch. Easy A, but not very enlightening if you're serious about film.

Prof Harrison is great. He knows what he is talking about, and really highlights Italian film. If you attend class regularly and do the readings (but more importantly, just listen to what he is saying in the lectures), you will not only do extremely well in the class, but will also learn and see things that you will never forget. Take the class.
Excellent professor if you want to major in film. Very eloquent in analyzing films and their cultural aspects
Professor Harrison managed to simplify the texts, which were well chosen. He is very knowledgeable, but not in a patronizing way. Funny too!
No Comments

Really disliked how she chooses not to upload lectures in a powerpoint slide or to put her notes online for students to review later. Everything she says in lecture is on pieces of construction paper which she reads from, and she literally talks for 90 minutes without a break. Extremely frustrated with how this class is prepared.

Honestly, one of the worst academic experiences in my time here at UCLA. Her voice is so monotonous and I feel like I need to take Adderall each time I walk through the doors of A139. Test format is essay questions, depending on your TA your grade will be horrendously inconsistent. Killed and destroyed my love for my field of study and the subject.

Long boring lectures, tend to go on tangents. Terrible tests, it's several essay questions that are quite open ended, and if you miss even one thing they want you to mention, they grade very harshly. One time she allowed a regrade (if you submit it with a long essay) only because too many people complained. LOTS of reading (3 books worth).

Great professor. Uses her notes so lecture can be messy but she covers everything regardless. Really nice if you talk to her. Great class.. if you dont like reading/attending lecture,then dont take her class. If you do your work youll do fine.
Her T.A. made the class.
I found the class to be very interesting, brought back my old passion for learning about animals and their adaptations.
Dr. Silk is a very interesting teacher with much real-life experience.  The class is very interesting and not very hard.  Two tests, one primate observation...easy work.  She grades on a curve!

Dr. Silk is very friendly lady and I enjoyed her lectures! She provided very interesting material with great videos to go along with it. The only downside to her class was the tests. Tests were all writing, with no multiple choice and graded very harshly in my opinion. I attended almost every lecture and still seemed to do poorly on the tests.

Not a good teacher.  Her knowledge is obsolete and is not very knowledgable of the topic she is teaching.  Class is boring.  She reads directly from slides.  Worse than an online course because it wastes time.

She is really not one of the best professors to take at UCLA...the lecture appears easy and it tricks you for the exam, altho the exam looks easy it is graded very hard and points are deducted for slight deviation from the exact concept...really hard to get an A consider someone else instead

Amazing genius of a teacher.  This course was called "Strategies for Life After Film School."  He's a wealth of knowledge about the film industry - he is quite thorough.  Course was not easy, he expects a lot. But well worth it.

This is how you thought college was going to be. The fact that we had to wait for grad school is sort of sad. His insight and multi- disciplined knowledge is breathtaking. He bears the one true mark of a great teacher: He makes you realize that no matter what he's lecturing on, the lessons can all be applied to life. Howard Suber teaches life.

The best class ever taken at UCLA, highschool, catequism, 1st communion. The course helps understand the most important question in film: what makes films memorable. It explores what has worked in the past, why films today are popular but not memorable, and what we must do to have our work remembered for generations.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. A MUST!

Very difficult very dense very important (for film students, anyway) very interesting material.  The core of why motion pictures work.  Lots of work.  Handouts provided and papers assigned every week.  Makes you think.  Easy to slide along but this is truly a class where you only get out of it what you put into it.
No matter what field of study you are in, this man will give you the greatest gift of all... take the class and find out what it is!
We miss him terribly. What a model scholar and mentor.

The passion and the knowledge of this professor is simply amazing. He respects his field and the students, and still manages a good sense of irony and huumor. His communication skills, clarity, and most of all, his desire to reach out to the students make him top. Too bad he is only a visiting prof--we could use him permanently! Nice looking too.

The passion and the knowledge of this professor is simply amazing. He respects his field and the students, and still manages a good sense of irony and huumor. His communication skills, clarity, and most of all, his desire to reach out to the students make him top. Too bad he is only a visiting prof--we could use him permanently! Nice looking too.

I have had Prof. Von Dassanowsky for both film and literature classes. I can only say: If you will remember any professor during your time at UCLA, you will remember him. Low stress but highly thought provoking, his classes are how I thought college would be.

If you ever thought professors were boring, take this guy. Not only is he damn entertaining, you can tell he really enjoys teaching German. I'd take him for ANY course. He's really nice in responding to emails. Perfect idea of a college professor.
Great!
Decent prof, but I don't think the board is what the girls in his class stare at during his lectures.

He's a nice enough guy and he wants to help but his French accent is extremely heavy and if you're not already good at calculus, his lectures and even office hours can be of limited help because of his limited English.
What can I say? Smart + attractive guy= great prof!

Prof. Houdayer is a great lecturer! It is clear that he knows the material very well- he lectures without any notes at all. I thought that the midterms were fair and the final was hard, but manageable (had some interesting problems).Also, I absolutely love his French accent!

Prof Sonali teaches with passion. I love her teaching method and love for archaeology and anthropology. She inspires her students to learn rather than just attend lectures. I recommend any class she teaches.
Dr. Sonali Gupta is amazing! I would take her classes again and again. She is so inspiring and makes you fall in love with the subject due to her passion. I wish I had taken more of her classes.
I love Prof. Sonalis approach. She engages with students and wants them to learn actively. I wish we had more classes like the one she offers. I think she is one of the best professors at UCLA

Sonali is a great professor. Very warm, experienced, and takes a multimedia approach to her archaeology classes. I have taken her twice and I really like her style. She doesn't make you memorize material endlessly, and gets students engaged with the subject matter through creative projects like short films and portfolios. Very thought-provoking!

I really liked Sonali & felt she cared about how I did in the class but the study guides and tests she gives out are insane. She also scans all her pdf's to make sure you cant use control find and she gave out the study guide for the final 2 days before not that it mattered ,study guide was not specific whatsoever. Again shes really nice but beware
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Professor Maasik is such a nice and sweet loving person. She gives great feedback on our essays and teaching us many several ways to improve our writing throughout the whole course.
weak. thoroughly bush-league. uninspiring teacher, uninspired course, basically serves to fill up time.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
great teacher
He is a very good professor and makes the material understandable. Not a very easy class, but you will learn a lot, and with effort, you will earn a high grade.

Dienstag just plain rules. He's not by any means easy, but you will learn, you will laugh, and you will earn the grade you put into it. Having a good TA really helps, but I have yet to meet anyone who regrets taking him.
Modern Political Theory - tough class.  The Professor and TA's however, are great. Highly recommend this Professor.
he's amazing. honestly he changed my life

Don't have the words to describe how great he is! Above all of the other professors, I think I would recommend taking him the most. An amazing person with clear passion. It also doesn't hurt that he's a pretty lenient grader, though I wouldn't slack off. Overall couldn't recommend him more, especially for first quarter transfers.

He's that rare combination of brilliance and kindness. His teaching style is excellent. He'll always stick out in my mind as a professor I was incredibly lucky to have. You'll learn a lot about literature, the United States' history and society, and yourself in a class of Yarborough's. Do take one if you have the chance.

My fav His analysis of the societal implications of a work, its symbolism, and the stylistic maneuverings of its author were drawn with most powerful and interesting care. My brain would brim with thought and was impressed by the great emotional charge of each piece. Long final, if you have an LD, contact OSD for proctoring. A note taker will help

After you go through the 10-series, the reading in this class seems so light. Passionate, articulate, understanding, educated, etc. Great individual, no negatives. Apart from reading, lots of history; make sure you don't get lost remembering all of it since ALL you need to do is identify 5 passages and analyze them in one paragraph. Great TAs too.

An infinite amount of superlatives do not even come close to how great of a professor he is! He is passionate about the material and it is infectious. As long as you read and think critically, you should be fine. He is also very approachable during office hours. He is one of my favorite professors!

The most unprofessional encounter in my academic career was with Professor Laviña. I came to his office prior to beginning my MSW for help with an issue concerning my placement. Mr Laviña made accommodations but also, without good reason, made it sound as though my ability to continue with my MSW more broadly was at risk. I wish I reported him then

Gerry is popular with a lot of students - but mainly with the ones he's cool with. He has his favorites in the department, and often funnels them into the better internships/fellowships. He has also shown himself to have pretty questionable boundaries with students, often drinking with them and flirting with female students. Don't believe the hype.

Gerry is an exceptional professor, mentor and social worker. He is an amazing asset to UCLA, the Social Welfare department and this profession. He is a genuinely caring individual that goes above and beyond to support his students.
I love Lavina!

Gerry is just awesome! He cares a lot about his students. We love him so much his office hours are always booked because of students wanting to get some time with him. I've cried a few times during this quarter and Gerry was always there to encourage me to keep going. He is also a pretty awesome lecturer. Better than the rest if you ask me.

She's VERY nice and very helpful. She'll take the time to make sure everyone understands everything. Her homework is very easy and only focuses on concepts. The only thing I didn't like is that i feel like I didn't learn much.
Great upperdivision Professor!  Care a LOT about student's learning and understanding; focuses and logic and concept, NOT memorization!
One of the better upper div Stats professors.
No Comments

Stats 13 was not difficult (open book and notes), but Esfandiari is a horrible teacher. Lectures are incomprehensible, and her 'concern' for student learning is not really as strong as she wants you to believe.

This Professor is amazing! His class is very interesting and enriching. Despite the fact that you are required to have a textbook , I didn't read any of the required reading and i was still able to get an A by studying thoroughly his slides. So study hard his slides and your notes and you should be able to get a good grade! Great professor!
good teacher , very explanatory,serious in his work

Carlos really cares about connecting with his students.  Having high school and college age sons of his own, he understands the stress we face and manages to find ways to motivate us.  His honors seminar was great in that we got a chance to interact with him directly, and it complimented the course well.
No Comments

Professor Grijalva tries to make his class as easy and as enjoyable as possible for his students. Granted, there is a two-hour lecture that is mainly guided by powerpoint slides, but the professor presents the material clearly and thoroughly. He exudes kindness.
Hands down, the best professor at UCLA. Brilliant; passionate; and really makes sure that her students understand everything. Brilliant.

Professor Mellor is a great teacher and an expert in her field. If you take good notes and keep up with the reading you will do fine. She really brought the Shelleys alive to me. So if you love Romantic literature and are an Austen/Keats fan then definitely take her!

Prof Mellor is a wonderful teacher. I loved her Late Romantic Literature class. She really brought the Shelleys and Keats alive and if you're an Austen fan, definitely take her. There is a ton of reading though but if you keep up-to-date you'll be fine.
Her lectures are very interesting but because she has A LOT to say, it is a little hard to keep up with notes. Otherwise, she is a great professor.
heavy reading load

The HARDEST class I've ever taken! So glad it's over bc the stress of it all was not healthy. Transferring in from a CC I was used to much smaller classes & more Instructor interaction 1-on-1. The LAs were just as lost as we were. No support. He was not helpful in lectures either.. was harsh to most that asked Qs and set the mood: intimidated..
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Prof Pham has been my favorite teacher at UCLA! With that said, the class was still one of the hardest I've ever taken. He actually made me enjoy Ochem (can't believe i just said that!) Attendance at lecture wasn't mandatory but missing class WILL hurt you. I had to dedicate hours on end to this class but ending with an A- was worth every second!

Very clear on what he expects and why. He makes lectures interesting, and it is obvious that his first priority is that his students actually learn the material. However, don't think that just because he's a nice professor that the class will be easy. Study consistently, and aim to understand concepts as opposed to memorizing things.

Dr. Pham definitely made 30A an enjoyable course.  Many students are apprehensive about OChem but his lectures, although fast-paced, were clear. To do well, do all suggested hw problems, go over lectures, and understand mechanisms. He makes himself available and has open door OH before all midterms/finals. Definitely recommend!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: My favorite professor so far at UCLA! I was pretty scared going into OChem, but Pham was awesome! He offered so much help, and always cared about all his students. He even gave us candy while we were studying! I hope he comes back to teach 30B. Let's rally together and get him to come back!
