John is incredible. He made philosophers whom I had no appreciation for beforehand among my favorites, he is open to help during personal trials, he is a great professor and an exemplary person. If you are serious about furthering your philosophical education, then you will regret having not taken him.

He's a good professor and extremely nice to the point were people take advantage. He Does have a monotone voice but he does record his lectures. Yet he has a way of explaining difficult information in a more simple manner. Attendance is a must. And he does expect students to have a high commitment to the course but it isn't overbearing.

Professor Carriero is tough. He has strong material knowledge, but he doesn't always convey it in a clear manner. I found him to be more helpful in one on one office hours. He discourages class discussion or questions during lecture and I found that disheartening. All in all I'd take him again because of his keen knowledge of philosophy.

He's amazing at getting difficult comcepts across very clearly. He's helpful, but he will not do your work for you, and demands ahrd work from his students. Do not expect to sakte in his classes! FYI: his nickname is John Aristotle, if that gives you any clue!
No Comments
He is so boring. He tries to make funny jokes that relate to class but then you get even more loss. Recommend not to take this class or if you do take it with another teacher
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I took this class Fall 2009, so I am posting it a little late. Prof O'Neill is awesome. It is impossible to get anything less than a C+. I have taken him twice and have received 2 As. His class is pretty straight forward. He actually has a pretty awesome sense of humor. Take him, trust me.
Easy A. I went to probably five classes, did half the work, and still nailed it.

He is not a hard professor he just doesn't really know how to run a 300= class. I enjoyed the class but it was hard. Go to class and pay attention. Do the readings and study you will do fine. He doesn't give less then a C so how bad can he be.
Seriously one of the hardest classes I have ever taken.  But I found out later that he doesn't give out anything less then a C.  Just be prepared to do a little math even though its a poli sci class
Not an easy A class. Professor Meranze is a tough grader, but his lectures were great.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Although the assigned readings didn't correlate with his lectures, he had good lecturing skills and was very knowledgeable about the material. Can be sarcastic and vague. Also, doesn't post lecture notes or allow recording. Attend lecture!

Tough professor with no study guide for the test BUT if you go to every lecture and take good notes you can definitely do well! He gives you the information you need for the tests all in his lectures!

Do not take this man unless you want to suffer and get low grades. Doesn't care about student learning, and throws random ?'s on the tests to screw you. No study guide, a final worth 70% of ur grade, and a boring/annoying demeanor. Stay away, far away, if you value your GPA.

Assigned reading was primarily supplementary. Exams questions are generally broad essay questions and ID's based on his lectures. Come to class and take notes. He does not post any notes or recordings online.

A nice enough person who was happy to talk during office hours, but the "required" lecture attendance was annoying.  Not the most interesting lectures, either; she was fairly monotonous throughout.  The class ended up being mostly memorization of dry facts.  Stay away if that is not for you.

If you do the work and attend lecture and section, it should be pretty easy to do well in this class.  She isn't the greatest lecturer, but the slides make up for that (Renaissance and Baroque art is gorgeous).  The grades were pretty generous, with most people getting A's (the average was around an A-).
No Comments
amazingly bad. eats students up and spits them out for fun. she belittles students, plays favorites, and doesn't understand art history. avoid!
No Comments

She does have an accent and can be difficult to understand at times. However, she is very helpful and he class is not difficult at all. Don't miss lecture because she tests on material from lecture that is not in the readings. As long as you do that and do the readings, this will be a very easy class for you.
Unbelievably useless class. Too much reading required per week. Doesn't put lecture notes online. Unclear lecturer. Overall a disappointing class. I thought sex was supposed to be interesting.
No Comments

Excellent professor. Expert in her field. Loves to help students, takes time to explain subject in clear manner. Her papers are tough but she will help you in office hours. Some people didn't like her but they were just being too lazy to learn

2 hrs. of solid lecture everyday.  The prof talks fast and it's hard to understand her, partially because of her accent.  She asks if the class has questions, but we are too lost to ask them.  Everyday, large groups of people get frustrated and walk out early. She calls us rude. Negative environment
unique experience
Professor Kupper is by FAR the bet professor i've had at ucla. lectures are extremely interesting. he made me consider a career in clinical psychology.

Kupper is awesome, he has a good sense of humor and the class is easy. He gives you the test questions before you even take the test! If you can't pass this class, you should not be a student at UCLA. He is also very generous as a grader!
Very dry  and boring professor.  Appears a bit disorganized.  Test format is short answer but what he really wants are essay answers.
Very dry and boring professor. Test questions are claimed to be short answers but what he really wants are essays.
Amazing lecturer!

One of my favorite English profs at UCLA, am very shocked to see he rates so low here! As a history major, I took two of his 111 course and enjoyed both immensely. I think the thing about Nagy is that he's very particular about students knowing grammar basics. Also, historical perspective: It is your friend for all 111 courses.

Do not take this professor.  He is irrational and completely arbitrary in his grading. What he expects from his graduate or undergraduate students is never clear.  You are very likely to get a poor grade and never know why.  He is also an egomaniac and is vastly more interested in his own views than in helping students explore theirs.

had a 3.5 before his class and has nicely dropped a few points as a result of it. will give u a horrible grade if u do not consistently meet him for office hours. the previous reviewer hit the nail on the head in their description of him. do yourself a favor and do not take him.

HORRIBLE TEACHER. He goes on massive tangents that have absolutely nothing to do with the readings that are supposed to prepare you for your mid-term and final. For the final we had 3 papers and a research paper due will NO IDEA what to write about due to his negligence on analyzing the readings.NOT HELPFUL and loves hearing himself talk. DONT TAKE

One of the BEST history professors I have ever taken at UCLA. His lectures are in the format of story-telling, never missed a class because he is that inspirational! I learned so much from him, and his class truly changed the way I viewed the world, and the race. Our entire class gave him a standing ovation at the last class. He is truly amazing.

Took his African American Studies/History Introductory course.  It was eye-opening. Prof. Hill is passionate, articulate, and intelligent.  Does a wonderful job of also linking readings to everday life, history, and culture.  One of the best courses I took as an undergraduate atUCLA.
intense, amazing and incredible.  Changed my view of the world, of race and of history.  Still resonates 13 years after graduation.

He seems to be an extremely knowledgeable professor who speaks with an often poetic precision, choosing his words so carefully sometimes that they come out haltingly.  The material he presents, however, at least for 150E, was worth less than 50% of the grade--student presentations and class discussions filled up, for me, an inordinate proportion.

Great Professor. Probably one of UCLA's best. His knowledge of historical subjects is truly inspiring. All you have to do is read and write your papers. You may have to present in class. But you will really learn a lot from him.

Confusing in what he wants. Inflexible to differing opinions. Wants students to pass though and cares for them. As a person I think he's great. As a political science teacher...meh. But he really is a nice guy, but with a mega ego.

He is really cool! never fall asleep during his class and he always make u laugh. He know what he is talking about and with tons of examples. But it is hard to take notes for his class as you don't know what is important, all of them seems more like his own experiences. Multiple choice midterm + final + quizzes. The questions are like : "what did P
Take any class with his name on it.  He is awesome.  He takes people to coffee just for fun or for career advice and he was really helpful

TAKE THE CLASS! He is smart, funny, and doesn't put you to sleep! What else do you want? He is insightful and easy to follow. If you like Asia Media or are interested in it... then this is the teacher for you. Worked for the LA Times and other newspapers in Asia. GREAT GUY!!!
Great guy!! You really learn from his class. He is also hilarious. You will never laugh as much in any other class. Not super easy though...you have to really try, but it is worth it!!
this per-v left the 4 comments below and talks about how hot he is. again he left these comments.

he came in the middle of the year so he tried the best to catch up. i was unable to go to office hours cause his times conflicted with my schedule. overall he's a pretty fair grader.  word of advice is to go to as much office hours possible. i heard it really helped.

Didn't think he knew too much cause he seemed young and inexperienced.  Turned out to be wrong.  Ended up getting a B+, but I felt I learned alot. The only thing that bugged was all the girls sat in the front.
pretty demanding and expects the best from students. great lectures for an early morning class.  the cutiest, youngest prof i've had, but still good caliber teaching. too bad ladies - he's taken.
very informative instructor. uses real life case scenarios that strengthen his lectures. extremely good looking, making it hard to concentrate, however. ladies watch out, he's a looker!

Difficult to understand at times, but definitely worth it. He knows exactly what he's talking about, but he's not looking for you to mimic his own opinions. He wants you to expand your own thoughts and give what you believe is the true answer. He doesn't believe in grading and is very open to all ideas. Great human being, overall.

Incredibly brilliant, incredibly kind, and incredibly cool. Prof. Julius is one of those rare professors who truly cares about not just research or the material, but encouraging students to learn it rather than regurgitate it. In other words, I learned to do actual philosophy as a result of him.. Basically this man is a genius.
He is very smart. But truly not the best explainer. I didn't enjoy his class

The man is so genius it may be hard to follow him. But you will have a great experience from taking his class, and it will make you think harder. on a one to one basis he is approachable and a very good dude. He doesn't believe in grades (competitive learning), he's very easy going (approaches the class with ease), & loves philosophy/economics! A+
AJ is the BEST! Every Philosophy student MUST take him before they leave UCLA!
He's great. I don't understand why Kozhan is leaving UCLA. He is so far the best math professor I ever met. UCLA, if possible, keep him.
The tests are awkwardly graded
HE IS AWESOME. Unfortunately, the class is super hard :(
Best Professor ever!

Khozan is great teacher! He's young and has a pretty chill Attitude. His lectures and exams are on the proofy/mathematically intellectual side, but if you study hard its worth the prep for when you'll need it in the upper divs. His homework is usually a few even problems from each section. All in all, he's not easy, but he's not a crappy teacher!

Don't think this is an easy A class, you have to work hard, otherwise, you won't pass. Get ready to many exams and pop quiz because most of your grades depend on the exam. She teaching very fast so you may not be able to keep up. She had many presentation requirements but told you two days before the deadline. No extra credit, no curve. Good luck.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: I enjoyed her the class and it was an easy A. The only problem is that she is too pretty. In fact, she's the most attractive professor iv'e ever seen in my life. If you're a guy then it's very distracting/encouraging.
Professor Suthana is very clear clear in her teaching and is always engaged with the class!
Professor Suthana is very clear clear in her teaching and is always engaged with the class! She's a blacksmith.
The most enjoyable class I've had so far. She is clear, and helpful. Do not rely on only studying her slides.
Awesome professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: He's funny and really wants his students to succeed. He'll send out emails with answers to questions that he didn't know when asked in class and he doesn't just read directly off the slides-- he elaborates on almost every point. He's also colorblind which makes class interesting sometimes.
He's sent from heaven. TAKE. THE. CLASS.
AMAZING. NUFF SAID.
Oaky
She's the BEST and she knows how to teach. She respects the amount of work people put into her class and makes sure you learn

Stats for PhD students. Dr. Woo is very intelligent and knowledgeable about the subject and its application. She made stats extremely easy and broke it into to simple concepts. The rest of my cohort did not enjoy the course , but I believe this is mostly a function of their lack of basic computer skills and basic mathquants. comprehension.
Had her as a guest speaker. Very intelligient, but yes, sometimes opinionated.

Rude, condescending, humiliates and insults students in class, does not answer emails, obvious that she does not like teaching.  She does not foster an environment that is conducive to learning.  Likes to brag about herself and her accomplishments. Lacks people skills.
Judgemental and rude.  She should be asked to move to another profession that doesn't include people.
Prof. Graham was an excellent instructor.  Knew Evidence better than anyone I have ever met.  Truly cared about his students.  Was one of the finest instructors at UCLA.
You'll flat-out learn the subject matter, but it's not easy.
Class can be tedious and final was awful (something like 300 questions in 3 hours).  HOWEVER, you walk away from the class knowing evidence down cold--useful for the bar.

His pedagogic method makes it a waste of time to attend class each day. Assigns problems to mandatory study groups; we're not kids! You can't hear the answers, so why bother going to class? He constantly has a frown on his face. Gross hair.

Gordon Henderson is an incredible director, and always makes decisions that are best for the Marching Band. Because of him, we get to travel much more and be intimately involved with the program. He makes you work hard, but it's completely worth the effort. Join the Band!! Go Bruins!

Join the Band!  (Don't let one comment disuade you from being apart of the Solid Gold Sound.) There are times where he yells and lets you know he's upset... but its for the betterment of the Band.  Go Bruins!
The best marching band director on the West Coast.  He is professional, personal, and knows how to get things done quickly and efficiently.  Any opportunity you have to work with him should be taken.
Awesome Marching Band, Great Director!  Go Bruins!

Overall, a knowledgeable man who really cares about his students.  I have taken him twice, and hes handed back midterms late in the quarter both times. He also tends to digress in lecture, however, if you attend class, there is really no need to do the readings in order to write papers. Really helpful during office hours. Recommend him!
SUUUUCCKKKSSSSSSSS DONT EVER TAKE HIM! TAKES HIM 6 WEEKS TO HAND BACK FIRST PAPER AND CONSTANTLY GOES OFF TOPIC ON LECTURE AND YOU NEVER KNOW WHAT HE IS TALKING ABOUT!! NOT RECOMMENDED

He is an amazing teacher hands down! I have learned so much in his class about the Zionist movement and truly enjoy his lectures. He's extremely helpful and tries to be available for you whenever you need him. Excellent excellent teacher...he doesn't push you to believe a certain idea and his lectures are not bias. I love him and his class!!!
I was ready to drop out of school before I took this teacher. I changed my minor so that I could take his classes.
If you don't have a background in medieval Russian history or aren't ready to dedicate the next few months of your life to it, don't take her classes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She's a really nice lady. If you're having a difficult time understanding what she wants in your papers and tests, go to her office hours. She's very helpful and will do what she can to help you understand. Be sure to do the reading and bring your textbooks to class.
Class material is really interesting, too bad the teacher isn't. She is a horrible grader, and the lectures are horribly boring. Don't take this class unless you have too.

Excellent professor with lucid teaching methods in her classes! It truly made me love learning Russian History and the Russian culture! Exams are all essay style. Midterm consists of 5 id terms with an essay. Final it's just like an essay(she changed the format at last). Final essay on a selected topic! Class is very engaging! Just love it!

Nandy's a good professor, he puts all his powerpoints online. You need the online book but not the hard copy. Honestly, he gets way into explaining. Works for some, sometimes confuses me. Always go to class!! Oh, and he gives out practice mid-terms

Nandy is a great professor, albeit there are many mistakes in his powerpoints and sometimes he is disorganized, ok a lot of times he is disorganized but he really cares about his students and he is very fair.
He is very knowledgeable and is extremely good at explaining. He explains a topic until he makes sure everyone understands.
No Comments

Dai knows the material, but has trouble projecting and explaining what he teaches. He can also incorporate more advanced mathematics into his 3A lectures, so if some techniques he uses don't make sense at first, you will understand later (in 3B). However, he can be liberal and lenient with the whole class if proper justification is presented.

There are two midterms. Average score for both midterms in the class are around 50 out of 100. His reviews do not help. You'd better do all the exercises on the back of the book. Homework alone does NOT help you to prepare the tests. In order to get a good grade, a good relationship with him is needed. He's not really willing to help.
He is willing to help students. Very smart. Lecture is crystal clear. Very fair in grading too. Highly recommend.
really easy, but only because i already knew the material. heavy accent makes him hard to understand, kinda funny sometimes though
Very helpful. Must take!!!
Professor extremely hot
No Comments
No Comments

Susan Foster is the best teacher in the department. She genuinely cares about her students. Is the class easy? No. But like any other class, it requires work. She helped me become a better dancer, writer, and artist-scholar and I know many that feel as I do. I highly recommend her class to all!

The other raters are right. Stay away from this woman's class. The grading is based on sucking up. She doesn't seem to prepare lectures, just randomly talk on the topic, beginning discussions of tough theoretical topics not at the beginning by explaining baseline info, but halfway through. Also, very rude to students who disagree with her opinions
One of the most arrogant and insecure human beings you will ever meet.  Veneer of manufactured personability covering for a lack of actual concern for students and impossibly self-centered behavior.
If you want a good grade, better agree with her, no dissenting opinions tolerated.
Avoid choosing for his class if you can. Irrelevant teaching and rampant discrimination. Also tough grading.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Horrible class, the professor is not motivated, does not even motivate students. The exam is totally different from what is taught in class. Also he will not give you an A despite giving your 100%. Complex Class, worst one you can opt for.
Poor professor. Not motivated

INT TRADE LAW -- From the bottom of my heart, avoid this class.  You have to attend lectures and do a 30 page paper at the end.  The catch is the lectures do not assist with the paper and you are stuck to do a paper on your own outside of class.
Maestro Stulberg is excellent during regular classes but NOW we are remote - he needs to CHILL on the overload of papers. Not necessary and not compassionate. Hope this changes.
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: total musician - perhaps the most well-rounded at UCLA. a thoughtful pianist and conductor who comes off as a scholar. highly insightful, sincere, and available to help.
He actually lets you express your opinion and develops interesting conversations.  Wonderful musician.  Good person.  Amazing pianist.
Brilliant pianist.

This was taken on Zoom due to classes moving online from the coronavirus. Anyway, Professor Chism is absolutely wonderful. She is incredibly kind and caring, and was super accommodating and understanding during a difficult time. Her grading is fair and assignments are not too hard, I would definitely take her again and highly recommend her!!
Great person, okay professor

Chism is average. She can be a little rude at times but papers and assignments are generally fair. Doesn’t inspire you to actually be interested in the topic at hand, however. Her lectures are generally disorganized but she encourages a lot of class discussion and therefore is flexible in her presentation.

Professor Chism is a great professor and person. Her teaching style in class involves great class discussion. There will be a lot of reading (a book for each week). However, she chooses great novels that are engaging and interesting. Her grading is fair and there are only two papers due overall and some small writings. Take her!

Professor K really cares about her students. Since the last is super abstract, she'll gladly review topics before exams, and she encourages people to ask questions in lectures. Exams aren't too bad since she provides a study guide.

Her Comms 143 class which is Rhetoric of Popular culture is ridiculously difficult. Its a Rhetoric class with maybe a few examples of popular culture. But the class is around 99% on just philosophical rhetoric. The material is very abstract and confusing, her exams are difficult due to tricky worded questions along with the difficult material.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is such a sweetheart! Professor K is passionate about her subject and her students which in turn makes her students passionate. Love this professor!

She is very relaxed and conveys the information in a more understandable manner.  Her exams are harder than expected, but they are based off her lectures (which obviously stem from the readings).  Her class is very enjoyable.

Kaplan is a very sweet guy he took the whole class out for coffee a few times, however, this class was incredibly difficult. He often goes off on tangents and you cannot tell whether the information he is telling you applies to the course or if it is merely a side story. The material was interesting at times, but it is very logic based. Be prepared

Kaplan was my favorite professor in the phil. dept. His lectures were the best I attended, and his office hours were also the best I attended. However, I would say his grading was deeply inconsistent but I would also add that this is most likely a result of the overly aggressive readers he employed in our class. Otherwise, he is an excellent prof.
Absolutely can't stand Kaplan's class! I will never take him for any class.
A very good teacher who clearly loves his subject.  It doesn't hurt that Philos 31 was one of the easiest A's I have ever received.
Great lecturer. And she's very helpful during office hours, but beware...if you are talking nonsense she'll call you out. She also teaches at the Law school.

Professor Shiffrin is one of the most intelligent people I have ever met. While this sometimes makes her intimidating, she truly cares about her students and makes every effort to make sure they're understanding the material and are engaged. Excellent professor.

Shiffrin can be cold.  However, I've also experienced how helpful she can be.  I don't know what I did or didn't do to receive the help I did from her, but she's actually quite compassionate.  If you want to be challenged, take her classes.  I took normative ethics and Rawls.  She is definitely something else.

terrible disposition. She is condescending & rude to students,outside and inside class. However, her lectures are crystal clear and the subject material is fascinating. It's a crime her personality isn't as remarkable as her pedagogy.  She is quite brilliant. Genius, in fact. TERRIBLE PROFESSOR AS A WHOLE!! TERRIBLE!!
very interesting and different kind of class.
One of the best GE I took.
Great class. I recommend it.

MUS HIST 5. Easy class. Online quizzes with 2-3 attempts. Need to go to class to get the lecture notes which is what you're tested on. But, easy information to take in and understand. However, Prof Eidsheim is difficult to understand and she babbles a lot.

Professor Goldberg really cares about her students. The reading is tough, but she is more than willing to help you master it. She taught me how to read academic papers with ease, which helped me tremendously in other classes. Just do the work to the best of your ability, and everything will come together

This class and professor is a joke and a waste my time. Considering the circumstances that has came during our quarter, she has nevertheless made it more difficult for not only my peers and I, but also her and the head TA. With 1 out of the 2 TAs at our disposal going on strike, she has decided to up the final material to be a redundant amount.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Goldberg does not care about her students at all. Despite the challenges we faced during this quarter (TA strike, protests) she has not made any modifications to the course, but in fact she made the final more difficult. She basically made the final an AP test worth around 60% of our grade, with 2 timed essays, and a paper.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Goldberg is a great professor who truly cares about her students. The class itself consisted of weekly readings and writing assignments, 1 essay, and a midterm+final. The class was fairly easy considering history requires a lot of memorization. I came in with an A+ before the final and I am south campus major.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Amini is an amazing lecturer, and he explains concepts in a clear and concise manner. For my semester, there were eleven quizzes in total, which was somewhat inconvenient. However, I learned a lot from this class, and it was overall a highly enjoyable experience. I would definitely recommend taking this class with this professor.

Structure of class is really good. Course grade is based on exams, quizzes, exercises, and a group project. Really helpful. Clear instructions and expectations. Lectures were interesting. Exams were a little challenging but material is manageable. Overall, I think he is one of the top tier professors CSULA has for CS.
Prof. Amini really cares that we learn. The material was very well organized and the lectures were amazing. I would definitely take any course he teaches!
researcher - not a teacher; limited experience running an entire course/real life experience.
He literally doesn't care about students' performance. He would purposely make the exam tricky and not makes the practice exam helpful
Not good

he didn't respond to my emails. don't take this summer class. he wasn't even there half the time. he would be good teacher but the summer class was a full time job for more students than he could handle. it wouldve been a very doable class if it was at a reasonable pace with enough depth into each topic.

I got super sick during the first quarter when I was taking this class (surgery level sick), Maloy was super patient with me and helped me out so much to make sure I passed the class with a high grade- A KING. Definitely cares about his students more than anything - also brings his dog to class! 10/10 - the dog (Toby) 100/10

Volokh is very funny and extremely intelligent. He describes himself, as a "crazy libertarian" and is a bit eccentric. Relies heavily on the textbook but is very easy to follow his class structure in the syllabus and the material is not too difficult to wrap your head around.

Volokh's great. He's hilarious, and he likes the material and makes it fun. Unfortunately, his brain works a little differently than most people and so sometimes it's tough to follow his logic or keep up with his reasoning. But his class is actually really formulaic and easy to follow once you get through all the material.
Brilliant guy. Not always great about keeping the classroom a safe and respectful learning environment.
No Comments

For some reason the course I took with him isn't listed but it's for the MAGIST graduate program (GEOG401) and it was one of the best courses I've ever taken! I truly feel like Professor Shin wants every single one of his students to succeed in and outside of the classroom. I loved this course and would highly recommend him.

Geography 7 was an online class, so I guess I don't really have *that* much to say about the professor. Some of his videos were boring to be honest; he has a pretty soporific voice. But, generally the course is pretty awesome. I had a cool TA and great labs. The homework was super fun although the workload is a lot.
Just NO. You think it would be easy before week 9. Final project will pull your grade down.

Best teacher I had at UCLA.  Took him for 4 different classes.  Very helpful, friendly, and interested in students' understanding of concepts.  I never went to office hours for any other teacher because I felt like I would waste their time. Prof. Shin was so friendly I had no problem stopping by his office just to say "Hi". I owe my job to him!

lectures are boring and hard to follow... filled with indistinguishably similar experiments that dont effectively illustrate the point Balleine is getting at. go to section for clarification!! study hard and be warned that it is not taught like most other "learning" classes; weird order of material. also, professor comes off arrogant and snotty.

Motivated behavior class. I was interested before I took him, but now he's made the info so confusing and convoluted that I hate instincts and drive theory. He talks so theoretically that you have no idea what he means in real life. Hard grader too.

good prof - very clear and works hard to make you get the ideas even when there from hard experiments. sometimes thinks students are smarter than they probably are. High standard. Sorta cute in an ozzy way

He is a great teacher. There are no surprises during the test, everything he lectures on is right on the ball. Overall, the course is difficult but he makes the lectures fun and interesting. You'll learned to love animals after his class.
BEST PROFESSOR AT UCLA. HANDS DOWN A CERTIFIED GENIUS.
If you're a feminist, you'll love her, and she'll love you.  If not, watch out.  She's the type of teacher that uses music to foward her career as a feminist.  And her book was pretty lame.
If you want to take this class, take with Prof. McClary. I promise you an absolutely great quarter with her!
Best professor at UCLA. End of Story.
Most caring professor ever!

Lectures were disorganized and she was very rambled with some of the things she said.  Difficulty wasn't horrific, and on the plus side you have like 30 practice midterms from either her or Rubin (which she pulls a lot of quetions from) if you do your research (online).
Easy grader..lectures tidious.  Grading: Hw: 3....Tests:4
Worst lecture ever.  Easy grader.

PR is a stupid class.  He makes it kind of fun but at the end of the day it is just a mandatory class that neither he nor the students care about.  Take his class when you are taking the MPRE.  Study ahead and take MPRE mid-semester. Review for final. Gives bonuses for participation.  Don't buy the textbook.  You hardly use it.  Buy suppliments.
Oh man - he is not very good. He thinks he is funny but he isn't.

Winkler becomes a better teacher each year.  He is extremely clear, especially for Con Law, which is notoriously ambiguous.  He is also an easy guy to get to know and is willing to take the time to get to know you.
this guy sucks. bad

Yes the class is about law cases, but Prof. Hobbs makes it easier to understand material and the handouts are the best! NO other professor makes it easier than that for you to learn material. Also great mentor if you want to work on Senior Thesis :)

NEVER AGAIN! This is the biggest mistake you will ever make.  The reading is unbearably long and tedious. Since this was a communications class, i assumed i was going to be tested on the first amendment and its effect on the media.  This class deals with legal precedent and judicial tests. Hobbs is the worst teacher you will ever have hands down.
Lots of reading material. TA's are helpful but tests are a lot of work. Midterms are 40% and finals are worth 60% so there is no room to screw up.

basically this class is really doable if you reason analytically and are your brain works in analytical, organized fashion...the TAs are super helpful and the workload is doable...overally pretty interesting.funny and accessible professor

Overall, this class was really easy, There's no discussion and it's pretty straight forward. The midterm and final are both multiple choice, 103 questions each. The final only covered material taught after the midterm, so that was nice. You shouldn't have a problem acing, no less passing, a class with Abramson. (Check out his band Crying 4 Kafka).

Nice prof but the material can get very boring sometimes. If u read his book and attend lectures the good grade is guaranteed. I got 50 out of 100 of midterm and the final and ended up with the B in the class. Curve is only to help you. Highly recommended

Dr.A is pretty straightforward. There are lots of movies and 4 books to read. 2 are case studies...easy reading. 1 book is about Pleasure and its dry because its very theoretical...and last book is a novel. He repeats himself, so it might be good if you take notes slow...but dreadful if you feel he repeated the info already.

Very cool teacher! fair and balanced, has strong opinions, but is not preachy, respectful and curious about others points of view, text is a book he wrote. If you do the readings and use the study guide you will do well
He teaches out of the book. Knowing allth econcepts in the booko that are in a green box is a must.

Very helpful. Lectures are straightforward. Follows the book. Knows his stuff. Has an Israeli accent, which some people might find difficult to understand, but it was completely fine for me to understand. His lectures aren't boring either.

He was kind of dry at first.  I heard he wasn't that good, but by the end of the quarter he had helped me out a lot.  Just ask him questions and he is totally willing to help.  He works with examples from the book and his exams are pretty straightforward.  Good Luck!
he's kinda hard to understand, but really nice. the class is curved a lot, most people end up with a B, but a lot end up with As too.

This was a terrible class. I love anthropology, but I hated this class. her lectures are horrible. She drones and is so boring. try to take another class instead of this. if this is an elective, do NOT take it.

There were certain things that were a plus about her as a professor and certain things that were a minus - HATED that she viewed our assignments as a contract and was rigid in this regard but she was very engaging and equally as fair when it came to grading.
WORST TEACHER!

Fonarow is a kickass Professor. Her lectures are so engaging- I always looked forward to her class. She's funny too and very eloquent. She cares about her students and even likes hanging out with them. A year after her class- I'm still on her emaillist.
She is not only brilliant, but she is able to teach and help students understand the brilliant concepts she conveys.
She is not only brilliant, but she is able to communicate her briliance to students in a way they can understand.
She is an amazing Professor! Not only was she interesting, but she was clear and brilliant!
She's professional, she knows her stuff, and she even has a sense of humor to go along with it.  Her tests weren't overly difficult.  Good lecturer.
This man is an absolute gem.
He's a star.

Professor Gunn makes student growth a priority and encourages them to seek help and training whenever possible. He is happy to go over choreography multiple times, and will compliment a student's technique and offer criticism to better the student.
No Comments

Took Classics 30. His lectures were pretty good, he went pretty fast but was relatively clear. He'd sometimes add in  funny pop culture references. Although he kinda looks like a UFC fighter he's actually super nice and helpful and approachable. He uses powerpoint but they're not that helpful by themselves because they're mostly quotes.
Classics 30 was an awesome class. Truly amazing professor. Would definitely take it again if I could and recommend it to anyone.
A very fun and easy GE class.
Hard stuff but his grading is easier. He'll really change how you think.

I'm a psychology major and this class was psychological anthropology- so interesting for me in that respect. Though his lectures were interesting, assigned readings were pretty disjointed and disorganized. Copious amounts of reading that didn't really relate to the lecture topic. He gave way too much power to his TA's, who are absolutely useless.

Very knowledgeable and eager to help if confused. well organized lectures that he posts online after class. lots of reading, but wants the concepts not so much the details. pop quizzes on readings, but takes off 25% of missed points. has study guides and curves the exam. fantastic instructor, highly recommended! oh and dead sexy.

One of the best classes I've taken. Professor was easy going, approachable, responsive and helpful, also organized,interesting, gave clear lectures with slides and films.  Posted articles were interesting reading so it did not seem like too much. Attend class, take good notes, do reading and you can get A. Highly recommend him!

Nice enough guy, very approachable, knows what he's talking about. HOWEVER, aside from being the most useless, irrelevant class I have ever taken in the Anthropology department, the amount of required reading is ridiculous, overwhelming, and unnecessary. This is one of those frustrating classes that is uninspiring and will make you resentful.

She is so nice and teaches at the perfect pace. Korean seems difficult at first, however she makes it really fun to learn. I recommend her 100% of the time! As long as you're interested in the class and practice, you'll get an A
awesome
Great Teacher! Fantastic! Very down to earth and approachable! She does extremely well in teaching Korean. She also teaches at L.A.C.C. so she always well prepares non-heritage speakers! A+
She is so nice!!!I loved her class!!The quizes were little bit hard for non-heritage speakers but she was very helpful to those students, too.

I took professor Ayala in the winter of 2016. Class was straight forward.  2 page paper, midterm, and final. This class is very dense. A lot of reading but it's sociological theory so it's bound to be dense. I would take him again.

He speaks really fast and has an accent, but you will get use to it by week 3. Very knowledgeable with his stuff and is honest if he feels ambivalent with a concept. All readings are available on class website so didn't have to buy anything! Except an iclicker used during lecture for questions. & no surprises on tests! Cool guy!

He talks really fast, can barely understand him. But, he posts his readings/lecture notes online - very helpful. If it wasn't for the T.A. though, I'd probably do horribly.. so go to discussion! Tests are hard so study hard! Fill in the blanks and short answer.. fill in the blanks are very hard.
Best professor I have ever had. Easy, clear and he saves you a lot of money by posting all readings on his website.

I want to warn everyone do not take any methods class from her. I took psych188. I went to see her during office hours three times, she was never there. Her assignments are extremely long and vague. half or more of class dropped, and I wish I had. I'm terrified I won't pass.

Professor Goff is great! You really learn valuable things in the class and she makes the material easy to understand. The class is pretty structured so you have to work hard but it's very doable. Highly recommend her!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: One of the best psych professors at ucla. She makes her lectures very interesting funny and easy to follow.

Taking Professor Goff was probably my best choice I had made in UCLA. Extremely funny, clear, flexible, and understanding professor. During the finals week where WHO declared Covid 19 Pandemic, she was extremely quick and flexible with final even with such short notice. There is no required material and I personally think she grades fairly.

Alexx is the sweetest professor I have ever had. Alexx always makes time to help their students. I learned so much from them! I recommend Alexx for anyone because they makes the subject of film so fun and accessible.

By far the best TA I've ever had. Alexx made a large class feel small and comfortable. Very knowledgable about the films we studied. Alexx is passionate about film and truly wants her students to have fun. She wants you to succeed and provides feedback on your rough drafts. I wish I could take this class again!!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Alexx is an excellent TA. I cannot emphasize this enough! Very accommodating and gives feedback on rough drafts.
One of the best teachers I have ever had. Understanding, engaging, passionate, knowledgeable - I couldn't ask for a better learning experience.
He's good with limits, but he isn't a professor.
memorize the lecture note.

Great professor if you go to office hours. You get to go over way more stuff than the other math 132 classes, and it makes what they go over look easy. Greene's class gets you to the like three theorems that tie the entire subject together in my opinion. You just have to ask questions when you have them, and then in office hours use the board.

I didn't like his style of teaching. He referred to integrals as "junk', "trash", etc. Maybe he thought he was funny, but he was funny in his own eyes only. He does not use correct mathematical terminology & he just laughs & looks happy. There are much better professors at UCLA than Robert Greene.
Material covered in class does not prepare for the exams.
Does not teach, no textbook, only ppt

Ju is ok, a bit hard to understand with language barrier. Pretty much just does the lectures and TA does everything else. Amazing TA(Hao Zhang) very helpful with homework. Exams are incredibly hard but he grades on the average. Everyone passed. Grad level class.
He is a nice person.

I was not doing too well in the class so I went to her office hours and explained my situation and she really guided me and encouraged me which helped a ton. Her tests are pretty hard but she's a good professor and she genuinely wants you to learn.

Slides are so detailed but organized. Thai's lectures are really helpful, so ALWAYS ATTEND CLASS!! Some stuff she'll mention in class will be on the test. Book is not needed b/c her slides are excellent. I loved was how the test was designed+the pacing, made anatomy fun. Really wants students to learn so she spans the tests.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

No GCC option, so this will be it because this professor deserves a good rating! Compared to Girard or Covitt, Thai is a bit more lenient on the spelling though spelling still counts. Her teaching method helps alot with anatomy's foreign content and shes very helpful. Gives students extra credit options. Tests are tricky but study!! A is achievable
Good teacher. Very young.

Bascara's writing prompts are REALLY confusing. The papers are all pretty long (6-7 pages) and the prompts can be a full page long without clearly stating what he wants or asking a direct question. He also sprung a last minute paper on us in wk 10 with an unclear prompt. The readings are great & hopefully your TA can decode the prompts in section.

Prof. Bascara is a real gem. He keeps class interesting with a variety of teaching strategies, films, and active-learning activities. He inspires us to think critically about the world and make the change that we want to see. He is accessible outside of class and gives feedback that is both helpful and motivational. Hands down the best!
Prof. Bascara is hot!! But yeah, a good teacher also.. take him. you'll enjoy him.

Although Prof. Bascara has a very different style of teaching, he is a fantastic professor nonetheless.  There is a lot of reading but also lots of group assignments and stuff.  Papers are definitely doable and actually interesting.  I would totally recommend him and I'm not an Asian Studies major.  He's incredibly nice/helpful! Take him!!!

He gives 6 long tough assignments instead of a final but you're allowed to work with others and get help during office hours. If you like the material and are comfortable with proofs then it's gonna be a great time cause Liam is very enthusiastic about the topic and it shows.

Very chill teaching style and super reasonable guy. Frequently checked in with the class to make sure things were going well and that he wasn't going too fast or too slow. We had 6 assignments that made up our entire grade which was a welcomed change of pace for me. He gives lots of help on the assignments if you ask for it.
Professor Watson is at UBC Math dept now and is an excellent professor. Great humour, very polite, quick to get back to you. Just all around excellent asset for UBC.
Professor Watson is really talented at presenting lectures. And his exams are nice and closely related to the course materials. I had a great time having his class.

Disorganized. Strong fringe opinions. Illogical arguments.

No methodology, just opinions.

Take it, if you need credits and an easy A.

For me it was a good, I could focus on my other courses.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Amazing professor. She makes the class fun and interesting and knows what she is talking about. Definitely take her if you can. Not an easy A, but if you study you will do well.

Awesome teacher. She's young and really relates to the students well. Take her if you can. I would't call it an easy A because there are presentations to do and a long term paper, but she's definitely fun, informative, and super smart.

One of the best professors I've had at UCLA...It's too bad she is only a "visiting" professor and not going to be around full-time. Material can get a bit dull at times, but she makes it interesting. Take her class if you can. She truly cares about the students and wants you to learn something, not just write papers for a grade and then leave.

This whole class is one in-the-field research project ending in a 15 page paper. Very fun, lots of independent work, and amazing discussions.

10/10 Professor. Not too hard but a lot of work.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Grade consisted of two things: participation (doing weekly reading assignments, attending class, engaging in class, a powerpoint presentation) and a final paper. The final paper carried most of the wight and was centered around data analysis. This is a writing intensive class. She is a good professor who is clear in her expectations.

Grade based on: Participation (which included turning in a question at the end of class and doing weekly read and response assignments), midterm, and a final paper. She is an engaging lecturer and very clear in her expectations.

She is a grad student, but still totally inept to be teaching a college level course. Her lectures were all over the place, the exam questions were on things that were nowhere in the course material, and she was extremely pretentious and unapproachable. I managed to get an A in the course, but really wish I'd taken it with a better professor.
Good
No Comments
Dr. Shaffer is a great teacher!!! I highly recommend taking her.
good professor-very helpful
He is okay teacher. Not easy, not hard. So, if you study at least sometime, you'll do fine in his classes.
He may be a good professor for graduate students, but he tries not to "waste" his time with undergraduate students. His lecture is okay.

he is a very interesting and funny teacher, he likes to make fun of himself. he is good in connecting real-life happenings in economics in class. and therefore, he makes it more interesting.  good teacher and i recommend him. the only part that he could increase a little is his knowledge of engli
No Comments

Professor Gelbart's lecture notes saved my life! Even though the materials are hard, I finally get all the stuffs by reading his handwritten notes carefully. And he's a really nice guy. Also generous on regrading. XD

Professor Gelbart is a gem in the rough in regard to teachers at UCLA. I've never seen a teacher care so much about his students. His lectures may seem hard to follow at times but if you put in the effort and clear up issues at office hours you will find them useful. Tests aren't easy but they are similar to the practice tests. Curve is generous.
No Comments
No Comments

I took LS 4 (genetics) with Dr. Pham. His English is incomprehensible. The only reason students attended his lectures were the mandatory clicker questions. His exams are very complicated and you are never given a decent amount of time to finish them. I walked into his  class all excited about genetics and he killed all my interest.

He was very hard to comprehend and he goes on a few tangents. He really is passionate about what he teaches but it is a class to sleep in. There are required movies and 3 exams, which are a huge part of your grade. Attendance is mandatory with the clicker being used in class.

He was  a very helpful professor in my opinion, I really enjoyed his class. He always asked if there was any questions and if you needed help and my TA John was SUPER helpful he explained things almost better than the teacher. Your grade is based on 2 midterms, 1 final exam, 12 hours of HIV related community service (not that bad) &an opinion paper
Bring your computer or die of boredom.  Reads every word off of Powerpoint slides. Wont understand your questions so dont bother.Made us buy a reader but never used.
Great professor.  Down to earth.  Sees through flatterers and fakes that tend to waste class time.

Professor McCumber really knows his stuff! He explained all the philosophers really well and the only homework we had was reading (which is not required) and writing a paragraph every other week or so.
Best philosophy teacher at UCLA

This professor actually TEACHES rather than assigning a series of books and expecting his students to understand them. I expected Modern Receptions to Ancient Political Thought to be one of the worst classes I've ever taken--it ended up being one of the most valuable for a general knowledge of the origins of western democracy.

DO NOT take this class if you need any accommodations. Professor ignored my needs, made up her own rules, and I spent the rest of the quarter fighting for my accommodations with the sociology department and CAE instead of doing homework. I am not the only CAE student who struggled immensely because of her, JUST IN THIS QUARTER!! :((((

She definitely was passionate about the class and wanted the students to learn. Most Soc classes focus on expanding ideas for the exams, but not this one. You have to more or less memorize. The good thing about this is that the exams are based on the slides. Use her lectures to expand on those ideas for the essay questions. Do the readings or gg.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: This was a history of contemporary china class rather than a SOC class.  her class was well organized and interesting, but her exams were horrible..she made you remember all the facts rather than use your soc. imagination to understand Chinese soc. system..she was very emotional, she can't stand any  absquatulation during class

Class was actually interesting. However, it is not really a Soc class at all. Before the midterm she tried to say "remember this is a soc class, so know concepts..." So I studied all the concepts and bombed the test because it was ALL facts. There are a lot of little assignments though, which are easy and help your grade.
Great
NAW
No Comments
enjoyed his class every minute, specially if you interested in marcello, check it out
Great course

Elective? Easy A. Core class and want to learn something? Avoid him until someone else teaches the course. 1hr lecture per week. 3 easy hw. 3 group projs that takes time. Otherwise light class. Looking back, I didn't learn as much as ENG201. Weird grader. Finals is easy if you study correctly.

Very unorganized lectures.  Presentations were just a pile of snapshots from all over the place.  Very poor lecture delivery.  Absolutely  learnt nothing from this class.  Please take  this class only if it is a required class to graduate.  Otherwise it is a total waste of time because students don't learn anything in this class.
Class is very unorganized. No well definedclear grading system.
Amazing, take her if you can
Professor Harris is a brilliant scholar, and an engaged and thoughtful teacher.
No Comments
AMAZING lecturer. She makes everything so clear, and can make a century-old case relevant to the moment. One of the best professors at UCLA Law
Nice people, perfect lecture
His exam and final sucks. Does not invloved on the homework he assigned. He doesn't know how to teach. I wondered why UCLA hasn't fired him yet. His class was like milk. It only good for 1 weeks
Hes the worst. DONT TAKE HIM

He was Absolutely HORRIBLE. you cant at all understand a word of what he speaks. and really vain. Very unhelpful. Infact the t.a can teach a million times better than he does. if u ask him quest. he gets all confused and makes u confused. this was the worst class i have ever taken.
The good: knows his stuff, offers help The bad: class kinda boring, can't hear his voice

Econ 101 is meant to weed out the unprepared, so I dont mind that this class was a little tough. Prof Kung is clear, and that's what matters, so im glad its not a cakewalk class! If youre not ready for UCLA, too bad. The one bad is that his voice is too soft and passive and may put you to sleep in class!

AVOID THIS CLASS!! This class was the hardest class I've ever took in UCLA. He certainly does not understand that he is teaching undergraduate students. He expects graduate level performance from all of his students. DO NOT disregard this comments and regret after taking his first impossible exam. I am expecting to get my first C in UCLA.

take Kung if you want to boost your gpa. I took sproul for 1 and 11 and loved him and did well, but Kung is even easier than sproul. Two midterms and a final. He's a little quiet when he lectures but always willing to help during office hours
Selma Morley was a treasure here at UCLA. May she rest in peace knowing that she has touched the lives of numerous Anthropology students. Her memory will live on forever...

Really enjoyed this class- not too much reading, only two short papers required plus a midterm and final. Studying what she covers in lecture is enough to do well enough on exams to easily pass the class.
Dr. Morley truley enjoys what she teaches and challenges her students. Gave us a choice of substituting one paper with a presentation, A+ I would defenitley recommend taking her class.
No Comments

Prof. Radcliffe definately knows her history. She is easygoing and keeps everything pretty simple. No test.Midterm is an essay and group presentations are required. Learning lots in this class..down to earth, she's not horrible!

Currently enrolled in her class.  She is horrible... does not know how to teach.  Tries to engage class in discussion, but is really weird about it.  Acts like a savior because she is opening the minds of students... who already have more of an open mind than she does.  VERY UNCLEAR on expectations... still don't understand grading system, so lost.

Posted readings up late.  Very unorganized.  Disappointing lecturing.  She's not able to engage the class while lecturing.  She has you hold your question until she's reached the end of her notes paragraph.  She doesn't return emails.  Course is not clear and her style of grading is a mystery.  Seems to have a constant chip on her shoulder.

Knowledgeable but not engaging-All she does is read from her notes. Least organized class I've ever taken. Material is posted late on website and what's expected still hasn't communicated clearly.  Was interested in class to get a sense of a stronger more rational woman but TAs come off like shrill screaming banshees. Should've just read the book.

He's so energetic, all the time. Reading the book is a must since he talks too fast. A lot of homework but easy. Lectures aren't long but you have to pay close attention. ALWAYS responds to emails. He helps when you ask. Overall, he's a good professor. Class is interesting; a little math involved.

Malkan is a fantastic teacher. His lectures topics are interesting and his peculiar personality is often comical. He is also very willing to work with students on an individual basis. Overall, a great professor.
Professor Malkan was one of the best lecturers I've ever had at UCLA. Very lively and made me actually interested in astronomy. Lots of math and science involved, but not unmanageable.

Astro3 at UCLA: This guy is is so entertaining and peculiar that I don't see how people can fall asleep in his class. I found the class very interesting but then again I'm really interested in astronomy. Forget his lectures; as long as you read the textbook you'll be fine. He curves a lot!
Worst professor I've ever had. He's very rude, not concerned about how his students do, and lectures are very dry. Hard to believe UCLA would employ him.
Easy and straightforward
No Comments

Only one midterm that is a term paper, and one final. Not a helpful if you don't understand something in class, but he helps in office hours. Lectures are ok, not very engaging, but not very dry. Lectures are well organized and comprehensible and supplements with CNN videos sometimes which is nice.
Great teacher, she is very friendly and always ready to help
Very nice fun teacher, class is easy and hwk is fair

One of the best professors I have ever had at UCLA. Very knowledgeable, willing to help, and very fair. I can say this with the utmost confidence for those who cannot follow her lecture; perhaps astrophysics is NOT for you. Highly recommended Professor! A+++
Reading the material isnt enuff.. u must kno the material inside and out like an astronomer does. if not for the curve i wouldnt have passed the class at all.

Very passionate Prof. But sometimes the assignments are a little unclear, and what he wants is unclear. It can be hard to grasp the concepts, and he is a tough grader with the midterm. But he is a good Prof, loves what he does, and keeps your interest, and I enjoyed taking the class.

This course which was co taught by Schreibman was the best course I have taken in the school.  He knows his stuff as it relates to telling the story with the camera.   His years of directing has allowed him to hone his insight into what is needed to tell a story.

Schreibman's coverage course is a great crash course on basic coverage techniques. He may not be able to direct a movie, but he is great at explaining basic scene coverage technique. I didn't like that he was on the phone half the time during class and that he name dropped.

This course teaches outdated methods from the 1980's, which makes sense, as the last film the professor produced was in the 1980's.  This does not prepare students for careers in the 21st century.  Truly a terrible course and should be a warning to anyone wanting to apply to this supposed prestigious program.
Very clear, very organized. Take her if you value your education. Especially if your field is in the sciences. Drops the lowest scored test. Interesting lectures.

McWhorter is a young professor whose lack of skill shows in the way she manages her classroom. She has little enthusiasm for the subject being taught and her contempt for students is easily evident. She is more subjective in grading than a true scientist should be. Enrolling in this class puts you at her mercy which would not be a wise move.

It was McWhorter's second year teaching Anatomy and she did fairly well. You can usually tell the new teachers and McWhorter was no exception but I definitely see her developing into a pretty good lecturer.  She was also easy on the eyes which made the lecture go fast.  Test and practicals very fair and mainly taken from the powerpoint notes.

One of the best teachers I have ever had.  She gave insightful and interesting lectures. Very knowledgable, organized and helpful. Her problem solving based approach made the material more interesting and helped me know what material I needed to study harder. Take this class with her if you can.
Extremely passive aggressive.  He needs to care about his students more and learn how to mentor them.
Really terrible hand writing. He does not have regular lecture notes to upload somewhere. Just copying the board makes students miss the concept.

Dr. Deming is by far one of the worst professors I've ever had. He was completely unapproachable for questions outside of class. He only writes on the board and has terrible handwriting, which makes taking notes extremely difficult. He clearly does not care if students learn his material as the range of scores for his tests is typically 50 pts/100.
I found (Tim as I now know him by) to be very Hard at all times.
i hate her she is awful
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Yan lao shi is amazing! She is so caring and helpful. Her lectures are all in Mandarin and she pushes you to speak as much Chinese as possible, so you have to study a lot in order to keep up. Exams are difficult but not impossible, and quizzes are the hardest part of the class, but she drops your two lowest quiz scores. Amazing teacher overall!
Shen laoshi is an inspiration. She cares about her students more than any teacher I've ever met and is so wholesome and kind. I learned so much and never felt that I wouldn't be able to suceed.

Lovely and caring lady but very intense Chinese course. She teaches the class almost entirely in Mandarin and covers a ton of material. It's very fast-paced... You will learn a lot but will fall easily behind if you don't keep up. The exams are brutal. Make sure your schedule is flexible and dedicate much time to studying otherwise you will burn.

During the COVID-19 era, since everyone is remote, this professor is extremely obsessed with the assumption that all students cheat and that makes him paranoid. Consequently, he makes the quizzes for our readings so difficult that even after thoroughly reading, despite multiple ways to answer, he's very picky and will mark you down. Don't take him
Great class. The easiest poli sci i have taken thus far. Do the readings, 5 quizzes, an in class essay for the midterm, and then a take home final. You will not regret.
Very helpful, very informative, a brilliant guy.

very enjoyable guy, has a hilariously dry sense of humor and will definitely make you laugh at times. very helpful, always responds to questions through email, which he will respond to whole class. fair quizes and midterm, final yet to be seen.  highly recommended
Knowledgeable almost too much so on Chinese people.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Very nice, But Prof. Schuh seriously needs to reevaluate his curriculum. The class was an intro course, but the subject matter was not.  Weekly quizzes/HW assignments with very indirect questions/answers.  Final is openbook and the average is still a D.  Beware if you're looking to take for a GE.

Really nice/terrible professor. The average grade for the entire class, for the final, was 35 out of 60 yet we somehow all got a B or above for our term papers. During the final exam TA was pointing out flaw, how confusing it was and information that we had not gone over before. Schuh's response was, "let's just see what they come up with."

Really nice guy - Terrible instructor. BEWARE! You can do well on quizzes and homework and FAIL the final. The class average for the final was 58. This wasn't a test of our knowledge it was a bloodbath.

I don't understand the other reviews on this page-Professor Srivastava is very clear in both the presentation of the material and what he expects of his students. His homework assignments are reasonable and he is very helpful and available on Piazza for questions. You do need to attend lecture and spend some time working to understand the material.

Gives impossible assignments and doesn't give any help when asked.  Only asks further questions so that you have to figure it out on your own.  Seems to know his stuff but expects that you SHOULD know it too. Not a good TEACHER at all, would NEVER make it in industry.
No Comments
The teacher is a fraud, he is not a teacher, he should let go and make a living by hard work.  Never take a class with him

He assigned a book he wrote, but it was totally useless, and never used, for the class.  The tests and assignments are vague and opaquely worded and no matter how you answer, you get points taken off.  All in all, a typical Political "Science" class where nothing useful for any kind of relations, political or not, is taught or learned.

Excellent Professor. If you are interested in international relations, I highly recommend this guy. Sarcastic, cynical, and funny. Im a psych major and took his class out of interest and now i am minoring in poli sci. It is a difficult class, but dude, this is UCLA.

Unfortunately I have to agree with the previous comment- Prof. Stein did not make this a fun class- he never answered questions (clearly), nor did he or his TAs answer e-mails, which, in my opinion, is a must.The subject matter is great, and the text was interesting, but I would suggest a different prof. if you are free to choose one.

What makes this class hard is that he and his TA's are disinterested, smug liars.  They will tell you that the tests are one thing, but on test day, you'll discover that the test is actually too long, too complex and not clearly worded.  They also refuse to be clear about what they expect on assignments and then, of course, deduct points.

I agree with the opinions of fellow students. She is one of the best teachers in the department.
It is a role model for many students who come from disadvantaged backgrounds. The thing to do these days is to apply for scholarships with major foundations like Rockefeller, Ford or Wilson. Those are the best avenues to undo the oppressive thoughts.

Liked the course very much, though it is a lot of work. Charlene's projects are motivating. She is involved in the history of art and the interpretation of decolonizing the minds of the Chicana /o people. Please follow her lead and apply for the Woodrow Wilson Foundation scholarship. It is the accurate path to decolonization of the oppressed

She is excellent in her field. Would take another class with her cz' she is a model for Chicana / Chicano students who are entering college these days. Charlene is admirable, particularly if you check her humble origins. An inspiration for all of us.
Lectures are always packed with info, do not miss!!! She is very nice and very approachable outside of class. By far one of the best professors you will ever take.
BEST SPANISH TEACHER!!!! I highly recommend you take her class. She is the best spanish teacher I have ever had because she is super knowledgeable in her subject.
Very caring person, by far is and will be my favorite teacher. She is very knowledgeable in her subject, and if she doesn't know an answer completely she'll have an answer by the next class :).
She is a great Professor and she knows well how to teach us!
This course is really cool. I love Spanish so much. Gracias.

Kind and a lovely speaker. Articles he provided were at many times convoluted, however, and it would be prudent to look at a general textbook on the Persianate world beforehand, even though background knowledge isn't required. Gives some great lectures on Persianate empire and is fantastic at teaching you the core themes which are useful for exams.

Professor Green is a nice guy, but not very engaging as an instructor; he just needs to allow more dialogue with the students.  Generally your grade will consist of two essays.  One of these essays is the final, written on the spot, and he will expect you to memorize and utilize numerous references from the reading material:  Not quite so easy.
Excellent. Whip smart, clear, helpful, knows his Islamic history.
the best class at ucla. professor Green is clear, nice and coincise. his lectures are organized and interesting. very good class.

I took his class around 1967 at UW Madison. I see he hasn't evolved. Everyone got an A if you showed up or not, no tests. Just leftist speeches. The other thing I left with was his belief that the U.S. was beyond repair and the government needed to be destroyed and then started over. I figure he wanted to be the rebuilder. Rated 0
Do not take his class, he is rude, mean, arrogant, boring!!

Professor is ok. He is very discouraged when student ask him questions tho bcuz he'll be like.."what do you think?" (Im like if I know I dun hav to ask you..duhhh) or he'll looked annoyed when you ask question.. Worse case he wont let u finish what u wanna say..keep pushing u down~ So u gotta keep talking to stop him..
nA
This is a different level of toughness , a great challenge , a lot harder than 33
I personally enjoyed this class , cool professor
this class is really tough. make sure you have enough time for it

This professor is a good guy, but a bad professor, he cant boil things down, he only talks jargons and goes fast , exams are impossible. Perhaps its better to be his student in grad school but definitely not in undergrad..
Awesome
Easiest class I've taken. Don't even need to show up and it's an easy A. No essays!!!

Anth33 is not a demanding class, and Denton's exams are almost laughably easy.  Her teaching style, however, needs a lot of work.  She's disorganized, visibly uneasy in front of a large class, and her lectures and slideshows have almost nothing to do with class material.  If you care more about actual content than easiness, pass on this one.
Really easy grader. Made class engaging and interesting.

Teacher is extremely condescending and rude, bordering offensive (almost filed a complaint with the school last quarter).  Treats students as if they are idiots.  Tough grader.  TA has email inbox with thousands of messages, so most likely will not respond to you.  Mandatory attendance (sign-in sheet).

Truly awful professor.  Syllabus and assignment sheets do not contain same information.  Both professor and TA are unhelpful and unwilling to help you outside of class.  Massive amount of reading.  Papers are expected to be completed with a PhD-level thesis.  Professor is rude and condescending.  Prime example of what is wrong with tenure system.

Yes, this class is easy and you will most likely get an A. But do yourself a favor and do not take this class. The class is boring, and the teacher is rude, inconsiderate, and mean. I got an A, and most will but stay away.

Interesting professor, and funny. There was a midterm paper (10 pages) and a final paper (10+). She gives you a list of 10-13 questions, and you choose 5 to answer. Some of the questions were hard. The stories were at least interesting, and the music and movies were pretty cool. Fun class except for the movie with ugly people having sex.  :(

Great Teacher, Take If Given Chance Immediately. Great lecturer, well-organized, knows her s___tuff, great help in OH, although not necessary to pass course, homework is decent and manageable (imo), tests predictable, but doable, writes big so you don't need to fight for the front row, accent is actually a help, not a hindrance, and great overall.

She is a very organized professor in lecture. She is helpful in explaining matters that a student doesn't understand. Classes are usually coverage of new material. Homework problems are even and are graded, but I found her to be a great professor.
Great professor!  One of the best math professors at UCLA!  Very challenging, but totally worth it!  Loved her!

best math teacher i have ever had. lectures were interesting and organized, loved the accent, hilarious and a great teacher, told us exactly what was going to be on the midterm. but her final was a killer and she assigns only even homework problems that you have to do correctly to get the points. overall though, i would definitely recommend her.
Hal was everything an arts professor should be: creative, helpful and supportive.

Hal was an amazing Prof. He inspired me to continue writing, and he is one of the best at UCLA. He cares about the process rather than the end goal, which makes for a great Prof. He also tells amazing stories that will teach you more than any book will. Take any class that he teaches. You will not regret it.

Very intelligent and challenging professor. Doesn't sugarcoat when it comes to feedback or notes on writing. Sticks to the facts about the process of creating a screenplay and getting it sold. Pushes students to really consider the positives and negatives of a career in screenwriting. Those that are driven and have the talent will succeed.
No Comments

Great Professor!!! Insanely smart, funny, and interesting. Very giving of his time, never met a professor so dedicated to his students (in a totally non-creepy kind of way.)UCLA lost this very gifted professor due to budget cuts. He was also very easy on the eyes; hands down the hottest professor I've ever had.

He is the Best Professor I've ever had, and the most thought-provoking. I was not excited about the class at first, but I was genuinely disappointed whenever I missed a class. Attendance is not mandatory, but you should attend if for no other reason then he is so damn interesting.
No Comments

Incredible, fresh grad student now a full-time professor at UCLA! Fantastic analyst and philosopher on life.  Also shows historical context and also how things relate to us in the 21st century.  I will be sure to take another class with him!

If you are looking to learn and gain a lot of information, this is a great class.  Professor is very knowledgeable and wants his students to learn. However, be aware that this class is a GPA-killer. So for pre-meds and those looking to apply to grad school, skip this professor. Otherwise, risk getting a B/C (I'm saying this even though I got an A).
Very quick to answer my emails and discussion questions, fair grading, now I love neuroanatomy. Overall, great teacher.
Makes the brain come alive, very passionate, fun, engaging.

Entered the course really scared since anatomy and the brain is pretty foreign to me, but he really broke it down into digestible chunks. I'm not going to be a neuroscientist, but at least I now know how we think.
I have far too many years of education, and Dr. Keeler is one of the best professors I've ever had.

Dr. Keeler was a great professor. His experiences at RAND and real-life examples made this class very applicable and useful training for the real world! Highly recommend taking his course. And, he is super nice.

Professor Keeler is very approachable and asks for feedback after every class. He responds promptly to student questions and suggestions and try to be helpful by providing more explanations. Sometimes the economic/math concepts are difficult to come across to health science students. Many terminologies take some time to get used to.

Dr. Keeler is an excellent professor. He uses a variety of methods to ensure that you learn the material. He is particularly good at teaching math and economics concepts. He uses a lot of real-world examples. One of the things I appreciated the most is how he asked us repeatedly to give him feedback on the course so that he could improve it.

Dr. Robinson talks really fast and her lectures are extremely dense. She lectures using really longggg powerpoints. However, you can tell she is very passionate about what she teaches and getting a good grade is possible if you're willing to put in the work. Her study guides are REALLY helpful and tests are fair.
Although a lecture heavy class it was clear she was passionate about the subject matter. Tests make sense as the study guides help.

She literally never stops talking. She has slide shows that are 120 slides long and doesn't take a breath when she speaks. Tests are easy and are mainly multiple choice. She gives study guides and the class is doable, but you will hate every second you are in the class. No one speaks, and half the people sleep.
Usually lectures the full time but its interesting if you pay attention. Even if not, the tests are based on the PowerPoints which are provided with study guides.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Larry is such a good professor! He explains everything so thoroughly in his lessons and is very clear about grading criteria and feedback. I never had any questions about how to complete assignments or what was expected. My class was remote/asynchronous but he recorded individualized videos reviewing our work every week which was so helpful.
