Larry is great, he is very helpful and thorough. He will constantly remind you that this is a technical course, not an art class so we should focus on perfection of our technical abilities. I love that because I get caught up with details and waste time a lot so time management is key here. I've developed so many skills, I hope to take his DC2&DC3.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Larry is very direct, even blunt. But I definitely got a lot out of the course which is more than I could say about DC I. Take notes, he likes you to take notes. I did not get the impression that he was handing out grades. I feel I'm in the minority getting an A+.
he is so nice! you are pretty much guarenteed an A if you do the work! TAKE him if you have the chance!

Did not teach towards the bar at all, but taught only what he was interested in. Oftentimes made offensive or insensitive jokes that he thought was funny. Extremely disorganized and would often digress to make jokes or tell stories that were not relevant, which often disrupted the flow of his class. Poorly constructed final and MC questions
Very engaging lectures, pretty fair with cold calls. The class covers a lot of ground that you are expected to be responsible for.
Terrible Professor.

He's pretty fantastic. Hilarious to say the least, always keeps class interesting. He does focus quite a bit on policy, which some like and some don't. His final exam was incredibly fair. Overall one of my favorite professors at UCLA.

Professor Bauer is amazing! Highly recommend taking her class! She is always there when you need help or have questions. She makes the class easy! She does give a lot of work throughout the week but it is not hard at all. If you want a good chemistry lesson please don't hesitate to take her class!

I can't give Dr. Bauer enough praise, she is kind, funny, passionate about Chemistry and puts the students before any grade. She is the definition of a Professor who cares about her students and making sure we actually learn the material instead of docking points and making University even harder than it is. Her love for science radiates

She was really nice.  She wanted her students to learn the material and made the grade less important, which was nice.  The midterms are more difficult than the final and she is there to help you understand the material.  The only thing, was her study guides weren't very comprehensive of the test, so it was a bit difficult at first.

She's a really nice professor. Did demonstrations in class a lot to try and excite people. Her tests were challenging though. I am pretty awful with the 20B focus on g-chem, and I tried really hard and failed the midterms and final, and got a C+, so yay. She says her class isn't meant to be a weeder class, so try and you will pass and learn.

Brian a smart guy, and his lectures and written homeworks force you to learn a lot. Unfortunately, the written homeworks are a lot of work, and they generally don't match what you do on the quizzes. He also doesn't give clear feedback on quizzes, and the class felt disorganized. Our grades were not posted online, and deadlines were always changing.

Professor Van Koten is a young, new professor. He is clear with his examples and he's always willing to answer questions. His exams, however, are very difficult. He's more focused on proofs . His class is kind of demanding since he has quizzes every week. It was the first time I struggled in a math class. I worked very hard and ended up with a B.

He teaches well and has good examples. The problem is his tests. The av. on the midterm/final was about 50%. I got a C+ which is super disappointing because I've never gotten below an A in math ever before. His tests are SUPER hypothetical, confusing, and downright almost impossible to pass. May the curve be ever in your favor.
Van Koten is a new professor, and he is very clear with his examples. He focuses on theory and proofs, rather than routine calculation. If you do the homework in his class, you will be fine
Very knowledgable and well spoken. One of the best.

Excellent teacher, good guide through subject- his style lends to you learning and retaining the course work. Let's class discussion explore all aspects of each topic. Only drawback for the UCLA community is he is a proud SC grad.
No Comments

THE FINAL IS CUMULATIVE, which is very difficult given the extensive amount of information covered.  make sure you stay on top of the readings. they are lengthy, but you WILL NEED THEM. Sections are REQUIRED and you will do well not to miss any of them because there is information given in them you cannot get anywhere else.

Lecture rooms get half empty after a few weeks.  However, she is a very intelligent teacher and is very clear.  It's not necessary to go to all the lectures though.  The midterm and the final weren't cakewalks because of the amount of material but it's easy to get an A or B because she gives you the IDs you need to study.

Dr Rapp is a wonderful professor.  She is infinitely patient and helpful.  Her insights were extremely valuable for my work - a very decent human being too.  I recommend her very strongly for graduate study.

Professor Swango is a great professor who will challenge you intellectually and help you think outside the confines of political biases. His lectures are engaging, informative, and often funny. He's very patient with students and makes him self readily available to help. Highly recommended. Tests are easy if you read the material.

Completely agree with first rater- if you want to get an A in his class, it WILL consume you. That said, he's very approachable in office hours, and he is quite clear. I attended every video lecture/discussion & actually enjoyed it, but I wish he'd encourage a bit more discussion. Forming a study group & dividing the sections is vital to the final.

Had a curve which only a gave a limited amount of As, Bs, Cs, Ds, and Fs. Rarely lectured and instead relied on video lectures of other professors. Had one midterm worth 33% of the grade and on final worth 67%. He's a tough grader but the material is good. As a teacher he's not very good. I wouldn't recommend him.

Professor Homann is wonderful. She's a fast speaker and covers a lot in lecture, so you really need to go. But her passion is so overwhelming that it just excites the whole class. I am saddened to know she won't be teaching next quarer.

Her class was okay, even though there were some works (two essays). But you don't have to read the course reader at all if you just pay attention in class and take notes for everything she'd say. Just show up in class and take notes. And meeting a great TA is crucial for getting A.

Prof Homann is very knowledgeable about African arts & her passion for it it's transmitted in her lectures.Though material is A LOT & she speaks really fast so be ready to be overwhelmed & writing notes like there is no tomorrow ,good notes=crucial.Tests are ridiculous! over 80 images to memorize, 1 full essay and 2 mini compare & contrast essays

I really liked both the professor and the course. Unique and interesting material. I think she is a sincere and compassionate person, which came through in her class. She seems more interested in getting students to think and work together than giving out grades. Do the work, get an A.
This is such an interesting class! She is nice, helpful, smart, and very reasonable when it comes to assignments.Definitely recommend!
Excellent professor! She was very helpful and always responded emails fast. She is fair with grading quizzes and tests. The class is very interesting overall, I would recommend anyone to take it!

Prof. Rhodes had a way to get me involved and interested in the topics (even when I wasn't interested at first).  He has a great passion for International topics as they relate to all aspects higher education policy. Projects assigned were directly related to class content.  He took interest in everyone's projects and provided great feedback.

Gary Rhodes in an incredible mentor and advocate for his students.  I really enjoyed his international education course because of the content and guest speakers whose presence generated  interesting dialogue each class.

This class was a great introduction to the role of international education in higher ed institutions and what administrators in international ed is like. There was a lot of autonomy in the class, and both Gary and Val Rust were passionate about what they were teaching. The more you put into the class the more you'll get out of it!

I had Zaidel when I was studying abroad in Korea in the summer of '09. She was GREAT! She made sure the class understood the material, and her tests were very easy. She was very straight forward. She's a great model for how intro classes should be taught. The students end up learning and being pleased with the results.

She's really kind. I love the way she teaches-- very straightforward, gets the facts out, and gives examples.  I can stay awake in class and laugh a few times. Tests are really short.  You need to study the material though. Pay attention in class and don't slack off. The tests are pretty easy... maybe its bc I went to a hard highschool.
No Comments

I have him in USC for calc3 and I love his enthusiasm for the subject and willingness to help.  Makes the class fun but his class is definitely too difficult. You must understand the concept ahead before attending the class or you'll get lost.

The hardest class I've ever taken, and his teaching style did not make it any easier. He goes crazy about the syntax of his sentences. His quizzes consist of just 1 question to be done in 20 minutes. Then, his tests have 4 questions, which are harder than the quiz, to be done in 50 minutes. Impossible. Makes you feel bad for not understanding.

He doesn't know what he is teaching at all. Just copy every word from the book on to the board. Unreachable. Do not want to communicate with students. Tests are super hard. He tests on things he does not teach.

she's ok but her lectures are based on stuff you can easily find on the internet.  would suggest she bring in guest speakers who know something more about the movies and tv she talks about?   she only has an MA but is teaching a course professors usually teach.  tests easy.

Class readings, movies.  Clementine is helpful but she doesn't  really know the subject too well.  she has strong opinions on Indian images but doesn't  know what  they mean.  she should give a context about these images and some of the history so we can understand them in their own time period and not just today.  Really, we've come a long way.

She seems to have little teaching experience.  Her knowledge of film and media is limited to her opinions, which anyone can give.  She has no historical context and she doesn't understand how movies work visually or the filmmakers behind them . i wish this class were offered through Film and Theater instead.

The class is discussion based so you really need to show up and talk to get a good grade. No tests, just papers, 3 in total. Lots and lots of reading. It's what discussion and papers are based on so the more of it you do the easier the class is. He really leads you to paper topics and answers in discussion if you pay attention so take notes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The class is really interesting for those with an interest in Chinese history. The professor explains quite well, and he gives out detailed outlines and even sample exam prompts so that it is easy to prepare for exams.  There are two papers, a midterm and a final. While the papers are graded strictly, the exams are easy indeed.

Tedious class because no one cares about participating in the seminars...but Von Glahn was a good prof. in a discursive way. Overall, he can be tedious because he'd wait 'til someone speaks up after he asked a q. But I'm ok w/that cause i'm the MOST ACTIVE STUDENT IN HIS CLASS! If u hate discussions, then bring a pillow!
great teacher. inspirational

Roger is a great teacher and tons of fun.  He seem really lax but he expects you to work, work, work.  The more work you make the better.  He may seem unclear but listen to what he is saying it will eventually become clear.  Take his class!
great

First, this class name has been changed from Women's Studies 10 to Gender Studies 10. Professor Williams was an awesome teacher. She kept her class very relevant by using current events as examples to help understand the concepts we were learning. I totally reccomend this GE to anyone of any major.
WONDERFUL! TAKE THIS GE!

Professor Williams is great.  She gives really clear directions and uses a teaching style that promotes critical thinking from students.  As long as you read the readings and come to class, you'll do well.
Best of the Best!
Sophisticated; Very Attractive; Knowledgeable of the field; Articulate; Professional
Best Professor Ever; Very Personable; Knows Her Stuff; Highly Educated; Highly Gifted

For many in my class she was a horrible professor, but for me personally, I thought she was helpful in explaining the conceptual aspects of calculus. I feel like once you have a firm grasp on the math conceptually, you should be doing more than fine on the assignments (we had eight to do online, averaging ten problems per), two midterms, and final.
She has an amazing personality and will help you if you need it! But her lectures are unclear and her homework and tests contain such difficult essay questions that she does not review in class.

LOVE her dorky demeanor! Definitely injects life into something like multivariable calculus. A bit hard to understand during lecture but extremely approachable and helpful during office hours. Tests were tough but doable, and the curve was very generous.
Yes, I must say that because I had a good standing and experienced in her class.

So, she is now teaching English at Durham Tech. She came in after our first teacher was fired halfway through the semester. It was a hard transition cause the past teacher was not following curriculum at all. Yet, she still managed to get us up to schedule without overwhelming us. She is open and caring and made the whole class so enjoyable

she is really hard to understand because her levels of sophisticated vocabs, she speaks really fast too. The reading is hard to comprehend and not very helpful for students to form a thesis. She is not open to interpretations of literatures too.
He is sweet, personally I found the exams pretty challenging though. They are open note so that is a plus.
Honestly, if you ARENT taking Sherrer, I don't know what you are doing. Dude literally lets you use hand-written notes on tests and curves his exams. PS he is also rlly good looking

Dr. Sherrer is honestly a great professor who understands students have a lot on their plate. The class consisted of two homework assignments, a midterm and a final which are open notes. Attendance isn't mandatory and he is super helpful and posts recordings and slides of all of his lectures to reference. His class was an easy A and he's great.

Machine learning is a pretty difficult course. The midterm was really hard. But thankfully Professor Leonard reached out to me and offered to help out by putting more weight on my final and group project. I think anyone expecting to do amazing in this class should just beware that it's not the reality if it's your first time being exposed to it.

Machine learning is a really difficult subject but the Professor has a way of making it fun and interactive. I had to do a lot and just beware that he is pretty heavy on the projects side. The nice thing is he will help you when it comes to grading. I didn't do as well on my midterm so to help me out, he put more weight on my project and final.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Leonard was not easy but definitely made the time if you put in the effort. He will hold office hours. JUST GO. He is also super responsive. I usually received feedback almost immediately.
So basically there was litewrally this one time where hew as like teaching and then he gave a test. SO literally gotta study like literally
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--So many papers

comment: He was a good and funny professor but the material for the class is sooooo conceptual and its all theories...its a very hard class over all but he is not all that helpful when u ask questions he is not good at explaining...very nice guy though..awsome australian accent ;)

The prof. gives an A to only 10-15% of the students, so it's really hard to get an A in PSYCH 15 which IS a lower-division class while competing a lot of smart ppl. And there are many tricky questions in exams. If I had known this info, I wouldn't have taken it.
Dr. BBJ is an amazing Prof. It's not an easy class, but you will learn a lot. She has energy for daysssss and is extremely passionate about her lectures. I would take her again for sure!

Can be  rude and jaded. She often yells at students, forgetting we are all adults.  I got a B+ in her class  but it wasn't easy. She weeds a lot of people out. An A is possible with lots of hard work and study time. I found her to be very unapproachable. My advice, take the class, study study, pass the exams and move on with your life. UcanDoIt

She does not respect your privacy as answer scantron, paper,office door is open for others to hear:so you can not address your specific needs. Talks incessantly about her extracurricular activities-- gives more time to that then her students.
why did you take my rating down Mr craig what's up with that
Sigma Sigma on the wall, who's the rizziest of them all.

Quiz every single week. Doesn't matter if it's midterm week or the week before finals. You're still going to have a quiz. But don't expect to get these quizzes back because that would be ridiculous. Started doing better in the class after I stopped going. 10 week quarter, haven't been to class in 6 weeks.

Attendance is important to her. She is an incredible person who really guides you to develop a love of learning Dutch.  This professor has a good feel for class temperament and knows when to push and when to back off. She's very compassionate. Just make sure you actually show up!
No Comments

Very talented at explaining the language. Fully bilingual. Often took detours, talking about humorous personal stories and examples of Dutch culture, when she sensed the class wasn't in the mood to learn Dutch. Cares immensely about student success in the class. No textbook. You learn to converse in Dutch from Day One. Attendance IS required!
His lecture are not hard to understand and have key information on the core of the class and tests. However, there are just TOO MANY THINGS to memorize, and he does not care.

Very unorganized. Doesn't stay on track in lectures so hard to follow. No homework, no attendance. About 6 under 5 question quizzes. Not worth much in the grade though. Grade based on a midterm and cumulative final for the most part.Tests are mostly essay.

I took him for Physiology and learned so much. Keep your head down, listen, read, study. His lectures are great and overwhelming, just know that is your 2nd time hearing the material (read chapter before class) and once you review the lecture again it will all set in.  He can seem a bit standoffish but that is just him being awkward science guy.

He is a great teacher,some students think he goes off on tangents but his discusssions are related to the material most of the time they are alternative interpretations or a different perspective on the subject matter. When he does not have an answer he offers his perspective to get you thinking although he is extremely knowledgeable.

On 2nd thought, Prof Heim tend to go off tangent a lot. Also he doesn't like when people ask him irrelevant Qs because he would get nervous and won't know the answer. It seems his grading is subjective and NOT fair in a way particularly to essays. y i say that? cause he's NOT clear when he assigns a writing assignment! he doesn't knowhowtoteach

Class was wonderful! Prof. Heim is EXTREMELY KNOWLEDGABLE! HE KNOWS AT LEAST 7 LANGUAGES! HE CERTAINLY HELPED ME WITH MY WRITINGS AND WANTED ME TO SUCCEED! Though I got a B in the class(because EVERYTHING is essay, writings, including midterms&finals in which required 3 essays and 10 3-4 sentence ids), I feel that I LEARNED SO MUCH! So Heim is BEST

Amazing class. Jesse is dedicated to helping and inspiring his students. Our class was at 8am and he changed the time to 8:20 to give us an extra REM cycle. There are daily quizzes as attendance, which you'll pass if you're functioning. There are 2 SHORT papers.  His lectures are organized, clear, and interesting. He's also got the looks to match

Amazing class. Jesse is dedicated to helping and inspiring his students. Our class was at 8am and he changed the time to 8:20 to give us an extra REM cycle. There are daily quizzes as attendance, which you'll pass if you're functioning. There are 2 SHORT papers.  His lectures are organized, clear, and interesting. He's also got the looks to match!

Jesse really helped me through this quarter which was one of my toughest personally. I'm also fairly certain that half the class had fallen in love with him by the end of the course. Great course, he is really passionate about the subject and really wants to help.

Prepare yourself for the most intense class you have taken at UCLA. You will literally read a lot! His exams are based on the readings,discussions + critical thinking. If you excel at essay writing then this is the class for you, if not then RUN!
Prof Lesure is very smart and nice. His exams are 10 questions, you pick 8 to answer. They are a mix from the readings and his lectures so just make sure to pay attention to both. Super east grader.

Prof. Lesure is a great professor, very respectful and is there to help his students out if they have questions.  His lectures are clear and well organized.  The questions on the tests are taken directly from the readings and class lectures, as long as you pay attention to the lectures and take good notes on the book content you should ace each exa
One of the best teachers I've ever had.  Excellent knowledge base, caring, humble, and will challenge you.

She's a very nice person and a good teacher.  I think the difficulty in the tests are that she has readers, which in my experience are usually harsher than the acutal professor.  She's very political and will share her views with you and puts the class in a real life setting. she also likes to leave directions open so that can be difficult for some

Prof. Hale is one of the rare academics left - humble, fair, cares about her students deeply, warm, wedded to social justice. She knows her stuff, she's political, and the most importantly, her students are her colleagues.

Although the lectures are unorganized, I really enjoyed the assigned reading. If you want a easy A then take his class. All you have to do to pass is show up. The only work he assigned was one long essay that is due at the end of the quarter. I only participated once and I got an A-.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Easy A as long as you do the work and his lecture are somewhat unorganized but all you have to do is sit there and participate if you would like. If you do talk I think he would give you an A+ in the course otherwise you get an A- which I'm totally okay with. Textbooks are required since there are no cliff notes for his assigned reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Kirsner is pretty awesome. He has a great personality and is a wealth of information. Very intriguing to work with him and gain his insights. I can highly recommend him.

Amazing and engaging professor. His lectures were clear and the midterm/final was fair and completely covered by things he taught in class. It was my first undergrad political science class and it really got me excited about the rest of my major and international politics in particular. Absolutely loved this class!
Love his class. He makes the readings easy to understand and is interesting to listen to.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Absolutely wonderful professor.  Coherent, interesting, and easy to follow lectures and articles in the reader.    His African politics course should be required for all UCLA students, political science or otherwise.

This class was SSSOOOOO easy...we had one quiz and I think 4 papers 3 of which were group projects. Yes the software to do the projects were hard but the class it self was not bad and I am usually the last person to say a class was easy.

The problem with professor Suh is she is rather new. The assignments are extremely time consuming. I do not suggest taking this class if you are enrolled in 3 others. The breakdown is 4 writing assignments (2 individual, 2 group) worth 20% each, a quiz (20 questions, she gives a study guide with 90 terms on it) worth 10%, and 10% for attendance.
She is a very nice Prof. BUT she can not teach for the life of her. She never seems to know what she's talking about.
Nicest faculty member at UCLA Venice Dental Center. He is very helpful and always in a good mood.
He knows what he is talking about. Doesn't hesitate to say let me go and look this up for u. Or let me get it in Ucla way.
Great Teacher.

She's real helpful makes tons of notes and gives good idea of what test will be like. Shes super nice. She's also super hotbeautiful. There's definitely something super sexy about her but it's probably the whole package, her eyes, smile, accent, smarts, and uhhhm yahhh. I'm sure she'll always be the number one teacher crush I've ever had :))

Aliki is an absolutely wonderful math professor. Easily the best math professor I've had at UCLA. Her lectures were so incredibly clear that I did not have to open the textbook at all to learn the material. Aside from her teaching style, Aliki is also an incredibly caring and friendly person. I've never felt so welcomed in a lecture class.

She is crystal clear about what she expects from students. She provides excellent lecture notes. There are no surprises on tests. Lots and lots of examples in class, which is really nice. Plus shes cute as a button. I wish I could have her for all my math classes.                                                               and dat a..nevermind

Clear and interesting lectures. No textbook, all pdf articles. 1 written midterm (short answers) and same with final. Cumulative. Weekly reflection papers based on the lectures and "key terms" the student creates from them. Once I stopped using the articles for the basis of my reflection papers and solely used lecture notes, I got better grades.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: He's a descent guy and a descent professor. 3 papers overall, midterm, & final exam. Reading outside material helps a lot and office hours with TA. Definitely a doable class. Crammed for class the night before the midterm and pulled off a 92, not knowing any of the info when I started.
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: His lectures aren't terrible but it definitely feels like it's missing something. Most of the information I get from the course comes from my TA, Jacob, or from reading over the extra material- not so much the actual textbook. There is one midterm and a final. Also, two 3 page papers and one 7 page paper.
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Acabado is an amazing lecturer! I had heard amazing things about him prior to the quarter so I was excited to take his course while also bummed that it would be online. There are weekly quizzes, bi-weekly precis, and bi-weekly peer reviews. Both tests are based HEAVILY on the quizzes and textbook so it's easy to study for! Great course!

A subject like Archaeology definitely isn't my cup of tea, but Professor Acabado definitely made it painless for me. His lectures are dry but he cracks some pretty good jokes now and then. Just fill out the study guides, participate in disucssion, and you'll get an A. Would definitely recommend taking this course as an easy GE.

He tells us to do group projects because he doesn't like to grade papers. He is unclear on deadlines and paper rubricscriteria. Better be ready to check in every day to see if he's changed the syllabus and requirements without telling anyone. His lectures are unorganized, unclear, and skip over the actual facts to focus on unimportant things.
Great lectures, interesting readings, and extremely knowledgeable. His class was one of the best UCLA courses I've taken.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. Flomen is extremely knowledgeable, and it shows in his lectures. He is passionate about what he teaches. Lots of reading, many papers, and participation is important. I learned so much from him.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: We were graded on two papers. For the first assignment, we were required to use our lecture notes and the four to five sources he provided. Since Max's lectures are filled with information and his slides are 95% photos...I would recommend recording him, if possible. I enjoyed the subject and material, but I hope he changes the course in the future.
College is not a place for politics. But apparently this one doesnt want people to think for themselves.
Radical professor who chooses indoctrination instead of unbiased teaching.

Really knowledgeable and willing to help. He tells you EXACTLY what he wants so don't assume you have to do more/less than he's listed in the assignments. He will review anything for you if you get with him before the due date. Advanced class but fair overall and fairly interesting if you like the subject.

Didn't necessarily feel like the lecture was all that valuable to the class. I did fine by spending that time reading the textbook rather than attending. He tells you the concepts for the exams in advance, though. Midterms are fairly simple- ranging in easy to somewhat hard questions. There's no homework or quizzes, just two midterms and final.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Coroniti is an awesome guy that is genuinely interested in and knowledgeable in his field. There were no homework assignments in the Astronomy 5 class, and it was very interesting.
very caring
Great Professor! Really interesting topic, and does a great job of getting everyone to understand the material.
No Comments

DO NOT TAKE ANY COURSES WITH THIS PROFESSOR!  One of the most frightening things about this teacher is that she will not hesitate to, at the drop of a hat, abuse her power in an attempt to try and intimidate a student into doing what she wants them to do.  If you are on her good side, then you are fine.  If, however, you fall onto her bad side (whi

Was really kind throughout the course. You could tell how much he cares about his students succeeding. I know online learning isn't for everyone, but this was definitely one of the best online classes I've taken. He has you apply the concepts to real world scenarios in a relatively low-stakes environment that allows you to learn from your errors.

He never responded to a single request for help, neither through class e-mail, nor work e-mail. Nothing more than a proctor, enjoying benefits of online instruction compensation with close to zero effort. This instructor is not instrumental in providing differentiation for the institution and you are just as likely to succeed anywhere else.
Great on-line class experience if you need to get a stats prerequisite out of the way!

Professor Thomson is the most difficult professor I have encountered at UCLA. Biggest tip with him is to not speak in class. Ever. If you don't speak, he won't know you by name and, therefore, can not single you out when he grades your assignments. HEAVY on reading and not great at responding to emails. PICK A DIFFERENT PROFESSOR.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Possibly the worst class Ive ever taken at UCLA. Professor Thomson can be very condescending. Is unclear in instructions and due dates changed multiple times throughout the course. Good luck getting any email response for an all remote course. I do NOT recommend a class with him.

He gives out 100 pages TOUGH readings every FOUR DAYS, and explain those theories/concepts in LATIN/GREEK/FRENCH, and expect us to understand the readings!! He does not even upload the lecture slides, nor anything that would help to prepare for his lectures. He also gives out unexpected assignments. Feels like he intends to fail people.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The course material was easy to understand and the professors lectures were great. However, there is a lot of work, homework twice weekly, labs, test, & journal reviews. The test questions are very confusing and answers, it seems like she goes out of her way to make the questions confusing so people can't cheat but it hurts the grades.
incredibly sweet and a great professor
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Courtney was very kind however I didn't like how she set up her midterm/final. Some questions seemed kind of vindictive as they were meant to trick you or were things like "A, B, C, A and B, A B and C" etc. I studied extremely hard for the final and thought I got 100% but ended up with a mid B. Just don't get lulled into security. NOT an easy A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Try to attend lectures! Book gets VERY confusing but he breaks down the topics and makes it easy to understand. Take good notes during lecture so you can use it when you're doing the homework. I wish he taught MGMT 124B. I would take his class again
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Tran is really great at lectures. Accounting is not my favorite subject but he make it enjoyable. He connects his real world business experiences to the lectures and makes it interesting for the class. Lots of material to take in but manageable. He also wrote me a letter of recommendation that helped me give a scholarship!

ALWAYS ATTEND LECTURE! Prof Tran's lectures are amazing. The material in this course is difficult to understand, but Prof Tran breaks it down and relates it to real life. He gives the best acronyms! Class has one final exam but he tells you what to study. Hw isn't bad, usually consists of 2-4 problems. No projects. Will take him again!

If you truly want to grow as a creative writer, then Professor Kevorkian's poetry workshop is the one you need to enroll in. She teaches and guides in the fundamentals of poetry. The weekly homework consists of writing one poem, alongside various exercises designed to help strengthen and develop specific poetic devices. She is awesome!

Karen changed my writing in so many amazing ways. I feel like she's the hidden gem of UCLA's creative writing staff. She has a very dry wit and sense of humor and a kinda heart to boot. Take her class and be challenged and intruduced to so many wonderful poets work that are wwriting today. (I swear this isn't paid lol)

One of the best classes that I've taken at UCLA. She is very helpful and gives a ton of feedback on your writing. Learned a lot from her. She can come off as a bit weird at first, and she doesn't like to get intimate with the students, because she says that it makes it harder to grade them, but once you get to know her better, she is very kind.

Pretty good class. Prof goes on a lot of tangents and is always late to class so lecture isn't worth it. Lectures get recorded on Zoom so you can 2x speed through. Topics are interesting and give a very wide view of all healthcare-related subjects. Assignments aren't too bad, just take a little bit of time every few weeks.

Dr. Fluitt is one of the best professors here at UCLA. She made my first quarter as a transfer student wonderful and her class was extremely inspirational. She was always available for extra clarification and helps you in a way that really makes you think and learn the material. I highly recommend this class and denounce the previous review.

This class sucks! The class focuses on 2 guest speakers who present on topics that go over everyones heads. Then Amy deconstructs their research, each for 5 weeks. My main problem with Amy is her impossible problem sets! She comes up with questions unrelated to lecture and when you ask questions about your work, she becomes snarky and wont help.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Best Spanish Professor at UCLA! Everything you cover in the class is on the test, so there are no surprises which makes the class easy if you just pay attention and do the work! I have no complains about her teaching method.

Amazing teacher! would recommend her to anyone. We should have more teachers like her. She is so helpful, makes you work to ensure you are learning. Genuinely cares about her students and takes time to get to know each one. Makes sure you are on track and more than willing to help. Very smart, funny, charismatic and all around wonderful!

The structure of her class is simple and interesting. She is a family person that always has a new picture of her kids as her computer background. Although she is busy by being in charge of the TA's for every lower division course in the department she is surprisingly very accessible either for office hours in her office or for virtual office hours

Thick accent, monotoned. Lectures are NOT interesting but YOU MUST ATTEND AND PAY ATTN TO EVERYTHING because "everything is fair game" on the Midterm and Final. No lie. Worst GE/Class I have taken. Should have gotten a B- but she graded it diff (I had 80.01% of the pts) and SHE GAVE ME A C+!
Terrible! Absolutely terrible!This class was a waste of my life and it requires the knowledge of physics! And her teaching style is just awful!

She was simply a horrible professor. I'll admit that I didn't care much about earthquakes before taking the class, but I left the class hating everything about them. Her thick accent makes it hard to understand her and her monotone drawl lulls any normal student to sleep. The class average on the midterm was a D and she didn't curve it...WTF!
cool class.

I liked his style of teaching. At least his lectures aren't boring like most lectures here. The guy seems to know what he's talking about which is important for a class like this. The readings were pretty interesting.

Professor Chhuon was a new teacher but seem prepared. It was nice to look at what I thought were common sense stuff from an academic view point. If you do the readings and attend class you should be alright.
lectures made me so sleepy lol just make sure you're at discussions and listen to prof Yans examples in lecture
Lectures were really interesting. Exams are straightforward. You HAVE TO READ ALL THE ARTICLES! He uses them for the exam.
Fair

Professor De Sapio is great! I heard his class was tough and he was one of the harder teachers, but I quickly found that this isn't true. He makes jokes and really takes the time to make sure you understand the material. The class can be hard but the De Sapio is one of the nicest most helpful professors.
No Comments
Funny and nice guy.  but tough class...
He recently moved to the University of Nevada, Reno. He is very good at teaching and he has a very clear explanation. He will give you reviews for your test and quizzes. I recommend this professor.
Very clear explanations about boring subject.
No Comments

The worst professor I have ever had. Their is no question about her intellect and level of expertise in her field, but she is a terrible lecturer. Does not lecture nearly enough to help students understand material in class, very unorganized, and overall is not helpful at all. Being nice does nothing for our  grades. Avoid at all costs.

course was not easy and requires effort on your part. if you like learning about how you learn and form relationships cognitively speaking, then this class will be fun for you. Dr. Cheng is extremely helpful but she's teaching something that isn't easy to grasp. overall, i'd take her again if i could.
Very intelligent person, but has no clue about teaching. Speech is hard to understnad, answers are unclear, and tests are extremely challanging. Seriously, do NOT take any class with her.
Amazing professor who is always willing to help out if you ask. Her classes are difficult but office hours always help. Love her!
Totally unhelpful.
Really sweet professor who cares about her students.
Beyond great. Best prof I've ever had, and his explanation of movie story is AMAZING. He breaks down hollywood movies and shows you how they work. He's funny, too.
Amazing. Peter changed the way I looked at movies -- he is INCREDIBLE. (He's also very funny) but the dude works in the biz and he breaks down films like nobody I never seen.
Peter Russell is amazing. He is literally the most entertaining, informative teacher I've ever had at UCLA. Classes are THREE HOURS long, and dog, you gotta be good to keep me from zoning...
Best course I ever took.
Amazing.
She is brilliant.

He curves like a saint. Although I never do reviews, the mercy that he has bestowed upon me has compelled me to evangelize to the world of the savior of my gpa that is Zachary Maddock. All hail Lord Maddock.
nice

His tests were hard and two hours long. I mean hard, but thank God for the curve. I didn't find his lectures to be that different from the book but most professors usually don't differ much from the book anyways. He was very clear in his lectures though. But no matter what, he was hot! If you are a girl, oh joy. If you are a guy you may even turn.

Professor is here to help you grow & learn. He is an open book of highly specialized knowledge. Do not let his serious manner of expression put you off; the point is to tease the best academic potential out of you, even if it means getting under your skin. Reviews here have judged harshly without understanding this teaching method can work.
He is passionate about Chinese cinema, and he is funny

A soft-voiced professor who is passionate about Chinese Cinema yet can come off as a bit pompous at times. This is not so much a film-history course,  it's more of a film-theory course, you will cover a lot of abstract concepts and be pushed to think critically. The films he picks are very interesting but warning: You will have to do much readings
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Awesome professor - very clear powerpoints that he's happy to post before class if you ask. I downloaded them and took notes directly on slides so everything was very clear. I loved his class! (I took Philosophy of Biology with him!)
Excellent Professor and really cares about his students. I would take another class from Josh Armstrong in a heartbeat! I encourage you to take one of his courses as you will not regret it.
Do yourself a favor and take a class from Armstrong.

I really hope I never have to encounter a professor like her again. She is the worst. I have never had a professor so out of touch. Most of the class has been doing bad and she tells us to try harder. She really needs to take a step back and self reflect. She has me contemplating my time at UCLA. My depression came back because of her. Thanks Daria

She is not a sociology professor, beware! Shes a linguistics proffessor and you can tell! In this class you will not learn anything might as well not go and teach yourself. When you ask for help she will be very vague and not give you an answer. She doesn't care if you aren't doing well either. Study guides are NOTHING like exams. Tests are HARD.

DO NOT TAKE HER. She does not care about her students the slightest. She is the worst professor I have ever encountered at UCLA and is such a harsh grader. Not only can she not teach but she is not even a sociology teacher. She acts nice but does not care if you fail. When you ask for help on a question she answers everything but the question awful
If You're taking this class I recommend you drop this class you won't look back
Seriously, if you don't go to lecture, you're not going to understand half of the material or how they are all related. She is a great professor who makes the lectures quite fun if you're interested.

Good Class, but you have to actually go to lecture to do well on tests. Expect to know all information on almost every Greek character you read about..you have to know about 160 people and terms inside and out to do well on final.

Pros: Smeenk is passionate and knowledgeable about the content and explains it well. Interesting and well-structured course content. Tested on understanding

Cons: Lack of timely communication and feedback was frustrating given how tough the course content is. Large time commitment. Unclear grading criteria at times (marking was fair though)
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Very nice, very responsive professor. However, won't recommend the course philosophy 2032 to anyone. Too much reading, so many dues, HUGE workloads, difficult exams

Great professor! I took his class at western university. It was a difficult course, but an amazing learning experience. Professor Smeenk was always available via email and even met with me to discuss material questions I had. It is clear that he really cares about his students.
Professor Saguy cares a lot about her students and is challenging but fair

Professor Saguy is an excellent professor. Her lectures are engaging, and they're organized and easy to follow. This was one of the best classes I've taken at UCLA. Professor Saguy is interesting and informative, and while the class is challenging it's definitely manageable.

if you are not gender major, do not take the class. it wont do any good for you. professor has very narrow minded in terms of taking students idea. she does not answer you with your question, but reiterate her ideas.

Professor Mahoney is very caring and amazing. His work for POSC is really easy with weekly video lectures to watch (super short) as well as easy 20 question quizzes with no time limit. The papers in this class are fairly easy if you spend a solid amount of time on it, extensions are offered if you are in a serious situation and email him about it.
great course to take, there are no exams only two essays and he is a very generous grader.

He is a great teacher who has a large background in the study of terrorism.  Poli Sci 139-3 is such a great class to take.  It's essentially a two hour forum in which people share their differing global views on terrorism and insurgency, and Mahoney definitely chimes in when necessary.  There is a lot of reading, and attend class!

He has no direction in his lectures. It is easy to get lost in his speeches because he does not get to the point clearly. Definitely a type of man that loves to hear his own monotone voice. Reading the textbook on your own is your only hope.  An example of his tests: He gives only a dozen questions for 5 Chapters of reading, and essay questions.
His lectures are very tedious and he expects you to know very finite details about South America.  Do the reading, because you won't be able to get much out of the lectures.

Very helpfull and energetic about pushing his students along and given encouraging words. Knows his very narrow topic inside and out. Very dull lectures, very dull approach to an interesting topic. If you care about his research, he's the best person to know. If you care about broader topics, a pure bore.
Best prof in TFT
Great teacher, wonderful class discussions and very helpful.  One of the best professors in the department.  His classes are tough but worth it--you learn a lot (unless you are lazy).

His lectures are messy, irrelevant to the class half the time. He doesn't tell the TA's anything, they never know what he wants. His paper topics are more of a graduate level, and he didn't give the study guide for the HUGE final until 5 days before1 AVOIDD

Loved him.  Makes his student think.  Is open to true intellectual thinking.  Opinions are not allowed.  This is GOOD.  To many of my fellow student thought opinions are driven by intelect, and not assumptions. Dr. Lovas, was a fantastic teach for Behavior Modification course!
Cranky, boring, narrow-minded, and he expects his substandard word usage to be parroted back on tests. A living demonstration of the limits of Behaviorism as a legitimate field of study.
he is MARVOLOUS !  ABA RULES!

A very knowledgeable professor, but a bit hard to follow. She begins explaining and then jumps to something else within the middle of a sentence. If you make a mistake in your translations, she jumps on it before you can fix it yourself. She's very forgiving in her grading, but in no way prepares you for what you're actually going to be tested on.

she is really a nice person and is very helpful and wants everyone to do well on the exams and essays. the studyguide is amazing and totally helpful. her lectures are hard to follow and she's a bit all over the place--its hard to keep up.
No Comments

Furner is one of those rare professors who both cares about his research and very much wants you to care (or at least think long and hard) about it too. I thought he did an excellent job of facilitating class discussing and curbing it when it was getting too heated or going astray.
Friendly, clear, interesting, funny. Really enjoyed his class.
Really good.  Covers a lot of material, but keeps it understandable and interesting.
Professor Erwin makes no effort to help her students. Her lectures take interesting topics and make them boring. She has completely tainted my love of theater.

Very clear and straightforward teaching style. Also very easy to communicate with. Although the subject matter can seem redundant, as it is a survey course, Erwin does make an effort to integrate good visual aids(films). For my qtr, she got really great speakers... really nice when lecture is 3 hours long on fridays

Professor Erwin gives all the answers to her tests in her powerpoints. She is always helpful, but this is a class of history of theater, not practical theater (although the extra credit requires you to act).

His class is tough. He is very laid back, and is always open to questions. If his students express a need to review a certain topic, he will review it. He is very understanding and will help his students in any way possible.

Chill, not always a good thing. Does a lot of proofs, which aren't really needed. Tests are fair, and the class gets really hard towards the end (multivariable and vectors). He's not that great at explaining, so get a good TA. Overall, pretty decent teacher and the curve will always be high due to the pre-meds.
Very hard material but professor structures his class in a very straightforward manner. I recommend him only if you are ready to buckle down and work hard. Definitely not an easy A class.

Class was super easy. Professor however is extremely annoying. Be prepared to feel like you are in high school. But if you just do the work its an easy A. She gives you study guides with the exact format and questions of the test, so if you do poorly, its really your own fault.
Interesting lectures.  THe subject matter is mind-blowing and life-altering.  HIGHLY recommend this class and this Professor.

I highly recommend Prof. Bays. She's very helpful, easy to follow and open-minded. She wants you to learn and is very passionate about Hmong history.  As long as you read & take notes, you'll do great.

I was an Anthro major many moons ago at UCLA and Dr. Hollan was one of my favorite. I found his course challenging, entertaining, and he was a very approachable Professor. I never met a student who did not like him! He's a wonderful human being. Period.
Great lecturer. Quite a bit to read but assigns interesting books/articles. Is very clear and willing to help to make sure everyone is on the same page.

My experience with this teacher rates lowest of all my experiences with teachers at UCLA. He leads the anthropology departmental honors, and in my opinion, is better suited to teaching kindergarten. In a program designed to give the most interested and advanced students in the department an advantage, he insisted on mindless handholding and busywor
Very unusual guy. Don't get on his bad side (which means you should avoid being next to him, all sides are bad).
Repeats the same stories over and over.
This is amazing boxing of texto!

She's very anal. She practically delegates all the work to the students so prepare to present on the reading material which is more than enough. She's not very receptive to others opinions and she'll also tell you to be creative with your final and at the end become very pushy with what she believes is the best way to present it.

I don't recommend this class if you are not Chicano/a because all materials are about Mexican American, and some readings are included Spanish, so if you don't understand Spanish, it's hard to understand. Also, if you don't have background, you have to read all of readings. I liked this course, but it was hard...

Very difficult and rude. She thinks she knows everything. Despite that the class is on understanding oppression and social movements, I find it hard to believe that she actually listens to grassroots people. She gets fidgety and attacks anyone who disagrees with her. take the class if you dare. just read a book on the syllabus topics instead
Very articulate. His lectures are easy to understand and help very well on the exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: I was not a music major, but was able to take his amazing class on current music and its roots. Totally amazing. I would listen to him read the phone book! I learned a ton. Probably the best class I took at UCLA.
though only music students will probably ever have him, he is a great professor.  His was one of my favorite classes at UCLA

This review is for 169 because it's not an option but basically I am frustrated and disappointed with this class. It's supposed to be about political corruption, which we did not look at for the entirety of the quarter except for 2 weeks and it's very R Studio/stats heavy. I spend more time coding than learning anything useful about the subject
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Uses outdated resources & just rambles on. Exams are very poorly thought out. She?s a waste of time & you will learn nothing from her class except not to take her again. If you want a better grasp of the EU take Tsebelis not Golden. UGH!

This teacher is horrible! the subject is pretty cut and dry-but somehow the average grade in her class was a 70%. the curve was so bad that a 60% was a C+. She gives a study guide, but the test is totally from the readings. She does not care about student's grades.

her diagrams don't match up to anything. Tons of work. She does like essay questions. She's enthusiastic about the topic, but over half the class has already dropped. I'll retake with a different prof.

A lot of lecture. She likes essay questions on her tests which involved great detail, and are worth a lot of points. Although her lectures were not always very clear, she was eager to explain things further if students asked. She provided lots of opportunities to make up points on exams as well as extra credit. Ask if you're confused.
she is soo easy, and at times she can be hard too.
Wow! He comes to class everyday well prepared. He is clear and concise when he explains concepts. After the quarter was over I truly felt I had mastered the material!

Very adorable professor with a crazy French accent. He is a very effective teacher, explains everything very well. He does not just go by the book, explains theory in a more precise way. His homework are very helpful!!

A VERY effective professor- makes sure that students really understand what is going on. Tests are very clear and not hard if you really comprehend the material. As a person, he is one of the nicest and most caring people I met in my life!

Great class: the subject was fun (in a word:3d), and the teacher explained it phenomenally(blatant sycophancy). He doesn't curve his tests because he doesn't have to: you'll most definitely get at least 90s on his tests because he has practice exams, review sessions and good lectures. Smith is the best TA around so if you fail it's your damn fault.

Park really cares for his class to learn and do well on the tests. He thoroughly goes over the material and his lecture notes facilitate note-taking. His tests are fair, but not easy. Everyone does well though.

Very dry subject, and I never used assembly, they were using CUSP and moved to MIPS, but I think this is for an area of industry which is not super popular, unless you go very low level.
This professor just reads off the slides and doesn't explain anything about programming..

He sucks!!! We had 40 somethin people enrolled and only 4 people showed up to class because he can't teach. He reads off slides which don't make sense to anyone at all unless you already know the material well. Pretty much...take Smallberg or atleast go to his lectures.
Did the same Uta Hagen work in high school. Some funny stereotypes of bad acting coaches exist with her lots of self promotion.

There weren't a lot of hard and fast acting techniques in the class. I agree it could of been an improvement. Felt like you were under her rue to make a good impression. I could see the gossip idea. Somewhat useful but not what I was expecting.

The Professor was a total gossip. Made me feel so uncomfortable to the world of acting. In class she discussed students personal business & background with the class. In terms of technique or skill I found other Professors to have more scientific or useful strategies for acting. The "Psychology" of acting wasn't present. Can't say I learned skills.

Very funny, very clear, and is always making sure no one is left behind. He is a bit stiff about talking or texting during class but he is not unreasonable. Attendance is not mandatory, but showing up to lecture late will get on his nerves.
Worst Professor in UCLA Engineering. Has a horrible attitude towards students, and makes issues a bigger problem than it really is.
No Comments

This class is HARD for a 1000 level. SO much reading and lectures are boring. He does care about the topic but doesn't understand this class is 1000 level. Midterm and Final are ID/essays. Tough grader! Takes FOREVER for grades to come back. 8-10 page research paper.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: His first year teaching at SMU. The class was super unorganized/ chaotic, we had two quizzes before the mid term and one paper due all semester. He also is super boring, but does really seem to care about students/ what he is teaching.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Berenji is great at breaking down overarching theories in understandable terms. He's very relatable, tying classic concepts to today's tv shows and ensuring that students have time for Q&A. Very approachable, offered test study guides that were clear and helpful, wonderfully marked readings that were "optional" as such.

Easy A! This class is online and lectures are pre-recorded. Her slides are very informative and pretty enjoyable! She gives excellent feedback and responds to all emails! All assignments are straightforward, weekly discussion posts, 5 quizzes, 4 assignments, a midterm, and one final with extra credit overall great professor!
Good class, really easy
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She's assessable to reach through her email, she's clear on what you need to do by sending in announcements. We usually read off the textbook alot for the discussion posts, make sure to take notes on the slides she uploads and on the chapters you read because you'll need them on your exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Amazing

Possibly the worst lecturer Ive ever had, especially given how renowned a researcher he is. He is rambling, pedantic, and incapable of focusing on the weeks material, preferring to lapse into the same generic monologue about the rise of superstar cities in every. single. lecture. 236 was a farce of a graduate seminar; save yourself & skip it.

He is one of the most competant, clear, knowledgable instructors I have had in 6 years of college. He knows the topic and still cares enough to deliver it in an interesting way. You really feel like you are somewhere important when you are in a class with him. Cool too.
The only way you will Pass this class is if you already took AP Calc in high school or you somehow understand his English as a second language gibrish.

You cannot understand him.  He  answers questions, but he is still incomprehensible.  He is nice but is awkward to talk to .  You need to read the textbook to understand all the non-math parts.  If you did not have calculus prior to the class, you should get outside help if you do not understand a concept because each lesson builds on each other.

He has a very thick accent.  You can't understand a single word he is saying.  Tests are structured in a way that there are 4 questions, one is a multi-part, and one is a really tough question.  Use your book and go to discussion, and you'll be fine.
I agree with the others. He's really dull. The topic should be interesting, but this class wasn't.
Borrying!
Most boring class in my entire law school career.  He tries, but he's a horribly boring teacher.
No midterm, no final. Only papers - can rewrite to get an A if you get a B at the beginning for the midterm
Super easy and chill, but so boring.
No Comments

Professor Warshel is great. She is extremely knowledgeable and I'm happy to have taken a course on such a unique topic. She is great at articulating her points in an objective and nuanced fashion. This class definitely helped me in my other courses. It deepened my knowledge. Challenging, it forced me to think critically. I am appreciative of this.

The course was very challenging, but much needed in a school of education. It is the only one that discusses the ethics of working with children. Professor Warshel is dedicated and engaged in critical discussion. She was really good at facilitating discussion. She also really helped us to develop our own projects.

It is unfortunate that Dr. Warshel is no longer at UCLA to continue to offer this course. The course is a major asset to our department. This is a very important and relevant course that those of us who were enrolled in were fortunate enough to have benefited from. Maybe UCLA can think of a way to convince her to return?!
He's pompous and he's not a humble guy. Worst teacher I've taken at UCLA. Avoid him at all costs. He's terrible. He's the kind of person that won't improve, when given feedback.

I did not like this professor.  He was too difficult for an incoming transfer class.  He has an attitude problem although his teaching style is decent.  He has favorite students and he likes to call people out in class.  I wouldn't recommend him.
Great Proffesor. Highly recommend.
Incredibly difficult and time-consuming class, but Professor Mehrnia is an amazing lecturer. I learned soooooo much from this class. It really taught me the fundamentals of circuit analysis
Amazing professor for one of the toughest core undergrad Electrical Engineering courses at UCLA.
Midterm average was 42%. We'll see how the final goes.
Excellent class and professor. Explains concepts very well.
Great lecturer and course. inspired me to change my major.

attendance isn't mandatory, but you get credit for lecture participation through the use of electronic clickers. grades based on lecture participation, lab participation, lab assignments, lab quizzes, reading quizzes, and exams. all are medium to easy difficulty, and most are available online. her lectures are terribly dry though.

A published well respected professional in his field and none of that kept him from being down to earth and completely genuine with students, staff, other faculty - didn't matter. What you see is what you get - no hidden agenda & always willing to help in any way he can.

Professor Thornton is by far the most adorable and nicest elderly professor I have taken at UCLA. He does not have a loud voice so be sure to sit in the front! I have taken two of his classes Anthro 172A and 169R, which have been both mind opening and amazing. Most of his lectures him speaking, and you have to make sure to attend class.

Best professor there is! If you want to learn and take notes from an intelligent and helpful instructor, this is it. I simply can not put into words what a great professor he is. If you get the chance TAKE HIS CLASS

Professor Diaconecsu is an amazing woman. She is not only a profound researcher, but she is probably the most generous professors I have met. She is always willing to help. The content of this course is very abstract and elusive, making it extremely difficult to teach, but Paula overcomes this by jumping right into endless, helpful examples.

It is very hard to understand what she says in class. Not just because of her accent, but of the awful way she teaches. You'll just find out that you learn nothing from her. Extremely vague explanations on the course materials. Don't bother to go to her class although she will give pop quizzes during lecture. Office hours are much helpful.

She should be avoided at all costs.  Knowledgable, but inarticulate, unclear, and incredibly difficult. She has ridiculously high expectations of student performance.  There is no way to feel that you have done well in this class.
Very kind professor, inspirational and dedication. Though his class is dry and textbook poorly organized.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: I enjoyed his class, although probability is a pretty uninteresting subject. The prof. explained everything clearly and in an organised manner.
best professor at UCLA!
I loved this professor Im so glad I had him thanks so much for the effort he really helps you learn
Had Ralph Weiss for a real estate law class at UCLA Extension.  Was best instructor i've ever had for my real estate broker license classes.  Weiss has become a mentor of mine.

Likes to tell stories about his celebrity clients as examples,test comes from text witch he does not greatly discuss in class (you're on you're own preparing for his only test- the final), typical attorney- hard to get help from or get questions answered by email or even after class. But to be fair a couple of my classmates loved the stories/style.

Wow.  If all classes could be like this.  I knew I liked the subject before I took the class, but the way Dr. Tidball explained was amazing.  I recommend this class to anyone who wants to learn about muscle.
No Comments
Love him! Such a great professor--such a great lecturer. Take him take him take him! Really fun/easy class that's super interesting.
He's great.  Nice and patient.  Really wants students to understand the material, not just memorize. Mostly conceptual.
Lectures can be kind of ineresting, he doesn't do a lot of problems in class, mostly theory, but you have to memorize formulas for tests. Have to study a lot. Nice guy!
Great professor. He even dresses well. Take him at UCLA.
No Comments

This guy was simply awsome. his classes were crazy fun. we talked about life, and death, and everything else. ethics, epistomology, rationality, theology. he packed it into one quarter and made it interesting! He is the phil professor to take.

He's a really good professor! He lectures clearly, and his exams are honestly not that difficult. Admittedly, the curve is what makes the class hard, but otherwise if you're willing to put in the effort you'll get more out of his class than a bunch of facts.
You feel like youre being tested every lecture.  Boring class.  Not the best lecturer.
No Comments

if you have never taken a calc class before, this class will be hard for you. He does problems on the board, but since his english is broken it gets hard to understand him. most of his tests are in the test bank, but his TAs grade the midterms super hard. Be prepared to teach yourself;

Popa is such a cutie-pa-tootie. Some might think his accent makes it difficult to concentrate, but I think it makes you put in more effort and more bearable for 8ams. He tries really hard, so as long as you look at past mid-terms and work hard on your hw, it should be okay.
AMAZING TEACHER!
Great professor.  Really funny.  Knows a lot about the material in the class and provides multiple viewpoints about energy.  He's very approachable.
No Comments
Great guy, smart, kind of funny too.  Take him if you can, good lecturer. Exams are very fair
She is very intelligent. And cares about her students.

She is hard, I will admit that. But she is very helpful and she wants you to learn. She is so intelligent. I have her in both PIL 270 and 566 Laws of war and terror. In 566 the reading is a lot, but the class gets better when you get in to it.

Worst class that I have taken in law school.  Professor Bali is an amazing woman, but has no clue how to teach.  I learned barely anything and law of war was my life for the semester.  She has unreasonable expectations, and taking this class was a horrible choice on my part.

This guy really knows his stuff. He looks like he just graduated himself. I'm assuming he specialized in Kant because he just goes off and describes every thought that Kant ever had. Reading the textbook was a waste. I survived by going to lecture and taking detailed notes on everything he said.

I really liked him and thought he was fantastic "Ethics" teacher. Additionally, he didn't come off as agendized, which is uncommon for liberal arts professors at major research universities like UCLA.
No Comments
In depth knowledge on subject a key

Behavioral Research in Marketing changed my life. Sood is like the Jedi master of Behavioral Marketing. It's a MUST TAKE! This prof makes the future executive in all of us come to life. Great, great great.

If you can get into his elements of mktg class DO IT! Sood is great and takes the time to help you really see why you're learning what you are. Can't say enough great things about Sood. THANK YOU Soodie!

I came to the program because he interviewed me. One of the smartest people I ever met and his knowledge base is incredible. Very down-to-earth for a professor who is world famous. He spends the time to teach one on one. He sets an example of how to interact with patients and goes over what he does. Nice to see a high tech guy who cares

Gifted teacher and true role model.  takes the time to teach one on one. national leader in his field. has sense of humor.  incredible fund of knowledge. teaches  patient interaction skills in a way i have never witnessed before. THE BEST TEACHER i HAVE HAD

Dr Prager is a unique gifted teacher. His knowledge base is phenomenal as he is a highly regarded expert in two different areas including neuromodulation and Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS).He is thorough.His bedside manner stands alone. Whether watching him examine a patient or perform a ketamine infusion,there is lots to be learned from him

Professor Stevenson is definitely well-educated and it is clear in how she carries herself. Though a bit intellectually intimidating, she is a real sweetheart and cares about her students. The course was a bit reading-heavy, but that is expected in any UCLA course. I left her class feeling more informed of slavery in both history and modernity.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I am taking African American History of Slavery with Prof Stevenson. She makes it very interesting and fun. Prof Stevenson is also a very nice person; she listens to our needs and works with us. Her exam is not hard, everything is based on her study guide. However, be very details on you short answers and essay questions.

I took a Women in Slavery seminar with her. Not much lecturing, mainly small group discussions. She has a strong passion for the subject and teaches it effectively. She has a fun, easy going personality and her class was a joy to be in. The work wasn't easy, but not quite as difficult as most of my other UCLA history classes.

This professor builds his whole course around a personal opinion, seemingly based in little or no research.  Because he so hates getting feedback of any kind (his articles in WSJ are not subject to reader comments) he has tried to vilify any docrine which advocates for feedback as a means to improve performance. Teach, don't preach!
Smug; indifferent toward his students; and a poor teacher, that is overly impressed with himself.
He is the ultimate jerk. He is in love with himself. You learn lot of dogmas- not functional at all

I don't think I've ever seen an ostensible professional, in a professional setting, act so unprofessionally. At the end of this farce of a class, when we were allowed to do evals and the TA attempted to rush that process so as to smother the anticipated negative reviews, the class came together as one to complete them and tell UCLA to dump her.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Goes on tangents so you don't know what's important. Also tough grader; on the midterm the highest grade was a C-. Luckily she grades on a curve.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: If you go to lecture, you do not need to read most of the readings she posts. Just go to class and you will get a good grade. Also, be active in class. She loves it when people engage in conversation during lecture.
Awful. Killed my interest in topic.
ok professor, but pretty boring.
LS 1 is a tough course but Zimmer is pretty good. Know the course reader inside out! Her notes are clear, straight forward, and somewhat fun- but its a lot.

Prof. Read is an extremely intelligent professor. However, his lecture are somewhat dull and dry making the material hard to grasp. Books are optional, all the exams are based of his lectures, which can be somewhat confusing sometimes, but he is always in his office hours to help.
he posts lecture notes online and the tests are not too bad.

He sucks,  this graphs are crap and  he uses math to explain cultural anthropology . Smart guy bad teacher. Mult choice test ,t/f , essay. Class is curved test can be tricky. If you can put up with not understanding anything  then take this class

Very nice professor, explains information clearly and does not mind answering questions and re explaining things. Lectures sometimes do get boring but overall pretty easy class if you review powerpoints.

She's still getting a feel for how to best structure the material so its a bit drawn out and lots of detail.She explains things pretty clearly.Very willing to go over any subjects that are confusing.Posts all pwrpt slides but attend class because she tells you what you need to know for test in lecture.take good notes and youll be good.
Teacher seemed unsure of material, class not well structured, material of entire quarter seemed all over the place

This was such a fun class. Writing an original screenplay is extremely difficult work but going to lecture once a week and having your only homework be some light reading and movie watching is undeniably enjoyable. The professor is entertaining and I had a great TA. Take this class! It's easy if you show up and put in the effort.
Condescending and arrogant professor.  If he doesn't like your genre, he seems incapable of exacting useful comments on your script. Overly opinionated and not helpful.

Positive/Negative feedback on scripts vague, nonspecific and unhelpful. Stated many times in a class with women and minorities that women and minorities don't have to to do anything to stand out in a writer's room. Also, extremely mysogynistic. Never received notes on my script which is one of the things I paid for.

Professor Crimi is awesome. You can tell he really cares for his students and wants everyone to succeed. He is flexible and very accessible outside the classroom. I loved taking Formal Logic with him and would recommend taking his class!

Milo is very caring and is willing to work with you if you are struggling. The class is difficult if you struggle with math, but Milo will help you every step of the way. All the exams are take-home, and all the homework is collaborative. There are plenty of extra credit opportunities. Great class!

Milo is incredibly kind and an amazing, engaging teacher. He is super knowledgeable about the material he teaches and is willing to thoughtfully answer all your questions. The grading is very much based on the effort you put into his class. The homework is relatively light, but it's important that you do it. One of my favorite professors so far! :)
She was hard to deal with sometimes, but she was knowledgable, I did learn a lot and at a fast pace. Wish I had more time to develop things more in depth though.
She was one of the worst human beings I have ever met.
The course is very intense, and the professor is very strict and would push you really hard. Professor is difficult to get along with and would assign a lot of tasks.
amazing
He is a very easy going guy, although this does not deter him from giving constructive advice. Note: You need to be self-critical because he usually won't do that for you.
What a joke. Transfer to USC and study with a real clarinet teacher, please.
Class is lecture heavy, but very thoughtful and interesting to learn from.
Great professor! Lectures were amazing

Lectures sometimes drag on and go in random directions, so it can be hard to pay attention and be engaged. however, he has a wealth of knowledge and believes in the work he does. His honesty and blunt nature can be confused for rudeness, but he is harmless.
very bad professor

CHAPMAN!
JoRo is one of the best professors at this school. Such a compassionate guy who knows so many students by their name and cares about their futures & well-being. He's also extremely knowledgeable about the business and invites some really great guest speakers to class.
swag

Joe is the best of the best. I learned so much about the film industry; it was the equivalent, in some way, of being at a Hollywood agency. Joe brought industry leaders in to lecture about various areas of the film/tv/digital industries. He gave succinct and insightful talks after each guest visited. It's no wonder he's now heading up the TFT dept.
uninspiring lectures, uninspiring professor
Unclear grading criteria and bad lectures.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Worst professor I've ever had at UCLA. I regret taking this class. Her grading system is terrible.
