Overall he's on ok professor but his lectures are extremely slow and boring. My biggest gripe with him is that he really likes long proofs to get simple answers that you could just memorize (ex: one time he went on a 20 minute tangent just to prove Soh Cah Toa existed). He's good at answering questions and explaining things you're confused on tho.

Cool and funny guy, clearly understands the content. But he spends way too much time proving ideas and formulas instead of walking us through examples, I stopped going to lecture because I realized 5-minute youtube videos were more effective at teaching me the skills
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I wasn't ready to take his class, graduate numerical ODE. go to office hours
Oleg is amazing.
The Worst professor I ever took, and I had to have him freshman year.
He has a hidden arrogancy about him. Easy to talk to and friendly but can flip a switch and take things very personal.

What can I say about this guy?  Well he loves teaching, is very good at it, engages the class, very smart and likable (but if you are ever a TA for him run!) He will work you to the bone, you become his grading slave...while he only shows up to lecture, and get all the glory (and most of the money!)
Speaks in a monotonous detached tone.  Does not care about students learning.  Cannot catch him, but if you are looking for a class where the professor is often away, this is it!
Extremely dry and uninspiring.  hard to get anything from the class.  He's busy with admin and always away, so classes are often cancelled.  Could be a plus if you like extra time.

I thought Helga was awesome. She's clearly very passionate about her field, but is also fair and willing to hear opinions that may differ from her own. The paper she assigned was tough, but all other assignments and tests were perfectly reasonable. Recommended!

One of the worst professor I've ever had at UCLA.  Course load is not hard, but she assigns two field reports + midterm + final for this class, and the field reports are VERY subjective because they're graded by a grader.  Extremely unhelpful and most useless office hours I've ever suffered through. Avoid!!!

He doesn't know anything about his class. He wastes everyone's time. He talks about everything except the class material. Nothing is clear in his class. No exams. very unprofessional. Shouldn't teach core course!
He is unprofessional. He doesn't know any thing about his class. He spends time only talking nonsense about stuff not related to the course. WASTE of Time... he should be fired!
Fair grader  participation is a MUST! Hard class for online though, would probably recommend in-person for this type of class. Would take this teacher again!
Hes amazing

Took Chicano Studies 10B with her, she was really nice but there was a lot of reading to the class.  She goes over most of the readings but sometimes its hard to understand her because of her accent.  The TAs were great and concepts were not hard to understand.

Her work is really easy and the midterm is very straight forward. There is no in class final exam but there is a take home essay final. The final could be a bit tough due to the length but the material is very easy and not hard to understand.
Mrs. T's enthusiasm is bound to grow on you, I've taken a few classes with her and I would say she is the best professor in the program.

This class sucked so bad.  It was boring.  The tests are totally subjective and graded very meticulously.  It was supposed to be an easy A, and I studied for it, used my notes right out of the book, and her mouth on the test, and still got a B in the class.
He has the knowledge
He's very hard to understand. Did not like him at all.

I took Remote Sensing with professor Smith. He is very knowledgeable about this subject and is very dedicated that you comprehend the science behind the sensors. That being said, the exams are more science based than hands on, but the labs do give you an idea about what professionals do in the real world. He also brought a guest lecturer from JPL!
Cool guy. Easy class. Super helpful. Can't ask for a better class.
SHES THE BEST WRITING TEACHER I"VE EVER HAD. Love her so much. Brilliant. Awesome. Kind.

Professor Mesle teaches her students to be great writers through mindful prose. She is very smart and funny, and she sincerely cares about every student's success in college. She is a great teacher and an incredibly nice person.

A good teacher if you like spontaneous ideas and learn best in group conversation. He is a wonderful teacher in terms of making you think, however if your the type of learner who needs clear- cut answers: not the best.

This professor made no sense the whole quarter I was in his class. In my opinion, he is the worse professor I have ever taken at UCLA- and I have already graduated so I have taken a lot of professors. I don't recommend him. He does not really care about students or his job b/c his job is already secured and can't get fired no matter how bad he is.

Creese is a great professor. Your write 3 papers all quarter based on movies you watch and readings that go along with them. He's open to ask for help and loves giving feedback. Plus after the first two essays you have a chance to revise. Great class for a Writing I requirement.
His teaching is horrible, its easy but expects too much
Worst professor. Stay away, he can be mean and intimidating at times. He tries to enforce his views of poetry onto others. Oh, and most of all really boring!
Professor Yenser is a great teacher. His poetry classes are alive and fun. He makes three hours fly by and holds great discussions. His homework level is light.

The reading materials were very interesting. I would recommend the class. Midterm was a take home essay. Final exam was one long essay (in class). She allowed us to bring a 3 by 5 card as a cheat sheet. There were no other quizzes or tests. If you like writing then its a good class. I recorded the lectures because she speaks quietly and quickly.
No Comments
Most accomplished music professor at this school.

He was the most awsome trumpet professor you could ever ask for. He is so helpful and is an amazing trumpter. He has helded me go up 4 levels on the trumpet performence scale. He such a great player and is so modist. :) Try to have him.

She is ok. Generally speaking a bit biased towards international students and towards younger folks as they pay more tuition and seem to be more naive. Is a prime example of walking talking white guilt. Unbearable at times but resourceful at others. Overall if I had to chose between her and some of the other newer faculty I would go with the newer.

Amassing teacher! She is always there to help you with your film. You will be able to screen your film more than twice and she will give you great useful comments to improve your film. Great interactive, fun and helpful class. One of the best Film teachers at UCLA.

Extremly judgmental and will cut you off on your potential ideas and experience for sake of her own taste. She simply just does not listen to her students. Keep disappear and some student found her working on her own stuff during the studio hours.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Mimi is an OKAY professor. Her syllabus was not that clear in regards to materials. Basically I recommend choosing EITHER oils OR acrylics to work in... In order to save money and avoid buying everything on that darn list. Mimi is a little bit distracted, and doesn't give the clearest guidance of where to take your work... However she challenges u.

Be prepared for the most difficult and tedious course you ever take in your college career at UT Austin. Class average is high 60s on every test, weekly homeworks will take you 10 hours minimum to complete, tests are based 50% on textbook material and are THEORY BASED. Each exam covers 150+ pages of pure econometrics, must read it or you'll fail.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Tests are tough

comment: It is rare to see a professor as accomplished in her field as her be an effective teacher, but her captivating lecture style makes even the most difficult concepts in econometrics easy to understand!
Turned my brain into mashed potatoes. Lectures are mediocre in helping to understand the material. Tests are hard if not extremely hard. Talk to him after class.

Taken many of his classes.He is an amazing person.He is an older professor and has a thick German accent so dont take his class if you are too young and immature to deal with this fact.  If you do take his class and pay attention he has a lot of knowledge and experience you will benefit from.  Talk to him outside of class, he is quite friendly.

The learning curve in this class went from 0-80 in a few short weeks.  Professor Kite not only knows his area of expertise but actually understands how to teach it.  Not all working professionals can articulate how they do what they do; Brian does. Kite is a gifted speaker and he's hilarious.

He is one of those teachers who everyone knows  even if they have never met him. All you have to say is '...Brian Kite...' and everyone around you response with 'I love Brian Kite'.  Yeah, he's that kind of teacher!
EXCELLENT PROFESSOR
No Comments

I just transferred to UCLA from a community college, and i must say, Bern is by far the best of the three professors i have had so far. He makes a boring topic (math methods) interesting. He makes the tough parts easy to understand, and he will be happy to explain things later. Everything Bern is, however, the text is not. Loved Bern, hated Arfken.
Has a very deep understanding. Very exciting lectures. Truly interested in helping students understand. Very helpful.

He's freaking brilliant. Took me from no understanding of american politics to analyzing politics. His class is amazing but decent amount of work. If you work you'll have fun and twill be awesome. If you don't, it wont (*#!@ off).  If you work you WILL get an A
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: Awesome class!!!!
Hes nice and genuine, and approachable, as well as interesting. He makes you interested and hes interesting himself.
This is the best professor at UCLA that you will ever have. I have never had a professor care so much about his students. He asked us to all keep in touch and will be invaluable in the future!
Very motivating and helpful. We strongly recommend her.
Great teacher. Very motivatingl
She's just WOW

Dr. Yang's Exams are HARD make sure you go to office hours.  Overall she seems like a nice person. Definitely one of the better teachers in the chem dept.  Each class is incredibly interesting, and I love the way she presents new material.
she is hot
Nadia was so nice, helpful, and passionate. The perfect teacher to start off my academic career at UCLA with.
Great professor! She made class interesting and fun, you can see her passion when she speaks. Definitely worth taking her while you are at UCLA, you would be missing out if you don't!

This is one of the most caring and best professors at UCLA. She is really dedicated to effective pedagogy and loves students. You read a lot of articles, but she explains them so you can get the grasp of them since they will be on the exams. Professor Givvin understands the difficulty of undergrad at ucla, thus tries to ease the experience LOVE HER

Very good class.  Lectures are long but excellent material with tons of examples.  2 group projects that are good.  Very clear grading criteria.  Expect both mid term and final exams.  Go over the lectures for an A in the exams.  Overall very good class that teaches good concepts of system engineering.

He has superb mastery of Systems Engineering. Good course outline. Lectures are long and have excessive text on presentation slides. Low-value-added textbook reading assignments take a long time (50 hr. for the course). 2 small projects were ok. Grading was easy overall. Exams were well paced, 90% short-answer questions.

The material is not that difficult. It's expected for a college level chem class to require time & effort. But Mason is so disorganized, wastes time in lecture doing derivations that won't be on the test, & the average on the first exam was 52% (no curve!). Lastly there are 90 students left; 70 people dropped. DO NOT PICK MASON FOR THIS CLASS!
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He is one of the best chemistry teacher I have ever met. Always perparing good and do not use ppt.He is very helpful and even once he could not provide a direct answer to me, he taught me several ways about how to find the solutions instead.

Amazing instructor. Truly cares about student learning. He would always offer to stay after class and discuss any questions we had, his personal business, or business concepts. For those of us not majoring in a business field, this was extremely useful. The BEST teacher I've had at UCLA thus far.
Very hands-on, learned a lot about how it's like to pitch to VC and build up a business development plan from scratch in real world. Coach is a very good instructor and has a lot of experience

Jacob would always tell us to stand up to stretch before starting class which I enjoyed and made the class go by easier. He's very young but he knows what he's talking about. Just be prepared to read A LOT! He's a pretty tough grader too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's pretty young but knowlegable

I took an intro to opera class where we reviewed and watched various operas throughout the semester. The class is very easy: if you show up and participate, you will be prepared for every other project. There's 1 group project, a midterm paper, and a final presentation and paper. Dr. Bloechl scans the book and puts it online
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Prof. Bloechl is a very good professor.  Her lectures are filled with information, most of which wasn't on the test but was still interesting.  For Mozart 62, she posted the text for the class online so students don't have to buy a text book.

She doesn't set clear enough standards for what she expects on her tests and really just wants you to regurgitate information rather than actually knowing it. Her lectures can get boring very quickly, and all of her questions are based on examples she's given you (in lecture and read), not applying your knowledge of sociology to different examples.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Jacobs class is tough due to the amount of reading required, but she always goes over them in lecture and is available outside of class. She also expands on ideas, and provides a study guide which is basically the exam. Everything she puts on her slides in lecture is on the exam. Overall, a good teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: An amazing teacher who has probably the best structured class I have ever taken. She uses wonderful powerpoints for lecture and also does a really good job of incorporating the language you are learning, while still making it accessible to new students (and this is from a very nonkorean). Final projectis is to make a short film, which was so fun!

Great professor for Korean! She uses Ko-nglish so you can understand the Korean. Textbook use is NECESSARY every week because of her mandatory vocabulary and grammar quizzes which you HAVE to study for because she picks tough words and their conjugations. Very fair professor. Expects/forces class participation and group projects. No essays!

Dr. Siler teaches a truly upper division political science course. You must really be into Poli Sci to be able to hang here. Yes, there is only one paper but it is a technical paper, its time consuming. If you learn the format and take the time to do it, you will learn a ton. I LOVE this guy. One of my favorite Professors ever.
No tests, no learning, just an essay

Instead of a simple textbook, you have to navigate through dozens of PDF files he uploads to the class website. Has tests and quizzes on unclear criteria. Actually gave us a study guide for taxon quizzes but then half of the terms on the quiz were not on the study guide. In lecture he will often just info dump a bunch of big terms too fast to note
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I love Dr. Wake as a person, but I would NOT recommend his course unless you are a fan of taxonomy and geography because there are quizzes on these, but you have to find the material in the endless readings. These screwed people's grades. He didn't give pointers or any direction to help with this. He won't go above and beyond, but he's nice enough.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Hands down one of the worst professors I have ever had at UCLA. She plagiarized her lecture slides from the internet, refused to explain concepts with examples, and did not lecture well at all, among other things. I only passed because the class collaborated together to survive her horrendous teaching.

I've skipped half the classes so far, and when I feel guilty and come to lecture I say "Oh yeah this is why I skip." I feel as if I haven't learned anything, and when we ask for a study guide for the midterm she almost didn't give us one. I probably only passed, because the class made a study guide together. She is nice, but not a good professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I took Professor Leaf's Music Industry 55 course over the summer at UCLA. The course is filled with interviews that Professor Leaf conducted with numerous Grammy-winning songwriters and executives that paved the way for a lot of the music we listen to today. The lectures incredibly inspiring, being able to hear from the songwriters themselves.

I've taken David Leaf's "Songwriters on Songwriting" series three times, as well as worked for the production team all three years. This is one of the best classes I've taken at UCLA. Guests have included Mike Stoller, Burt Bacharach, Jon Platt, Mike Posner and many, many more. Highly recommend!!!
Easy class. I recommend everyone to take him
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: He's the best. His lectures were great, he would assign manageable work and he really cares about what he's teaching. He has office hours every week and they were so good!

Lectures were difficult to understand, concepts were difficult as well. Genuinely cannot recall a thing I learned, only two real assignments-midterm and final exam. Curves are great but it's only because everyone is struggling, at this point just hoping for a B because I know I won't be able to get anything higher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Harris really knows what he's talking about. He understands political economy backwards & forwards from all the world regions. The bulk of your grade is made up of midterm/final so study everything (lecture, reading, etc). Anything covered is fair game. Hardest class in the IDS major, but worth it. Huge plus: Harris is FINE.

R.I.P. Professor Miller. Thank you for giving us the courage to stand in front of the public and speak. The course is hard and need to prepare for the speaking, tough grade, final paper is about a book and it is long.

He taught us about how to perform a good public speaking. However, he never get patient to students. He will reject you or say "I'm tired" in his office hour. He likes to boast too much about himself. His class only lets students to perform their speech, and no lecture. I won't take his class in the future.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: vgrfbvrt
The gist is he knows more about spheres than we do.
Awesome professor! Take his class, you wont regret it
Great class

Monique definitely knows her stuff, but her course was very unstructured and she would often move around due dates on a whim. Many of her demos and lectures were unplanned and were just her improvising + experimenting without much explanation. Don't expect too much help or consistency.

Great prof to have for the first of painting series as she will teach you how to oil paint. I have read Raul doesn't do that as much for the 106A course when he teaches it but she does teach us the basics and helps us to kind of figure it out on our own. Miss three classes and grade goes down. Roughly one painting due every other week.
Great teacher
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: He walks in and starts LECTURING w/o a single word 2 the class; very complicated lectures, highly intellectual and rigorous. Not what I expected, not an easy A, must know about Armenian history, culture, artists, etc. to get ahead in class. Rewarding @ end but not 4 those lookin 4 a nice, breezy klass 4 fun.
he was really passionate but a little too fast paced. he is defintely smart but he doesnt offer a whole lot of understanding for when people get confused or behind.
Good professor.

By far the worst professor I've ever had. He was rude, ignored emails, and made exams purely memorization-based. I learned nothing in this class. He requires you to pay for materials and bans laptops in class. His ratings are terrible, and it's baffling he's still employed—nobody seems to like him.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Poor communication skills, lack of self-awareness.

Worse professor I have ever had! What is the point of memorizing the reading materials word by word? And what is the point of learning by mere memorizing? And why are p/np students required to get a B to pass the course? Could have been a useful course, but unfortunately a horrible professor.
AWESOME PROF!!! highly recommended!
Lecture is very interesting and reading is interesting sometimes. MUST read the reader! Attending lecture will most likely help you a LOT on the final.

Well physics is hard to teach, but I think he makes the subject harder than it should be. You can barely understand him because he has an accent and he doesn't speak up at all so you should sit in the front. He does help you when you need it. The practice midterms are easy compared to what he actually gives in the midterm. There's 8-10hw probs a wk
No Comments
No Comments
Great professor. Makes mathematics fun and interesting. Best of all he is very leniant.

hilarious professor! The lectures are kind of useless. Easy to pass without attending lectures. The sections are also not that helpful. You can just read the book on your own and pass the class with ease. But Professor Hall is one FUNNY man.
I don't think I made it through a single lecture without laughing....his attitude is absolutly hilarious.

Juana is very unorganized & condescending during lecture, teaches at a middle school level, and gives out misleading exams. During lecture she'll call out people's names to answer questions and will give out pop quizzes for attendance. Her exams are A-E and say, "If answer is not here put your own." She's infuriating at this level.

She is pretty clear in her lectures most of the time. Sometimes, she makes mistakes on the homework problems or in her lecture notes. Overall, she is pretty good. The homework assignments are some work but aren't killer. Her tests are fair.

Professor Nehring is a great professor. His upper divison classes tend to be smaller due to the level of difficultyu involved. He is very helpful in addressing student's needs. He tries to involve the class into great discussion. One Midterm (Paper) + One Final (In-Class). Grading is fair. Overall, great professor!

Great guy, with fun stories. Sometimes hard to understand with his German accent but you get used to it. Doesn't use powerpoint or a projector, nor does he use the internet to post lecture notes and vocab terms (thus why it's essential to show up to class). Sometimes hard to hear but he hates mics. But he's a VERY nice, helpful, good teacher.

Worst math teacher ever.  Can't explain the material.  The midterm was fair, the final was impossible.  There was no point in doing the homework after the midterm as they won't even help you on the final.  I'm just disappointed in all the time I spent studying for the class and now have nothing but a bad grade to show for it.

this professor is pretty useless to be honest. he just repeats and rewrites thereoms that are in the book onto the board. he'll throw in an example here and there and thats about it. exam questions are worded difficultly and tricky.
Good

His field of study is labor, so there was a large emphasis on the development of labor and its effect on today's world. This included the formation and crack-down of unions, many employment bills, etc, and less emphasis on "general knowledge topics" like what actually happened internationally and in the US during WWI and WII, besides labor issues.

Butler is a very nice guy; he's helpful, understanding, and has a very uniquely interesting way of teaching 3B material. However, his exams are almost nothing like his lectures and review sessions. Maybe going to his office hours might help, but lots of self-study is recommended.
I'm writing this as I take his final...open note...we can use the internet for the test!  Very nice guy...really mean tests. Hopefully generous curve!! I would definitely take him again in the future

She is not a good lecturer and is impossible to get incontact with, but her class had very little work involved. If you do the reading you will be fine, but still mad at yourself for taking the class.

This lady is HORRIBLE! If you care about ur GPA even a little bit stay away from her at all costs!! I don't care how convenient the lecture time is or if the class sounds interesting, she will make it unbearable I promise. I studied my butt off for the final and mid-term, read like 80% of the crap she gave us and managed to get a B-. BEWARE!!!!

Prof was very helpful and enthusiastic about the material. The course reader was pretty intense, but it was much more interesting than reading a textbook. She offered a lot of extra office hours, really seemed to care that we learned why things were important and was a fair grader. Liked the class.

Interesting class and the Prof is passionate about the topic.  The class had lots of papers and readings, but there was also a field trip to the Getty that was cool.  I took it for upper div credit and I hate writing, but she helped a LOT in office hours (she let us do re-writes).  Seems to really care about her students. Recommended
Took him in the summer.. Lots of reading in the course reader ($150).. But you can find the articles online.. one midterm and final, all essay. Interesting class.. Great Proff.
His class is not the type where you can miss lectures and do fine. It's not difficult, but you have to attend class and do the readings.

Professor Goldberg was a wonderful teacher! One could tell that he genuinely cares for his students and wants to equip them with tools for becoming a better writer. Do note, that you will have to work to receive a good grade on the papers. You will have to defend your answers, because Goldberg encourages everyone to explain their thinking.
Great person, good teacher. I liked his class and most of the material was very interesting!!
Has definitely shown improvement in being anxious about teaching, shows clear mastery of knowledge
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: not a good professor, anxious when teaching and highly limited

It was very challenging to participate, as she interrupts students and talks over them, and at times may cut someone off if she disagrees (even if it's just a question). Never received clear answers why, just told we were wrong. Material from class was different from the other profs teaching the same class. Most students still did well on her exams

Aurora Jackson is one of the best professors who teaches in the Social Welfare Department.  At first she seems a little intimidating, but once you get to know her, she is nice and helpful.  One thing you must know about Professor Jackson: if you come to class on time, you're guaranteed a good grade.
Amazing guy. Extremely encouraging. Truly the best.
Amazing, inspiring teacher!!!
not clear and has a hard time answering questions without looking irritated
No Comments
She Rocks
No Comments
student oriented!!!
No Comments
Excellent lecturer. Very clear, and cares about student learning. The multiple choice exams are fair, and you can probably do well if you just read the slides and pay attention to the lectures.

Great teacher, very nice, well prepared, knowledgeable and cares about teaching. Some test questions a little unexpected but overall quite reasonable. Office hours good for questions if you can make it. Well published too.

If only he was a FT professor at UCLA! He's such a great professor. I'm not a big fan of Archaeology but this class was fun. His lectures are engaging and he's funny. The work load isn't too bad. He gives weekly themes and concepts which are helpful for studying. Midterm, research paper and final..grades fairly. I got an A!

One of my favorite professors of all time! He is excellent, his power points are good, he is funny and engaging, and completely strait forward with what he expects from you as a student. The best part was the readings he assigned were realistically manageable,none of that 150 pages a week crap other teachers try to pull! If only he was full time!
outstanding professor
BEST PROFESSOR AT UCLA...He is a wonderful human being that is genuinely concerned about student learning.  I would recommend his MIMG 102 class to anyone!!!!
He's really funny, but mostly when he messes up... Which is more often than appreciated. His tests are fair and reasonable, and he's helpful during office hours.

I have mixed feelings about this guy. He is an interesting person and will make you laugh... but will confuse you simultaneously.If you haven't taken calc already, YOU WILL BE LOST.  But if you go to his office hours he's super helpful! And his tests aren't tricky. But be warned: in class, there's a high chance of confusion. And laughter.

Belozersky speaks very rapidly so it's difficult to follow, she is also not very organized. She had us purchase a $100 course reader! she expressed guilt for this but had us purchase it anyway. Her tests are difficult. You need to follow along every lecture as best as you can to feel remotely confident for her midtermfinal.

The passion Marina has for the artists she presents is infectious. She has good energy and is very knowledgeable about her subject. You have to read quite a bit in this course but the book is written in a way that keeps your interest. Loved this class.
cool class
Just a great class, he cares for students learnt material and easily meets outside office hours.

Professor Izvanariu introduced me to Critical Race Studies. Assigned readings are intriguing and class is interactive, collaborative and intellectually satisfying. She does a great job of explaining concepts or pointing out current examples of what were studying. She is a great mentor, accessible, and a champion for empowering women and POC.

Brilliant. Creative. Passionate. These are just a few words I would use to describe Professor Izvanariu. She teaches students how to attack each problem using an interdisciplinary approach. She will teach students how to approach each issue using legal arguments. You will read briefs, cases, and legal journals. She is very accessible. Shes amazing
Have taken K. Ball a number of times. She cares a lot about her students and has a well balances class when it comes to test and assignment.
Her lectures are pretty interesting. And I believe she really enjoys what she does. And although, she is sometimes strict, especially about testing and grading, students respect her.
Dr. Lorenz is Awesome!!!
Doesn't know his own slides; says incorrect information.

The class is based on 50% participation and 50% on the two essays at the end of the quarter. Easy class. Lot of reading but online videos break them down so if don't want to do them you don't have to. It is recommended though. Interesting class, show up to class participate and go to office hours & you'll be good.
awesome

Professor Stemple was my favorite professor at UCLA Law. Not only was her curriculum intensely stimulating and comprehensive, she took a deep interest in supporting the career development of her students. She has extensive practical experience that infuses her teaching as well. I learned and gained so much from this course.
No Comments

I took Lustig's Jews: Invented or Imagined class. Lustig is very kind and lays out expectations clearly, and is a very fair grader. There is a lot of reading you will do for this class, sometimes around 100 pages a week. There are no midterms or finals. If you participate in discussion and do the readings, you will be golden.

Professor Lustig is very knowledgable. He is not a stickler, but expects you to do the readings so you can meaningfully contribute to the class. He is very approachable and gives great feedback. Highly recommended
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Would take again

comment: One of the most knowledgeable yet humble professors Ive ever had. She connects concepts across many different fields and industries, and really cares about students. Visionary.
Most eye-opening class I've taken in my four years at UCLA. It was a big class, but she runs it like a small seminar, with group projects and interactive activities.
He is very knowledgable and helpful. Gives a lot of real life examples that helps in learning the material.

He doesn't seem to like teaching. He breezes through a lot of material to just get it through rather than making sure we understood it. His research gets in the way - he's always busy, not helpful during office hours. Plus, gets angry too easily. He would barge into the classroom right when the other class dismissed just to rush the instructor out.
Terrible and unapproachable. Avoid.
Terrible. Not a good instructor. I feel he does not care about others and also is rude.
Incapable of explaining even simple things
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: This professor is not ready to teach at UCLA. Her lectures are simple, but she cannot answer questions. Just not of sufficient quality.
he is   the   meanest  teacher at  ucla  he  got twerked on
He's a gem.

Taking professor bravos class was the best choice I have made. He is a literal Greek Encyclopedia. He knows his stuff, he is a very respectful man, and he responds to students immediately with any concerns. There is a good bit of writing in the class, but its mainly to make sure the students are staying engaged with the lectures.
One of my top two courses ever at UCLA
Very helpful outside of classroom. Supportive. Enjoyed taking her class.
This class should have been taught in seminar format.  Nice lady though.

Very easy going and listens to issues we are having and resolves them completely. Very funny and makes every class fun as well as making sure we actually understand why or why we don't use the tools that he talks about.

Bill is a TA, but he might as well be a prof in the PHILOS department at UCLA already. He is insanely smart, but this alone isn't what makes a for a great professor. He is very passionate and explains complex material in a very intelligible way. He is consistently available outside class and goes to great lengths to help motivated students succeed.

This teacher was amazing! He helped get my friend and me free tickets to a concert as well which I am so grateful for. He also makes the class interesting with lots of videos and has you interact and make sounds/music in person.
Just a really nice and intelligent guy overall
I really liked her class

If you value your life, time or education do not take this class. I actually had to quit my job in order to keep up with the workload of the least engaging class I have ever taken. Somehow, we had a constant flow of tedious assignments, yet every class it felt we were repeating the same material. She makes students feel stupid for asking questions.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Jack Rochel was a very professional teacher. He taught us a lot even though it was an online class. I really enjoyed him as a professor. Take him if you can.
Jack is a great teacher but his tests are super hard. Expect to study a lot for this class since it is not an easy A
very helpful, sometimes hard to understand, but he tries. assignments increase as the quarter progresses.
He's hard to understand when giving directions, yet he is helpful in his critiques of your work.

Dr. Alexander is by far the toughest professor I've ever taken, he was very informative but I took his more advanced classes and the curriculum starts on day two. He is very clear with his grading criteria, but he is insanely tough. He is very intellectual, and encouraging but quite strict with his rules. By far the best professor I've had.

Overall, Dr. Alexander is a great professor. He's extremely talented and smart and frankly, I couldn't of seen me enjoying this class with any other professor. He's a tough cookie, but if you follow the rules, show up on time, and don't cause any issues, you can take a class with him, with ease.
he likes to yell at other professors in front of students, and acts like a baby when teaching.
Not him

Tied for my favorite professor of all time,  Prof. Hines is the real deal: he lives and breathes the material and is perhaps the most knowledgeable professor I've ever met. Make no mistake: when he tells you what you must know to pass, you really must learn all of it, and be prepared to show him at exam time. This was the hardest class I ever took.

Hines is very nice & has a lot of enthusiasm for the topic.  He'll always take questions gladly, both in class & office hour.  HOWEVER, exams are very tough.  It's a lot to remember, & it's challenging to write it all out concisely, & put it in context.  When it comes time for exams, do flash cards & know EVERYthing about every bldg on study guide.

I had a 100% going into the final in this class with barely any studying. The midterms were at a very simple high school level and were almost completely based on the homework (which was also very simple). The final was much harder than the other 10 weeks. It was her first time teaching the class so she might change her tests in the  future.

The class was simply awesome. I used to think quantum was hard, but now I think it actually makes sense. She always made the connections to the real world and applications, which was cool. Very smart, clear, helpful, kind, and oh yeah.. very pretty professor. what else to wish for?

Extraordinarily knowledgeable, calm, clear and kind professor.  Quietly fabulous man and an wonderful mind that, in his unassuming guru-like way, he is always willing to share with his students.  Will be taking him again next quarter.
Prof. Racy's lectures are my favorite of this course.  he knows so much and he's very organized and clear.

this professor is condascending, unapproachable, talks over students after asking questions, assigned readings never discussed in class or assignments, said to class "I don't care about you. I don't care why you miss class." would avoid any class taught by her.

I understand this is UCLA but she makes this class much harder than what is necessary. Also, when asking questions about materials or papers due, she is demeaning and overall wants you to conform to her views and style. she seems like a nice person overall, but this doesn't mean she is a good teacher. I don't recommend her
not too hard of a class. decent professor.
as

Yep, Magdaâ??s one of the nicest professors on the planet! Sheâ??s always ready to help you. We read 2 short 20th century German texts (a play and a novel) and wrote 2 essays (2-3 pgs each). The workload is reasonable and if you have good attendance and participation, you can be exempt from having to take the final exam, so it pays to show up!

Very nice professor! I took her for German 152- Conversation. All readings and exercises were handouts. Grading: 50% - 5 x video journal / group skits; 10% - class participation; 20% - midterm; 20% - final. Moderate amount of HW, a LOT of vocab, but she?s a generous grader. Overall, a fun class that will expand your vocabulary big time! Recommended
lecture is very interesting, but test is hard part.

Really interesting class, detailed oriented so it's not for everyone but Clayman and Heritage work as a pair to teach it &they make it very enjoyable. The class is not a heavy course load, and I've gotten all A's so far without doing the readings. (Glanced at one reading for our TAKE HOME midterm) One transcription assignment, 2 MC quizzes, & final
Her accent is difficult to understand.

Avoid her ! She only faces to the blackbroad and then keeps writing the materials which are exactly from the book. It seems that she is teaching to the blackbroad instead of her students because all we can see is her back. Explain nothing !

Complex Systems Science is just an odd class. Bragin reviews a lot, but sometimes it takes several explanations before he really gets something across well. He's an interesting person and his teaching is decent, but you have to be in the mood for him, so to speak, when you walk into class. The tests are pretty easy if that's what you care about.

Horrible! Never got complete syllabus.  Readings were posted a couple days before each class so difficult to complete. Graded materials were incomprehensible. Made class 7 wks instead of 10, yet required mastery over agent based simulations we were supposed to go over in class. canceled 2 wks of class, had grad student teach program never used.

Professor Chichester not only gives wonderful feedback to her students but also genuinely cares that all her students excel.  She is a kind human being who inspires you to be a better person  and do your best regardless of which field you're from. Hands down,  she is the best professor I've had at UCLA.
Great teacher! Really helpful and interesting. Easy to do well in her class.
No Comments
No Comments
Awesome professor. Lots of reading but very interesting articles. Definitely would take his class again...very approachable. Decent amount of workload...
Prof. Hernandez Is truly an inspiring professor.  He will do anything he can to ensure your success in his class.  I would definitely take him again.

This is simply one of the best instructors on the planet. He repeats key points clearly and carefully, leads you through learning exercises, listens patiently to students, and has an encyclopedic knowledge of his field. Love him! Took several classes, too.
ugh
He's just terrible, would not recommend by any chance.
He will turn you on to math and has a good personality but tests are too hard and he doesn't curve. :(
He is a good professor and he puts out like crazy. It's true.
He's really young but he's a very detailed lecturer. I would strongly recommend!

If you want a professor who's gonna babysit you, look elsewhere, because Professor Bevins is the kinda guy who lets you stay up late, eat ice cream for dinner and watch R rated movies. Best come correct.
Mr. Bevins enlightened me not only on urban planning, but on the ways of life.
He lectures. His interpretation of the novel is the only interpretation of the novel. He doesn't encourage exploration. Truly uninspiring.

He has great insight into both prose and poetry, explains his analysis thoroughly, is an authority in his area, yet approachable, funny, clear, and holds his students' attention during lecture. Bravo!
I found Professor Musumeci to be very use-e-ful. Yes, very good.
No Comments

This class requires a lot of reading, so make sure you keep up! But the midterms are straightforward, the midterm study guide is almost exactly like the midterm. Time consuming, but I think it's a fairly easy class.
One of the best professors I have ever had.  Take her class! She is detailed and her lectures are incredible.
By far the nicest professor I've encountered in the UCLA philosophy department. He really cares about teaching and making sure you understand the material. Great lecturer and great person.
cool class.  i learned a lot.  remember to read your notes.  Hilarious professor.  Even when he laughs at his own jokes.  Must take class.
Sucks at explaining things. You ask to clarify and she makes it more confusing. Otherwise kind, tries her best, is just still a bit green.
No Comments
No Comments

A very interesting class that keeps you on your toes. May is very intelligent and he'll clarify things in lecture if you ask. His lectures are very organized and his passion for the subject is evident. Some of the readings were challenging but hey, this is college so it's to be expected. There is a lot of reading so plan accordingly.

She is totally useless. Her PP slides are informative, yet they don't help a bit on the 8 papers you have to write. She makes NO attempts in making the lecture easy and understandable and she has a great tendency of using academic jargon to explain concepts and even her own instructions. Avoid her if POSSIBLE. Nice person though.

In Sociology 1, most of her lecture material comes from powerpoint slides and films (only course reader needed), and assigns six weekly critical thinking posts as homework (35% of grade). There is no midterm exam, but there is 7-page term paper. Final exam consists of straightforward definition and short-answer questions. Easy A.
He was just an absolutely fantastic professor.
all around nice guy. from belgium. motivated about the subject, asks insightful questions, wants students to learn. not a class for those looking for an easy science GE.
I LOVE PROFESSOR CHRISTOFIDES SUCH AN AMZING AND INSPIRATIONAL PROFESSOR. NEVER UNDERSTOOD MATH BETTER. AS A FELLOW GREEK  HE REALLY CONNECTED WITH ME AND WENT OUT OF HIS WAY TO HELP ME LEARN.
Excellent professor, excellent course. Highly recommended. Sometimes too nice at times (if that is possible).
Nice professor
Highly engaging instructor, but only take her if you are looking for an intense and immersive experience in Brazilian Portuguese.

You can't go wrong with a teacher who won the Distinguished Teaching Award for Teaching Assistants.  Everything is explained clearly, and even if you don't understand a topic or need help with homework, problem sets, or practice self-evaluations (which come in handy when studying for the two midterms and final), office hours are very helpful.
SHE'S SO CUTE OMG SHE GIVES SNACKS DURING HER OFFICE HOURS SHE MAKES CHEM LESS LIKE HELL

I took PSYC 196A with Dr. Modrek and it was my first research experience at UCLA. I really liked working with her because I felt like she made sure I was interested in the work I was doing. I really learned a lot and she definitely made us work  hard but she was great!  She makes you think !

I took PSYC196A under the supervision of Dr. Anahid Modrek, and I am so glad I did!! She really let me explore my own research interests in psychology and was very supportive when I had my own ideas or questions. Working with her was really motivating and it got me to think!! She's really smart and nice, but tough !!

Dr. Matthes is a great professor. Clear expertise and can be tough. However, he never made me feel stupid when I couldnt figure out a theory or problem and was always approachable for help. He has a dry sense of humor which I enjoyed  You get back more than what you put into this class!
Great professed, the best lecturer Ive had at UCLA. The class is tough but you will learn a lot.
I actually used things from this class while interviewing.
Real world examples!
The midterm and final are generally 8-12 questions and worth somewhere around 120 points; that is to say, If you miss one question, you're SOL. DON'T skimp on reading, it's ALL quote ID.

Took his Asian American literature course.  One of the most intelligent literary critics I've seen.  Lots of reading, but it's interesting and he's a skilled prof.  One drawback is somewhat tough grading.  A B or B+ is manageable with moderate work, but to really get an A/A- you have to put forth a superb effort.  Still, its worth it.  Great class.

Professor Raphael taught the class online but makes the students teach themselves with the textbook. I took this class during UCLA's first quarter switching to online because of COVID-19. She graded tough, gave vague feedback, seemed annoyed most of the time, gave tough assignments and did not curve or give extra credit. By far the worst professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: She's very knowledgeable in Tropical Climatology. Her lectures are powerpoint based but she doesn't post them online....only a brief summary of important topics which may or may not be helpful. HW assignments are not terrible but fairly long. Tests are definitions and short & long essays. Overall, the class was interesting.

Great professor who seems to be passionate about her fieldwork. Lectures can be a bit boring but everything is posted online. The only downside to the class is that she does not give you study guides for any of the tests. You just need to study anything and everything that was discussed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tests? Not many--Would take again

comment: She is cool

He's a clear speaker which helped. I liked him overall, and his class consisted of midterm final and 1 paper. it was tough, because the tests were written in class. he's not super compassionate and available, but he's fair & will listen to questions. it was a hard class, but he was a good prof overall. get ready to read. I do enjoy his lectures!!

Great professor, anything you do not understand he will clarify easily, he grades on a curve, its hard to even fail this class, like super hard lol , but you will definitely learn when you leave but he tries his absolutely best to make sure no one fails and everyone learns, if he teaches any other SOC classes I'm taking them lol trust me !

Professor Blaisdell explains lecture materials very clearly so that I could understand what I was learning. A lot of his lectures overlaps with text book so it is easy to study. If you are not a lazy person, you will get an A.
If you can, wait to get this guy for "learning."  He's the best one in that ironically difficult class.
Hes a real one
Great guy, very funny and passionate.
Do not waste your time taking her class. It was boring, useless and difficult. Fortunately she left the school this year.

Professor Brown's tests require you to know a lot of the readings, she only briefly covers them during lecture so you'll need to spend time with them on your own. She really cares about her students and offers extra credit and different ways to take your final that best suit the class. Tough but would definitely take her again

had him at DH for gen chem 2 - made you feel inadequate for asking basic questions giving attitude as a grown man (very visibly miserable) DID NOT make you feel comfortable asking questions. He talked about CSUDH with such low respect while speaking about UCLA so highly making other students feel bad for attending DH tho no longer employed at UCLA
It's impossible. I regret everything.
The best teacher I've ever had in foreign language. Thank you

Cristina is super engaging with her students and cares so much about not only their learning but their wellbeing. This was the first class I have taken at UCLA that truly felt like a little community despite being online due to COVID but she made me want to actually show up for online learning! I found this class a genuine joy to attend every week!
I enjoy the time in the summer at UCLA, thank you so much!
Prof. Anjum is an excellent professor who cares about her students. IDS1 was not a difficult class, and seems like many people in the class received at least an A.
He cares about the students and has a very practical teaching style. He's an outstanding scientist and educator, and that comes across in his classroom

Knows his stuff. Flipped classroom. Course was very engineer/practical-oriented, our textbook was focused on modeling lasers using MATLAB. Attendance was enforced through quizzes each class, and he has high expectations which I think befit a #1 public institution. In other words he will push you and you will learn. Does speak quickly. Also, hot.
You really heavily on the book (course reader), so you have to buy it. The slides are not posted since he uses his own textbook that he encourages students to buy.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Good prof

She's incredibly east-coast and pretentious. She doesn't tell you what she's going to be grading you on until you get back your first paper. The reading is crazy. She clearly favors if you've been at UCLA since freshman year, but if you're a transfer, good luck. However, she gives interesting lectures.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Super enjoyable class; the books she assigns are always interesting. Almost perfect for someone with anxiety you don't get called on unless you volunteer. Gives you a break in the middle of class since it's usually about 2 hours long.

He knows what he is doing, but this class requires a lot of leg work outside of class. Tests are only moderately hard if you prepare adequately. His lectures are clear, however, Linear Algebra is one of those topics you need to sit with for a while. He makes you feel stupid when asking questions, though, and that is unacceptable D:
He knows what he is doing. He undersatands what he is talking about. but not the students.
Loser in the game of life
does shy sheepish things tomake it with the undergrads

Dr. Jesse Byock is an extraordinary teacher. His depth of knowledge and passion for Icelandic history and Norse culture is a joy. Easily one of my favorites at UCLA. I was fortunate to take several of his classes, including Norse language. His Feud in the Icelandic Sagas and Medieval Iceland are among the few books I kept after graduating.

This guy knows his stuff but won't do much of anything except chat with grad students during class. Took Norse 151 & 152 and loved the material but had to study a lot on my own, plus there was no book, we were his "guinea pigs" testing a book he was developing. Lots of xeroxed pages. If you're an undergrad, he won't pay much attention to you.

Had her for Psych of Gender at UCLA. She was awful-worst "professor" I've ever had. She's completely manic and unnecessarily stubborn. I diligently attended every class, read everything, and promptly turned in all my thoroughly prepared assignments. I love being a student but hated going to her class. I will remember her for all the wrong reasons.

Gilmartin maybe “book smart”, however, she has a lot to learn and is clueless when it comes to teaching! She is rude, snooty, not very approachable and completely out of touch with her students. The only thing that she succeeded in doing within the 10-weeks was to make students feel incompetent! My complaint is not that she has high expectations an
Really great prof. Passionate about the subject

Good speaker, not the most effective prof. Lectures SEEM well-organized via ppt, but not a lot of "meat" to them. Lots of gen info, w/ few pts that really matter. Will draw you to class, but that's the most you get. Reading doable, IDs, 2000 word essay at end. Use books for essay.

Does a good job at teaching what can be a frightfully confusing subject (corporate and partnership tax) and making it accessible.  Only cold-calls in lower level classes.  Attendance and reading are a must.  Exam was very difficult, but fair.
No Comments

This class was the one that convinced me to change my major to Linguistics. Stabler gives an excellent, clear introduction to a difficult subject. He's a great professor to take if you plan to take more classes in linguistics, because he covers a lot of information you need to know for your other ling classes. Great professor and great class!

This class was so insanely hard it was unbearable. Picture algebra with words instead of numbers. You MUST get a good TA to have anything in this class make sense. The prof teaches with examples, but if you dont understand the material how are you supposed to understand the examples??
Mrs Yoon is nice but sometime very strict and cranky or moody. This class was all about memorization. If you are a native Korean speaker you will do fine. Overall it was fun.
Very helpful.Willing to listen and work with you.Highly recommend.

Professor Stoll goes off on tangents and recording lectures is useless because he goes off base so much. Also, his tests are written very vague but he is looking for specific answers!!  so beware !!  TA's were horrible and could not hold a helpful review session either.  Stoll may be the chair but even the TA's agreed the test was written poorly.
he is super hard and incomprehensible

Great professor! He is a little difficult at times but the tests are straight to the point and he really cares and wants you to do well. His office hours are very helpful! Make sure to read the book! If you don't it will be hard! Worked with me one on one at office hours and I got an A. Great Professor, Great person!

Very difficult to stay awake during class but the man knows his stuff. He tends to stray from the main topic in lecture, but he can clarify any question during OH. Definitely read the book; it helps clear up the points he misses and he tests on obscure information from it. Really cares about students learning, and is overall nice and knowledgeable.

Came as a visiting professor to Pomona College after teaching a year at UCLA. She is a great person! She is very nice and understanding and a good prof too. She was a little restricted by the curriculum that Pomona made her use but overall the class was very good. Shes incredibly helpful and always willing to see you in office hours or after class

She's really cool :) If you read and go over the material with her and the rest of the class in class it's easy ;) She's a great professor who's always willing to answer your questions at all times ;)
Super nice but he gives a lot of quizzes. He also uses a lot of audio and video files so you know what he's talking about. I enjoyed the class a lot.

He know's his stuff. Make sure to read. First part of class was pretty tough with the Population Genetics problem, but I'm no math wiz and I still aced the midterm. He makes the lectures available on Bruincast for your convenience. If you're not up for the workload, don't take the class. Manson is a great professor.
New to teaching but is improving.  He follows assigned textbook and no surprises.  Really enjoyed how he takes his extra time to help his students.
Enjoyed his Lab very much. He is not your typical instructor! Enjoys the company of his students. He is an easy grader if you do all homework and assignments.
A bit boring to sit through his lectures, but they do provide useful information that will appear on exams. He is very approachable and is ready to assist students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: the class was pretty easy. it's taught by several professors and the seminar was ran by decker and a TA (agamba). i's pretty chill and fun. i would recommend it for others.

I took Latin American History with Dr. Moya focusing on Argentina mostly and he was an excellent professor that overextends himself.  He always had a line out his office hours.  If you have the opportunity seriously consider taking his course.
Best teacher ever -- too bad he's teaching at Columbia now.

Great professor really cares about her students.  Engages students in meaningful conversation and encourages community involvement.  Workload is fair, grading is fair – I will take her again.  See her during office hours. .

Maybe knows a small bit more than her students. A bit simple in her approach. Nice person. Boring overall, and you wont learn a lot more than reading an article or two. Nothing special, but nothing too offensive either.

Good professor, but take what he says with a grain of salt. Kind of hard to take a professor seriously when they break the very foundations of teacherstudent trust. His wife is a 23 year old ex-student, he's pushing 60
Great teacher
I love music and a bunch of other stuff like that.
helps you out with every step of everything. Although she does require you to be in class every day, class is very laid back and has a very friendly environment.

Re prior comment: This was a class specifically intended for foreign students. Very unlikely the commenter even attended US Junior High. Sears is a very well regarded teacher and ED of the UCLA Williams Institute. He was def not lazy, just extremely busy leading a prominent LGBT rights org. Students in this class were blatantly homophobic!

This professor has his eye on the clock throughout the class. His law courses are similar to civic courses of a junior high level. He never reads the assignments before grading them. He is lazy as most every one of his students agree. God knows how he got to the UCLA law school!
Mr. bishop is simply awesome. He is a very educated guy with a great sence of humor! I enjoy being in his class.  You will be very
Jack is an excellent professor who truly cares about his students. He is always willing to take whatever steps are necessary to help students and his course web site is the bomb!

I took History 111C with Professor Pirnazar and enjoyed it very much. She is a very nice and serious lady who is devoted to teaching at a high quality. If you really like the topics youll enjoy her teaching immensely. However, dont take her class just because it fits your schedule. She demands a lot, but her study guide is very  helpful.

I took her Iranian Jewish History course.  There is alot of material and she goes thru it fast.  Takes attendance.  Extra credit available after midterm.  Didnt learn alot from the lectures, recommend doing the readings.  Exam study list is 3 pages- didnt bother.  Fair grading.  Do not recommend if you have no prior knowledge of subject.
Makes stats fun
Great professor, makes stats fun.

Great professor. Go to class, he might seem like he does not care, but he does a surprisingly good job explaining ideas. Only bad thing is he can get into bad moods at times...and there is nothing you can really do but wait it out.
No Comments

More professors should be like him, super helpful, knowledgable, and will assist you on any questions you may have. He brought in great guest lecturers that were both inspiring and knowledgable. He definitely cares about his students and wants to make you better.

Really good teacher, the class is very interactive, you will participate a lot. He really knows what he is talking about in the Entertainment industry. He will bring great guests speakers that are already working in Film and TV. Fun class!!! Homework: you have to write a journal based on your internship.
Changed my life.
This class made me think a lot and challenge myself in the way I see things.

I took medical anthropology with Linda Garro, and it's been one of my favorite classes. The materials assigned were interesting and relevant to the class. Lots of reading, and lecture can be a bit heavy. If you're willing to work for a grade take a class with her.
boring, few movies, podcasted so never need to go to class

Incredible professor. Crystal clear lectures, lost of practice material by way of homework problem sets, assigned book problems and released past exams. Made the material engaging.  A blessing to the UCLA Chemistry department.
greatest professor ever. genuinely cared about her students and went above and beyond for us. Also, she is the coolest person ever.

(at Drexel btw) Never have I ever had a more disorganized professor. Briefly talked about a final project ONCE (in week 7), no info online/email. Assigns final project during finals week and gives you a few days. Never ever inputs grades. She's a good teacher but you will have ZERO idea what your grade is and what you need to do week to week.

She is the most ridiculous professor Ive ever had in college. I took this class as a gen ed and its a 101 course so I didnt expect a crazy workload. Instead I received more work in this class than in any of my 400 level classes. The worst part is no grades were uploaded the entire term and now there is an NGR placed as my final grade, STAY AWAY
Lectures are confusing to follow because topics are not explained properly.

I will give 0 star if bruinwalk let me. Professor and TA are not helpful at all. Her slides were confusing and jumping around. Topics were not organized. Many students posted on ccle discussion board asking for clarification. You barely saw this happen in other classes in UCLA before. Very sad to see ucla cs falling.
Interesting lectures and clear grading criteria.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Park is very serious about the topics she teaches. She made me think, and guided me to areas of knowledge I had never encountered before. I have to say, I found it arousing to be in her presence both in class and during office hours. She's a very bright and dedicated scholar and teacher.

Lectures are dense but very interesting. Gives long readings with heavy jargon which doesn't teach students effectively. Part of your grade involves being graded by other students, most likely done as an excuse for Idan to grade less assignments. Grades very harshly and is very picky with answers. Not reasonable. Not for me. Nice guy though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: He doesn't answer questions very much and makes accessing files/documents/materials difficult. He doesn't teach the subject properly as he focuses way too much on computers and goes into the meaningless details of studies. He blows through the material and doesn't slow down even when asked. projects are lengthy and too advanced for newbie to get
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Has been the most helpful instructor I've ever had. I took her class two years ago, and she still stays in touch. She has done letters of rec, referred me to employers.
I want to be her. She's funny, she sends long detailed emails that go over everything and include a lot of helpful info. You feel like she really cares about her students. She knows her stuff.
i took 32b
No Comments

Tries his very best to make the class entertaining and bearable. Makes sure all the information required to be successful is presented in a clear and concise manner. Extremely fair grading parameters. Energetic and positive.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Patterson was one of the best professors I've ever had. He delivered his lectures in a fun way and I really enjoyed learning about the presidency. There is quite a bit of reading, but not as much as some other poli sci classes. Highly recommend.
Amazing professor very engaging very passionate
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: She was an alright professor. She was very passionate about the material and really wanted you to take something from the material that she taught. Weekly Journal Entries and 4 papers for the entire course. The midterm involved memorization. Final Paper AND Final Exam (which included 2 Extra papers). If you don't have a choice take this class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--So many papers

comment: Professor Kaufman's class will definitely challenge you, but she goes the extra mile to ensure you remain abreast the material. Her generosity with time, feedback and guidance is unparalleled. If you take advantage of these things while remaining committed to the material, you will be fine-- and quite possibly, exit the course a stronger writer.
rating_tags: Caring--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Great class, brilliant professor, seminar-style discussions of weekly readings. "Adultery in the Novel" was the class theme. Reading selections were interesting. Grading: 2 six page papers (30% each), weekly reading quizzes (30%; she drops the lowest two), attendance and participation (10%). No midterm or final exam. Highly recommended!

spectacular professor. I Have taken multiple of his classes and will take more! He is full of knowledge and deep interest in his subject, particularly his expertise on the northern renaissance, but also in history of Los Angeles, and much more. His northern renaissance class is super well made and one can tell he has taught it many times. 3 tests

This Professor is very intelligent, he clearly knows his stuff. There is quite a bit of reading and he covers a lot in lecture that can be hard to get through. However, there aren't any papers and your grade is the mean between your midterm and final test scores. Tests cover material and are multiple choice. He isn't too rough on the eyes either!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I didn't know what to expect going into the class, but left with an appreciation for quality works as well as additional knowledge of culture and history. She explained and explored ideas thoroughly and gave students the opportunity to come to their own conclusions and interpretations about the material. Keeping up with the reading is key!

Very nice professor! I took her for French Autobiography. We read 6 short contemporary novels and part of another (ranged from 100-150 pages each). Grading: 40% - attendance, group presentation (5-10 mins on 1 of the texts), and 1 online blog comment for each text; 40% - mid-term & 2 essays (2 pgs & 3 pgs); 20% - final essay (5 pgs). No final exam!
The midterm was horrendous.  Tons of reading though some of it was interesting.
No Comments

Sanchez is super passionate about literature so be prepared to read a lot and be blown away by his lectures. Sanchez likes to read the work aloud so it's pretty easy to follow along and soak it all in. The weekly discussion posts are pretty easy and you have to read in order to pass the quizzes. The final essay is pretty hard but he is very helpful
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He's really politically oriented. Participation is mandatory, and you must post in the discussion board every night before class, on top of that he has quizzes every class so read. The grade is pretty much divided between a 10-15 page paper incorporating 10 sources and your participation, but he does give a lot of (confusing) feedback. Hard grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Cool and funny professor. Pretty clear during lecture, not too much homework. Very helpful during lectures and outside class. Ridiculously difficult Midterm and Final but curves are generous - cuz everyone messed up.
Sometimes, his explanations for problems are literally "that's how you do it." His grading system is kind.
I took Prof Grand for soc methods. Don't recommend him, but he ain't too bad either. He tries to make it seem easier but what he ends up doing is making it more unclear and vague

Unclear, vague lectures that are difficult to understand, not necessarily because the material is challenging but because he fails to explain in depth. He oversimplifies the material and does not make himself available for help. He is nice, but not engaging or helpful. No textbook. Weekly HW. Midterm. Final.

THis professor shouldn't even be teaching. He mocks students' gender and race in front of the class and deliberately embarrasses them.  Ths class has nothing to do with producing.  He's definitely on a power trip.
Intense. Unique. Both the class and the professor.  Truly a one of a kind experience.  My fav professor here.

There is no textbook for this class to purchase; he provides one in pdf format. I would recommend sitting toward the front because he is pretty quiet, & some info he does mention is important & helpful toward getting the bottom line of the topics. Despite how serious he is about you learning the material, he is really nice and actually funny…

Professor Baschek is currently working a strong & well-paid position in Germany, & there's no certainty if & when he returns to UCLA as prof. In the instance he does, he is very knowledgeable about the topics in physical oceanography. Concepts are heavily focused upon in this class, as you will find out. HWs (best 3 of 4 at 30%), midterm (30%)…
Great class, great professor
Exam is harder than professor lets on
LONG, BORING, YAWN
No Comments

She is indeed one of the most boring professors. Go to class to take her weekly quizzes (best 5 out of 6). Quizzes were straight forward. Hist 180A was a small class consisted of maybe 20 people. Everything was graded by her. 1 Midterm, 1 Paper, 1 Final.   A if you put the work in reading .. Easy C for minimal work .. Stay away if possible!

She is a very boring lecturer but compared to other GE's the workload is easy.  Getting an A is all about how well you connect with your T.A because that is who controls the fate of ur grade in that class.  Go to T.A. office hours, you won't miss anything at all if you skip lectures, and at least skim the reading.

He's probably a better researcher than a teacher. Seems like teaching is his means to end for grant $ to work abroad, or write. He likes an audience but one on one he's cold & impatient. Course is a requirement. Be prepared to sit thru group presentations every week (he peppers his comments throughout). Readings were interesting & relevant.
easy class.

Overall, I really liked Venugopal's class and I learned a lot. She put all the readings up online and was very organized.  Sometimes she would go a little too fast and leave some info out, but she is always there when you have questions. Since our class was small she was very strict about attendance.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: I took her last quarter for LS 20, absolutely loved her. The lectures are clear, she tries to answer questions thoroughly. Goes at a reasonable pace. Taking her again this quarter for LS 30A. Most test questions are identical to the homework, though she did throw in one random one on the final. Overall great professor. Also no textbook required.

There were no readings but you had to go to lecture (they were super interesting and interactive). In discussions we were assigned to groups, got to create our own experiments based off of that weeks topic and carry them out like we were researchers. I remember just about everything I learned and I loved it. Everyone I know that got him, loved him.
Professor Oppenheimer is a great lecturer and a very knowledgeable guy. I loved Psych 10 with him!
Must read book, before attending class. He Will move forward through 7 chapters in 6 days.

The material is complicated itself..He tries to make it has easy as possible...he leaves a lot of home work..TONS.hes okay..not the best..he gives study guides for both midetrms and finals..he does give pop quizzes..he grades on a curve.He subtracts points if ur late and absent...you decide.

Professor Stone is by far the best professor I've ever had. I entered this class thinking it was going to be the worst thing. But I looked forward to every single lecture, and during lectures, I was always checking the time hoping it would not end soon. I almost cried during our last lecture! Also, he's really helpful and his conferences are great.

AMAZING professor. he is great at what he teaches and really makes you understand how to write a paper effectively. The class is centered around fairy tales which makes it even more interesting. Though it is an hour and 15 minutes its hard to be bored in his class. I really recommend taking him if you have to take english comp 3.
Mike is great!!!
Excellent teacher who cares about students learning the material. Answers all questions thoroughly.  Wonderful person. :-)

I miss my PR! He's the reason my boyfriend and I started dating, and if we get married, Professor and Doctor Rocha are both so invited to our wedding. He's one of the best professors you'll ever have, and the best person you'll ever meet. I wish I could take only Rocha for the rest of my college career!

Great teacher.  Allowed for great conversation and debate in class.  Class was never boring and lectures were never just lectures.  If only all teachers were this good.  Two best strenths: his clear passion for Philosophy and his great teaching skills.

19th century French short stories. The readings were interesting. Friendly professor, very approachable. Mostly lecture, but he encourages students to comment on texts. Grading: 2 five page papers 35% each; Attendance and participation 30%. No tests or quizzes. Recommended. :-)
No Comments
So funny and I learned so much!
I love Rich Rose! He's so funny and genuinely cares about his students. He should be running the theater department at UCLA.
Dr. Nguyen was incredible teaching this course. Explanations were so clear. Exams are difficult as everyone said, but very fair. Too bad it's his last quarter teaching :(

Professor was incredibly tough, but really fair and sweet. The curve really saved me, got a B. His exams are systematic, so you must read and review everything or else you'll pay for it on the exam. It's only his second quarter teaching, but he's extrememly well-prepared and his lectures are awesome. All the girls seem to like him.
Great class! Loved her accent.
I enjoyed the class a lot. I liked that she was a native speaker and that she was always patient and encouraging.
Very good professor, I loved him
good class but hard

Professor Ryan was honestly one of the most efficient and honest people I've met. If you have a problem with your writing she will give you every resource you need to correct it. She is dedicated to her work, love literature, film, and popular culture. She's also on the low very funny.I would recommend her to anyone who really want's to improve.
terrible at explaining things, all of class time was a waste, and she assigned far too much text to truly read and process
Great instructor, I learned a lot in this class, it was very challenging but I remember it as some of my best learning experiences at university.
Really good professor, and interesting projects. The grading scale is difficult though.
emily is the best
Excellent professor!

All exams will require you to write your answers in essay format, besides that the guidelines are obscure. The grading of your exams will be completely subjective and depend on the professor/TA liking/disliking you. I mean, its psychology, if you have power yourre going to abuse it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Frustrating and confusing. Exams graded slowly and with no guidelines. Not using a key word in a single short answer exam question could cause you to lose 8% of the class grade, even if you explained your answer well.
