The professor is inaccessible and uninvested in student success. The worst class I've ever taken.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Fun professor who helps you to get an A. Loved his lectures!

The professor doesn't use books and he mainly conveys info to you through lectures. He has a wealth of knowledge and asks you to write papers in lieu of tests using the information provided in class. Sweetest man and he also works with a local museum. He cracks G rated jokes and reminds me of my grandpa! I would love to take him again
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS--Caring

comment: just like with any math class, be prepared to invest time and energy if you want to get an A.
Horrible.

William was a talented teacher able to connect to and and make an impact on myself and my class. His wisdom and kindness made him a really great teacher and mentor. My class was a symposium, so it was on the easier side, and William made it a highly enjoyable experience. Loved this teacher.

Bill is a tremendous teacher and mentor.  He genuinely cares about each and every student and wants to see them succeed in every way possible.  He knows and appreciates his craft, and that comes through with exceptional clarity.  I highly recommend taking any class possible that is led by him.

I don't know where this hate comes from. Henary seemed genuinely caring and clearly loves chemistry. He'd smile constantly during lecture and would frequently come into the lab to ask how we were doing, and would give us constructive criticism here and there. Tests weren't that bad.

Henary is suppose to be easy. And I guess to an extent, he is easier than Pang. However, his accent makes it really hard to understand the concepts. Also, he doesn't really help much in office hours; he assumes you are totally stupid and gives off a condescending vibe.

I want to start this by saying Dr. Mack is by no means a bad person. She very obviously cares about her students and the topics that she teaches. However, she loves to proselytize and she gets off topic very easily I didn't learn anything of value in this class and dreaded going.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Dr Mack is by far my favorite professor I've had at Weber. She is smart and thoughtful and her classes and assignments were so engaging and enjoyable. this class is heavily based in reading and participation and you have to do the reading, but really is the best way to analyze and understand Anthropological Theory. 100/10 would recommend her class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Seems like she would be nice/understanding, but she definitely is not. Tough grader for no reason. Grades insanely harshly for a course that should have been easier and about exploring yourself/your writing. Good luck trying to get on her good side, try to understand what she is looking for, and getting her to grade your work fairly.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Does not take into consideration the opinions of students on COVID and hybrid
phenomenal ta, would take her every quarter if i could!

Super laid back, very understanding, and knowledgeable in Latino Politics. Attendance is mandatory, but it's worth it. She brings her dog, sometimes snacks, and makes it worth your time that you really learn something new after every meeting.
Unique point of view which is fascinating. He brought in incredible speakers too.

As an anthro major I HATED archaeology before taking Vranich. His lectures made it interesting and fun, not to mention his tea times. His charisma and teaching style make this class fun to take no matter what your interest level. There were 2 written assignments (both very straightforward) a midterm, and a final. Alexei rocks, 'nuff said.

Here is a funny story about Zame: One day he brought cookies to class. The first student he passed them to took out some napkins he had with him to pass around with them. "You sissy!" he shouted at the student. The next time Zame brought cookies, no one took out napkins and cookie crumbs were left on the table.
Clear speaker and well-organized, but gets unreasonably angry over minor things.  Rude.
No Comments

Dr. Giuliano really has a passion for english and enjoys the books you read. She is very eccentric as well. Her explanations can be vague and she can go back and forth on interpretations. Her organization is really bad also. She is unclear on due dates and she rarely replies to emails. But overall, really nice and helpful if you ask.

Professor Craig is sweet, however she is a little distracted. Participation is necessary in this class. I like the material. There is A LOT of reading and weekly reading response assignments due every week (1-2 pages). Class meets once a week, I wouldn't recommend missing more than one class.

Although the course itself might be interesting, I felt that the professor wasn't able to engage with the students. His lectures are wordy and was very hard to understand. I personally don't think he is a fair grader. He gets offended very easily and i think that he isn't really fit for a proper professor.

She puts a lot of time into making sure that students have the tools they need to succeed in the course such as practice exams  that and solution sets. She also made plenty of time for office hours for students who have many questions. Overall, I would recommend taking her.

A seminar for hist majors, mostly discussion, no exams, and 1 12-16 page essay at end. Lots of reading (one book a week), but you should be used to it if in hist. Very approachable prof, edited essays before deadline for us. Told us many relevant hist anecdotes. A very good class for Angelenos. Learned things I've never learned before about LA.

This professor is complicated. He is nice but only in some situations is very VERY strict on no phone policy. Attendance isn't mandatory but makes a big deal when you don't show up . Lectures are just him ranting about what he thinks of the reading . He does not give good feedback on work. Has his own way of how he wants things done terrible

Easy class. Just pay attention and take the in-class notes all the notes are in the exams. NO FINAL OR MIDTERMS. There are exams for each philosopher you read the prof reviews every reading so dont worry. You dont need the book. Hes pretty funny,not difficult.IN the all the exam there are like 5 true or false like 8 mult choice & 3-5 SHORT ANSWER.

He loves teaching and is gives more of a "presentation" of the material, rather than a lecture. It is difficult, but he makes it bearable even for people who have less interest. Grading is a little tough, but a terrific professor.
hard but knowledgeable

Tests consist of homework problems, definitions, and true/false questions. He will not help you with hw though. This makes the class much harder than it should be. His TA/Grader: Anton Malyshev is useless and is very strict with grading. Curves the class very generously, though.
Sure he's nice and comical but his tests are a joke. Prof Copic can't write questions without errors. He tries to make this class easy but he just isn't very good. Take him at your own risk.
Prof. Effros is a great guy and I've had some very interesting conversations with him on mathematics. He loves mathematics and teaching. The difficulty in the course was with the Gamelin textbook.
Nice guy, if you show that you take the material seriously and not talk during class, he'll like you. One of the most interesting and fun papers I've ever written was for his class!

Susanna was good, but she lectures waaay too quickly. The material is dense and she breezes through it. It wouldn't be such a problem if the lectures were recorded and posted online to refer back to, but even taking notes rapidly you'll have a hard time keeping up. Tests are short essay format and there is a ton of reading. Super important topics..
No Comments

He might be able to do, but he certainly can't teach. You read his scripts and discuss them. When you pitch your own ideas, good luck. He won't like any of them, which is surprising because his scripts (as producer) can be pretty bad IMHO. Easy class, but you also won't get an A in it either, regardless. Appears to fish for ideas. Cold/distant.

Angelina is a great instructor! She's always willing to help and clarify if you need it. The grading is tough, but I honestly believe that she is making me a better writer. She also doesn't just give you your grade. You have to work for it. Also there is mandatory attendance, but she let's you have two days off no questions asked. No sept discuss.
Great professor that is young and enthusiastic. He has a lot of experience and was very clear about the material. He was also very organized.

A wonderful and inspirational human being. He does leave a lot to TAs because his classes are often huge, but I think he has good TAs, too.  I thought his class really led you through the info from the start to the end.

Professor Silvia was super nice and not strict at all. She encouraged any discussion. She starts the class by talking about the movies we will watch for 30 minutes to an hour, then we watch a movie for the other 2 hours. This is a super laid back and nice class. There are 3 papers--1 midterm, 1 research, 1 final (all are take home).
Mediocre, not very engaging or interesting as an instructor.

World Bank-Annenberg Summer Institute not worth price $7K unless compensated Secure financial aid Take good MOOC for credit instead  Min influence on your current work Overall entertaining esp. for faculty but expensive LA retreat Low level of interest/instructors from World Bank Take part in Annenberg-Oxford Media Policy Summer Institute instead.

Professor Himadri is a nice person who is dedicated to his students. He offers many office hours for the student to ask him questions. He goes over so much in class and can go on and on about a certain topic. A day or two before the test he'll tell you exactly what is going to be on it. Tests aren't too tough as long as you prepare and do homework.
good prof

not that hard as you expected. Attend the class and take notes if possible. she'll provide u a study sheet before tests. there is a midterm and final exam. As long as you stick with the concept and key-terms. it will be fine.

She's a very stressful woman, that seems to have no life after hours. She will make your life miserable, but in many instances, she actually cares. She is will make you work for the grade but, your writing and analysis skills will improve. She truly is one of the best and absolute worst professors I ever had.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: I really enjoyed Prof. Illes's California class as well as her teaching style! It was very informative, I knew what she wanted, the reading was very interesting, the assignments were constructive and thought provoking.  I would 100% take another course taught by Illes, it was one of the better ones I've had at UCLA.
Single most gifted teacher I've ever come across in my entire life. what an inspiration. Nice!

I wouldn't recommend taking Dr. Ng. She doesn't care about the students or their success in the class, barely responds to emails and even when she does it takes her at least 3 days, and she's one of the profs who think your world revolves around their class, without realizing that life happens (COVID, for example). Worst UCLA prof I've had so far.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Good guy.  teaches K law.  You won't learn much but you will work super hard.  He gives lots of praise during the semester but that is misleading.  The curve means he is not quite lying but not helping when he praises you.  Gives lousy feedback after the final. Just makes excuses that it is really hard to grade finals.  He tries.
hottest teacher ever ;o)

Dr. Cole is one of the most intelligent professors I have ever had. He is captivating and makes African History very interesting. Would recommend his class if you are serious about learning. If not, he may eat your lunch!
Classiest man in the world; a refined and older Colin Firth

A truly inspirational clinical instructor, as well as a compassionate and caring practitioner. Her kindness and grace helped me through an extremely devastating and disappointing immersion. She is a wonderful role model.

A very clear and fair teacher. Tries to make Latin more interactive by doing pair work in class and commentary assignments on excerpts of your own choosing. His explanations are concise and make a lot of sense.

Super nice and awesome for a Vietnamese professor. Piece of cake if you know Vietnamese, and if you're not, she really likes to cater things to you. She's so cute when she tries to explain things :) Very understanding about exam conflicts and other issues if you tell her. HW, projects, quizzes, & extra credit. Final is 99% of quizzes taken before.
Amazing!
Hot!

I can't tell you how great he is! He is one of my favorite professors. He didn't give you lots of homework, but once you do your homework, no matter wrong or right, you get whole credit for that! And his exam is much easier than other professors, only multiple choices.

I first took a class with Dr. Fricker in Fall 2015, Environment M114: Soil & Water Conservation. He was clear with his expectations and class material. He is passionate about his work and will talk about his studies in Panama. He also takes time to help you think about careers. I took him for Geography 5, and hope to do so again in the future.

Amazing lecture even though it was an 8 a.m. Attendance checked through pop quizzes where you basically can just write anything. Section attendance though counts. Exam essays given ahead of time. Project due @ the end. 10/10.

I enjoyed the feedback & resources Marco offered. My complaints were mostly in the content of films he chose to continuously show in class. There was little to NO inspiration and motivation in students and the art work suffered b/c of that. Marco was funny, but his humor is swallowed by a select few. I'm an older student and enjoyed him very much.

Very prolific research analyst from FOX  who happens to teach at UCLA because he cares. Extremely knowledgable. Gets you to become more conscious of the business side of the entertainment/tech industry and how they strategize. A lot of critical thinking. You will learn a lot, especially about contemporary and future stuff. This class is gold.

Javier is a true gem to this school! He is always making sure that all students are on the right track and that nobody is missing out. He encourages class discussions critically and engages everyone! He is a tough grader sometimes, but he will always justify what you could have improved in your papers. Definitely take this course with him!! :D
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Andrea has been my favorite professor of all time! Phenomenal lecturer who knows what she's talking about and will keep you engaged the entire class. Genuinely cares about her students and often checks in to make sure you understand the material as she goes along. She breaks physics down into concepts that students new to physics can understand.
He was an amazing teacher!

Dr. Gana is brilliant! I took him for Comp Lit 100, Intro to CL / Postcolonial Theory, an engaging seminar class. Readings are interesting, but workload is massive, so you'll have to scan. 500+ word weekly writing assign., 10 min presentation, 3k word term paper. He is a fair grader. No tests or final. After 2 absences, you lose 10% of class grade.

Take! Take! Take! Easy grader, test questions are easier than homework questions! In class assignments/participation consist of writing a question about the lecture on a post it, hw always 8-10 questions due weekly, 2 midterms 1 final, final can replace your lowest midterm score, drops the lowest 3 homework assignments!

Just show up and participate. Hes very flexible and reasonable as well. He talked to the class about the final and which essay questions he possibly would post. A bit monotone but very nice and caring.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She's a great professor! So down to earth but still challenges you. An inspiration for male and female students.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: So I basically failed the first time I took a stats class, and I retook it with Zanontian. BEST EVER. Her lectures have everything you need and she gives examples which are basically like questions on her tests. You don't need to study much if you do all the homework and quizzes correctly.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I've never had a teacher that cared less. Not engaging or interesting at all.
This class was the most unuseful thing ever. He is still better than most of the other options so...
Awful, absolutely horrible does as little as possible and leaves all to TA which is also horrible. Outdated ppt FROM 10 YEARS AGO.

Dr. Mata is the most human, humble, understanding, and flexible professor. He is always there for the students and accommodates individuals' needs; he is very supportive and encouraging. He always respects students' comments, asks if we understand the lecture, and encourages group work for quizzes, making the assignments less difficult. Awesome!!
He was a pretty entertaining lecturer.

Prof. Jarrett's class was alright. The only thing that was graded in her class was 2 midterms and a final. They were pretty hard, not gonna lie. They asked questions that did not seem relevant to what we were doing sometimes. Overall, she seemed like a nice person though. Her smile was bright and that was nice. There is minimal extra credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Has a great laugh and very encouraging to theatre students... very willing to chat about Directing; Auditions; different types of theatre, and how to work in the real world. Other students report it to be a highlight of their academic experience. Very fun class... I hope the TFT department let's him teach directing or other courses in the future.

I was so excited for a course on punk but this was almost impossible to stay on top of. I spent at least 5 hours a week on this class outside of the notes. I haven't even been able to do anything besides what's necessary and I'm not doing well at that either. The final was a group project, I have literally never met my teammates.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Love's lectures are amazing. She is very clear with her content and her expectations, while slightly challenging, are very clear. She is a compassionate instructor who truly tries to teach students as much pertinent information as possible. She can be particular about a few things, but overall Dr. Love is an amazing professor to learn from!
A

This course is discouraged due to unclear lectures, contradictory slides, and grading inconsistencies.TAs offer limited guidance to resolve grading issues with the professor. Exam is not existent until day of. Communication between the professor and TAs is lacking, unfulfilled promises of material reviews during discussions.

Really great professor! I'm glad I took this class - a MUST for anyone planning to work in media/journalism. He's so down to earth, VERY kind, funny, cool guy. Told fascinating stories about his career at LA Times. Readings are rather supplemental to the lectures. Exams can be a bit confusing/vague due to the nature of this class :( I recommend!

Hipolito is very disorganized and unprofessional. She cannot run her classes and is rude to students. There is a clique that is acknowledged in classroom discussions and another that is not. She also jumps to conclusions about work without asking students for clarification.

Coursework was easy, but the student-teacher interactions were subpar.

Professor Kochian is a really nice man, and even though he is VERY disorganized and does not follow his course outline at all, he really is interested in student learning and actaully giving speeches. Take him if you have to take Speech 1!

Lecture consisted of historical discussion, name memorization, and listening sections which, as a jazz fan, were quite enjoyable to me. There are three essays to write, the last of which I found myself struggling to write. The tests, on the other hand, were 100 question multiple choice, and tested you on lecture and listening materials. A good GE.

The teacher grades a little difficult, but is an amazing lecturer, and wants to help her students. She holds many office hours and walks you through everything. Overall she helped me think for myself and was inspirational!
Try to avoid as much as possible. The class would be easier if a cabage taught it.
History of American Film 1950s-80s.  Amazing professor. Course required 3 short papers and one 15-page final term paper.  Not easy but well worth it.
No Comments

Anup is quite a fun and interesting teacher.  If you go to his office hours to send him emails he is very willing to answer everything, even things that are completely unrelated to the course.  Despite that, he might sometimes be unclear about what the format of the exams or quizzes would be like, and what he expects from us.
His lectures weren't organized very well, but the material was somewhat interesting and straightforward
Nice, sweet person. As a lecturer, however, her teaching is very difficult to follow along. She goes very fast, I ended up playing sudoku on my phone instead because she was so far ahead.
Good course, professor is interested in teaching this material. Just do your work and study for the exam and the grade is simple.
very helpful; strongly recommended!!

This is Lee's first time lecturing at UCLA, and he was an unbelievable professor. He was very articulate, down to earth, caring, very knowledgable about the 4 books we covered in Critical Race Theory. Very passionate about the subject, clear lectures, and fair grading. His class definitely got me interested CRT, and racialization in general.

This professor was very knowledgeable about subject content, but his condescending manner came off as better than, and this was not appreciated by most of the students. In short I would not recommend this professor.

Easy grader but the class felt like it dragged along all the time. Davidyan is very professional and cares about student learning however I got annoyed with all the in-class therapy session going on. LOL

Worst Professor I have ever had! reads directly from power point, has weekly pop quizzes on irrelevant subject matter.  The final consists of quotes from all the readings the entire quarter and choosing who made them.  She did not teach this class well or I misunderstood the what Chinese civilization should be.  TA Tyler Cann, bright spot

Amazing! Most entertaining and fun class I have ever had at UCLA. No textbook! 4 very short assignments and 2 in class tests (midterm and final) that are very fairly graded, and interesting movies! Katie Mullen was also fabulous, she was the discussion class teacher. I learned so much in this class and really wish I could take another one with her!
No Comments

Awesome class! I really learned a lot about Siberia! Klenin is one of the kindest profs of UCLA! She's very helpful and wanted us to succeed!! There's NO ONE else that really cared about my grade other than Prof. Klenin! So she rocks!! This is what inspired me to learn Russian as well! Spr. 09
Wonderful teacher. So down to earth. Remembers what it was like to be a student and is compassionate. Good sense of humor. Assignments were interesting. I hope to study with her again.
hard but good

If this Seung Ji is the TA for labs and other physics classes, then I'd say he's a nice guy, nice TA, and you'll get the grade you deserve. If you aren't 100% sure you're ready for the class he's in, either shape up or drop; he's a hit or miss.
He's helpful and wants to make sure you understand. But he goes too fast in lectures and often digresses.

Accent was extremely hard to understand and his lectures were all over the place. He has a weird obsession with the chalkboard and never turns around to look at the class or to see if anyone has questions. If you call out to him to ask a question he gets really annoyed.  His tests were also way harder than any of his examples or hw.

I seriously believe this course was designed  to make you fail. The majority of the students in the class are Islamic majors and have already have an understanding of Islamic History. She will assume u do as well. Your grade is 5, 15 point quizzes. It is VERY easy to let ur grade fall by simply missing a few questions per quiz. This class is HARD!

Sarah is such a lovely professor. While she isn't a super charismatic lecturer, the content she provides and the way she provides it is clear and interest-inducing. Beyond that, she 's accessible outside of class and is always happy to talk through readings/concepts. She's also a great research mentor, in case you want to do SRP or English Honors.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Robert was the most thoughtful and helpful professor I have yet to have. He gets back to you in a moments notice when you email with problems. If he doesn't feel you have put in enough effort or he grades you down, he will always work with you to do better for full credit. He cares about how much you learn not about the mechanical grading process.

This class is "easy" in the sense that there is only a midterm and final. The midterm is "circle one answer or the other" and fill in the blank. He gives out a study guide the lecture before the midterm. The final is a take home essay with somewhat unclear instructions and a general idea of what he wants. Grading method is unclear for the final.
She is charismatic, cares about the students and works with you. Confidence is a big lesson she teaches. Great spirit!

Professor Christensen is really passionate about teaching so she gets upset if you're not invested. The only work that is graded are the essays which you get to revise throughout the course! A couple group presentations, but you are primarily graded by essays and participation. Different from all the English courses I've taken, but still valuable.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I really loved this class and I really enjoyed reading all the texts that were assigned. There's only one essay that's due and she gives weekly quizzes so you have to do the reading. There's a creative project which means you can do whatever you want! As long as you do the work you will pass. She's super approachable too! Love her!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Do not fall behind. Do all the reading and study questions.

Her lectures are interesting. She is very organized, lots of fun slides. She gives out a study sheet before the exams and her grading is quite fair. I would highly recommend taking Prof. Lydon, she is one of the foremost experts on Trans-Saharan trading networks.
Aimee has no filter, and that whats makes her so fantastic. If you want to take a class from a smart, honest woman then choose her.
Hottest professor ever! But also really nice and funny. He's also super smart, knows everything about politics. A bit of a pushover when it comes to marking. It was the best class I took this year.

Amazing course. Most of the readings she assigns is covered during lecture. Grades easy on the midterm. She gives you an option of two types of midterms and the final is a very fun project. This class is highly recommended. There is no textbook for this class. All readings are online for free. One day lecture and one day guest speaker.
Great

So I took Stats XL 110 as an extension at UCLA for GCC because I didn't want to take additional math classes and wanted to get it over with.  Prof. Nathan is the coolest professor ever,  simple, polite, calm, a little nerdy / cute,  sincere,  just pretty awesome.  The midterm / final was challenging, but the QUIZES ARE THE MOST IMPORTANT, PASS THEM

As someone who's taken 3 classes of hers, Professor Hallock is one of the best lecturers I've had at UCLA.  She's clear and genuinely interested in students' learning of the material. Lectures are always interesting, office hours are helpful, and exams are doable if you attend lectures regularly. I wish UCLA would keep her for more classes!

I haven't finished the class yet or gotten a grade back, but Bondarenko is overall a good teacher and lecturer. There are many professors who are good at what they do but suck at teaching basics, but Bondarenko isn't one of them. He's really good at explaining things in a way that you will understand and gives enough examples.

Professor Berman is not only the best professor I've ever had but is also so incredibly good looking. I worked with him on a brief I wrote for class and he was always available to discuss it with me. He gives detailed feedback and helpful tips that I am sure will make me a successful lawyer.

Dr. Amah has the greatest personality of any professor I've ever taken. Although I was in a class of over 100 students, she took the time to get to know us outside and really cares about our needs. Her presentations focused on both helping us getting into the world of research, as well as professional schools. Definitely recommend taking her!

Panagia's syllabus is really hardcore, but you realize he's actually chill when you go to lecture. Discussion attendance is mandatory, but lecture is not. However, I would recommend going to lecture because Panagia basically tells you exactly what to write about in your essays. He also offered 5% extra credit for a random lecture.

The curriculum is determined by the department, we were graded based on a MT and FN exam, based on vignettes and the application of what we learned. Very open and honest about what being a therapist is like, she's clearly very knowledgeable and a great lecturer. I think for a direct practice class she is an excellent choice if you have the chance.
Greatest teacher out there! He even gave me a hug!
Took Prof Hashem's Design Communication class. Super chill professor and a modern thinker. Worked hard during class, but learned a lot. Would recommend for intro to Design students

This is the worst professor I had over 3 years of university. He have accent and on top of that talks way too fast. Additionally, he swallows words often that makes it extremely hard for students to listen and understand the lecture properly. This is only the first week of class and I generally give second chance, but I don't think he will improve.
Excellent class. Readings are interesting and he clearly spends time crafting the class. Great lecturer and manages to incorporate enough participation opportunities to not make the class dull.
Eric needs a raise. He was the greatest professor I have ever had.
he communicates very well and is very clear with his lectures. He also sends. out emails to update the class. It is obvious. he cares about students' success. highly recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: One of the best professors I've had. His lectures are clear, and he always can help if you don't understand a certain topic. He even makes time to review for exams.
Covers a high volume of information just for your general knowledge. Homework and tests are essay based and the textbook covers everything needed for both. Overall, good class.

Awesome guy. Hard as hell to understand as far as his accent goes, but he gives you all homework ahead of time, and have a week after you finish a section to DO the homework. Speaks very clearly as far as analysis goes, and is fair..

MJ (Professor Amelia) makes the class feel like less of a chore/duty and more like an opportunity to gain exposure to a variety of topics that may ignite personal interest. MJ emphasizes learning and interactivity rather than assessments or grades. They also strive to be as unbiased which promotes students to be engaged and share opinions.
PROF BOBROW!!!! He was a great lecturer, and incredibly funny. We loved every lecture he gave and the great stories he would share, especially the ones about his college days playing tuba.

The class was very lecture based but she managed to make them entertaining. She uses more photos than words so its easier to understand the concept personally, and she really knows what she's talking about. She gives good feedback and is a fair grader on essays, even letting you redo them sometimes. Attendance isn't mandatory. 100% would take again

Really interesting class but so hard to enjoy it because of this teacher. He would read off a script during lectures and refuse to share the script or even record the Zoom. You need to show up for lecture if you don't have a classmate to share the notes with you. He's super conceited and not great at answering questions. White saviour vibes.

Great Professor, I took her for the Fall22 Gender 10. This class consists off in class participation assignments and a group project Final. To present during finals week. I recommend this class with her bc her grading is clear and she provides all readings to you. My TA was great and he assisted us with extra help. I do reccommend this class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Cha seems to follow a script and lacks flexibility.  Her style made me question the way she had studied for her degrees.  Believe others when they say that the faculties from this department are totally gapped in knowledge and techniques.  I truly hope that Cha did not gain her position from merely sharing similitudes with her connections at Ucla.
The class structure included group projects that were manageable. The workload was reasonable. Overall the class is easy if you put in some effort.
The GOAT for real but 2k24 disrespecting him badly and the game is broken so it needs to be fixed
Consistently late, lacks knowledge, displays rudeness, shows clear favoritism toward certain students, provides inadequate guidance, and grades unfairly.
His tests are easy
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: SO much chemistry on SOILS. Lectures are long, not particularly interesting, and extremely difficult. Read the textbook , took notes, and re-watched lectures for this class to still feel like I did not understand the material. Worst class I took at UCLA. Stay away!!!!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I took Prof Law for CS174 at UCLA this quarter. The course is about programming for computer graphics, using Javascript and WebGL. Using these simple tools it's possible to build 3d games, scenes, and demonstrations. It's pretty cool. Prof. Law is well organized and enthusiastic. Team project was fun. Recommended.

Prof. Weiss is very nice and helpful but is more into academia than straightforward material. The text is "supplementary" (/for hw). He tests on what he lectures,  goes on tangents and namedrops. Hard to study for tests as they don't follow hw, you have to do personal research so if you're interested in chem as a subject in itself you may do well.

This professor started out easy and fun, but about halfway through the quarter he started forgetting his microphone and his markers so you could neither hear him speak nor read his chalkboard writing. He focuses more on memorizing about 50 equations than comprehending how to use them. No calculators allowed.

The class grade was comprised of a midterm, a paper, and a final. Lecture was difficult to stay awake in. Otherwise, the concepts are really interesting and the readings aren't totally necessary as long as you get the overall ideas of the works down. Attending lecture and discussion should be enough. But Morris is a very passionate professor.
Prof Burns is knowledgeable, engaging, challenging, and darn hilarious.

Such a great professor, always wanted to make sure we understood the material he was teaching us.  The workload is super manageable with only 1 paper a week (was always a super easy prompt) and non-mandatory readings recommended before each class.  The exams were also super easy, all based on exactly what he taught us in class.  10/10 recommend.

Wonderful professor, very clear with material and expectations. Always responded to emails and made time outside office hours for his students. Couldn't be anymore straight forward, his instructions and expectations are very clear. If you care about your grades he will reciprocate. As long as you follow along you will do well.
His lectures have all the information for exams, plus his assigned readings will also benefit you for the exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Has a strong passion for dedication and seeks to empower students knowledge and agency
Great teacher. I strongly recommend her.

Actually Physiological Science Dept. Great Professor! Systems biology is an important and rapidly growing branch of science. Tests and homework are very reasonable and although some of the material is innately challenging, Dr. Xiao puts together nice presentations that make it approachable. Must read a couple dozen real research articles for class.

She is a very nice and accommodating professor! There is A LOT of reading (~10 mystery novels), but it is worth it. And she is very fair in her grading. Her class is more of a discussion-based course rather than lecture style. She's awesome :)
Awesome professor! He's new to teaching but got a lot better as the quarter went on. He's very knowledgeable about physics and is very friendly and helpful.

Professor Roper was an awesome guy and super nice. However, I am a student that needs a lot of examples and clear cut notes to really understand a topic and Professor Roper isn't that type of teacher. He is also a biologist so he draws a lot of what he teaches from science so he can go on a tangent then realize it doesn't really apply to the math.

It was fun to learn engineering drawing and CAD using SolidWorks. The lab also has a fun project about designing and 3D printing a wind turbine! He is very helpful in office hours and go the extra mile to help you.

Not the greatest professor, but he sure will make you pass. I had him two quarters and miraculously No one failed either. Not gonna learn much unless you study on your own. He does EVERYTHING from the textbook. Do the Challenge Questions in Hw

Dr. Caffee is an amazing professor. Brand new to teaching after writing her dissertation, she's insanely interesting and impressive. She taught us all about Eurasia through food and on the day of the final we got to try to food. There is a lot of reading, but I didn't do all of it because you choose your research paper topic. TAKE THIS CLASS!!!
Probably a phenomenal researcher, but most definitely not a lecturer.

Won't explain material, relies excessively on Socratic method (and won't step in when the entire class is lost), unnecessarily hard on students who are simply confused, difficult to approach to address stated issues, rushes through material, obviously smart but is truly one of the worst professors I've ever had

I feel like Professor Radko is one of the better math professors I have ever taken.  She really cares about student learning and encourages students to come to office hours and ask for help if needed. She also uses Bruincast which is useful to use to study for exams. Midterms were homework difficulty level, and the final was slightly harder.

Extremely disorganized, rude, and difficult to understand. If you study you'll do well in the class but the combination of her thick accent and teaching style made lectures hard to sit through. Her instructions for assignments and emails rarely made sense. Very nitpicky. Stay away.

Worst philosophy professor at UCLA. Do yourself a favor and stay away from Cross. Most pretentious professor I've ever met. He is very closed-minded and will not listen to you and have his own way. I did not enjoy his lectures at all; very boring and almost put me to sleep. Also, pretty tough grader; the worst I've ever had in my four years here.

Respectable man, can speak for hours on the subjects he is teaching. Only criticism would be that the exams were not questions that tested what you learned in class, but rather, questions you need to go and research yourself to answer.  Although the class subjects are interesting, the lectures can get intense and boring. Discussions would be nice
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lauri is really invested in making the class engaging. Great assigned material and discussions. She helps you make it as challenging as you need on assignments so its never something you can't handle. Definitely make sure to participate!

Renee was very invested in student learning and was extremely approachable. She helped to open my eyes about an area of social work that I was not very interested in before the class. I would most certainly take another class with her.

I have not met anyone who lies and inflates the truth more than this professor. He does not care at all about his students, and blatantly tells us that. He is creepy with female students, and asks them to do work for him for free in exchange for favours like connections. Stay away, this professor is trouble and dishonestly wrapped in one.

I would reccomend this teacher if you love to read because she does give everyday reading assignments. They're around 10-20 pages long and gives a test based on the readings every 5 weeks + 2 page essay. So 3 essays in total. And there is one map quiz of Latin America. She's pretty chill though. She does review what will be on the test a day before
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Requires putting in the work to get a good grade but it's worth it and his lectures are especially helpful to give you a great depth of understanding of the material. Put in consistent work on review and the homeworks throughout the quarter and do not procrastinate, that was my mistake
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Lectures are kinda boring, but her tests are from the material. Overall, not a very difficult class.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Not a bad choice. The course was easy with average/below-average workload AND I learned a lot too
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Even though were 80+ students in class, Abbe makes everyone feel important. She even puts on a name game for everyone to try and get to know eachother - makes the classroom really friendly.
No Comments
Really awesome guy
One of the best professors I have had at ucla. There is ample  opportunities to improve your grade. The tests are pretty fair and the music video extra credit is tons of fun!
Great teacher, learned a lot
Overall its a cool class, she knows the material well, and can answer most questions. Plus shes a fox making the lectures that much more interesting to attend and to pay attention to.
She guest taught a class at SDSU on the History of Rome and I fell in love immediately. I almost considered transferring to UCLA to have her more often. Perfect professor.

Professor Bloch has been an outstanding lecturer. He has helped make Ed Soja's concepts about thirdspace and spatial justice crystal clear. He has also reignited my interest in urban theory. I only hope to still be at UCLA to take more classes with him. In short, Dr. Stefano Bloch is highly recommended.

Professor Tzur is an amazing professor who actually cares about teaching his students. His course was very interesting, and I appreciated his insight. He is a fair grader, and he is willing to put in extra time to make sure that his students understand the material. I would recommend this course to all my friends.

John Houck is a phenomenal professor and artist. He has a clear syllabus, and is a practicing (studio) artist.. IMO an important quality in a professor. Class is easy enough... Mostly you work alone, but sometimes you work in a group in order to take photographs. I HIGHLY recommend.

I have Prof Rogers for an African American political thought seminar and he's really knocked my socks off. He is thorough and insightful. He is brilliant but extremely respectful of students and our ideas and comments. The material he chose is a mix of classic political texts and selections from the current conversation, well put-together. A+

I took the class as a requirement and didn't know anything about archaeology, but overall enjoyed what I learned. There's a fair amount of reading, but it's doable and it doesn't feel like a waste of time. Can be a tough grader on participation.
good teacher
Professor McBride is a really great instructor and is extremely knowledgable in a vey unique field. Take this class if you don't mind hard tests (midterm and final). All around solid teacher.

Professor Warren was my favorite professor this quarter! Though the class was highly work-intensive and caused me to fall behind in my other classes, I will have to say that my writing has improved tremendously in just 6 weeks. She is a tough grader and makes you work for the A, but she definitely prepares you for university-level writing.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: His course assigns the most reading I've ever had and expected you to use the readings for midterms and finals.

Curriculum is set by the department. Dr. Moio is very intelligent and knowledgeable about theory and the application thereof in practice. She will challenge you though, this is not an easy class and you will need to participate in class discussions and group discussions, and she will have good questions for you to fumble trying to answer in class.

I took this class because it was an easy GE, which it was. However, this class with Woolsey was the worst decision I've made. The class is sooooo boring and is more focused on furthering her personal agenda rather than important parts of history. We listened to lesbian rock and transgender punk instead of impactful groups like the Grateful Dead.

Amazing discussions and reading. Really opened my mind to the world of polticial economy and its many intricacies. Would definitely take again... And it would not hurt to mention that this instructor is a superbly attractive French guy.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Her lectures give everything from the book plus extra details that you will need for the tests. Homework is not collected or graded but will GREATLY help prepare for tests. She also has a lot of assignments but these also help understand the material in further depth.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: A very bad communicator.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: ABSOLUTELY THE WORST TEACHER IVE EVER HAD. He just reads off the Powerpoints, which he posts to the course website after class so theres really no point to going to class except for the attendance. He keeps you 45 mins after class ends and acts like its ok. He never answers emails. DO NOT TAKE ANY OF HIS CLASSES!
Great guy. Tough class, but you will learn a lot. Brings cookies every week.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He taught the worst mass transfer class ever. Lecture materials are not clearly taught. Himself must not have a good idea about class materials. Instead, he let you do a lot of math. You would never want to take his class.

I has Prof. Lohmann seven years ago, and only for a fiat lux freshman seminar (I was actually a senior who was one unit short of graduating, not a freshman).  Still, Dr. Lohmann is one of the BEST profs I had at UCLA.  Unbelievably helpful, extremely interesting, very approachable.  I still remember things I learned in that class.  Loved her!
I found him to be arrogant and not at all helpful.
She's awesome and she is passionate about what she does!
She is a great professor. She enjoys herself during lecture, and that reciprocates on us. A very easy course if you do your work.
He was my advisor. Apparently he's pretty talented.

Professor Wu is very cheerful and energetic! You definitely won't doze off in her lectures. Make sure you PARTICIPATE in her classes though, or else she'll knock down your grade! Her class is definitely not for people who like to remain quiet in the back.

This class was my favorite of all my courses, and although it contained the most work with the project-based assignments and two-page responses, all the topics were relevant and fascinating to learn more in-depth about. Honestly, the projects felt more like fun than homework. She grades very fairly, and her feedback is always lovely and thorough.
Terrible. She is very elitist and does not respect her own flute students. She is a great flute player, but very unprofessional. Avoid this professor at all cost.

Very unorganized class. She's very sweet and knowledgeable, but I was confused about what she expects from her students. Lectures contain lots of information that isn't included in exams.
Focus on the overall chronology, not details. The readings weren't worth the time, except for the Oxford history textbook. Avoid, unless you adore ancient Egypt.

Dr Jeff Flanagan relies on student engagement, rewards collaboration and is an effective lecturer.  Dr. Flanagan requires copious amounts of reading, case analysis and legal structuring.  He is bright and very supportive.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Had a blast in this course. Material was very interesting. Lots of reading.
bad teacher liek que ducks
Ugh. That's all I have to say about her class.
May not answer the question you are asking. Her lectures are not helpful for me. I learned most through self study and asking the TA questions.

If he cared for his students as much as he did promoting his coffee table book, he'd be decent.  Close-minded, doesn't know structure (crisis point is halfway thru, pal!), unorganized, high, passive agressive standards.  You waste the first two weeks with a questionnaire.  USC can keep him.
I took him for Stats for Political Science majors over a a decade ago. I still remember the principles he taught and even the readings he assigned.  Great professor.

Professor's explanations too complex. Does not test anything from homework or lectures or book. Does not curve. Very difficult compared to other professors of 3A. Class average on midterms etc. was 57%

Interesting material. Professor kind of talks over your head unless you have very good background. Overall, I would recommend the course and professor, but just make sure your math skills are good along with programming experience.

He is a tough professor who makes you feel like your life should revolve around his course. Makes impossible due dates, changes them later on to more reasonable dates (I guess he thinks this makes you work harder). Overall he is a good guy who cares a lot, but not the best professor to learn from. Overall grade you receive is easier than you think.

His exams are pretty hard, but only 3 questions with part a and b. There are two midterms which are 25% of your grade, a final that is 30% of your grade, and homework which is 20% of your grade. He goes through lectures extremely fast and his handwriting is hard to read. Good thing is his exams are all open book, open notes. But the book is useless

hard to get A, lecture is not clear enough, too much definition, not enough examples, if you really want to learn how to prove definition, take his class. if you want to pass the class with a god grade, don't take with him, his lecture will confuse you

She's a sweet, caring and witty professor. If you are interested in pursuing a Ph.D, she's def got your back and will support you as an advisor. Although many of my peers didn't like her, I did.  The material is research focused so you may get bored listening to lecture but Moon always has witty punch lines you need to stay awake to hear!

One of the worst math profs.  His lectures were worse than useless, they made me more confused than before.  His tests are confusing.  He showed up to midterm and final late AND didn't print enough tests. Tries to teach us off-curriculum material that he wrote his grad school paper on and makes NO sense- tests on this material too.  Teach yourself
great

Ms. What has really helped me understand ways to make my writing stronger.She's picky, which can be hard to take, but ultimately I think I'll be a better writer because of it. I appreciate the time she took to really read and respond to my work, instead of just offering general advice that didn't target my weaknesses and strengths.
She is absolutely awesome. Loved her class. not too hard. The tests are also not that hard, you just have to do the study guide she gives. Great class. Definitely recommend it!

Kasari is great! It was her TA Eric who gave me the A. It seems her presentation of Special edu. children were interesting. The fieldwork was the best experience that I had! I worked with many children that were in the 1st, 2nd& 3rd grades! They were cute & mischievous @ the same time. Awesome class overall!

Really cares about his students and will bend over backwards for anyone in need.  Homework is hard, but we also had a really bad TA grading it.  Of all my math classes this one, I matured the most in this series.  If you are serious about math take him, if not stay away.
Average professor in many ways.  Average difficulty tests, easy to understand, decent lecturer, follows textbook for the most part.  Definitely not the worst math teacher I have had

He is a very intriguing professor! He was always interested in hearing what students have to say and does not have a pedantic teaching style. He engages the class and values students' opinions--he admits when he is wrong or when he didn't think of something that a student did. He values student learning, and his positive attitude is encouraging.

Professor DeLand is an excellent teacher. His course 'Law and Society' was very interesting with a great selection of readings. Enjoyed looking at a sociological approach to law in society. Not your typical boring SOC class, DeLand makes lectures interesting and I highly recommend his classes. Exams are not meant to trick you, very fair teacher
I thoroughly enjoyed her digital preservation class. She's really chill and personable and is very down to earth type of teacher. Great teacher!
His exams are tough and time constricted, but his lectures provide good examples and definitions that you will definitely use. If you have a good TA, that will also help.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Although this class was only for students who wanted to learn about the subject, Professor Hernandez-Leon made it interesting and fun. You have to read to be able to understand his lectures, but other than that no complaints!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Everybody loves Dr. Clubb!
Great teacher...I like his facial expressions...he's funny and clear and always willing to help you. RECOMMENDED!

Very easy to understand and a great help. He makes translating Latin more interactive with pair work and commentary projects on excerpts of your own choosing. His explanations are concise and easy to follow.
I took Anthro of Deviance with her. I LOVED HER!!! GREAT CLASS! Very interesting. I would 100% recommend
Do the work and attend all the classes and you'll do fine.
Helpful, approachable, excellent speaker.  Great class!  One of my favorite professors of all time!!
:S simply disappointing
Love to see more professors like her.
Very fun guy. Straightforward midterm and final. Very lenient
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is honestly one of the best TA's at UCLA bar NONE! She is absolutely amazing at explaining various topics and won't rush you if you're not getting it.

Good sense of humor some might say, nice person I think anyone would agree. The curriculum is set by the department, so she had no hand in the structure of the class, but was helpful and gave us as much heads up and time to work on our projects as one could expect. Overall a good choice to get the job done.
Outstanding lecturer and hot!

KT has been completely MIA for hosting an online class. She would not respond to emails and would not take constructive criticism for how difficult she would make assignments. Insanely long readings and left the end of the course to have the heaviest amount of tests/essays. Due to miscalculations on her part, also made final weighted heavier in end
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Requires A LOT of reading and if you don't do it, you won't pass the exams. Almost half of your overall grade is based on lecture and section attendance so don't miss too many. His exams are on the readings, map of Latin America (which I hated). He just reads from the slides in lecture, just watch out for the iClicker questions (also on exams).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Amazing lecturer, very intelligent.
Pulls info from lecture straight from wikipedia. If you are actually interested in this subject take another professor.
He's very dedicated and passionate. He really cares about making his students understand. He tries to make learning entertaining. He speaks spanish.
He was terrible
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--So many papers

comment: She's a great professor. She's always responsive to students and I don't think she's ever said an unkind word in her life. She expects a lot from you, but her class is small and it's because she knows you'll get more from the class the more you give. Some of the assignments require careful attention, but it will pay off and is definitely worth it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Decent professor. Material isn't excruciatingly hard and your grade is composed of a lot of different components so you have safeties in case you mess up
Excellent online sleep course

Dr. Arbuckle is an amazing prof with clear and concise instructions on assignments, tests, and quizzes. She was engaging in her lectures, which often included a variety of fun resources. Overall, I was genuinely enjoying the lectures. PS. took the class without any knowledge about ancient Egyptian religion but I still managed to do pretty well :)
Bad course, Do not take!

Professor Arabifard is a real gem. He is a great instructor who can introduce non Persian and also second generation of Iranian- American with depth of Persian music, instruments, ensemble and poetry.

For an online MBA level course the professor was unsatisfactory due to a lack of didactics. When asked for clarification on assignments his response was "I know what I want, but I can't tell you." This is a teach from the gut kind of class with no use of frameworks. We were even referred to another UCLA professor's classes to learn key concepts.
Alice Chang is ok, I guess.
This professor is extremely caring about you as a person and how well you do in class. Always willing to help you succeed. Highly recommend!

Amazing teacher. Lectures clear and to the point, with examples. Prof Huppin is very impressive yet very accessible and kind. Will not baby you, but fair and if you follow directions and take the class seriously you will be fine. Learned a lot, which is the goal. Subject matter was fascinating. My favorite class I've taken. No unnecessary busywork.
World-class. One of the best professors I ever had. You could tell that he was well educated beyond compare and very passionate about his impact on students.

He is the sweetest professor I have ever had! I felt like he really made an effort to connect with each student. He is very approachable, & makes volunteering in class feel like a positive experience. He is so calm and so is his voice-- he makes class comfortable. He looks like a fluffy bear that I just want to hug. Great man & professor! Take him!

Took Play and Entertainment thinking that based off the course description it would be interesting and kinda fun. Wasn't really the case.   Struggled to build up the will to go to class. Most people lost that battle as classes were at maybe 25% attendance for most lectures. Although Steen really cares about what he is teaching, he really had troubl

One of the easiest classes I've taken at UCLA. Final is 10 questions multiple choice. Castro is fun, motivational, and overall a really great teacher.  Loved going to lectures.  By the end of the quarter, what we needed for the final was already engraved on our minds.
took english comp 3 loved the class. Always willing to help and really gives you tools to be a great writer

If you're into animation, this is the class for you! Difficulty is proportional to how ambitious you are (YOU SHOULD BE PRETTY AMBITIOUS). You can look up the syllabus online. You should do cels, because you still can. Doug is nice & helpful. He's like a mentor, and he's very experienced. Enrollment is thru PTE #s; grad students and Sr/Jr standing.
Attended every lecture and office hours yet never  understood what he was looking for in exams or the term paper.
Keith is an amazing, inspirational, brilliant professor. I wish I could take his class again!

I was looking forward to this class ALL summer! But OMG! She sits and reads her notes aloud. You see the top of her head more than her face and she NEVER asks the class to participate. I really, really don't like her teaching style. But if you show up, ON TIME, and read the book (her dissertation from 1976), studying for her exams is super easy.

"You go diva".  Prepare to hear that all the time.  So, Neema is great.  She can ramble at times and she has a short fuse some days, but in general, she is a great teacher and mentor.  Take the time to listen to her, she has a lot of great information to impart.  Last thing-She is a TV lady, so don't expect her to understand your grand film ideas.

This guy is awful. He gives off the impression of being easy, but he throws you for a loop and is impossible. DO NOT TAKE HIM. I am an A student and he gave me a B in the class. He teaches interesting content and presents the material well, but clearly does not know how to grade. He is inconsistent and lacking. One of the worst profs I've had!!!!

Kevin is a great instructor. (I am a hand-builder) He gives freedom for students to explore their potential by creating parameters in which we can work in. He has offered many suggestions on how to take our ceramic artwork further, and think outside the box. I recommend.

He is a great professor really teaches but he test are really challenging both midterm and final are multiple choice but do not be so sure that they will be easy, because one has received a perfect score without the curve on each test.

Oh boy, make sure to bring paper and printed slides or whatever work you need to do for other classes. You are not allowed to use computers during class so make sure your work is on paper or an IPAD because you will get bored. I felt I was back in a 9th grade history class. Grading by the t.a's was pretty generous/easy.

Prof. Bauer just became a professor this quarter after receiving her PhD. She is sweet, funny, & very excited to teach. She is a fair grader; I am so happy to have taken her class! I will definitely take her again when possible. I got lucky this quarter with all my teachers - Prof. Bauer, Prof. Madley, & Prof. Ferraris-Besso are the best!
Very, very nice lady. Her class is demanding, but she gives thorough study guides. I loved going to lecture and lab, although the lab is very long (5 hours) its pretty fun.

He is very organized. The subject itself was hard. It requires detail understanding of the topics. The class consisted of 1 midterm, 1 research paper, and 1 final. If you have the time, and are not working then I would recommend taking the class, but if you have other hard classes it will be tough. This class will become your priority (btw5 units).

Murtha Baca is one of my favorite professors with the IS dept.  She is excited about the material she teaches and her lectures are thought-provoking.  Her assignments require you to think, but are not especially difficult.  She is extremely approachable.  However, sometimes her lectures run over the allotted time.

She is a pretty good novelist. Not a very good prof. She gives you very little feedback and there isn't much to go on. You won't improve your writing. Weekly short story readings and writing exercises. A kind lady, but not the best professor. Of all the creative writing professors, I would recommend Kevorkian; the only professor you'll learn from.

Took Ling 1 for my last GE as a transfer in the comm department. A little tougher than I wanted. Going to discussion helps quite a bit because his lectures can be confusing to take notes on. Having a buddy in this class is a must to do the homework worth 45% of the grade. No MT, only Final.

He may be renown in the industry but he should not be teaching Business Strategy at UCLA Anderson.  He spent 80% or more of lecture discussing random stories which rarely lead to a takeaway.  Most of us did not learn a single thing over the 10 weeks.  The midterm and final were so scattered and opinionated that studying would not help.

McWhorter is a young professor whose lack of skill shows in the way she manages her classroom. She has little enthusiasm for the subject being taught and her contempt for students is easily evident. She is much more subjective in grading than a true scientist should be. Enrolling in this class puts you at her mercy which would not be a wise move.
hi

I really enjoyed the class & the professor.  I liked his real world stories and examples about hacking and hackers.  The only draw back to the class was for me was other students.  Half of the students seem to not belong in a class of this level. They would hold up the rest of us while Mr. Mosley would have to explain things they should know.
great

Bargheer is so nice! The class has lots of readings since you read older works of Sociology. I got an A- for the class when I thought I was getting a B. Grades on: Pop Quizzes, Midterm (In Class, 2 short ssays) and Final (Take Home, two 5 Page Essays).  The readings can get difficult but the TA's will help

Dr. de Lee doesn't mess around. Very straightforward with everything he does, whether it's his expectations, strong analysis, or great commentary. I took 3 of his courses at SUNY Cortland. He's very locked on and is an impressive historian. Show up and participate: you'll do great! Very easy going and helpful. Also stand by folks: he's hilarious!
Probably one of the best classes I've ever had at UCLA. Very dynamic in the way he presents material. Topics are applicable to me as a prospective science teacher. Great class discussions.

Bozzone was very organized in every lecture. She introduced group projects in an organized manner as well, addressing any questions. She was very open and conducted engaging class discussions. The course was super interesting as well, and I consider it my favorite class I have ever taken at UCLA. Sad that she's not teaching at UCLA anymore. :(

One of the best at UCLA. I highly recommend you take her for her PS 124C class. She makes it interesting and is not a hard grader as long as you know the material and willing to do the heavy reading load. Her class is very clear, has quizzes which help you, notes, lectures, etc. There is no reason you shouldn't get an A.

Literally copied the entire course from the book, but whenever asked about the book he told us to not bother reading it. At the end of the course we looked at it, and his slides and example codes are copied from there word for word, but the book has further explanation. Didn't explain anything well. Basically just teach yourself from the get-go.

I have been out of college for almost 20 years and this is the ONE AND ONLY professor that I still remember from UCLA. I still even remember the theory he taught. He was a dynamic speaker and kept the class interested.
awesome teacher. do not make excuses and be ready to learn.
No Comments
No Comments

Wonderful professor; very articulate and easy to follow.  Very open-minded; great at getting class involved.  Sorry to hear she's not returning.  Would have taken her again. Only downer was her TA who read and graded all the exams & papers.

Professor Rhett seems like a nice person, but I don't think her teaching does enough to fully understand the weekly homework and the biweekly quizzes. I also don't think my TA is that helpful. I like linguistics, but not the structure of the class. The lectures might be enjoyable, but the homework is a nightmare!

Awesome guy. He's very clear on his explanation in class and really wants you to understand how Greek works, not just memorizing it. If you have any trouble, he's more than happy to work with you overtime in his office hours.

She's an amazing, funny and down to earth. Very approachable and cares a lot about student learning. Her grading is reasonable/borderline easy as long as you back your stuff up, you can at least get some points. She's amazing!

Consider yourself very lucky if you had Gabi in Introduction to Human Physiology at UCLA. It's not an easy class (Physiology is not an easy subject matter) but she made it interesting and fun. If you see her name in any class, take it! I loved the way she explained aerobic respiration (and everything else, actually). She is also caring and pretty.
Ms Nymeyer is a wonderful and nice person.  She was always very helpful and kind in class and office hours.  She's quite attractive too, which made it even easier to pay attention.

Many people believe Vishnu is the supreme Indian God; however, this man is the actual supreme being. He is changing the game in his field. Instead of lecturing, he can take control of your body and implant in your brain on how things are done. One cannot say that they did go to that class and not become enlightened. He also likes Russell Peters.
She is very nice and tries hard to make sure everybody understands the material. She's also really funny.

I think it was his first teaching. He did quite a good job. He has a heavy british accent. I learned quite a lot from him but it was not like a very interesting class tho. The materials are not as fun, but he explained them throughly.
Love this professor. Clear and makes the topic relatable.
Great class

TAKE HER CLASS! She nurtures student learning and works hard to meet their needs. Kind and understanding. Don't be afraid to email or text her! Lectures are clear and reference the readings. Her assignments and exams are easy, but still require you be critical. She wants to give everyone A's and gives many extra credit opportunities!

Suzanne was OK. She definitely rubbed me wrong a few times. But I learned a lot in the class about sculpture. She left early frequently and yet expected a lot from her students: participation in critiques, clear concepts, and sketches, artist research assignments etc.

Reilly is able to take what would be a very dry topic, organizational studies, & turn it into a funny/engaging class that everyone looks forward to! Take him! 1 Midterm, 1 Final, 6 (easy) pop quizzes on the reading assigned. tests are all essay questions.  this is not an easy A, you work for it, but you will love it, and learn so much! BEST PROF!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures

comment: He is one of my favorite professor in UCLA.

The best teacher I've ever had, but the class is really hard and it is a lot to learn. I had to read every single day over and over again and study my ass off. It is really heavy. But the teacher is adorable and so understanding and kind. Just be prepared that it is going to be hard. It's quizzes, research papers, observations and extra credits.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: After the first few weeks of theory, it gets more and more interesting. The grade is highly dependent upon a huge group research project on animal communication. Show up, do the readings, take good notes, and get a head start on your group project asap. Visit him in office hours for help. He can be abstract and confusing so ask questions!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He's pretty good. I heard when he got here a year ago he was real bad, but he's good now. He's visiting faculty btw. He tries to give clarifying examples of concepts in lecture.
He's an amazing professor all around. His lectures are really clear and he really cares about his students and inspires them.
Dr. Baylor's lectures were very hard to follow. He is not easily approachable for questions about the curriculum.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Awesome professor! So passionate about the course subject up until his last lecture.

Honestly, easy class lol. Answers to quizzes can be found directly by doing Ctrl+F and search if you don't want to read and the paper is graded leniently and you have a lot of flexibility with it. It's an easy A.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Rottman is hands down one of the best professors I've had the privilege of taking a class with. He was really knowledgeable about the material and was accessible outside of class if his students ever needed help, and was also really flexible with grading. The readings were light and interesting and the exams were totally doable.

I'm committed to learning Yiddish and enjoyed Miri's class. However, she often assumes that students know words outside of the textbook and will act frustrated when this happens. She also doesn't clearly explain many grammar concepts, so expect to have to teach that to yourself. I didn't turn in the homework and passed with an A.
super awesome! So caring!
Never forget the tiddle,twiddle, tilde thing he did. He was pretty impressive though. Very thorough, very knowledgeable. Knew some interesting things.

Nat is super knowledgeable about microscopy, but the format of this class made it hard to get through lectures in time, even when they were about pretty advanced optical physics. However, he was good at answering student questions about the class.

Professor Loya is the best instructor I have ever had. He uses accessible language and constantly applies real life examples to help us digest the material. I genuinely felt supported by Professor Loya.

Professor Hazel is great! She explains each topic very well and focuses on understanding the material. The quizzes can be scary; 22 quizzes, 63% grade, no partial credit, but there are no midterms. Some questions are really difficult, but I learned a lot and the final is quite easy. Lenient on due dates. I'd take her again. 
(Not on bruinwalk yet)

This was my second course with Professor Rosenblum, and what an absolute delight!  I enjoyed this class even more than the first.  Professor Rosenblum is not an easy grader, you have to work for your grade, but she provides great feedback and is very available in office hours to help you be successful.  She's truly one of the best.

Professor Tchaykov is amazing! I would strongly recommend taking his course. He is very thoughtful about the content he teaches in his courses. He is very considerate of his student and makes sure that they will succeed. You can tell he really cares about the content he is teaching and is very knowledgeable about it. I loved this class!

I took Sakai during COVID, so it was completely online. She was very clear in her lectures about the material and gave us a lot of examples to work and understand. As long as you did the homework and did a bit of studying it was somewhat easy to receive a good grade on the exams. She's super nice and is open to helping students outside of class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Hazlett is wonderful - he explains his notes very clearly and articulates what he wants you to do well. He is very empathetic, caring, witty. He was wonderful !
She's hilarious and obviously loves teaching what she does. She is a very easy grader and there are only two quizzes and one paper (with outlines) for the whole course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Graded by few things
